Title: Senior Manager - Optimisation - Analytics
Description:
Senior Manager, Optimisation Analytics – Negotiable Salary – Plus Benefits – London

This entrepreneurial company operates within the leisure arena dealing with millions of customers thus collecting vast amounts of data - every minute of every single day.
This role presents real but exciting challenges, extracting commercial value out of this ever-growing volume of data. This is a unique opportunity to utilise your real passion for data science, whilst directly influencing the bottom line, working with the brightest minds in the tech industry in an energetic and international work environment.

Role & Responsibilities.
You will be responsible for developing a coherent and overarching revenue optimisation strategy
Responsible for generating significant revenue growth
Lead multiple projects, solve complex, unstructured problems and drive insights.
Use your knowledge to solve complex, open-ended business problems.
Apply data science techniques in a commercial environment.
Solve large, unstructured business problems.

Experience & Skills Required
Educated to MSc or PhD degree level in a quantitative discipline such as Mathematics, Data Science, Engineering, Computer Science, or similar
You will be able to understand problems at a high level and translate them into actionable strategies
Demonstrate a passionate about data.
Be capable of a having a technical discussion with a Data Scientist whilst having a high-level business conversation.
Have a deep understanding of supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods
Excellent knowledge of statistics and principles of experimentation
Strong working knowledge in at least one programming language associated with data science - Python, Java, Scala or R.
Demonstrate experience of querying datasets in a big data environment.
Experience and turning insights into commercial value.
Great communication skills able to converse at all levels

If you fit the above job description, please contact Roisin McCarthy on
Show phone number
or email her on rmccarthy@datatech.org.uk. Please be advised that we can only accept candidates who have the right to work in the UK.

Alternatively, you can refer a friend or colleague by taking part in our fantastic referral schemes! If you have a friend or colleague who would be interested in this role, please refer them to us. For each relevant candidate that you introduce to us (there is no limit) and we place, you will be entitled to our general gift/voucher scheme.

Title: Senior Product Manager
Description:
Hammersmith, UK
Permanent
Competitive Salary
Who we are
iPLATO are on the search for a Senior Product Manager to become a piece of their puzzle. But this isn’t an ordinary
puzzle – we’re a puzzle with no sides, constantly evolving and adapting to fit in our environment, as soon as we lay
one piece, we are working together to fix another. We are a team of fire-fighters, plate-spinners and pull-together-
and-find-a-solutioners. We serve millions of patients and healthcare professionals every day and are passionate
about healthcare and finding the best technological solutions. We are supportive of our team and live in the cliché
of no two days are the same. If you think you’ve got what it takes to work in a fun, fast paced, reactive and rewarding
digital health company then we would love to hear from you.
About the role:
Reporting to the Head of Product Management the Senior Product Manager will add immense value to iPLATO’s
service offering in the way of shaping, scoping and driving one of our key digital platform products. The Senior
Product Manager will look after the growth and health of our overall platform and will be confident in driving the
delivery of the roadmap within an agile environment.
Your main responsibilities will be:
Managing the entire product life cycle from strategic planning through to deployment.
Leading and collaborating with Product Owners, UX/UI Design, BA and Development team members,
ensuring everyone is clear on goals and deliverables.
Proactively identifying, prioritising and resolving issues. Understanding risk and managing change when
necessary to meet industry regulation and standards.
Driving data collection and reporting on product KPIs to track progress and manage product performance.
Writing EPICs and User stories, Refining and prioritising the product backlog and taking part in stand ups
and retrospectives.


Engaging with external stakeholders including patients, carers, clinicians and commissioners to shape
product features in the right strategic direction.
Driving market, competitor and user research to support with product roadmap planning.
Communicating with internal stakeholders including marketing, sales and customer support, translating the
larger strategic vision into deliverable roadmap releases.
Working closely with other product teams, scrum master, developers and designers to deliver the product
roadmap within timelines.
Informing product positioning and promotion in terms of USPs, benefits and value.
Supporting iPLATO business development in commercialising the product.
Analysing and reporting on product KPIs and metrics.
To be successful in this role you will need excellent communication skills to be able to present product value
to internal and external stakeholders as needed. You will also share our passion for transformation of
healthcare.
What we are looking for:
Essential:
Graduate
Experience working in healthcare, ideally with the NHS
Exceptional presentation and communicating skills
Thrives on working in a dynamic and rapid growth environment
Outcome driven
Analytical and problem-solving aptitude
Solid Team/Line management experience
Desirable skills:
Experience as an Agile Digital Product Owner (ideally a CSPO or equivalent certification)
Online consultation and/or machine learning experience is a plus
Experience using Jira
Above all, we want someone that shares our core principles. These are:
We are Patient Centred
We can be Trusted
We can Deliver Quality
We are Passionate


We aim High
What we offer
25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Birthday off
An annual individual training budget of up to £1000
On-site wellbeing programmes and massages
Free breakfast
Life insurance
In-office pool table and conveniently located Hammersmith office
Company Share Option Scheme, Travel Loan Scheme and Contribution towards a monthly fitness activity
(on passing probation)
If you are looking to make a difference and help transform the healthcare industry, please forward your CV and
covering letter to careers@iplato.com writing “Senior Product Manager” in the subject field. By applying to this
role you are confirming you have read and agree to our privacy notice which can be found here. Due to high volumes
of applications we are only able to respond to those who have been successful for interview, if you haven’t heard
from us within two weeks of your application then please presume you have not been successful this time around.
Strictly no agencies

Title: Senior Economist, Insights and Innovations
Description:
§ Must have PhD in Economics.
§ Must have experience in retail, e-commerce, or similar industries.
§ Must have experience in Python, Stata, R and/or Scala.
§ Must have a proven record of bringing high impact statistical models to production at scale.
§ Must have the ability to communicate relevant scientific insights from data to senior business leaders.

Amazon strives to be Earth's most customer-centric company where people can find and discover anything they want to buy online. To achieve this we hire the world's brightest minds, offering them a fast paced, technologically sophisticated and friendly work environment.

Economists for Amazon UK will be expected to work directly with senior management on key business problems faced in international retail. The role allows you to influence UK wide strategy by applying the frontier of economic thinking to selection, pricing, forecasting, program evaluation, customer behaviour and other areas. Economists at Amazon will be expected to develop new techniques to process large data sets, use econometric models and methods to address complex problems, design and test hypothesis on customer pain points and key growth ideas and contribute to design of automated systems around the company.

We are looking for a results-driven Economist to join the Insights and Innovations team in London and be among the first economists to help build our technical economics capability in the EU. The team is focused on kick-starting the next radical idea in the UK and getting it from the drawing board to V1. The team owns key inputs at a UK level such as Selection, Pricing, Availability, Customer experience and Competitive and Market intelligence. The team is dedicated to innovating and failing fast with minimal resources. Economists will work closely with other research scientists, machine learning experts, and economists globally to design new frameworks that systematically identify low touch machine driven recommendations that propel customer growth while creating a meaningful economic impact for Amazon. Research science at Amazon is a highly experimental activity, although theoretical analysis and innovation are also welcome. Our economists and scientists work closely with software engineers to put algorithms into practice. They also work on cross-disciplinary efforts with other scientists within Amazon.

The key strategic objectives for this role include:
Provide data-driven guidance and recommendations on strategic questions posed by the UK and EU Retail leadership.
Design and analysis of version-zero (V0) experiments and define and analyze success metrics across marketing, pricing and supply chain optimization.
Identify opportunities/tests that drive product discovery, new customer acquisition or purchase frequency with the end goal to drive growth. Conduct, direct, and coordinate all phases of research projects, demonstrating skill in all stages of the analysis process, including defining key research questions, recommending measures, working with multiple data sources, evaluating methodology and design, executing analysis plans, interpreting and communicating results.
While the scope will be focused on UK and EU, the economist will also partner with economists in the US team and think of projects with Global scope. Functionally decompose complex problems into simple, straight-forward solutions.

If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, you know how to deliver results fast, and you have a deeply quantitative, highly innovative approach to solving problems, and long for the opportunity to build pioneering solutions to challenging problems, we want to talk to you.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

§ Strong background in program evaluation methods, empirical industrial organisation methods, applications to business problems, and/or big data.
§ Experience applying economics combined with machine learning or data science techniques.
§ Ability to work in a fast-paced business environment.
§ Strong research track record.
§ Effective verbal and written communications skills.
§ Preferred specialties in applied micro or empirical IO, but behavioral economists and generalists with broad applied econometric skills are also encouraged to apply.

Title: Senior Solutions Architect - Education Vertical (London& Sou...
Description:
Background in any of the following: Cloud Architecture, Systems Design, Software Development, Infrastructure Architecture, Data Engineering or DevOps
Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience.
Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English
Passion for technology and for learning

This role is within the UK Public Sector organization and you would be working with Education customers.

Solutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects are responsible for creating and presenting technical content and sharing best practices.

Solutions Architects are responsible for the overall technical relationship between customers and AWS and make recommendations on security, cost, performance, reliability and operational efficiency. They work to understand the customer's needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with AWS technology. Solutions Architects lead activities such as architecture reviews, white-boarding sessions, demos and technical workshops. They collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, support, product teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.

In this role you will get to practice your creativity, linking technology to tangible solutions and educating AWS customers about the art of the possible. You will have the opportunity to define cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases. (Immersive learning VR/AR, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Serverless, Containers, Analytics, Big Data, DevOps or Security). The Solutions Architecture team is a diverse group of technologists from a variety of backgrounds. Practical knowledge of the AWS platform is desired but not required, provided you have a sound technical foundation and a desire to learn.

You will have the support to grow your expertise in industry and technology areas of depth. Every day you will learn something new from your customers, your peers and your own experiments.

At Amazon you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of the customer. We value your passion to discover, invent and build on behalf of customers.

Amazon has always been, and always will be, committed to diversity and inclusion. We seek builders from all backgrounds to join our teams, and we encourage our employees to bring their authentic, original, and best selves to work.

Roles and Responsibilities
Work directly with customers to accelerate their projects and recommend best-practice architectures in line with their long-term business outcomes
Build technical relationships with customers and operate as their trusted advisor. The best interests of the customer will shape the guidance you provide.
Share the voice of the customer to inform the roadmap of AWS features.
Participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts).
Evangelize and educate about AWS technology and industry trends} (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
Contribute to the growth of the Solutions Architecture organization by interviewing candidates and having a voice in hiring decisions. You will also be helping others develop new skills by mentoring team members
Develop areas of depth in technical domains relevant to your interests and your customer's outcomes.

The following qualifications are desired but not required:
Experience designing, building, refactoring or operating IT systems - either on premises or in the cloud
Working knowledge of cloud native architectures
Knowledge of a modern programming language (Python, JavaScript, Go, .Net, Java, etc.) and/or scripting, Infrastructure as Code etc.
Experience working in a customer-facing role
Experience with public speaking
AWS certification (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate or Professional) or other industry certification
Continued or advanced learning (Master, MBA, PhD or equivalent)

Title: Senior Systems Engineer
Description:
Senior Systems Engineer
Location: Woking
Salary: £65,000

About the opportunity;
To work as part of our systems development team specialising in signal processing and numerical model development throughout the full engineering lifecycle. Supporting from research and studies through to the development of high-performance system design such as sonar and communications / VLF and Sonar simulators. Specialising in complex system problem solving and developing engineering solutions

Senior Sonar Systems Engineer Requirements;
To develop and evaluate algorithms for detection, classification and localisation of contacts using underwater acoustic sensors.
Communication VLF and any other areas.
Observe, predict scientific, engineering and technological trends to continually improve the business offering.
Provide a research and development capacity by conducting the studies and producing technical papers and reports.
Support the business development team in preparing technical proposals & solutions.
Interact with hardware, software and firmware engineering development teams to ensure that system designs achieve the operational performance requirements.
Required to have an in-depth knowledge and experience in digital signal processing, signal processing with statistical methods, sonar array signal processing, numerical methods and simulation of physical processes and use of digital filters.
Experience in complex system design, implementation, test and integration.
Experience developing engineering-based computer models using high level programming languages such as MATLAB/Simulink.
Expertise in algorithm development and front-end signal conditioning for analogue digitisation.
Able to provide technical leadership within project teams as a Design Authority.
Willingness to work as part of a collaborative enterprise with other companies including short period of detached duty on-board or at sea when required.
Analogue design and pspice simulations
Experience of transducer and sensor interfacing
Participation in the full engineering system lifecycle from Requirement Capture, Design, Implementation, Test, Acceptance to Evaluation.
Good interpersonal skills to liaise across Engineering Functions supporting system design meeting operation performance requirements.
Previous experience in the field of underwater acoustics or similar.
Communication Systems / VLF.
Experience of electronic hardware, software or firmware design.
A knowledge of AI and machine learning would be advantageous.

Senior Sonar Systems Engineer Qualifications;
Ability to attain DV or SC UK security clearance
Full driving license
PhD/Degree level Physics, Math or related Engineering Degree with a strong mathematical background.
Member of a professional Engineering or Science Institute / Chartered Engineer.
Sonar, communication systems or mathematical modelling course (desirable)
Ability to travel on occasions within the UK & Internationally

If you are interested in this opportunity please contact Layne Eadie on
Show phone number
or l.eadie@mane.co.uk

Title: Senior FP&A Manager
Description:
ABOUT THE TEAM
The finance team is the backbone of Revolut’s business. The department has grown from its initial internal accounting remit to a major function that supports all areas of the business, including assessing financial implications from various key strategic decisions and growth opportunities.

When you join the finance team you get the opportunity to interact with all areas of the company: one day you are involved in a banking license application process, the next you are running analysis for a new product launch, and the next you are working on an executive summary of Revolut’s performance for the board of directors.

ABOUT THE ROLE
Prepare high quality and timely management reporting on a monthly/quarterly and annual basis. Partner with other functions across the business to identify underlying commercial drivers behind the financial results. Deliver concise and succinct financial summary for various investor related requests around commercial business dynamic

WHAT SKILLS YOU’LL NEED
Strong FP&A experience with sound knowledge of accounting and financial controlling
Financial services experience in a multi-national / multi-currency environment
Strong IT skills with experience of improvement programmes and building processes
Ability to analyse issues and present key messages clearly
Experience of preparing presentations & reports for Board meetings and senior management
Ability to prioritise demanding and competing requirements
Anaplan/Jedox experience is highly desirable

WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
You will report to the Management Reporting leader, helping him to drive process standardisation and reporting automation for internal and external stakeholders
You will be responsible for management reporting being a key figure in understanding underlying business dynamic behind the numbers and being a go-to person for business units providing visibility on their financial performance
You will support FP&A month end closing and partner with Accounting team to produce accurate financial reports
A little about us…When Revolut was founded in 2015, we had a vision to build a sustainable, digital alternative to traditional big banks. Our mission now is to help our customers improve their financial health, empower them to have more control, and promote financial cohesion across the communities in which we operate. Launching into 2020 with 10 million Personal customers and over a quarter of a million Business customers only reinforced our belief in the vast need across the world for better financial services. As our customer base has boomed in the last year, we’ve expanded our team to match that growth. We started 2019 with several hundred employees; we closed it out with 2000.

What we’re looking for…Revolut is being scaled up by people all around the world who share our vision. We’re looking for people who align with our four core values: we Never Settle, we Get It Done because we Think Deeper and we’re Stronger Together. You’re the kind of person who wants to join a community of forward-thinking people, all personally and professionally invested in Revolut’s mission. You thrive in a collaborative space where everyone’s learning from each other, and learning fast. We believe in empowering our Revoluters in their work, giving them autonomy and ownership of what they do. We want everyone at Revolut to own their story and their successes - working with us means you’re not just another cog in the machine.

THE BENEFITS
Competitive salary
Biannual equity bonuses
All the latest tech you need
Skip the commute and work from home once a week
Roll with a free Revolut Metal subscription
Pension plan
Private health insurance
Start the day properly with fresh fruit and cereals
Stay refreshed: get juice, tea, coffee and soft drinks on tap
Rest up with 29 days’ holiday per year

Title: Senior Solutions Architect, ISV, AWS UK&I
Description:
Basic Qualifications
Technical Degree (Computer Science, Maths, Engineering or equivalent) and/or relevant tech experience.
Fluent written and verbal communication skills in English
Experience of Software, Systems or Data Design
Knowledge of a modern programming language (Python, JavaScript, Go, .Net, Java, etc.)
Knowledge of software architecture, application development and deployment concepts and tools including source code management, continuous integration, or configuration management
Passion for technology and for learning

SaaS Solutions Architects work hand in hand with Independent Software Vendors (ISVs) to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage with organizations at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects also take a leading role in creating and presenting technical content and best practices.

This role is within the AWS UK & Ireland organization and you would be working with ISVs who are want to transition towards building applications delivered in a SaaS model.

In this role you will get to practice your creativity, linking technology to tangible solutions and educating ISVs about the art of the possible. You will have the opportunity to lead and collaborate with ISVs by defining or inventing cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases. In domains such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Serverless and Container driven architectures, Microservices Application Architecture Design, Analytics and Big Data, DevOps or Security.

The Solutions Architecture team is a diverse group of technologists from a variety of backgrounds. Practical knowledge of the AWS platform is desired but not required, provided you have a sound technical foundation and a desire to learn.

You will have the support to grow your expertise in industry and technology areas of depth. Every day you will be learning something new from your customers, your peers and your own experiments.

At Amazon you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of the customer. We value your passion to discover, invent and build on behalf of customers.

Amazon has always been, and always will be, committed to diversity and inclusion. We seek builders from all backgrounds to join our teams, and we encourage our employees to bring their authentic, original, and best selves to work.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

Roles & Responsibilities:
As a SaaS Solutions Architect in the AWS UK&I ISV team, you will act as the technical trusted advisor to key ISVs working closely with their technical leadership teams and the AWS Business Development teams.
Provide architectural guidance and best practice recommendations necessary to help ISVs build new SaaS solutions, new business models and architecture designs following the principles of the AWS Well-Architected Framework and the SaaS Factory.
Demonstrate vision, creativity, business acumen and deep AWS knowledge in jointly developing industry and vertical technology solutions.
Share the voice of the customer to influence the roadmap of new features and services the APN Technology Partners provide on the AWS platform.
Evangelize and educate about AWS technology (e.g. workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).
Contribute to the growth of the Solutions Architecture organization by hiring, coaching and mentoring others.
Develop areas of depth in technical domains relevant to your interests and your customer's outcomes.
Benefits
Competitive compensation includes a base salary, a sign-on bonus, and Amazon Restricted Stock Units (RSU)
Some domestic and international travel to visit customers and participate in company and industry events.
Flexible working policy
Parental leave
Employee discount program
Choice of Mac or Windows laptops
Public Transport Season Ticket Loan

Preferred Qualifications

These qualifications are desired but not required:
Experience designing, building, refactoring or operating large scale and impactful IT projects - either on premises or in the cloud
Working knowledge of cloud native architectures
In depth working knowledge in a technology domain such as DevOps, Serverless, Big Data, analytics, Machine Learning, high-performance databases (SQL and/or NoSQL) or highly secured workloads etc.
Knowledge of modern data processing techniques and systems
Understanding of the UK and Ireland ISV ecosystem
Experience working in a partner-facing or customer-facing role
Experience collaborating effectively with internal or external stakeholder groups at multiple levels
Experience working with Independent Software Vendors and Software as a Service (SaaS) providers.
AWS certification (e.g. AWS Solutions Architect Associate or Professional)
Continued or advanced learning (Master, MBA, PhD or equivalent)

Title: Lead Software Engineer
Description:
It's a scary time we're all currently living at the moment - Covid-19 looks to be the main topic for the foreseeable, barrelling towards another recession, uncertainty over job security, McDonalds have shut their doors, there's no loo roll… the list goes on.

It's a time to be proactive, instead of reactive - and right now you have the opportunity to be proactive and join a company where the gears don't stop moving and the pistons keep on driving, even in the toughest of times.

You have the opportunity to join as a Lead Software Engineer, utilising your Python Engineering abilities and getting to play around with other tech (ReactJS, Ruby, NodeJS, Rust). You will build, test and deploy containers in Windows and Linux. Whilst also using Jenkins and Gitlab to build pipelines.

You will be creating bespoke software for clients globally - this is no ordinary software. You will be fully hands-on designing and implementing tailor made software that uses Machine Learning and AI techniques to track user journey. This real time testing catches any bugs or defects, monitors performance and where it can be improved.

Working within sectors such as Automotive, Defence, Aerospace and many more - You'll ditch the scary times and join a company that are continuously changing and improving.

No CV needed. Get in touch for more details.

Title: Sr. Analyst, Digital Media Trading
Description:
About Us
MediaMath is a leading independent advertising technology company, working with brands and agencies. We created the first software for real-time media buying in 2007 and today work with over two-thirds of the Fortune 500 and more than 3,500 brands and their agency partners to grow and deepen direct customer relationships.
We have recently launched SOURCE by MediaMath which provides our clients with the purest media supply to connect their brands with consumers: real impressions on real media properties; real humans connected to with real ads, at scale; and a true and trusted data set that enables machine learning and attribution at scale, across channels such as mobile, Connected TV, Digital Out of Home, and display.
We need talent like you to fuel this next-generation ecosystem.
Key Responsibilities
We are seeking smart, data focused individuals to join our Trading team. The Trading team is responsible for driving client performance on the MediaMath TerminalOne platform, leveraging cutting edge product functionality as well as a vast network of best in class partnerships to do so. The team tend to have backgrounds as campaign managers, ad operations specialists or traders.
As an Sr. Analyst, you will become a subject matter expert on how media campaigns are managed using programmatic platforms and optimization engines. Analyst manage campaigns as well as consult directly with clients to ensure optimal campaign performance. They also participate in research, analytics, and product testing efforts to develop new best practices and cultivate industry thought leadership.
You will:
Apply analytics in a business environment; marketing analysis, data mining, predictive modelling, customer segmentation, forecasting, econometric modelling, etc. for campaign design, campaign management, and analysis
Work with large data sets and understanding analytic methodologies for evaluating data with SQL and/or other data manipulation tools
Trade and optimize media in the MediaMath TerminalOne Platform
Interface directly with MediaMath clients
You have:
Bachelor's degree required
1-2 years of experience in campaign management
Either experience with data analysis, client engagement, marketing or hands-on media trading in the marketing or advertising industry - either full time or as part of your role - trading or trader
Understanding of adtech platforms and ideally have had hands on exposure with a DSP
You Are:
Experienced with MS Excel and Power Point
Able to demonstrate analytical skills and ability to think creatively about challenging problems
Strongly desired: Familiarity with SQL or other data manipulation tools
Someone with an insatiable appetite for learning in a collaborative environment
All about attention to details
Able to self-manage and juggle multiple priorities
An excellent communicator – ability to distill key ideas for a non-mathematical audience
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, fun, and entrepreneurial environment
Collaborative and team focused
Why We Work at MediaMath
We are restless innovators, smart, passionate and kind. At the heart of our culture are six values that provide a framework for how we approach our work and the world: Teams Win, Scale + Innovation, Obsess Over Learning & Growth, Align then Execute, Do Good Better and Embrace the Journey. These values inform how we energize one another and engage with our clients. They get us amped to come to work. And, let's face it, so do the free snacks and great benefits.
We were named a Leader in both the 2018 and 2019 Gartner Magic Quadrants for Ad Tech, won four awards from the IAB for Sales, Service and Education Excellence, and received Best DMP in the 2019 Digiday Technology Awards. We have offices in 16 cities worldwide and are headquartered in New York City.
MediaMath is committed to equal employment opportunity. It is a fundamental principle at MediaMath not to discriminate against employees or applicants for employment on any legally-recognized basis including, but not limited to: age, race, creed, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, sex, disability, predisposing genetic characteristics, genetic information, military or veteran status, marital status, gender identity/transgender status, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical condition, and other protected characteristic as established by law.

Title: Senior Quantitative Researcher, Equities Alternative Data
Description:
Why
Quantitative Research is what drives every single investment decision we make in the Global markets. Quantitative Researchers work as a collaborative team to develop short, medium and long-term systematic investment strategies, enabled by a leading-edge research and development platform. The firms Quantitative Research team has been established and growing for over 20 years and holds a stellar, and Global reputation as a World-class investment manager. This position represents a unique opportunity to join a distinguished and hugely successful quantitative investment team to assist the firm further explore and expand their systematic alphas in the Alt-Data space.
Role
We are looking for an exceptional and experienced Senior Quantitative Researcher to create and improve proprietary trading models and strategies focused on the ALT-DATA market. Senior Quantitative Researchers work on a variety of trading strategies and research projects, conduct independent research and originate research topics. Specific responsibilities range from utilizing financial and alt data in an effort to create or improve predictive models and alphas, developing and/or leveraging leading-edge statistical and machine-learning models to enhance the research, creating algorithms to monetize the predictive signals.

Qualifications
Alpha Research experience on systematic trading strategies (absolute return/Prop)
Expertise, passion and experience developing Quantitative alpha strategies utilising Alt-Data
Excellent data analysis skills, with strong research hygiene and determination
Self-motivated and highly-productive, with a strong sense of ownership and urgency
Intellectually curious, creative, and rigorous
Excellent communication and collaboration skills

Firm
This position is with one of the World’s leading and most successful Hedge Funds and headquartered in London (Knightsbridge). They run several tens of billion dollars in asset under management and have approximately 300 staff members worldwide. You would be joining an award-winning and innovative team, who operate a collaborative research lab structure and have delivered solutions to some of the most complex problems in Finance, and the team contains several Authors, Speakers, and recognised specialists. We look for, hire and compensate for the very best Quantitative Researchers in the World who proactively push boundaries of what is possible, and has a burning desire to deliver a strong return.

The working environment is best described as extremely fast-paced, flat, meritocratic, collaborative and open. It is an environment that is suitable for experienced and successful Researchers that have genuine expertise in their markets. We are hiring for the expertise and the value that this expertise brings to the team, and the firm.
Available
Competitive buyside basic salary
Annual discretionary bonus (multiples - performance-driven)
Intellectually challenging and stimulation environment
A mature, collaborative and meritocratic culture
Private pension, Private Family Healthcare, and Insurances
25 days holiday & 20 days sick pay
Free daily cooked breakfast and lunch
Free coffee shop and bakery

Title: CADD Lead
Description:
CK Technical are recruiting for an CADD Lead position to join a pharmaceutical company at their site based in Slough on a contract basis for 12 months.
The Company:
Our client is a global biopharmaceutical company focusing on the treatment of diseases in immunology and neurology.
The Location:
This role is located on a well-established biopharma R&D facility based in Slough. There are good transport links whether you drive or even use public transport.
CADD Lead Role: Key Responsibilities:
Drive IT initiatives requiring a very close collaboration with CADD and Chemistry partners.
Lead the selection and creation of next generation CADD tools
Lead the ideation and introduction of novel applications and software tools
Lead new scientific software development projects through ideation and introduction of novel applications and tools.
Identify and enable technology & opportunities to cover unmet needs for CADD/Scientific applications in Early Solutions.
Mentor a team of software developers based in Bangalore.
Your Background:

Modelling/AI data analysis skills using common Data Mining and Machine Learning tools based on Python, JavaScript, R, Julia… (Scientific Programming).
