Title: Senior Java Developer
Description:
Senior Java Developer
We're looking for a full-time Senior Java Developer to join our growing team in London. The role is a unique opportunity to build beautifully simple experiences that guide our customers through TransferWise, helping them to live, travel and work internationally.
For our customers, using TransferWise should feel as simple as sending a text message. Yet behind our app and website lies a complex, one-of-a-kind engine of currencies and routes that's being designed, built and powered by our talented teams in cities around the world. With new capabilities being built every day, there's still heaps to figure out, and we can't do it alone.
You'll receive a competitive package, generous stock options, private healthcare, flexible working and a range of other benefits.
Your mission
Help us take TransferWise to the next level as we scale to impact 100's of millions more customers. You'll hide away all complexities under the hood of our product and build seamless experiences for our customers
Working on the core flow of TransferWise, you'll guide our customers from their first experience on our landing page to completing a transfer and making sure they are informed every step of the way
Create clear and helpful interfaces, whilst maintaining consistency, maintainability, performance and an understanding of what problems our customers might encounter along the way
This role will give you the opportunity to:
Choose your own path to success - you'll have the freedom to define the vision and the responsibility for making it happen
Be flexible in how and where you work, we understand everyone needs a little something different so we'll do our best to make it happen
Travel to work with our teams in London and Budapest as well as meet various partners and organizations when needed
Inspire teams with your ideas, knowledge and self-starting attitude
A bit about you:
You'll be passionate about product and user experience - customers are at the heart of what you do and that empathy drives your decisions
You'll have solid Java 8 knowledge and hands-on experience
You have high coding standards (TDD, Clean Code)
You know your way around dependencies, have experience in performance tuning and have used DB abstraction layers like Hibernate or messaging services (Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ, JMS)
You have experience working with Spring, Spring Boot and REST microservices
You have worked for several years within a production environment
Some extra skills that would be awesome:
You have experience with financial systems
You have knowledge of PostgreSQL, advanced types and query features
Perhaps you have experience with machine learning or other data driven development experience
You know your way around event driven architecture
You have some Groovy experience
A bit about TransferWise:

Since 2011, we've had a clear mission: money without borders. Built by and for people who live global lives, we're the fairest, easiest way to manage your money across borders.

We're just at the beginning of our story and we're growing at an incredible pace. We won't stop until anyone, anywhere can send, spend and receive money wherever they are, whatever they're doing. There's still heaps to do and we can't do it alone.

Our People:

At TransferWise, you'll be joining a movement of people who believe in a better, fairer, more transparent way of moving money around the world. You'll collaborate to do your best work and take on problems that no one has looked at before.

If you're keen to learn, grow, try new things and aren't afraid of a bold plan, you'll fit right in.

How we work:

At TransferWise our strategy emerges from the collective brainpower of all our people, who are organised in dozens of independent, autonomous teams. Teams stay closest to our customers, so they choose what problems to solve and where to spend the most time.

You'll experience radical levels of ownership and empowerment within your role. Plus the opportunity to see the direct impact of your work on our customers.
#LI-RJ1

Title: Business Consulting, Senior Consultant
Description:
FICO (NYSE: FICO) is a leading global analytics software company, helping businesses in 90+ countries make better decisions. Join our world-class team today and fulfill your career potential!
Job Summary
Job Description
FICO Advisors is a global team of fraud business consultants that travel globally advising clients in best practice fraud management techniques. FICO Advisors work on a wide range of fraud disciplines across different industry segments, predominately in financial crime management. We are considered industry thought leaders, who save our clients millions of pounds every year (many of which are the world’s largest financial institutions). This role gives you the opportunity to learn from experts in fraud management, while getting to run a diverse range of analytic projects which protect clients from fraud exposure. If you a driven individual with a strong risk or business analytical mind, who is interested in working in financial crime management then we would like to hear from you.

The FICO Advisors Practice is a dedicated group within FICO that provides best in class customer lifecycle consulting services to the financial services industry.

The FICO Fraud Consulting group mainly offers 2 different types of consulting services:
The first is aimed at supporting the Falcon solutions used by clients. Consultants are required to be experts in all aspects of the solutions and be able to provide best practice approaches for the configuration and use of this tool. This type of consulting is provided to new customers during the implementation of Falcon, but is also offered to existing Falcon customers post implementation.
Secondly FICO fraud consulting group offers Fraud Advisory services. These offerings are independent of the solution used, but are based on providing fraud management thought leadership. Advisory services are aimed at helping financial institutions in managing fraud exposure across different products (Cards, Retail Banking, Acquiring Loans, Mortgages, Insurance etc..), coping with industry changes or dealing with certain fraud management challenges (First Party Fraud, Internal Fraud etc).
What You’ll Do
Consultants are responsible for providing best in class recommendations in Fraud Analytics. Consultants are required to be experts in fraud analysis and be able to offer impartial, practical and actionable enhancements to clients’ fraud environments.
The Fraud Consultant will collaborate with the client through other consultants to develop methodologies for the effective delivery of the business aspect of any fraud solution implementation.
Support and conduct a detailed data analysis to develop a thorough understanding of the client’s requirements for fraud products and services.
Responsibilities also include working with professional service project management team to assist clients while converting to fraud solutions.
A consultant needs the ability to work collaboratively taking guidance from peers on the overall engagements, while taking responsibility for specific deliverables.
Problem solving and the ability to develop unique approaches for challenging situations that address a customised client need.
Consultants are expected to work with the client to identify other opportunities for FICO within Fraud Consulting or other areas (i.e. credit risk) within the client’s business.
Provide regular feedback to the Fraud Consulting Director and Analytic Business Consulting Management Team.
Expected to proactively participate in providing new ideas and recommendations for fraud services and product offerings that may be valuable for clients in different geographical regions globally.
Work with the Fraud Consulting team to continue to build a strong collegial working relationship that creates opportunities for knowledge sharing so that the business unit continues to provide valuable services to its clients.
What We’re Seeking
Skills & Experience
A University degree in Business, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field of study would be preferable or equivalent experience. MBA designation is an asset, as well as successful accreditation in either CFE or CISSP.
Proficiency in a second language is an advantage (i.e. French, Spanish, Chinese, Japanese, German).
Proven ability to develop strong relationships with new and existing clients.
Experience of collaborating in a matrix management environment.
Proven leadership skills through successful project completion.
Extensive experience with progressive responsibilities for operational and business mandates in fraud or credit risk, with a premier financial institution, credit card issuer, or risk management consulting firm.
Sound understanding and experience in all areas of the fraud management lifecycle, including strategy, data analysis and MIS and operations.
A fraud professional recognised for having made significant measurable contributions within their regional market.
Demonstrated results orientation and the ability to influence, negotiate, build relationships, and manage change.
Experience supporting the development of strategic planning documents, proposals, business cases, and detailed reports complemented by strong communication skills (verbal, written, presentation).
End user knowledge of Falcon, Auth Systems, Processor Systems.
Proven analytical, problem solving & time management skills are essential.
Ability to frequently travel domestically and internationally.
Personal Characteristics
Candidate must be able to be comfortable interfacing with senior client management as well as FICO senior management
Candidate must have the experience, confidence and expertise to make appropriate and timely business decisions
Ability to effectively listen to clients and understand their priorities and business needs
Highly professional and organized
Leadership through influence
High degree of diplomacy and superior interpersonal skills
Ability to effectively listen to clients and understand their priorities and needs
Highly developed written and oral business communication skills
Self-motivated and enthusiastic
Ability to prioritise workload and adapt to changing priorities
Ability to work effectively under pressure
Our Offer to You
Flexible working practices, a lucrative base salary and bonus package, enhanced family leave policies.
A culture and work environment strongly reflecting our core values: Act Like an Owner, Delight Our Customers and Earn the Respect of Others.
The opportunity to make a difference by leveraging your unique strengths.
Opportunities to give back to your community, social events with colleagues.
Why Make a Move to FICO?
At FICO, you can develop your career with a leading organization in one of the fastest-growing fields in technology today – Big Data analytics. You’ll play a part in our commitment to help businesses use data to improve every choice they make, using advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, predictive and prescriptive modeling, and much more.
FICO makes a real difference in the way businesses operate worldwide:
Credit Scoring — 150+ billion FICO Scores have been sold to date, making it the most used credit score in the world.
Fraud Detection and Security — 2.6+ billion payment cards globally are protected by FICO fraud systems.
Lending — 3/4 of US mortgages are approved using the FICO Score.
Anti-Money Laundering — our solutions check more than half a billion transactions a day to prevent criminal schemes such as terrorist financing
Global trends toward digital transformation have created tremendous demand for FICO’s solutions, placing us among the world’s top 100 software companies by revenue. We support many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, telecommunications providers and other firms reach a new level of success.
Our success is dependent on really talented people – just like you – who thrive on the collaboration and innovation that’s nurtured by a diverse and inclusive environment. We’ll provide the support you need, while ensuring you have the freedom to develop your skills and grow your career. Join FICO and help change the way business thinks!
Learn more about how you can fulfill your potential at www.fico.com/Careers
FICO values the benefit that diversity and a culture of inclusion bring to our workplace. We are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and we’re proud to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Title: Senior Hadoop Administrator
Description:
Position Type :
Full time
Type Of Hire :
Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)
Education Desired :
Bachelor of Computer Engineering
Travel Percentage :
0%
Senior Hadoop Administrator
London
Are you curious, motivated, and forward-thinking? At FIS you’ll have the opportunity to work on some of the most challenging and relevant issues in financial services and technology. Our talented people empower us, and we believe in being part of a team that is open, collaborative, entrepreneurial, passionate and above all fun.
About the team
Data Technology Services (Datatech) provides Worldpay’s Big Data capabilities including large scale data processing, analytics, fraud platforms, machine learning engineering, stream processing and data insights.
Datatech provides large compute clusters in multiple datacenters and the cloud. Datatech teams self-organise using agile practises and operate within a modern devops culture.
What you will be doing
The Senior Hadoop Administrator is a key role ensuring that the Hadoop platform at the heart of this initiative is secure, available, performant and fit for purpose.
Alongside the Lead Hadoop Administrators responsible for the implementation, management and operation of the Enterprise Data Platform.
Significant contributor to the development, operation and administration of the EDP Hadoop Clusters; working in conjunction with other team members to provide a highly available and performant environment.
Significant contributor to the Design, Implementation and Maintenance of a mission critical HA and DR solution; Establish methods to ensure appropriate systems recovery.
Significant contributor to the Monitoring and Management of the Hadoop cluster performance and capacity planning
Significant contributor to the end-to-end performance tuning of Hadoop clusters and Hadoop Map/Reduce routines against very large data sets.
Significant contributor to the Development and Validation of Hadoop cluster connectivity and security within a highly secure environment (Knox, Ranger, Kerberos, Active Directory, TLS, SPNEGO); Establish methods to ensure appropriate systems security
Significant contributor to the definition and maintenance of Operational documentation and provisioning of subsequent support and training. Lead contributor to Key Design Decision process, quality standards and validation techniques.
Lead for
o The management of Hadoop software patches and upgrades; 3rd party software installation and configuration
o The troubleshooting of Hadoop issues with other team members; Resolve configuration issues with Apache add-on tools
o Management of subsidiary PostgreSQL databases: e.g. backup and recovery, connectivity and security, upgrades and patching
o Management and ownership of end-user and support ticketing systems and resolution of tickets.
Develop, implement and document test plans for the production solution.
Develop, implement and document processes and procedures for High Availability and Disaster Recovery.
Point of Contact for Vendor escalation
Provide out of hours support as and when required in order to ensure an Operational System.
What you bring:
3+ years Hadoop Technical Support or hands on Hadoop Administrator experience with multi-terabyte Hadoop production infrastructure with 1+ years as Senior position.
Strong experience of administration within Linux based production environments, including command line editors, scripting within a production environment (Shell, Python, Perl, etc.)
Practical experience of securing Hadoop and related technologies within a Kerberos and Active Directory environment.
Added bonus if you have:
Certification as Hortonworks Hadoop Administrator
Majority of prior experience with Hortonworks Data Platform.
Implemented High Availability and Disaster Recovery Hadoop production infrastructure.
Experience in all aspects of the software development lifecycle including requirements gathering, design, coding, testing, source control and production support and leadership in setting of standards for these.
Experience with processing of a variety of file formats (XML, JSON, unstructured data, etc.)
Strong Unix or Database engineering and administration background and has moved into Big Data.
Experience with Big Data cloud deployments.
Performed and managed technical Proof of Concepts.
What we offer you
A multifaceted job with a high degree of responsibility and a broad spectrum of opportunities
A competitive salary and benefits
Varied and challenging work to help you grow your technical skillset
A fantastic range of benefits including private medical cover, dental cover and travel insurance
Privacy Statement
FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice.
Sourcing Model
Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.

Title: Senior Software Development Engineer
Description:
A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
Strong experience in architecting and building multi-threaded, distributed systems
Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, big "O" analysis and designing for performance, scalability and availability
Outstanding problem-solving abilities and a clear commitment to making Amazon a great place to work
Ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment
Sound business judgment, proven ability to influence others and strong analytical thinking skills
Entrepreneurial spirit and willingness to have fun!

Amazon.co.uk opened its virtual doors in October 1998 and strives to be the world's most customer-centric company, where customers can find and discover anything that they might want to buy online. Originally known as a bookseller, Amazon.co.uk has dramatically expanded its range over the years to offer everything from DVDs to MP3s, Toys to Tools, Clothing to Computers and so much more.
The Selection Contribution Platform team (SCP) owns the systems that allow Amazon to carry the largest, highest quality and most up to date selection in the world. SCP directly contributes to Amazon's vision of carrying earth's largest selection. As a member of the team, you will play a key role in driving Amazon's business. You will solve technical challenges in large webscale computing, distributed systems, web applications, data mining, optimization, scalability, availability and algorithms to name a few. Working with business teams to translate their needs into technical requirements you will build cutting-edge systems that meet challenging business and technical goals.

Innovation
Are you seeking an environment where you can drive innovation? Do you want to apply state-of-the-art computer science to solve real world problems? Do you have a curious mind that applies concepts like machine learning, pattern matching and mathematical modelling to solve complex online business scenarios? Do you want to pave the future of Amazon Retail, enhancing how we do business as a key player in global e-commerce?

Opportunity
To meet these challenges, we are looking for a passionate, talented and super-smart software engineer. We’re looking for someone who innovates, loves solving hard problems and never takes no for an answer. Our engineers are some of the best software developers in the industry, who work hard, have fun and make history.
With a broad technology toolbox you are able to select the right technical solution for each business challenge, playing a key role within the team as we build innovative and robust solutions that drive ongoing expansion to Amazon's catalogs across our worldwide websites. Your solutions must be well designed, implemented, tested, deployed and supported. Your success will depend on your skills in understanding the big picture of Amazon's business and delivering incremental solutions contributing to the larger vision.
Amazon offers a competitive reward package, pension scheme and life cover, 25 days holiday per annum and a range of other excellent benefits including private healthcare. You will also have the opportunity to develop a rewarding career. Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. We welcome applications from all members of society irrespective of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

A Masters or PhD in Computer Science or a related technical discipline
Experience taking a leading role in building complex software systems that have been successfully delivered to customers
Experience mentoring junior software engineers to improve their skills and make them more effective, product software engineers
Hands-on expertise in many disparate technologies, typically ranging from front-end user interfaces through to back-end systems and all points in between
Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build.

Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.

#NicheTechUK

Title: Senior Integration Developer
Description:
A career in our Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence practice will provide you with the opportunity to help organisations uncover enterprise insights and drive business results using smarter data analytics. We focus on a collection of organisational technology capabilities, including business intelligence, data management, and data assurance that help our clients drive innovation, growth, and change within their organisations in order to keep up with the changing nature of customers and technology. You’ll make impactful decisions by mixing mind and machine to leverage data, understand and navigate risk, and help our clients gain a competitive edge.

Our team helps organisations understand the potential rewards and risks associated with implementing artificial intelligence tools. As part of the team, you’ll help with pattern recognition, predictive modelling, text mining and search, programming and miscellaneous data analytics.
To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be an authentic and inclusive leader, at all grades/levels and in all lines of service. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.
As a Senior Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:
Take action to ensure everyone has a voice, inviting opinion from all
Establish the root causes of issues and tackle them, rather than just the symptoms
Initiate open and honest coaching conversations at all levels
Move easily between big picture thinking and managing relevant detail
Anticipate stakeholder needs, and develop and discuss potential solutions, even before the stakeholder realises they are required
Develop specialised expertise in one or more areas
Advise stakeholders on relevant technical issues for their business area
Navigate the complexities of global teams and engagements
Build trust with teams and stakeholders through open and honest conversation
Uphold the firm's code of ethics and business conduct
An experienced Integration Developer with a strong track record of applying Enterprise Integration Patterns to design, code and test solutions in an Agile environment. This is a hands-on development role that would suit candidates who have strong experience integrating distributed solutions at scale in a microservices environment and who enjoy collaborating as part of a team, mentoring, knowledge sharing and pair programming.
The candidate is expected to be a delivery-focused, self-starter who is keen to actively contribute to the success of the team and who is comfortable taking responsibility for all aspects of a feature including both functional and non-functional elements such as security and resilience. They must be able to demonstrate evidence of having been instrumental in delivering practical integration solutions into production environments at scale in scenarios requiring both parallel and distributed elements.
Required skills
Enterprise Integration Patterns (EIP)
Apache Camel
Microservices
Web Services
REST
Understanding of data formats and serialisation (e.g. JSON, protobuf, MIME)
Behaviour-Driven Development (BDD)
Java
Maven
Spring Boot
JMS
Nice to have
Experience of DevOps
OAuth
OpenID Connect

About PwC

We’re one of the world’s leading professional services organisations. From 158 countries, we help our clients, some of the most successful organisations on the globe, as well as its most dynamic entrepreneurs and thriving private businesses, to create the value they want. We help to measure, protect and enhance the things that matter most to them.

The skills we look for in future employees

All our people need to demonstrate the skills and behaviours that support us in delivering our business strategy. This is important to the work we do for our business, and our clients. These skills and behaviours make up our global leadership framework, ‘The PwC Professional’ and are made up of five core attributes; whole leadership, technical capabilities, business acumen, global acumen and relationships.

Learn more here www.pwc.com/uk/careers/experienced/apply

Diversity

We work in a changing world which offers great opportunities for people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We seek to attract and employ the best people from the widest talent pool, as well as those who reflect the diverse nature of our society. And we aim to encourage a culture where people can be themselves and be valued for their strengths. Creating value through diversity is what makes us strong as a business and as an organisation with an increasingly agile workforce, we're open to flexible working arrangements where appropriate.

Title: Senior Software Engineer -JavaScript
Description:
We are notonthehighstreet.

We’re home to 5,000 phenomenal small creative businesses that we are proud to call our Partners. But, now more than ever, this community needs our support. So we’re doing all we can to shine a light on these dynamic entrepreneurs, waving the flag for small businesses and generally championing their socks off.

On top of our brilliant Partners, products and customers (not to mention our incredible team who have been busy beavering away from home since March), the last 12 months has seen great progress with our tech platform and customer experience. We are now looking to build on this momentum to drive our business to the next level. And that’s where you come in.

What we need

We’ve embarked on an ambitious new phase of development to advance our technology including platform re-architecture to modern microservices and rewriting the front end. This will include moving all the services to cutting-edge tech and introducing new big data & machine learning platforms. It’s an exciting time and we need to strengthen and grow our teams!
As Senior Engineer you will join one of our engineering teams building a new set of micro services and front end for Not on The High Street customers, partners and internal users.
Some of the things you'll be doing
Writing, testing and maintaining quality code
Working with a small, empowered cross-functional team to deliver business value
Making a significant contribution to defining, maintaining and improving our architecture and best practices
Designing and building systems which are performant and secure
Providing support for other team members through code review, pairing and mentoring
Be part of our success and make a difference
Some key skills + experience you’ll need
You will have fresh hands-on experience as a Senior or Mid level or junior engineer, ideally in an Agile eCommerce/Digital environment
Javascript, front end frameworks, preferably React including server rendered React
Would be great if you had experience with Node.js and GraphQL
Cloud Technologies (preferably AWS)
Experience with event driven architectures
Keen software engineering approach
Desire to work closely with the business, learn new things and teach others
Ability to take ownership of a project or issue, analyse it and solve problems not faced before
TDD and functional programming
Experience with agile development methodologies
Champion of modern development practices and tools, e.g. Continuous Delivery with Jenkins, Source Control with Git, AWS Infrastructure etc
Previous e-commerce experience would also be beneficial
Our current stack includes Ruby, Java, React, Node.js, ElasticSearch, Jenkins, Docker, and AWS and so experience with any (or many!) of those would be highly advantageous
Our perks

It’s important to us that our people are well looked after, which is why we offer everyone BUPA healthcare, life insurance and a pension plan. Because having a break is important for your physical and mental wellbeing, our holiday allowance is 25 days (plus bank holidays) AND your entitlement increases an extra day for every 2 years you spend with us.

The team spirit at NOTHS House is legendary, and while we all miss the in-office massages, hair cuts and the abundance of free fruit, we’ve taken to our virtual world with gusto and bring the team together regularly for socials and of course the odd Zoom quiz!

We endeavour to support our people to make sure work….well, works for them. And the pretty big issue of the recent global pandemic has propelled us into working more flexibly than ever before. With the office closed until further notice (at least until government social distancing advice has changed), we’re using the lessons learnt over this period to evolve our approach to flexible working whilst ensuring we all still get together as one #teamnoths

Diversity and Inclusion

We are committed to equal opportunities and to building a more diverse and inclusive team and are working with our recently formed internal community in driving progress.

Apply to join #teamnoths

We’d love to hear more about you, your experience and why you’d like to join our team.

For now, our recruitment and induction processes are fully remote, taking advantage of the wonders of modern-day technology. If you are successful in your initial application we’ll explain more about next steps, as this can vary slightly from role to role. Good luck!

Title: Sr. Solutions Architect - Global Partners - Data & ML
Description:
Customer relationship management experience and collaboration skills
Experience working with global teams in a highly matrixed organization
Executive speaking and presentation skills – Formal presentations, white boarding, large and small group presentations.
Ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges in an enterprise environment. Understanding of Agile methodologies, and the ability to apply these practices to Data, Analytics & ML projects.
Highly technical and analytical, possessing 8+ years of analytics platform implementation or operations experience. Deep understanding of database and analytics technologies in the industry including MPP, Relational, and NOSQL databases.
5+ years professional experience in software development in languages like Java, Python, Scala. Experience working with RESTful API and general service oriented architectures.
Implementation and tuning experience in the Apache Hadoop Ecosystem, including Hadoop Streaming, Spark, Pig and Hive.
Implementation and tuning experience of Data Warehousing platforms, including knowledge of Data Warehouse Schema Design, Query Tuning and Optimization, and Data Migration and Integration. Experience of requirements for the analytics presentation layer including Dashboards, Reporting, and OLAP.
BA/BS degree required

Would you like to be part of a team that is redefining the IT industry? Amazon Web Services is leading the next paradigm shift in computing and is looking for a world class candidate for the role of Partner Solution Architect, Data, Analytics and Machine Learning, within our Global Systems Integrators (GSI) Channels & Alliances business function.

This is an ideal role for someone who has experience working for a global systems integrator, a large IT consulting firm, or a Fortune 1000 company. In this role, you will develop the technical capabilities of our Global System Integrators (GSIs) so they can be successful in the cloud. Working with these large partners is a team effort that will require influence and coordination with many stakeholders to collaborate on solutions in Big Data and Analytics and Machine Learning. These engagements will focus on Real Time and Batch-based Big Data processing, Data and ML strategy, Business Intelligence, and Visualizations. If you are a problem solver with a data & analytics technical skills and a growing knowledge of how Machine Learning compliments the data, you will enjoy this role.

In this technical role, you will architect enterprise-grade Amazon Web Services solutions, own the technical relationship and deliverables for a GSI on large enterprise transformational customer opportunities, develop and execute multi-day workshops, lead white boarding sessions, author white papers and blog posts, and respond to complex technical inquiries including RFPs. You will partner with ProServe, Sales, Business Development and the Data, Analytics & ML Service teams to enable the partner’s Data, Analytics and ML services adoption.

Your roles and responsibilities will include:
Design Customer Solutions with GSIs to use Amazon Web Services such as Elastic Map Reduce (EMR), Redshift, Kinesis, Lambda, Data Pipeline, S3, DynamoDB, and the Relational Database Service (RDS).
Understand at a baseline level Machine Learning on AWS, including Apache MxNet and TensorFlow, 2) Machine Learning Platforms such as Amazon SageMaker for data scientists and 3) API-driven Services like Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Comprehend, and Amazon Rekognition to quickly add intelligence to applications with a simple API call.
Help manage and drive joint Strategic Deals between the partner and AWS. Build a set of best practices around how data, analytics and ML fit into our largest deals, and replicate across geographies.
Thought Leadership – Evangelize AWS Data, Analytics & ML services to share best practices through forums such as AWS Big Data or ML blogs, whitepapers and reference architectures, as well as public-speaking events such as AWS Summits, AWS re:Invent, etc.
Act as a technical liaison between customers and the Data, Analytics & ML services engineering teams to provide customer driven product improvement feedback.
Serve as a key member of the business development and account management team in helping to ensure customer success in building and migrating applications, software and services on AWS.
Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the worldwide AWS solution architect community.
Provide the architectural guidance and recommendations necessary to promote successful partner engagements
Assist system integrators in building offerings and technical strategies that will enable them to build and sell their offering on the AWS platform
Coach and train System Integrators on an ongoing basis to adopt AWS innovations for Data, Analytics & ML workloads
Travel up to 50% (Post COVID-19 restrictions)

Professional experience architecting/operating solutions built on AWS
Visible IT Industry thought leadership on relevant topics related to enterprise IT infrastructure
Experience with Machine and Deep Learning toolkits such as MXNet, TensorFlow, Caffe and PyTorch.
Experience with AWS services related to AI/ML highly desirable, particularly Amazon EMR, AWS Lambda, Machine Learning, IoT, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon S3, Amazon EC2 Container Service, Greengrass etc.
Experience working with/for Global Systems Integrators and knowing the market landscape
International sales and delivery experience w/ global F500 enterprise customers and partners
Use of AWS services in distributed environments with Enterprise Software
Advanced degrees in engineering and/or business
Cloud and/or AWS experience; AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Associate Level, AWS Certified Big Data – Specialty, AWS Certified Machine Learning - Specialty

Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Title: Senior Programme Manager
Description:
Senior Programme Manager

Description
We are looking for a driven, talented Programme Manager with knowledge in running cross-functional change and delivery programmes to help us build our SaaS-based anti-money laundering solutions, which help organizations fight financial crime! We are building cutting edge solutions that help reveal the truth for a safer world and stop money ending up in the hands of terrorists. You will be a founding member of our new delivery function, being involved in delivering strategic programmes of work both internally and also for our larger customers.
About us
Since launching in 2014, we have been on a mission to fight financial crime on a global scale. In that time, we have raised over $35m in funding, opened offices in New York, Singapore and Romania, and have grown to over 280 employees, and we're not stopping there!
We aim to grow to over 350 employees in the next 12 months, as we continue to fight the good fight against financial crime and help make compliance less painful for our client base of over 450 customers across 45 different countries. We're leveraging game-changing tech to help us on our mission, building our platform around AI, Machine Learning and Big Data, meaning that our platform is unrivaled in its capabilities.
No fight against crime is complete without the right values, and we take ours very seriously!
Focus on the Team - We're Collaborative, Human, and Humble
Kaizen - We're Curious, Proactive and Agile
Deliver Results - We're Tenacious, Accountable and Focused

We can only defeat financial crime if we have the right people with the right values in place to do so, and we're committed to investing in passionate people who are experts in their field. Our culture and working environment is second to none - Don't believe us? See what our employees have to say on Glassdoor

The Role
We are looking for an expert Programme Manager to join our new delivery team. You'll get involved in
Develop and design cross-cutting programmes of work to deliver against the companies highest objectives both internally and customer facing
Coordinating the successful delivery to the Tier 1 account from contract close through go live to ultimate ongoing delivery
Working with our world class engineering team and delivery managers to ensure successful delivery against milestones.
Developing and building out the ongoing support processes and team to continue to deliver on contractual demands
What does success look like after 3 months?
You will have taken ownership for delivery against our commitments to our largest customers interacting with stakeholders across the business from top to bottom.
In consultation with the COO and CEO you will have identified the key strategic programmes of work across the business and put in processes and mechanisms to effectively deliver those programmes.
You will have formed strong trust based relationships with a wide variety of colleagues globally

The Requirements
We're looking for a smart and motivated individual that takes pride in their work and contributes to an informal working environment. You will be confident in your ability to deliver on the points covered above, and you will have the following:
Strong programme management and organisational skills
Ability to communicate complex topics to both day to day teams and senior stakeholders
Strong leadership, interpersonal and influencing skills
Experience of delivery of tech enabled programmes
You may also have:
Commercial experience (especially of contract negotiation)
Experience working with larger external organisations

Benefits
The benefits of working at ComplyAdvantage include the below;
Competitive salary
Stock options
25 days' holiday
Flexible working hours, and remote working opportunity
Company Pension Scheme
Company Health Care Plan
Travel season loan ticket
Cycle to work scheme with Evans Cycles
Training and development budget

Title: Marketing Lead UK
Description:
Having world class products is great but to continue our growth we need to be known far and wide – this is where the Marketing Lead comes in. We're looking for a dynamic and curious person to bring passion, business acumen, innovation and focus on performance and results to the marketing team.
You will be working closely with your Marketing and Commercial colleagues to drive revenue growth by generating quality leads and growing the sales pipeline with focus on impact and ROI. This is a great opportunity to join an exciting innovative, fast growing company and position yourself for excellent opportunities for career growth.
Reporting to the Global Marketing Management Lead (based in Stockholm) and working alongside the wider Marketing and Sales Teams, this is a key role and requires a proven self-starter with strong experience in managing marketing and demand generation projects and deep understanding of digital marketing in an international B2B environment. The desire to work for a fun, fast-paced company with constant change and on an amazing growth trajectory is essential.
What you’ll do
Develop the country marketing strategy and plan, based on company strategy and central marketing strategy, in close collaboration with your Marketing and Commercial colleagues.
Develop and optimise the lead generation strategy for our product portfolio and align this with other marketing and sales activities.
Set targets for, track and improve customer acquisition and activation campaign performance (e.g. CPA, LTV and ROI).
Plan, execute and evaluate marketing initiatives and lead generation campaigns vs targets.
Plan for, set targets and develop business cases with budget asks for online and certain key offline marketing and demand generation activities.
Work with the creative, digital and CRM teams to improve traffic, conversion rates and retention.
Work on the preparation of sales enablement materials such as case studies & ROI analysis for customers adopting iZettle.
What we’re looking for

To be successful in the role you’ll be comfortable working in a fast paced and often unpredictable environment. To get our attention, you’ll have the following...
A proven track record from a similar B2B marketing role with focus on demand generation and customer acquisition marketing.
An integrated marketing mindset, with the ability to understand the interplay between brand building activity and performance marketing, and the balance between marketing channels.
The ability to support both inbound and outbound demand generation activities.
Experience with marketing automation platforms and CRM with the knowledge and ability to act on that insight and adjust demand generation strategies to meet goals.
Experience working as a true partner with Sales to deliver shared goals.
A track record of understanding and briefing creatives on data-driven targeted marketing assets.
Experience in managing budget and paid campaigns.
Be a natural at and love collaborating with others to come up with, impactful programs with high ROI.
Ability to juggle multiple projects and stakeholders simultaneously.
Hugely motivated by achieving metrics (leads volume, revenue, profit, ROI etc).
Thrive in fast paced and constantly changing environments. Bringing a pragmatic mindset.
Enjoy focusing on the big picture, whilst ensuring all details are aligned.
Willingness to roll up the sleeves and work across strategic thinking and planning as well as the execution of marketing plans. For you no project is too big or too small.
Strong knowledge of, and passion for the financial services arena, and new technology within this space is meriting.
Last but not least - project management is a super power of yours.
Job_Description_Summary: In 2018, iZettle became part of the PayPal family. iZettle is on a mission to help small businesses succeed in a world of giants. Tens of millions of small businesses worldwide are still being underserved by the traditional players. By giving small businesses the tools to get paid, sell smarter and grow, we’re empowering them to reach their full potential. Together with PayPal, we can reach 24 million merchants across the world with more of the affordable tools they need to thrive. Join us in putting an end to the ordinary way the world defines financial freedom.
Who we are: Fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, PayPal (NASDAQ: PYPL) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. Our open digital payments platform gives PayPal’s 286 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. Through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, PayPal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. Available in more than 200 markets around the world, the PayPal platform, including Braintree, Venmo and Xoom enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their PayPal accounts in 25 currencies.
We're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We hold ourselves to our One Team Behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. Our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. We want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. Join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom.
PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Title: General Ledger Senior Accountant
Description:
As a key member of the accounting department, the General Ledger Senior Accountant I partners with members of the accounting and finance departments as well as teams across other departments throughout the Company. The position provides exposure to key accounting and reporting areas and offers development opportunities that can lead to advanced roles within the accounting organization or within other departments.
Key Responsibilities:
Independent preparation of monthly and quarterly account analyses and reconciliations for a number of general ledger accounts across Vertex’s various entities. • Work closely with members of the finance team to track and record various types of expenses.
Proactively provide observations/recommendations to all levels of management in order to gain efficiencies in the monthly GL Close process.
Assists in preparation of internal and external SEC financial statement reporting.
Clearly articulates and summarizes changes in account or financial statement line items for internal fluctuation reporting.
Maintains and leverages the financial accounting systems and processes in order to inform critical financial decision-making company-wide.
Collaborates with key contacts at foreign entities to ensure accurate intercompany reporting.
Formulates and provides guidance with regard to accounting policies to all levels of both the Corporate Departments in Boston and at other Vertex locations. • Fosters a climate that creates and evaluates “best practice” processes, structures and systems. Help co-workers translate new change goals into practical implementation steps.
Monitors and evaluates operational efficiency improvements in the business processes and systems utilized to manage responsibilities.
Partner in championing change and the supporting projects. Ensures team understands the links between the changes and the strategic business direction. Assists with the development and communication of the vision, business case, and requirements for change.
Provides and interprets data for external auditors during quarterly and year end audits.
Coordinates SOX documentation and testing with the SEC internal controls team.
Minimum Preferred Qualifications:
BS with a major in Accounting; CPA, preferred
some years experience in an accounting environment, preferably within a pharmaceutical company and/or Big 4 accounting firm.
Preferred Qualifications:
Microsoft suite of software
Experience with Oracle Financial Software, SAP or other General Ledger Accounting system a plus
Excellent communication and organizational skills.
Ability to work independently with strong attention to accuracy and detail
Ability to communicate effectively with higher levels of management.
Successful candidates will possess the following competencies:•
Action Oriented
Integrity and Trust
Informing
Motivating Others
Organizing
Detail oriented
Planning
Priority Setting
Problem Solving
Drive for Results
Time Management
Change Management

Title: Commercial Lead & Product Owner - FTC
Description:
Commercial Lead & Product Owner - FTC
Redhill
Job ref: 200005YP
Closing date: TBC
for this job
Specialism: Sales and Distribution
Career area: Sales and account management
Salary: £50,128.40 - £60,870.20
Description
A great opportunity for a commercially astute and adaptable individual to play a key role in coordinating and executing the commercial and product activities that contribute towards the successful implementation of the Motor and Home transformation programme in the UK and Ireland. Ideally, you will have experience working in the financial services industry in order to bring the balance of insurance, commercial and project knowledge to the role.
You will be responsible for managing and delivering the Products, Contracts & Services workstream plan, coordinating and seeking inputs from subject matter experts as required. This will include acting as a local product owner in the UK for a new product and policy management digital tool (currently being built) and representing the local interests in the wider global programme to ensure positive commercial outcomes of the new technology.
You will have the opportunity to interact with a wide range of stakeholders and put your own stamp on an evolving workstream in a fast paced and dynamic environment.
Day-to-day activities…
Project Management
Own and iterate the project plan for all commercial, products & services activity in the UK Transformation Programme
Highlight, monitor, and escalate risk and issues in a timely manner, mitigating where possible
Coordinate and lead a matrix team of subject matter experts to deliver to milestones
Represent the UK at global level across new technology products, planning, and wider commercial transformation initiatives.
Report on status weekly through delivery meetings and provide written and verbal updates as required to sales, marketing and distribution leadership teams.
Commercial
Act as the commercial domain lead, working with global counterparts to align on vision and plan; translate this into local plans and activities; oversee the implementation of any change to operating model in the commercial space; identify gaps or issues between global vision and/or plans and local ambition and constraints.
Responsible for leading and managing the core commercial activities required including contract analysis, partner database integration activity and modelling policy wording and evaluation of standard services’ applicability to the UK market
Act as the local product owner for the new commercial technology assets to be rolled out in the UK. This will include sharing local requirements with global counterparts; building local use cases and validating the build of the new assets; leading the implementation activities required to get the new assets live.
Responsible for leading all preparatory tasks to make the new technology assets live including configuration of assets for UK use, creation of use cases and liaison with Testing Manager and users to ensure robust testing prior to release
Responsible for preparing the standard operating procedures and processes required for the commercial team (Sales, Marketing and Distribution), and wider business, to make effective use of the new technology in service of benefits delivery
Qualifications
Hard skill and experience
It would be great if your background involved working in B2B commercial or account management functions, ideally with a service based proposition, and have experience of implementing new process in service of achieving commercial and customer outcomes.
You must have some understanding of how B2B contracts and insurance policies are constructed, ideally in an insurance services context.
You will need to have experience in a technology-related transformation project, working to deliver and report to a plan across a matrix organisation. You should have an understanding of the key phases which constitute a change programme.
About you …
You are exceptionally execution-driven with the ability to work with new technologies with an understanding of process automation and implementation tasks. Because of your flexible and adaptable approach, you are able to work in potentially ambiguous situations with the ability to digest complex information and summarise concisely in order to set clear actions and outcomes, and articulate the message to a variety of audiences.
You have a relentless drive for continuous improvement and strong propensity to persevere in a moving and fluid environment.
What else do I need to know?
We know how important work-life balance is, so we want you to know that flexible working hours/working from home is an option.
This is a fixed term contract until the end of 2020, with a possible extension to the end of 2021.
About AXA
AXA Group is the world leader in insurance and asset management. We protect and advise our clients at every step in their lives, by offering products and services which satisfy their needs in the areas of insurance, personal protection, saving and asset management. AXA is the leading insurance brand worldwide, with over 100 million clients. We are transforming from payer to partner for our client, with a strong focus on risk prevention.
Our mission: Empower people to live a better life.

Our values: Customer First, Courage, Integrity and One AXA.
AXA Partners is an AXA transversal business unit offering a wide range of solutions in assistance services, travel insurance and credit protection.

AXA Partners’ role is also to implement innovative solutions emerging from the AXA Innovation unit.

Our mission is to help our Corporate clients to enrich their customers’ experience, with more than 9,000 employees at their service anywhere, anytime.
What We Offer
By joining AXA Partners, you will work in a responsible company, which offers a real culture of expertise & diversity. Our focus is on accelerating the development of everyone’s skills, whilst offering attractive and competitive compensation and opportunities for professional development and growth.
Additionally, at AXA, we work to make a real difference to people - when amazing things happen and when we create opportunities for a better life, the feeling of pride is extraordinary.
What's the best thing about working in the AXA sales team?
Rewards and Benefits
As well as a supportive and rewarding working culture, you'll enjoy a good holiday allowance and generous company pension scheme. Depending on your role you’ll have the opportunity to buy share options, a car allowance and private medical insurance. Note that benefits can vary according to the different part of AXA and the role itself.
Pay and Bonus
We carefully consider our pay levels and carry out a review each year so you are paid fairly for what you do. When AXA does well, we share in its success and all employees are eligible for a discretionary bonus payment each year, dependant on individual and company performance.
Pension and Life Assurance
We want to help you actively plan for a financially healthy retirement, so we offer a Defined Contribution Pension Scheme. This means that we contribute to your pension fund depending on the amount you choose to pay in.
Holiday
Work life balance is important. Our holiday entitlements start at a minimum of 22 days (plus bank holidays) dependent on the business area or the role, increasing up to 28 days (plus bank holidays) with length of service. Depending on which part of AXA you work in, there’s also flexibility to buy up to five additional days or sell up to three days, helping you to achieve the right balance for you.
Recognition
We recognise and reward you when you demonstrate the behaviours that make AXA great.
Our Stories
Would you like to know more about life at AXA? Our AXA Stories offer a good insight into what it's like to work here.
Customer services
A career and life changing trip to Bangalore
Before I joined AXA’s customer service department, I worked for the chief executive of the NHS for nine years. When I said I was leaving, someone said to me that I was moving to the dark side – but nothing could be further from the truth!
Read more
Sales and account management
A day in the life of an Account Manager in the Bristol Broker Hub
“The Broker Hub went live in March 2016. It was created to support and work with intermediaries who may not have considered selling Private Medical Insurance to their clients. My role as an Account Manager involves helping them develop and grow their SME Private Medical Insurance portfolio.
Read more
Location
Wherever you are in the UK, there's likely to be an AXA office near to you.
Redhill
Find out more
Our Values
Our values shape what we do and how we do it. They inspire us, guide us and empower us to work together, push the boundaries, challenge things for the better and believe in ourselves. No matter how big or small our achievements, our values sit at the heart of everything we do.
Customer first
All our thinking starts with the customer
Integrity
We are guided by strong moral principles
Courage
We speak our mind and act to make things happen
One AXA
Being together and being different makes us better
AXA prides itself on being an inclusive employer, so during the application process we will ask for some Equal Opportunities data purely for equality monitoring purposes. The answers received are completely anonymised and will therefore never be used for recruitment purposes. AXA only ever sees a percentage based outcome and this can never be attributed to a specific application.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
What is Syft?
Founded in 2015, Syft is an on-demand marketplace helping Job Seekers and Employers have 100% control and choice over shifts worked in real time. We want to enable Job Seekers to control their schedule, choose their work and enable them to work as many or as few shifts as they want. The platform enables Employers to book reliable, rated and verified staff immediately. At Syft, we’re harnessing innovative technology to revolutionise the flexible staffing sector.

About Us
Our mission is to help people get jobs by democratising work and giving jobseekers ownership, control, and choice. We are working hard to build a world where access to work and jobseekers are frictionless.

Our results speak for themselves, £8.75 million in VC funding between 2016 and 2018, ‘Recruitment Technology Innovation of the Year’ at the Recruiter Awards, ‘Hottest Platform Economy / Marketplace’ at the Europas and ranked 7th in the ‘Startups 100’ in 2018.

Syft has grown to nearly 200 employees across 8 offices around the UK. In 2019 Syft was acquired by Indeed.com, the world’s #1 job site, allowing us to match our synergies and skyrocket our journey.

The Role
As part of the Syft Strategy and Analytics team, your role is to manage our Business Intelligence environment and provide business analytics insights. We expect you to be an expert on Syft data and aid our team to have more visibility on stats by providing multiple dashboards, ad-hoc analysis, drawing insights from data and drive company business. You will first start from partnering with each function team and providing support to the team. This includes the design and development of any data flow and data source, building dashboards, visualizations, and targets management. Development experience in the Tableau environment is a big plus

Responsibilities & Duties
Understand requirements for Business/Product Analytics and Tableau dashboards from business stakeholders and build them to drive business growth
Compile and analyze company, product and operation data to propose opportunities for growth
Propose and manage company targets and performance information
Build and maintain multiple data flows, sources and documentation based on the right understanding of Syft table and data structure
Maintain all data flows and dashboards up to date including quality assurance

Basic Requirements
5+ years of work experience in financial planning & analysis and/or business/product analytics
3+ years of Tableau experiences including building dashboards and visualization
3+ Years working with SQL. Must have the ability to write complex, highly-optimized queries across large volumes of data
Willingness to question the validity, accuracy of data and assumptions
Curiosity and passion about data, visualization and solving problems
Creativity to determine the best solution for a real-world problem with quantitative data
Business Administration, Statistics, Data Science, or related degree

Desirable (nice to have)
Tableau prep and flow maintenance experiences
Knowledge of PostgreSQL
Knowledge of ETL and data warehousing concepts and processes

You’ll fit right in at Syft if:
You’re Flexible- able to consider challenges from different perspectives.
You’re Entrepreneurial- see how a challenge could become an opportunity.
You take Accountability through thick and thin, inviting ideas for improvement.
You’re Data Driven- see the necessity of analysing metrics when devising solutions.
You’re Passionate about what you do and self motivated.
You can Adapt to your team’s challenges and Collaborate with other departments.

What you’ll get:
Flexible work arrangements, remote and working from home.
Employee Assistance programs, free eyecare vouchers, discounted gym memberships and more.
Unique bonus structure for every employee.
Social events and lunch and learns.

Syft is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that wants to build a welcoming and diverse working environment. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to ethnic background, race, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.

Title: Senior Product Manager
Description:
What is Syft?
Founded in 2015, Syft is an on-demand marketplace helping Job Seekers and Employers have 100% control and choice over shifts worked in real time. We want to enable Job Seekers to control their schedule, choose their work and enable them to work as many or as few shifts as they want. The platform enables Employers to book reliable, rated and verified staff immediately. At Syft, we’re harnessing innovative technology to revolutionise the flexible staffing sector.

About Us
Our mission is to help people get jobs by democratising work and giving jobseekers ownership, control, and choice. We are working hard to build a world where access to work and jobseekers are frictionless.

Our results speak for themselves, £8.75 million in VC funding between 2016 and 2018, ‘Recruitment Technology Innovation of the Year’ at the Recruiter Awards, ‘Hottest Platform Economy / Marketplace’ at the Europas and ranked 7th in the ‘Startups 100’ in 2018.

Syft has grown to nearly 200 employees across 8 offices around the UK. In 2019 Syft was acquired by Indeed.com, the world’s #1 job site, allowing us to match our synergies and skyrocket our journey.

About You
You’re someone who wants to see the impact of your work making a difference every day. Your friends describe you as thorough, analytical and detail-oriented. You are someone with high standards who leads by example, and who will take pride in Syft like we do.
You take big problems, break them into the smallest MVP and ship them fast to learn and iterate rapidly. Most of all, you love solving hard challenges to make a difference in the lives of other people, whether they be job seekers, employers or your fellow colleagues.
We aim to fundamentally change how the world looks at work in a way that benefits both Job Seekers and Employers. We are looking for someone who is thrilled by all the possibilities.

Responsibilities & Duties:
Focus on data driven decision making through iterative feature development.
Communicate with and align Stakeholders about product direction, strategy and the operational execution.
Understanding business objectives and mapping day-to-day efforts into those business outcomes.
Producing clear MVP definition and roadmap and work collaboratively with engineering to execute on it.
Collect and analyse feedback from our users, clients and internal stakeholders.

Basic Requirements
5+ years of Product Management experience.
Can take an unstructured problem and build a product roadmap to solve it in a structured manner.
Experience with B2B and B2C products.
Track record of obsessively understanding your customers looking to wow and delight every customer.
Experienced using SQL, Excel, Jira, Mixpanel/ Google Analytics.
Able to breakdown complex problems into simple solutions.
Mobile First Product Development Experience.
You measure everything and attention to detail.
Self starter and Entrepreneurial spirit.

Preferred Requirements
Marketplace Experience
Hiring/ Recruitment Space Experience
Experience Launching Products Globally
Experience launching products without dedicated UX, Marketing, Sales teams to launch faster
Equally comfortable with long term planning and day-to-day progress tracking and execution
Previous entrepreneurial/start-up experience a plus
You’ll fit right in at Syft if:
You’re Flexible- able to consider challenges from different perspectives.
You’re Entrepreneurial- see how a challenge could become an opportunity.
You take Accountability through thick and thin, inviting ideas for improvement.
You’re Data Driven- see the necessity of analysing metrics when devising solutions.
You’re Passionate about what you do and self motivated.
You can Adapt to your team’s challenges and Collaborate with other departments.

What you’ll get:
Flexible work arrangements, remote and working from home.
Employee Assistance programs, free eyecare vouchers, discounted gym memberships and more.
Unique bonus structure for every employee.
Social events and lunch and learns.

Syft is proud to be an equal opportunity employer that wants to build a welcoming and diverse working environment. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to ethnic background, race, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neuro-diversity, disability, age, or any other non-merit based or legally protected grounds.

Title: Senior Product Manager - Data
Description:
Senior Product Manager - Data
- 20000U4B)
The big question: why on earth should a Digital professional like you work for a 150-year-old retail chain? Because we’re on a journey. Changing the way we operate. Learning to think nimble. Giving our teams the time and freedom they need to push boundaries within an ever-changing, ever-accelerating digital landscape, where we’re always testing, experimenting, and learning. Digital is at the heart of everything we do. Welcome to the home of Sainsbury’s Digital.

The team and what we’re excited about:

As a senior product manager at Sainsbury’s Digital you’ll not only own the digital vision for an area or domain, in addition you’ll be looked upon to embody and role model great product thinking.

Product management is a large family and we’ve worked hard to create an open and collaborative culture with all the people and skills you’ll need and want to learn from under one roof.

Our product areas vary in scale, complexity and domain because digital at Sainsbury’s is deeper than our major websites and customer facing apps, and about our stores and the thousands of colleagues that work there, and, business operations that go into making us a leading digital business.

Currently we have an exciting Data Product Manager for our Sales Transaction Services within our In-Store team to work on a new Group technology being built in house by our digital excellence centre. The focus will be on collecting, formatting and publishing till data in a cutting edge way to enable several strategies around future innovation for our Group. The role is a combination of direct Product Management with a truly agile team and building a brand new piece of technology but also managing a high number of stakeholders who either produce or receive the data, interfacing with more legacy systems and prioritising the right transitional states that help us achieve the outcomes we want.

More about the role:
You’ll own the product backlog and roadmap, working actively with your on-site engineering team to build out new features that achieve the area vision and OKRs - this means taking ownership of delivery, blending both pace and quality
You’ll have a strong desire to improve customer experiences and will partner with and lead Engineering and Experience Design to work out what the next awesome experiences you want to ship for our customers
Be the champion of your product – use the right level or type of material to communicate experiences, benefits and long-term vision across a variety of audiences including development teams, stakeholders at all levels, partners and external parties
Own the customer and business value for your product backlog, working to deliver maximum customer and business value whilst making effective prioritisation choices to deliver the maximum value and return on capital
Shout about and report on the value you’ve delivered once something has launched
Collaborate with other Product Managers to ensure consistency, drive product goals/shared objectives, and continuously improve product management across the division
What (or Who?) we’re looking for:
Passion for Product
Creative problem solving
Enthusiasm for delivering change through people and technology
Developing a culture of learning, empowerment, experimentation and collaboration
Ability to translate business goals, technology strategy and market knowledge into a product roadmap that prioritises delivery of value and enables future business agility
Ability to switch between strategic visioning and getting into the detail, being the authority in all aspects of your product
Strong leadership and influencing skills, adapting your decision making to different levels of ambiguity and urgency
Ability to switch between strategic visioning and getting into the detail, being the authority in all aspects of your product
A high level of team contribution, seek opportunities to provide input and support across the team and outside core areas of focus, role model effective collaboration
Proven track record of leading delivery of technology led change in cross-functional environments; you have shipped products at scale that customers and colleagues love
Extensive experience of product/project/programme management, or relevant ecommerce discipline(s)
Demonstrable experience of leading and developing teams, directly and cross-functionally
In return you’ll get:
Colleague discount across the multi-brands – Sainsbury’s, Argos and Habitat
Holiday allowance
Bonus scheme
Pension plan
Special offers on gym memberships, restaurants, holidays, retail vouchers and more
Flexible working and job share conversations are encouraged. Across our multi-brands, we’re proud to be an equal opportunities employer that champions a diverse and inclusive culture. If you’re reading this, even if you’re not 100% sure you’re there with your experience, we’d still love to hear from you. If you’d like to find out more head to Sainsburys Digital
