Title: Senior Python Infrastructure Developer & Data Czar - London...
Description:
As a Infrastructure Developer Lead and Data Czar, your mission is to help lead our team of innovators and technologists toward creating next-level solutions that improve the way we manage Data. Your deep knowledge of data, design, analytics, development, coding, testing and application programming will help your team raise their game, meeting your standards, as well as satisfying both business and functional requirements. You will be responsible for creating, updating and approving data models for your organisation and representing those models within the firm wide model governance program. Your expertise in various technology domains will be counted on to set strategic direction and solve complex and mission critical problems, internally and externally. Embracing leading-edge technologies and methodologies inspires your team to follow suit. Collaborating with our network of global technologists will enable you to deliver diverse and inclusive software solutions.
In this role, you will become a major hands-on contributor on the high-performing global development team consisting of London, New York and India software engineers. Put in practice the core-engineering concepts of the Data Rationalization Program, from platform stability to cloud deployment.
This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:

BSc/BA degree or equivalent experience
Expertise in application, data and infrastructure architecture disciplines
Expertise in data modelling and data modelling governance
Advanced knowledge of architecture, design and business processes
Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals
Fundamental knowledge of and hands-on experience with the key open-source components of distribution stack such as Kafka, Splunk
Solid development experience in Python and Django
Solid understanding of SDLC, Scrum & Agile frameworks
Experience in building DevOps tools, from data quality checks to system performance monitoring for big data batch-driven and real-time pipelines
Experience in deploying within JPMC private cloud and network technologies an advantage
J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Title: Senior Product Manager - Retail Apps
Description:
Senior Product Manager - Retail Apps
- 20000X5W)

The big question: why on earth should a Tech professional like you work for a 150-year-old retail chain? Because we’re on a journey. Changing the way we operate. Learning to think nimble. Giving our teams the time and freedom they need to push boundaries. To create amazing systems and technologies. To give our colleagues and our customers even more incredible experiences.

There are thousands of experts to talk to and learn from. We’ve got data from billions of transactions for our teams to play with. Things get built here. They get made here. They hit customers and colleagues quickly. Welcome to the home of Sainsbury's Tech.

More about the role:
Working within our Retail CTO, this Senior Product Manager will be responsible for devising and implementing the strategy across a sub-set of our colleague-facing mobile and web applications in both Sainsbury’s and Argos Retail
Working alongside our technical teams – including Solution Architects, Delivery Managers and Software Engineers - but also nurturing close relationships with our retail colleagues and business owners
You will have ownership and responsibility for a set of products that help and make a real difference to our colleagues across retail. Bridging the technical and business worlds, you will work with colleagues across our business to develop and deliver your products’ roadmaps
What we’re looking for:
Someone who is passionate about retail and creating awesome products that our colleagues love
Someone with a track record of managing multiple stakeholders and strong examples of clear and concise communication – if you thrive in a complex stakeholder environment, this could be a really exciting opportunity for you in the Retail sector!
A thought leader in Product, who can guide teams with a strong vision and clear purpose
Able to demonstrate a high level of previous product ownership experience in an Agile environment
Experience in managing many Products which are part of an overarching strategy is preferable
In return you’ll get:
Colleague discount across the multi-brands – Sainsbury’s, Argos and Habitat
Holiday allowance
Bonus scheme
Pension plan
Special offers on gym memberships, restaurants, holidays, retail vouchers and more
Flexible working and job share conversations are encouraged. Across our multi-brands, we’re proud to be an equal opportunities employer that champions a diverse and inclusive culture. If you’re reading this, even if you’re not 100% sure you’re there with your experience, we’d still love to hear from you. If you’d like to find out more head to Sainsbury's Tech

Title: Manager-Senior Manager, Capital Markets, Data Risk Analytics...
Description:
Your opportunity
Do you want to define the future of financial services? We are a global organisation who advise the worlds largest FS clients on the application of data, analytics, AI and disruptive digital technologies to manage risk, create innovative propositions and solutions and generate value. Join us in delivering market leading advice and practical solutions that make a material impact to our clients, our people and society.

As part of the largest Data Risk Analytics practice in the UK, you will be part of an agile, innovative team of individuals who understand exactly how data, analytics and AI underpins a business. Using your unique skills and experience, you’ll drive transformational change across our clients – everything from Data Strategy, through to Data Engineering and the application of AI models. If you’re an ideas person, problem solver and hands-on doer, who loves to collaborate, you’ll thrive here.

We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.
Your role
As a Manager/Senior Manager in our Data Risk Analytics practice you will be working collaboratively across the data, analytics and AI domains, helping some of the largest, most interesting organisations in the world imagine, deliver and run the future - transforming complex business requirements into practical, implementable solutions.

Within our Data Risk Analytics Financial Services team you will have the opportunity to gain a breadth of insight across a diverse range of prestigious financial sector clients both in the UK and internationally. We invest in our people, so you will have access to leading training and development opportunities, allowing you to develop both personally and technically.

Your Responsibilities

The successful candidate will have responsibility for:
Working with Investment Banking clients, particularly to deliver services around risk and compliance.Building on Deloitte’s innovative risk and compliance solution and services.Managing a strong industry network, identifying and converting sales opportunities.Determining client needs by supplementing the standard assessment techniques and tools with innovative approaches.Managing diverse teams within an inclusive team culture where people are recognised for their contributionYour work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.

Location:
London and regional offices- frequent domestic travel for client-based projects. With. Significant opportunities for international travel if appropriate. We also offer a range of agile working options

Work pattern:
This is a permanent opportunity.

Our team members work a variety of agile working patterns. Tell us what arrangement works for you and we’ll try to accommodate.

Your professional experience
Requirements
Significant experience of risk and compliance approaches, methodologies and techniques within Investment Banking.Functional knowledge of investment banking, and front/ middle/ back office processes and systems, particularly impacting risk and compliance teams and operations.Proven experience delivering services related to risk and compliance and leading client bids and presentations.Leading engagements delivering, working with or knowledge on a range of tools in addition to and complimentary to the aboveInformation management tools (e.g. SQL, ETL, RDBMS)Visualization tools (e.g. Qlikview, Tableau)Data science (e.g. R, Python, Alteryx, SAS, SPSS)Big data tools (e.g. Hadoop, Spark)Cloud technologies (e.g. AWS, Google Cloud Platform)Experience managing, strengthening and broadening key client relationships.The ability to determine client needs by supplementing the standard assessment techniques and tools with innovative approaches.Understanding of, and experience with, the development of solutions beyond the proof of concept stage into industrial-strength products.Your service line: Risk Advisory
In Risk Advisory, our thinking and actions give clients, our people and society the confidence to succeed responsibly in a rapidly changing world. We don’t just work with our clients to manage risk, we help them understand and grab the opportunities it presents too, helping them gain a competitive advantage. Our expertise and industry knowledge run deep here. At Deloitte, you’ll find yourself working with some of the most inspiring and experienced colleagues and with clients who trust you to lead the way to smart choices, better control frameworks, and new systems, including bespoke solutions that have a direct impact on their bottom line.
Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.
About Deloitte

Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Malta, the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,500 partners and over 40,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It’s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.
Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work – and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we’re looking for:
We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they makeWe develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunitiesWe drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and bordersWe believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior peopleWe move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.SLRSKA BADAAN CFTECH WPFULL

Deloitte LLP is a limited liability partnership registered in England and Wales with registered number OC303675 and its registered office at 1 New Street Square, London EC4A 3HQ, United Kingdom.Deloitte LLP is the United Kingdom affiliate of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"). DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL and Deloitte NSE LLP do not provide services to clients. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.

Title: Senior Data Developer & Data Tools specialist - London - VP
Description:
Senior Data Developer & Data Tools specialist - London - VP
We are looking for Senior Data Technologist with experience in data tools in the Enterprise Data Services team under Enterprise Operations and Technology, to help the implementation of next generation Data Platform using cutting edge Data Management Technologies. The Candidate is required to possess relevant data design and development experience in the Big Data Eco-System and should be a strong team player. Exposure to treasury, finance or risk functions on the Retail/Wholesale Banking products. This is a significant opportunity for an experienced developer / tools specialist with experience in modern data platforms and data tools to move into a role working with a variety of development teams, including close collaboration with an on-site Data Governance team.
The Applications Development Technology Lead Analyst is a senior level position responsible for establishing and implementing new or revised application data tools and programs in coordination with the Technology teams & Chief Data Office. The overall objective of this role is to build and implement data tools aligned to data strategy of citi.

Responsibilities:
Active member in the design and build of new Architecture using a variety of cutting edge technologies & tools.
Ensuring high quality software development, tools integration, utilize advanced knowledge of system flow with complete documentation and tractability
Promoting unit/functional testing and code inspection processes
Working with business partners and BA’s to understand requirements
Working with data scientists to understand and interpret complex data-sets
Working with project managers and support teams to meet delivery targets
Quickly becoming knowledgeable on Finance and Risk Functions in Cards, Loans, Mortgage products.
Review and analyze proposed technical solutions & data models for projects
Contribute to formulation of strategies for data tools and other functional areas
Provide evaluative judgment based on analysis of factual data in complicated and unique situations
Ensure essential procedures are followed and contribute to defining standards negotiating with external parties when necessary on tool selection.
Partner with multiple management teams to ensure appropriate integration of functions to meet goals as well as identify and define necessary system enhancements to deploy new products and process improvements
Resolve variety of high impact problems/projects through in-depth evaluation of complex business processes, system processes, and industry standards
Provide expertise in area and advanced knowledge of applications programming and ensure application design adheres to the overall architecture blueprint
Develop comprehensive knowledge of how areas of business, such as architecture and infrastructure, integrate to accomplish business goals
Provide in-depth analysis with interpretive thinking to define issues and develop innovative solutions
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards.

Experience preferably in the Financial Service industry
Experience as Applications Development / tools specialist
Experience as senior level Technology specialist role
Stakeholder management experience
Demonstrated leadership skills
Exhaustive knowledge of industry practices and standards in data.
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication

Confident engineer with an authoritative knowledge of data tools and data modelling
Experience in relevant tools like data lineage tools, data governance tools, data tracing tools & data mining.
Comfortable working with large data volumes and be able to demonstrate a firm understanding of logical data structures and data analysis techniques
Experienced with automated build and test processes
Able to demonstrate an expertise in identifying and resolving data quality issues – in data sets at rest and in flight
Familiar with the financial services industry and/or regulatory environments
Proven work experience on one or more leading data tools in the market
Skills & Technologies:
Data Tools like Collibra, Solidatus, Informatica, Manta , Celonis , Snowflake
Scripting /programming languages
BI tools and data visualization tools
Industry standard Data Modelling tools

Potential to contribute to projects involving complex feature-based data modelling
Exposure to data science, Finance & Risk functions in a dynamic and challenging industry with regular close collaboration with our Data Governance team

A graduate Engineer holding degree in any of the Engineering streams. Exceptional candidates who do not meet these criteria may be considered for the role provided they have the necessary skills and experience.
Competencies
Adept written and verbal communicator
Highly adaptable and be willing to mentor and train more junior team members
Organized and prepared to manage multiple parallel pieces of work
Prior experience working with remote teams

Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience

Title: Value Analytics Lead
Description:
Capital on Tap believes that the future is all about the impact that small businesses can have in the world. As such we are on a mission to help them thrive – cash flow shouldn't be a barrier to success.
Since launching our business credit card and business loans in 2017 we have taken off like a rocket! We are one of the fastest growing companies in the UK (Sunday Times Fast Track 100 in 2017, 2018 and 2019), and we've continued to show stable profitability throughout Covid-19. We anticipate that both our profitability and growth will continue, and if anything accelerate - in part supported by having been certified under two of the government backed lending schemes (BBLS and CBILS).
This puts us in a strong position to help even more small businesses! Our passion for collaborating and helping small businesses thrive has only increased as a result of the current crisis. This means the work from here on out is only going to get even more interesting and we are looking for a diverse and talented team to join us on our journey moving forward.
Our people (and our office dogs) really are the best thing about working at Capital on Tap. We have built a dynamic, fun and vibrant culture where your opportunities for growth are as big as your ambitions.
The Role
We are looking for a talented Credit Analyst expert to join us in the continued success of our rapid growth trajectory. You will be expected to work closely with the CRO, management team and other colleagues across the business to assist in the management of a £250Million revolving credit portfolio. You will make an impact on the bottom line of the business with an ability to implement your concepts and theories. You will establish the path to achieve the company mission and see your ideas become reality from start to finish.
What you'll be doing
Using your advanced analytical skill to deepen our understanding of the value we create from our portfolio (for example through building and running tools like NPV models).
You will help us improve the value created through adjustments to acquisition and portfolio management strategies - helping us refine things like who we accept, how much we lend and at what price.
Conduct retrospective analysis and implement test-and-learn/champion-challenger strategies to refine our strategies
Source and evaluate new data sources to see if they will add value within the current decisioning process e.g. Open banking sources
Cohesively working with business stakeholders (from C-level execs to front line staff) to ensure risk analysis can be implemented seamlessly without deterioration to customer experience or complex IT builds
Constantly refining our decisioning process to improve its efficiency through greater use of automation
Coaching and mentoring more junior colleagues on the tools and techniques of Credit Risk
What we are looking for
5+ years of experience of building and using value management tools (like NPV models) to help manage lending portfolios
Deliver quantifiable improvements while effectively communicating complex solutions in a simple manner (deliver ideas within a "1 pager")
Willing to operate in a fast-moving environment, initiating and driving quick pilots to obtain 'soft' information (e.g. customer feedback/qualitative market research)
Data-driven mindset, able to supplement soft analysis completed within the business with hard data (e.g. A/B test outcomes) through business modelling and analytics
Uses SQL and Excel/google sheets on a daily basis to extract and analyse data, experience with a data visualisation tool such as PowerBi/Tableau/Looker is a plus.
Customer-centric approach to growth while balancing the need to remain risk-averse and compliant in a fast-moving regulated environment
Able to work autonomously, strong judgement and proactivity within a small credit team
What you get in return
We try not to take ourselves too seriously (all the time) so we make sure our office is decked out with a pool table, arcade machine, beer tap, and a couple of office dogs thrown in for good measure. In addition to a great environment in a buzzing location we also offer:
Competitive salary
Excellent progression and opportunity to grow and develop – we give every employee £1,000 a year to grow their skills outside the company
Private healthcare
28 days paid holiday (plus bank holidays)
Travelcard loan and/or cycle to work scheme
Generous anniversary rewards including a month paid sabbatical at four years
Diversity and Inclusion
At Capital on Tap we are fully focused on equality and believe deeply in diversity of race, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, ability, national origin and all the other characteristics that make us who we are.
We want to be a place where a diverse mix of talented people want to come and do their best work and most importantly feel included and that they can be their authentic selves. We welcome, consider and encourage applications from anyone that shares this passion.

Title: Senior Software Consultant (Big Data / Data Engineering proj...
Description:
Are you interested in getting into Big Data / Data Engineering based projects? Do you have some technical skills ideally in C++, Java, Scala or Python and have a strong academic record?

Excellent opportunity to work with a truly world class technical team on exciting, new and large-scale projects for top tier FTSE 100 / Fortune 500 clients. Current projects include Big Data, building data lakes, and complex high performance real time data processing & parallel processing systems. You do not need prior Data Engineering experience or skills to be suitable for this role. The client base is high profile and predominately in Banking, Finance, Fintech and Telco. You will be involved in working very closely with customers to produce proof of concepts, technical designs and provide problem solving on projects / implementations.

A background in software is desired with some experience of working on difficult, complex and large-scale applications / systems. Experience of working on data heavy systems is very useful. Skills such as C++, Java, Scala or Python are desirable. Knowledge of databases such as Oracle or DB2 is desirable. A strong academic record is important ideally to a PhD or Msc level with a quality university.
The company is a very forward-thinking tech company with a global presence and an enviable reputation for building unique quality solutions that actually work. The environment is very professional, collaborative and research focused. Excellent benefits package and bonus. Highly supportive environment with virtually zero staff turnover.

Title: Data Analyst (Mid-Senior Level)
Description:
We create expert video insights and technology solutions to engage high value financial services audiences around the globe. Our brands have become a trusted source for due-diligence, validation, research and learning; in many cases, supporting regulatory obligations.
Our Asset TV, Insure TV, Fintech TV and Akademia brands work with some of the world’s biggest companies, delivering high quality media to professional audiences in the US, UK, South Africa, Europe and Asia.
About the role
As a data analyst you will work within our CRM, CMS, analytics systems and MySQL deployments to analyse viewer data to identify key insights, trends and marketing opportunities. You will also act as a gatekeeper to our services through managing our user registration system and assessing suitability and or researching additional information.
You will develop data analysis tools and procedures to pinpoint incorrect or incomplete data, as well as maintaining and improving our existing tools to effectively report on data across multiple systems.
Working with the senior data analyst you will liaise with directors and stakeholders to scope and produce reports that can be presented in an easily consumable way. You will also work within our ESP systems to streamline and enhance our data driven marketing processes.
This is a real opportunity for a talented data analyst to help shape the future of our data insights strategy and produce best in class data analysis for our customers.
About the candidate
You have...
3+ years’ experience in a similar role
A high level of numeracy and an extreme attention to detail
The ability to work to project deadlines both effectively and efficiently
A positive attitude and love working with a team
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
A high level of self management and organisational skills
Essential skills
Experience using MySQL or at least 1 other relational database (such as Oracle, MariaDB, PostgreSQL etc.)
Advanced skills in creating custom Python modules to analyse vast amounts of data spanning multiple databases/deployments (or similar languages such as VBA, R etc.)
Proven history of analysing big data and producing complex reports
Comfortable managing, reporting and administering data within front-end CRM systems (such as Zoho CRM, Salesforce etc.)
Experience using business intelligence tools (such as Data Studio, Tableau etc.)
Knowledge of Git workflows and services such as GitHub
Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel
Knowledge of working with REST APIs to produce and maintain data ETL processes
Experience of database and server administration
What’s on offer
We work from a modern open-plan office in Harpenden (Hertfordshire) with great rail links to London St Pancras (20 minutes) and easy access to the A1 and M1. We choose to be here because it’s a collaborative environment and we don’t have to spend hours commuting!
Market leading salary with regular reviews
29 days holiday, including your birthday and bank holidays
A company contribution to your personal pension
Access to further training
PerkBox employee rewards (discounts on the high street and online)
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Benefits:
Casual Dress
Company Pension
Life Insurance
Store Discounts
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Language:
English (Required)
Work remotely:
No

Title: Senior Analytics Engineer - Remote Working
Description:
SENIOR ANALYTICS ENGINEER - DBT, GCP, BIGQUERY - REMOTE WORKING
Up to £90,000 + Strong package
LONDON
Do you want to work with a modern tech stack to design and build a data platform at an industry-leading Media Company, to connect analytics teams to a high volume data lake? Do you like the idea of being the technical authority of a cutting-edge data platform at a household name business? This could the the role for you!
THE COMPANY:
The company are a one of the UK's leading media brands who have recently build a data lake in Scala, Spark and AWS. They are now building a green field data platform on top of that in GCP for the analysts to easily access the data. They use a modern tech stack at the forefront of data and analytics, using GCP, BigQuery data warehouse, DBT and git. This role will have you working across these technologies to deliver on analytics projects for multiple teams across the business.
THE ROLE:
As Senior Analytics Engineer, your responsibilities will include:
Modelling and building the Big Query Data Warehouse using SQL and DBT.
Work closely with data consumers to create and maintain the ETL/ELT pipelines, data models and data catalogue as well as the data modelling standards that enable effective analytics group wide
Understand and document how source systems work, their underlying data models and logic required in the ETL pipelines in order to build the data warehouse models
Work across the team to design, build and launch the data assets that deliver the data models
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
An ideal candidate will have the following skills and experience:
Strong SQL coding experience
A great knowledge of both ETL and ideally non-traditional ETL where custom SQL has to be written
Knowledge of scheduling tools like Git as well as cloud based data environments
Ability to be the most senior member of the team, including working on architecture and mentorship, as well as delivery
Exposure to or knowledge of DBT preferred
Excellent communication skills and a great underlying knowledge of data warehouses and architectures
HOW TO APPLY:
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Ross Henderson via the Apply link on this page.

Title: Lead Performance Engineer
Description:
About Refinitiv
Serving more than 40,000 institutions in over 190 countries, Refinitiv provides information, insights and technology that drive innovation and performance in global financial markets. Our heritage of integrity enables our customers to make critical decisions with confidence while our best-in-class data and cutting-edge technologies enable greater opportunity. We enable the financial community to trade smarter and faster, overcome regulatory challenges, and scale intelligently.
Summary of Business Unit/Function:
Quality Engineering’s (QE) mission is to provide standardised value-add testing solutions, processes and tools that deliver the highest level of service to our customers through bold innovation, focused risk management and collaborative and open culture of continuous improvement.

Role Summary:
Reporting into the Director of Performance Engineering (PEG) within QE, this role will be accountable for the successful delivery of performance engineering and testing engagements, often overseeing working teams comprised of performance engineers and testers.
Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:
Hands-on lead, accountable for the successful delivery of performance engineering and testing engagements, from the sales lead, through discovery, estimation, planning, design, execution, reporting, and management communications.
Act as the PEG single point of contact to the stakeholders of an engagement
Assure the technical integrity of engagement delivery
Contribute to PEG service design, service build-out, as well as assisting in driving convergence on tools, and defining and socializing standards and best practices.
Participate in the creation and delivery of mentoring and training
Essential Technical Skills
Proficiency in performance test scope identification, and strategy definition including NFR and SLA analysis.
Deep understanding of how to translate test objectives to test design
Deep understanding of how loss-of-integrity can occur in performance testing and how to detect and prevent this
Expertise with leading and augmenting teams and tooling to support geographic performance testing deliverables
In-depth experience with two or more leading load generation tools
Experience in at least two APM tools such as SiteScope, Wiley Introscope, Symantec In-Depth, ITCAM, AppDynamics and Dynatrace
Experience with HTTP Analyzer, Fiddler and Wireshark
Experience in using and integrating open-source tools in support of performance engineering and testing
Experience in testing public cloud applications
Must be able to effectively communicate (verbally and in writing) with director-level staff
Essential Experience:
Minimum of 10 years in IT.
Minimum 6 years of experience with LoadRunner (Performance Center) spanning both usage and administration
Minimum of 3 years of expertise with JMeter
Experience with orchestrating very high-volume load tests
Experience with WAN Emulation tools such as Shunra or NetEm is a plus
Knowledge of C, Python, Java, JavaScript, or Linux shell scripting is a plus
Knowledge of statistical inference is a plus
Qualifications:
Master’s degree in technology-related fields or equivalent work experience.
Training:
Certification in HP LoadRunner
Certification in Cloud technology is a big plus
Other requirements:
Strong collaboration and leadership skills are required
Experience in the Finance industry or knowledge of Financial products is a plus
Impressive benefits? Of course.
We support our colleagues’ health and wellbeing with inclusive benefits. So that's support for physical, financial, mental and environmental health, paid time off to volunteer, consumer discounts& savings and so much more. All of which are tailored to your needs and may vary by location. For more details talk to your recruiter.
As a global business, Refinitiv relies on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. Therefore we seek hardworking, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under country or local law. Refinitiv is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.
Refinitiv makes reasonable accommodations for applicants and employees with disabilities. If an accommodation is needed to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and/or to receive other benefits and privileges of employment, please contact us to request an accommodation. A full list of our office locations and contact information can be found at: Refinitiv Office Locations .
Be the breakthrough, activate your future and shape ours.

Title: Senior Privacy Analyst (6 Month FTC)
Description:
We are a team on a mission, to put accessible and affordable healthcare in the hands of every person on earth. Our mission is bold and ambitious, and it’s one that’s shared by our team who shares our values, to dream big, build fast and be brilliant.

To achieve this, we’ve brought together one of the largest teams of scientists, clinicians, mathematicians and engineers to focus on combining the ever-growing computing power of machines, with the best medical expertise of humans, to create a comprehensive, immediate and personalized health service and make it universally available.

At Babylon our people aren’t just part of a team, they’re part of something bigger. We’re a vibrant community of creative thinkers and doers, forging the way for a new generation of healthcare. We’re only as good as our people. So, finding the best people is everything to us.

We serve millions, but we choose our people one at a time…

The Senior Privacy Analyst (6 month FTC) will be engaged in assisting and advising on data protection compliance. The role will be based in London and report to the Data Protection Officer.
Responsibilities
Conducting data protection impact assessments (DPIAs).
Support the Data Privacy team and the business as required to establish, maintain and monitor data protection policies.
Administer and manage Babylon’s Records of Processing Activities (and other data protection relevant documentation and forms).
Supporting the business with day-to-day advice on data protection and maturing Babylon’s data protection programme in general.
Maintain ICO and other supervisory authority data protection registrations as appropriate.
Assist in data protection-related due diligence of vendors or customers.
Manage Data Subject Rights Requests in accordance with established internal processes, ensuring compliance with regulatory timelines.
Support data protection training programmes, including assisting with the development and delivery of content for privacy training.
Providing data protection support for audits and certifications.
Supporting the Data Protection team as necessary.
Skills / Experience
A broad varied role, hence the need for an experienced Analyst. This could be the perfect move for Analyst's looking for a broader role with the aim of gaining additional skills.
Experience in a regulatory compliance, risk compliance or legal advice role, of which at least 2 years should have been spent specifically on data protection.
Good knowledge of data protection laws is a must.
Good understanding of online technologies and their privacy implications.
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
Ability to act independently and exercise good judgment.
Ability to prioritise and manage multiple tasks in a fast pace professional environment.
Excellent working knowledge of IT packages including Excel, Word, Outlook and PowerPoint is a must.
Must be detailed oriented and passionate about privacy.
Experience in privacy/data protection role is a must.
Team player

Title: Google Performance Marketing Lead
Description:
Are you a performance marketer with a specialism in paid google search, looking for that big opportunity to join a high growth eCommerce company doubling their sales every year? We are looking for a passionate, data-driven Google expert to join this fantastic London headquartered company.

About The Company...
Altitude Ads is a young and vibrant brand building company based in the heart of London, we are currently on our mission to scale over the next two years and are on the lookout for the best available talent to come on board to sustain our growth. We are a rapidly growing direct-to-consumer, digital marketing company (former start-up, now firmly-established in the 4th year of trading currently at 44 employees and scaling into the 60+. In the US we had a $40 million turnover in 2019

About The Role...
As our Google Lead, you’ll be both highly numerical/analytical as well as commercially driven. Your primary responsibility would be to manage the company’s Google Ad accounts. This role will involve transitioning away from our current Google agency while also budgeting and optimizing our activity across shopping and search, experimenting with paid social and display, as well as video and programmatic.

Responsibilities:
The growth of online customer acquisition through Google Ads
Reporting to the senior head of growth + CEO
Management of large scale budgets, forecasting, and target setting
Managing and developing the testing strategy
Developing and growing the cross channel remarketing strategy
Structuring and optimizing paid search accounts
Developing and mentoring and recruiting junior team members
Helping define the product strategy and roadmap through consistent traffic analysis

The Ideal Candidate:
Around 3-5 years in a similar role
Strong commercial acumen – numerical, great with reporting, forecasting, analysis, and optimization
Strong PPC experience across both Bing & Google
Good understanding of implementing and optimizing Product Shopping Ads
Strong experience using Google Analytics for traffic analysis
SQL experience would be great or at least a desire to learn.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst - 6mth FTC
Description:
BE PART OF BUILDING THE FUTURE.
Since our founding in 2009, Pure Storage has empowered innovators to build a better world with data. In less than eight years, Pure reached $1B in sales, faster than nearly every enterprise company in history, and our incredible growth continues to outpace the competition.
Our mission? Deliver a simple, evergreen data platform that enables everyone to turn data into intelligence and advantage. The secret sauce? More than 3,000 team members (and growing!) around the world who join forces to invent the next big thing. And then the next one.
The world is experiencing a revolution driven by next-generation technology like AI, machine learning, virtual reality, quantum computing, and self-driving cars—all of which require unprecedented amounts of data. This sets the stage for Pure's technology to grow exponentially in the coming years.
We've only scratched the surface of our ambitions, and as we continue to gobble up market share, we're blazing trails and setting records:
For five straight years, Gartner has named Pure a leader in the Magic Quadrant for Solid-State Arrays.
Our customer-first culture and unwavering commitment to innovation have earned us a Satmetrix Net Promoter Score in the top 1% of B2B companies globally.
Pure puts a premium on the future, investing 26% of revenue into R&D.
If you, like us, say "bring it on" to exciting challenges that change the world, we have endless opportunities where you can make your mark.
BUSINESS STRATEGY AT PURE...
What makes this team unique in contrast to other opportunities? Here at Pure Storage employees get a much wider exposure to strategy development and market execution. This team is closely aligned with both the Sales and Finance organizations and presents strategic guidance directly to top management. Business Strategy works closely with product management, engineering, finance, marketing and many other teams to develop partnership strategies, influence product vision, and establish go-to-market plans.
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING...
Maintain SQL queries and Tableau dashboards
Provide business analyses to various internal business stakeholders, including sales and channel leadership as we as the International commercial and strategy teams
Generate reporting from existing data; understand requirements and produce quick reports efficiently
Produce market analyses based on market research data, write up summary reports and distribute amongst stakeholders
Model complex deals including pricing and solution optimisation; solve problems based on different business requirements
Work with other internal teams to produce presentations for Quarterly Business Reviews as well as Mid Quarter Reviews

WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO THE TEAM...
Proficiency Tableau, MS SQL, SFDC; Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Google Sheet formulas
Intellectual curiosity
Strong analytical and critical thinking mindset
Ability to work with large amounts of detail; ability to collect, structure and assess data
Strong communications skills, breaking complex problems and models down to easy to understand and actionable root causes
Independent working with a high level of accountability and professionalism; willing to go the extra mile with a strong work ethic; self-directed and resourceful

BE YOU—CORPORATE CLONES NEED NOT APPLY.
Pure is where you ask big questions, think differently, and make an impact. This is not just a job, but a place where you have a voice and can accelerate your career. We value unique thoughts and celebrate individuality, and with ample opportunity to learn, develop yourself, and expand into different roles, joining Pure is an investment in your career journey.
Through our Pure Equality program, which supports a flourishing field of employee resource groups, we nourish the personal and professional lives of our team members. And our Pure Good Foundation gives back to local and global communities through volunteering and grants.
And because we understand the value of bringing your full and best self to work, we offer a variety of perks to manage a healthy balance, including flexible time off, wellness resources, and company-sponsored team events.

PURE IS COMMITTED TO EQUALITY.
Pure is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or any other characteristic legally protected by the laws of the jurisdiction in which you are being considered for hire. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at TA-Ops@purestorage.com.

Title: Integration And Data Lead
Description:
Integration and Data Lead - Consumer IoT
Do you want to be part of the Commercial IoT team?
Our purpose at Vodafone is to connect for a better future. The commercial team drives all consumer-facing products, services & innovation. If you are part of the team, the future is in your hands. Our products help build a Digital Society that’s hyper-connected. In that society, inclusion is key - we want everyone to have access to technology, not just the fortunate few. This ranges from Consumer IoT solutions for the home, price plans for girls in India, and data offerings that suit all streaming needs. You build the Vodafone our customers see and experience every day. The team is broad; you could be working within brand, commercial management, consumer services, terminals, M-Pesa or customer experience operations. What links us all together is that we think big, take risks, keep the best and learn from the rest. Do you?
We created V by Vodafone 2 years ago with a mission to pioneer a new way of connecting customers to the world of Internet of Things. Now, we are revolutionising the playing field in Consumer Internet of Things.

You will
Be accountable for successful technical integration of new Cellular products, features and interfaces (APIs) within the overall technical landscape and architecture
Have hands-on coding capability – capable to write scripts to verify features / functionality as well as create stubs to speed up development and support trouble-shooting and drive product quality
Define and deliver data model strategy and set up data flow and processes working closely with the Data Analytics teams
Be accountable for analysis and interpretation of cellular data to drive service improvements in collaboration with Quality and Lifecycle Managers
Define and deliver reports and dashboard to create visibility on service quality and customer usage

It would be nice if you have…
Good understanding of IoT technologies and standards – preferably in Cellular and mobile applications
Good understanding of network and Cloud technologies, databases technologies, security, data analysis tools and software development and integration
Working experience on coding (such as Python or Perl)
Deep technical knowledge (such as REST, SOAP, SSL protocol, OAUTH, OpenIDConnect, HTTP)
Hands-on experience with tools (like Curl, Splunk, Postman, Datameer, Tableau, AndroidStudio)

You must have…
Proven self-learner mentality
Education to University degree standard in Computer Science/ Engineering or similar
Leadership – self-motivated individual with excellent organisational and analytical skills
Excellent business analysis and technical skills to lead partner solution integration into a complex multi-service environment

#groupresourcing

Title: VP - Senior Kafka Engineer - Innovation Lab
Description:
We are looking for an engineer with significant Kafka experience to join our team creating a platform hosting pipelines for streaming financial data. This is a hands-on role working closely with our cross-functional teams to deliver real business value.
As a Senior Kafka Engineer you will be responsible for the reliable, scalable deployment of multiple Kafka clusters. You will build and integrate with other systems for provisioning, monitoring, and alerting. Working closely with our support teams and development teams, you will help deliver this project with a high level of automation and reliability. We want to minimize manual processes and strong software engineering proficiency in this role is key.
This is an exciting opportunity to work on a greenfield project with cutting-edge technology, which will have huge impact on our future technology architecture.

Responsibilities:
Building and maintaining a large-scale Kafka platform (including components from the wider Kafka ecosystem) to support a range of big data streaming applications
Being the point of contact for new teams seeking to use the platform – i.e. supporting and on-boarding their data and applications, seeking to automate these tasks wherever possible
Developing a suite of tools around the Kafka platform to give clients the ability to manage their data, e.g. by sourcing or sinking it from other on premise databases and in the cloud
Building a close relationship with clients and stakeholders to understand the use case for the platform, and prioritise work accordingly
Working well in a multidisciplinary DevOps-focused team, building a close relationship with development, SRE and L1 Support teams

Skills & Qualifications:
You have at least six months experience working with an Apache Kafka instance running in production
You have good knowledge of the wider Apache Kafka ecosystem (Kafka Streams, KSQL, Connect Platform)
You have good understanding of Multi-Region Kafka Clusters
You are passionate about databases and worked in the past with a range of SQL/NoSQL technologies (e.g. SQL Server, Oracle, Couchbase, BigQuery)
You have experience deploying and managing fault-tolerant systems on Linux/Unix
You are fluent in at least one programming/scripting language, preferably Python
You would potentially have familiarity with Kubernetes/OpenShift and Cloud Platforms
You have high development standards, especially for code quality, code reviews, unit testing, continuous integration and deployment
You have proven capability to interact with clients and deliver results, taking ideas to production
You have experience working in fast paced development environments
You agree that verbal and written communication skills are vital

Title: Platform Engineer - Team Lead
Description:
Are you looking for the challenge and flexibility of a start-up, with the financial stability of an established business? Are you ready to take an exciting product from local to global?

We’re Pollinate - a new fintech business aiming to get banks back to where they belong: at the forefront of the payments industry. As a product-driven payments software business, we’re helping the world’s largest, most complex banks compete with digital challengers.

In Spring 2019, we worked with NatWest to launch our global merchant acquiring platform in the UK (www.natwest-tyl.com). And we’re just getting started.
If you join us, you’ll be working with experts across payments, technology, consumer and financial services, supported by a world-class network of partners. You’ll be a key part of a team that’s changing the future of payments, with the freedom to make your mark. Together, we’ll be pushing the boundaries of merchant acquiring.

Purpose of the role

Reporting to the Head of Platform Engineering you will be part of a team of engineers focused on developing and maintaining a world-class Azure cloud platform, associated tooling, automation, DevOpsBot’s and observability to the highest standards leveraging cutting edge tools, technologies and engineering principles. In this role you will work with developers, third parties and our customers to ensure we meet all functional and non-functional SLA’s and KPI’s

Responsibilities

Work closely with a variety of internal and external stakeholders to build to designed architecture patterns
Work with technical partners to create operational capabilities
Support services once live and continually enhance capability for client and internal resources
Work closely with development teams to integrate infrastructure builds with application deployment processes.
Design, build and maintain the CI/CD infrastructure and tools
Line management responsibility for delivery team (4/5 team members)

What we are looking for

Highly skilled technologist with exposure to cloud services
Natural leader, experienced and comfortable coaching, mentoring and leading other engineers
Experience of cloud architecture: iaas, paas & saas with experience in Microsoft Azure preferred
Experience of setting up greenfield services in the enterprise
Good understanding of big data frameworks
Experience with observability tooling
Payments industry experience desirable
Software Development Experience desirable (Python/Java/GoLang/C# etc)
Experience of DevOps tooling, e.g. Continuous Integration tooling pipelines across a variety of technologies (e.g. Java/Scala/React), Containerisation (Docker/Kubernetes etc.), Infrastructure as Code (Terraform), Source control platforms (VSTS/Git/GitLab/Gerrit etc.)


Who we are looking for

Be able to work in fast changing environment and deliver within very tight deadlines
Work unassisted and be well organised, able to work to deadlines
Strong verbal and written English communication skills
Strong team collaboration skills essential
High energy and drive that suits a start-up environment
Comfortable working outside of rigid structures and frameworks
Proactive and able to articulate complex technical issues clearly

What we stand for

We believe we are better together when we listen, engage and support each other, we want you to bring your expertise and experience to work every day
We are passionate about what we are doing and want you to share this with us, enjoy your time with us, stay calm under pressure and bring positive energy to the team
We are all on a journey together, we want your ambition and flexible mind set to embrace the twists and turns as we grow as a business

At the moment, and for the foreseeable future, this role will be 100% home based. We are in the process of developing a Future of Work at Pollinate strategy.
Pollinate offers great benefits including up to 20% bonus, Life Assurance, Health Cash Plan, CSOP as well as flexible working hours and an online Yoga class.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Station10 specialise in providing high quality data solutions to a wide range of “big-name” clients across a variety of business sectors. These projects lead to long term and evolving relationships, in which we provide on-going strategic support and analysis to help increase customer engagement and improve business ROI.
We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our growing team, to play an important part in our fast-paced and collaborative environment. The right candidate will work across several clients to provide actionable insights and bespoke strategic solutions. You will have a fantastic opportunity to define and shape multichannel data strategies for leading enterprises, and will play a vital role in the growth and strategic direction of our company.
Key Responsibilities
You will help to deliver a key range of digital analytics and data science services for clients, including:
Digital Data Strategy & Planning
Measurement Requirements Definition
Data Implementation & Maintenance
Data Auditing
Optimisation Analysis and Management
A/B & Multivariate Testing & Ongoing Optimisation
Data Experimentation & Investigation
Multichannel Deep-Dive Insight
Segmentation Analysis
Statistical Analysis
Correlation Analysis, Propensity Scoring & Churn Modelling
Emerging Measurement Techniques and Analytical Methods (R, Python)
Big Data Technologies (Hadoop, Syntasa, AWS, Adobe Data Workbench)
Analytics and Insight Evangelism and Training
Experience and Qualifications
Degree educated in a numerical or science discipline.
Strong learning agility with enthusiasm to learn and develop new skills.
At least five years of working with digital analytics tools, such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics, WebTrends Infinity, IBM CoreMetrics.
Leading analytics projects, either as implementation or insight analysts, including managing client/stakeholders, and ensuring on-time accurate delivery of projects
Experience of working with digital optimisation tools: Adobe Target, Google Optimiser, Oracle Maxymiser, Optimisely.
Experience with Data Science techniques and tools (R, Python)
Experience with Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Syntasa, AWS, GCP, Adobe Data Workbench)
Experience in advanced web analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research.
Familiarity and/ or implementation experience of digital data collection techniques and limitations
Confident communication skills, able to translate complex information into concise and usable insights across a diverse stakeholder group though a variety of means (visual, verbal and written)
Advanced skills using the Microsoft Office suite with very strong Excel, Word and PowerPoint skills
Technical understanding of HTML and web applications.
Being part of a small team provides a fantastic opportunity for both personal development and career advancement.
Company Benefits:
Company Bonus scheme and pension matching
Staff social activities
Great development programs - continuous training and education
Based in the heart of Farringdon
Cycle to work scheme
Healthcare
Pension scheme
25 days holiday - with additional holidays added based on length of service
Apply for this job
Please email your CV to hello@station10.co.uk and we will be in touch.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - AI Forecasting, Finance team
Description:
As part of our forecasting initiatives team your focus will be to improve the accuracy, scope, reach, and usability of forecasting methods globally across all brands. You will take ownership of assessing immediate business needs to develop custom data models and algorithms, creating processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.
You will also be responsible for building and maintaining relationships with our business partners, developing and maintaining accurate forecasting models that solve their near- and long-term challenges.

What you’ll need

Minimum 5 years of hands-on experience preferred as a Data Scientist
Experience developing and deploying forecasting models
Python and SQL coding skills are required; R is a plus
An understanding of Agile workflows and product development cycles
Experience using key external third-party data sources, including Nielsen/IRI/Storeviews, Kantar, Homescan Panel, Retail Execution, Shopper card, first party data and consumer surveys
Experience querying databases (SQL, Hive) and working with big data platforms such as Hadoop ecosystem (Azure), including in-memory solutions (SAP HANA and Apache Spark)
Working knowledge of data visualization tools - Tableau, Power BI, D3, ggplot - to deliver output to the broader business community for improving decision-making and productivity
Strong communication and presentation skills
Bachelor’s Degree within a STEM discipline (Computer Science, Statistics, Data Science, etc.)

What you’ll do

Inspiring your stakeholders to adopt data driven decision-making by developing advanced analytics methods is an enormous priority for this role. By mining vast amounts of data from company databases for insights you’ll help solve challenging business problems that will ultimately make Mars more profitable.

Working with a small multidisciplinary team alongside the Global Analytics, Big Data Engineering, Business Translation and AI teams, you’ll partner with Product Owners to solve problems that real users face using advanced digital techniques. That includes closely collaborating with users from our segments and markets around the world to find the right problems to solve. More importantly, you’ll use this stakeholder exposure to invent true ‘firsts,” new and emerging approaches Mars hasn’t seen before.

#LI-HE1

Title: Policy Leadership Roles
Company: UK Government - Department of Health and Social Ca...
Description:
Examples of the types of role we have within the Group are:

Leading on adult social care charging reform: Social care charging policy is a varied and high profile policy area that has a tangible impact on people who need care and support. Our work is at the heart of public debate – the 2019 Conservative manifesto commits Government to finding ‘a long term solution for social care’. DHSC Ministers and other Government Departments including HM Treasury and Cabinet Office take a close interest in the policy, providing the opportunity to develop and demonstrate strengths in communicating with Ministers and senior leaders, and tackling complex policy issues. The work ranges from considering fundamental questions about the role of government in supporting people with care needs, to negotiating policy solutions with a range of colleagues across government, to understanding the legal and analytical complexities of specific policy proposals.

Leading on Covid and cross-cutting issues relating to the adult social care workforce. The workforce at are the heart of everything that happens in social care. Working in social care requires both skill and commitment to values of caring for others, but people working in social care often feel unrecognised and undervalued in our society. We need to put in place the frameworks, policies and programmes to change that and support employers to recruit enough people with the right skills and values to meet the needs of all citizens who need care and support. Over the past few months this has including agreeing, funding and communication infection control measures, putting in place a package of mental health and well being support for the 1.5 million strong workforce and working with colleagues cross the department to put in place a Life Assurance Scheme for the families of care worker who have sadly died from Covid 19. You will lead a unit of c10 people including 2 or 3 G7 team leaders.

Leading on the improving the experience of social care and the wellbeing of adults with care and support needs: social care in England delivers vital support for over a million adults with varied needs and abilities. These adults include older people, including those with dementia, learning disabled people and those with physical disabilities. DHSC works closely with these adults, their families and carers to ensure that government understands their views about the support they need to live as independently as possible and lead fulfilling lives. Like everyone in the UK, the lives of these people have been, and will continue to be, affected by the pandemic – social care services have been under pressure and will continue to change as we adapt to life with Coronavirus and beyond. This post, within the quality team, will have a focus on improving the how the system delivers the best possible care for adults with support needs, advocating on their behalf across Whitehall in both the design of adult social care services and other services that impact on the provision of care. As the new Social Care Directorate develops, Ministers are keen to see more work in this area, with stronger Departmental oversight of the quality of social care and to better use the insight and experience of users, their families and carers in the polices we design. The post holder will have a unique opportunity to build and shape this workstream, leading a team to make real difference to people with care needs, in care settings and in the community.

Leading on delivering the Spending Review for adult social care. Putting social care on a sustainable footing, where everyone is treated with dignity and respect, is at the core of this Government’s programme. Ensuring that the adult social care sector has enough money to deliver high quality care is essential to delivering this ambition. Working with policy teams and analysts from across the social care group, DHSC and government, the postholder will rapidly build a coherent and robust case for funding. The SR will be an exciting, fast-paced and stretching programme of work to deliver, with significant levels of Ministerial interest. The work ranges from building an understanding of future demand for care, to developing a deeper understanding how Local Authorities spend money on social care. You would be part of a friendly and growing team, who are currently working hard to ensure the system has enough money in the short term to respond effectively to the COVID-19 pandemic. The postholder would oversee a unit of ~8, comprised of two G7-led teams.

Lead provider market policy. The provider markets team is focused on ensuring the social care provider market is dynamic, sustainable and able to deliver seamless high-quality care to those who need it. In the wake of the COVID-19 pandemic, this is all the most crucial and challenging. In this role you will work closely with care providers, the Competition and Markets Authority and the CQC Market Oversight team to maintain a strategic overview of the sustainability of the market and develop thinking on innovative models of care. The postholder will be responsible for considering how best to use and strengthen the data, intelligence and market shaping mechanisms at our disposal to respond proactively to risks facing providers or the market as a whole.

Successful applicants will be expected to be flexible as we work to shape our new Group, but we welcome individual’s preferences as well and will take these into account as far as possible.

The Adult Social Care Group is a friendly, supportive and dynamic place to work. Our policy touches on the lives of almost everyone in the country – whether it is they themselves or a family member or loved one who needs care – and we are a team committed to developing policy that supports everyone to live the life they want, in the setting they chose, for as long as possible.

We welcome applications from candidates regardless of their background and are committed to supporting team members in their personal development. We actively encourage applications from people who work part time or as part of job-sharing arrangements. Several of our senior management team work in this way, and we support all of our team to work in a way enables them to balance work and life outside of work.

We welcome encourage applications from people with experience of working in the social care sector.

This is a fantastic opportunity for high performing individuals to develop and prove their policy leadership skills on a high-profile subject within a supportive and inclusive team.
Responsibilities
Provide leadership to a team of policy advisors and be an engaging, resilient and supportive leader within the team and directorate.

Provide high quality advice to Ministers and senior officials, both in person and in writing, to ensure they understand the benefits, limitations and risks of policy proposals.

Build and maintain constructive relationships with partners and stakeholders within and beyond government.

Key requirements for the role

The role will involve:

Thinking strategically about long term options for policy development.
Tackling policy problems constructively, taking account of trade-offs and risks to develop effective solutions.
Working effectively with stakeholders across the social care sector and with other government departments across Whitehall.
Working closely with analysts and lawyers to understand the impacts of policy options.
Communicating complex issues clearly and concisely to Ministers, stakeholders and the public.
Leading, managing and support a team of policy advisers, often cross-site and/or remotely
Planning ahead and identifying risks to effectively manage work across the team, particularly in the face of changing priorities and timelines.
Providing leadership and direction within the wider Group

Desirable Experience (this is desirable but not essential experience):
Experience of working as a member of the social care workforce (whether in regulated or unregulated roles) and/or social care services in a local authority.
Behaviours
We'll assess you against these behaviours during the selection process:
Seeing the Big Picture
Delivering at Pace
Leadership
Making Effective Decisions
Working Together
Benefits
Learning and development tailored to your role
An environment with flexible working options
A culture encouraging inclusion and diversity
A Civil Service pension

Title: Senior Biostatistician
Description:
Let's push the boundaries together and make the most of your talents!
Senior Biostatistician
Location: Slough, Berkshire, United Kingdom
Job Function: Clinical Development
Job ID: 67367
Help us transform patients' lives.
At UCB, we put our heart, soul, and skills into making a difference for people living with severe disease. Working together to push the boundaries, we blend the best of our talents to unlock innovation. Will you join us in our pioneering adventure?

To strengthen our Global Statistics team, based in the UK or in our Headquarters in Belgium, we are looking for a talented individual to fill the position of: Senior Biostatistician.
As a Senior Statistician you will be driving statistical input in one or more individual clinical studies within a clinical program or across multiple clinical programs. Performing exploratory statistical analysis to gain novel insight that can be used to help inform the development of existing or new compounds. The role will require the Principal Biostatistician to work effectively with other cross-functional teams within and outside Statistical Sciences and Innovation (SSI).

You like to work in an environment where you can:
Lead one or more biomarker, ‘omics or big data projects, offering expert statistical input across all stages of analysis, from feasibility and optimal study design to dissemination of results.
Oversees the development and maintenance of advance predictive models to improve decision-making for clinical studies, clinical strategy, operational efficiency and patient experience.
Communicate results to clinical teams and non-technical audiences focusing on the significance of the findings and interpreting them in the context of the broader scientific questions.
Support studies across all stages of clinical development by providing evidence in support of studies using datamining approaches.
Contribute to raising the profile of the department with the dissemination of scientific findings through papers, conferences and seminars.
Communicates and coordinates all statistical activities with external partner biostatisticians. Ensuring the implementation of global, program and SSI standards by all biostatisticians contributing to the project.
Provides input on interpretation of results by attending and presenting at the Results Interpretation Meeting (RIM). Reviews and inputs into the clinical study report.
Assists the biostatistician lead for a program of studies with the statistical deliverables for regulatory submissions and the lifecycle of a development compound.

You will contribute by:
Providing novel statistical methods using Machine Learning and AI
Implement and apply Statistical methodology within a clinical development setting
Effectively contributes within cross-functional or multi-disciplinary groups
Stays current with ongoing developments in statistical methods applications in the pharmaceutical industry.
Acts as a resource for other biostatisticians in SSI
Communicates complex issues in nontechnical language by using visuals, simulations and other illustrative techniques.
Provides statistical sciences training to UCB employees from different disciplines on statistical concepts.
Seeks opportunity to represent UCB by active participation in external professional/technical forum and defend statistical strategy in front of regulatory authorities when required.
Contributes and reviews abstracts, posters, presentations and manuscripts for publication and ensures accuracy of all biostatistical aspects of such documents
Interested? For this position you’ll need the following education, experience and skills:
Educated to PhD level within a Statistical or computational field
Have strong experience using R and Python
Experience in data visualisation (RShiny)
Experience in Machine learning/AI and applying Big Data methodology

Why you should apply
At UCB, we strive to attract passionate and outstanding talents who thrive on change and are ready to bring real value to patients. Working for us you’ll discover a place where you can grow and express your full potential. We place an emphasis on innovation, collaboration and impact. Through meaningful recognition and a motivating work atmosphere, we aim to provide an optimal experience by caring about and valuing our employees – just as we do for the patients we serve.
If you believe you are the perfect match to join us on our pioneering adventure, then we invite you to apply and tell us more about your profile and motivation.

About us.
UCB- Inspired by Patients. Driven by Science. Everything we do starts with a simple question: “How will this create value for people living with severe diseases?” By putting patients at the heart of what we do, our approach – from discovery to development to delivery – is continuously transformed and designed around patient needs and their journey.
With a team of approximately 7,500 employees and operations in more than 40 countries, we are a global biopharmaceutical company investing more than a quarter of our revenue in cutting-edge scientific research. We are focused on addressing chronic, neurological, immunological, and bone diseases.

UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer.


Job Segment: Neurology, Immunology, Statistics, Law, Pharmaceutical, Healthcare, Data, Legal, Science

Title: Senior Cloud Engineer - Identity
Description:
Senior Cloud Engineer - Identity
- 19000NNL)

Principal Software Engineer – Cloud – Digital Identity

The big question: why on earth should a Tech professional like you work for a 150-year-old retail chain? Because we’re on a journey. Changing the way we operate. Learning to think nimble. Giving our teams the time and freedom they need to push boundaries. To create amazing systems and technologies. To give our colleagues and our customers even more incredible experiences.

#There are thousands of experts to talk to and learn from. We’ve got data from billions of transactions for our teams to play with. Things get built here. They get made here. They hit customers and colleagues quickly. Welcome to the home of Sainsbury's Tech.
Team & Challenges:
The Digital Identity team are building a customer Identity platform that is used by millions of Sainsbury’s Group customers every day. The product is pivotal to the company digital customer strategy and helps to provide secure and consistent access to Sainsbury’s Group digital products.
Challenges we are excited about:

Building a highly scalable and resilient solution using the latest Cloud technologies
Using automation techniques to deliver change frequently, quickly and without interruption
