Docker, AWS ECS, AWS EC2, AWS DynamoDB, Terraform, Ansible, Packer, Python, Apache Kafka, ELK stack & New Relic. We integrate and build with Jenkins. We keep track of everything using Git, Jira & Confluence. We have a microservices mindset. You don’t need experience with everything in this list!

About the role:
You will work closely with Cloud Engineers and Product owners across our most high traffic platforms and be part of a team that is responsible for mastering our customers credentials and authentication. You will design and build large scale distributed systems and act as an authority within the engineering community. You will champion engineering best practices and help maintain a high standard of quality.

What we’re looking for:
Essential:

Deep understanding of the AWS platform
Expertise with Terraform and orchestration tools like Ansible
Experience in one or more programming languages
Developing high quality software through automated unit & integration testing
Understanding of scaling and high availability

Desirable:
Pragmatic & able to promote positive change in technology and processes
Information security
Experience with continuous delivery
NoSQL backends, particularly DynamoDB.
Containerised build and deploy using Docker & ECS
Advanced deployment patterns e.g. blue/green deployment

Title: Senior Consultant
Description:
Senior Consultant – Business
Transformation
Location: London - UK Mobile

Salary:
Up to 50K + 3% Flex Fund + Life Assurance + Pension

The
Company

Shared Services Connected Ltd delivers
class-leading business transformation programmes to government and public
sector across the UK with a target to release one billion pounds of savings to
the public purse.
As a trading name of Shared Services
Connected Ltd, SSCL has established an enviable track record in the design and
delivery of large-scale innovative HR, Payroll, IT, and Finance &
Accounting solutions to significantly improve efficiencies and enhance service
levels across government and public sector.
The company was established as a joint
venture between the Cabinet Office and Sopra Steria Ltd, in 2013 as part of the
Government’s Shared Services Strategy for Smarter Government programme and
operates from four regional centres of excellence: Blackpool; Newcastle;
Newport; and York.
Our clients include a number of
government agencies including the Department for Work and Pensions, Environment
Agency Department for Education, Ministry of Justice and Home Office as well as
the Metropolitan Police Service and the Construction Industry Training Board.

The
Day Job

We are looking for a Senior Consultant
to join our growing consultancy team within our Government sector. We are a successful, growing team with the
freedom to set our own direction and a determination to build sustainable
business by putting our clients’ success first.
The Senior Consultant will be
responsible for identifying and developing consulting
opportunities for individuals and new projects for SSCL. You will also be
responsible for taking ownership of l specific work-streams (and their
outcomes) as part of a consulting team or for the overall management of small
projects and their deliverables. You will also identify and develop
consulting opportunities and new projects.
You will be an practitioner in one or
more of the following business transformation competencies: Business Process
Reengineering or Continual Improvement (EG: LEAN, Six Sigma); Operating Model
Design; Business and Technical Requirements Capture & Assessment; Programme
and Change Management.

Key responsibilities
Bring sector knowledge and understanding of the key business transformation issues to help SSCL’s clients meet their key challenges and opportunities.
Manage the successful delivery of a work-stream or small consulting project in order to achieve revenue targets and high levels of customer satisfaction.
Combine fresh thinking and insight to identify additional consulting opportunities and shape innovative business propositions for new and existing clients.
Work with clients to capture and shape consulting opportunities, helping them re-imagine the future and stay ahead of the curve.
Run and support bid opportunities for small-scale projects that demonstrate Sopra Steria’s distinctive and sustainable consulting business and secure additional revenue and/or new clients.
Be an advocate of SSCL Consulting through participation in industry forums, events and social media.
Live the consulting-led culture by embracing innovative, highly disruptive technologies that support new ways of working in a digital world.
Contribute to the wider Consulting Community through sharing personal knowledge and experience.
Essential skills
Client facing consulting experience in a recognised consulting business.
Delivering value to businesses through business transformation initiatives.
Experience of describing and positioning propositions that embrace all domains of the client’s operating model including a business processes, organisational change
and information technology.
Experience of delivering business transformation work streams and small projects.
Change management skills including analysing capacity, process mapping, cost modelling and benefits appraisal.
Good data gathering and analytical skills.
Degree level education or equivalent, typically in Business, Information Technology or Engineering.
An innovative and fresh thinker.
Security
clearance
The successful
candidate will be required to go through a SC Security Clearance.
Reasons why you should apply to us
We’re big – really big. With that comes career growth opportunities - we offer excellent training, you’ll join a company where development and progression is actively encouraged and not just something we talk about
We have an enviable client list – we work with some of the biggest names out there
We ensure our working environment is supportive and collaborative, everyone has a voice and all opinions count
Our goal is to disrupt the market, not just follow the status quo
Sustainability is really important to us, in fact we are within the top 1% of companies worldwide tackling climate change and managing our emissions

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related technical discipline
6+ years of experience as a data engineer, software developer or related technical job
Experience with AWS services
A passion for improving customer experience
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and technical writing skills

Love data? Love music? The Amazon Music team is looking for a brilliant, creative, and passionate professional to join our Business Intelligence team. The responsibilities include developing self-serve and automated tools that improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the Digital Music Business Intelligence & Data Science team, as well as partnering with the central Data Engineering team to develop central solutions that meet the Business Intelligence & Data Science team’s requirements. You will help lead the way in defining and optimizing how we handle data in the Business Intelligence team.

The Core Business Intelligence team develops processes, tooling and metrics to help the broader Business Intelligence & Data Science team raise their standards of work, but also has the opportunity to influence across Amazon Music and the wider Amazon organization. We deal in AWS technologies like Redshift, S3, EMR, and EC2, and also work with Spark, Airflow, and Tableau. We assess new technologies that can help Amazon Music delight our customers.

This role requires you to focus on the data end to end, from producers to consumers. You will develop an understanding of our data, analytical techniques, and how to connect insights to the business, and you will gain practical experience in insisting on the highest standards on operations in ETL and big data pipelines. With our Amazon Music Unlimited and Prime Music services, and our top music provider spot on the Alexa platform, providing high quality, high availability data to our internal customers is critical to our customer experiences.

Our ideal candidate has a combination of strong technical skills, superb analytical capabilities, and excellent verbal and written communication skills. As a member of our team, you will have the opportunity to work with one of the largest and most complex data warehouses in the world to support how the team gathers insights using data from across Amazon. You will work closely with the broader Business Intelligence and central Data Engineering teams to solve unique problems and find answers to questions that require tenacious problem solving and creativity.

Data-driven decision making is at the core of Amazon’s culture, and your work will have a direct impact on decision making and strategy for the Amazon Music Team.

Key Responsibilities
Contribute to maintenance of and manage projects for the evolution of our data / analytical environments (e.g. Redshift, S3, EMR, EC2)
Partner with our central Data Engineering team to enhance data infrastructure, data quality, and data availability, in order to improve internal customer access to high impact customer insights
Proactively develop new metrics and projects to drive desired data management practices for operations in ETL and big data pipelines
Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes to support large scale data analysis
Join a large and growing BI/Data Science team to leverage extensive music listening data to better understand customers and contribute to product and marketing strategy

Graduate degree in a related technical field
8+ years of experience as a data engineer, software developer or related technical job
A love of music!

Title: Senior Java Engineer
Description:
Senior Java Engineer
- 200003PM)

Senior Java Development Engineer – Checkout/Basket/Post Order, Sainsbury’s Tech @ London Victoria

We are a technology focused retailer hiring automation tester at our London Tech Hub.
The big question: why on earth should a Tech professional like you work for a 150-year-old retail chain? Because we’re on a journey. Changing the way we operate. Learning to think nimble. Giving our teams the time and freedom they need to push boundaries. To create amazing systems and technologies. To give our colleagues and our customers even more incredible experiences.

There are thousands of experts to talk to and learn from. We’ve got data from billions of transactions for our teams to play with. Things get built here. They get made here. They hit customers and colleagues quickly. Welcome to the home of Sainsbury's Tech.

Team & Challenges:
You will be working on re-implementing the Checkout, Basket and Post Order journeys of the Argos web-site.

It’s an exciting opportunity to join a growing team in the process of re-architecting the basket, checkout and account customer experience on a brand new tech stack. We’re building exciting new features that we can test and release at pace, delighting our customers and helping to take digital at Argos to another level.

Tech Stack:
We use Java 8, Spring Boot, Microservices Architecture, Kafka, Spring Webflux for reactive programming, BDD Automation with Cucumber. We connect with back-end micro services architecture running on a mixture of AWS and on-prem, deployed to Mesos/Marathon with Redis, Dynamodb, Jenkins, Docker. We write our own performance scripts using Scala and Gatlink. We keep track of everything using Git, Jira & Confluence and use the full SCRUM cycle with stand-ups, planning poker, burndowns, demo’s, retros, sprint planning and empowered teamwork!

Sainsbury’s teams are encouraged to explore and adopt new technologies to solve the challenges they face. Are you ready to join our next stand-up?

About the role:

Checkout, Basket and Post Order modules of the argos web-site are the most complicated and challenging areas of the entire platform. It requires integrating with many systems like Payment, Order Management, Product Details, My Profile, Promotion service, Loyalty service, etc. The candidate will have a chance to sit down with all the other teams and be involved in design discussions, work closely with other teams, apply BDD and TDD using API Level testing frameworks. The role might require leading a pod of developers and automation testers. So it requires advanced technical and communication skills, not just sitting and coding all the time. Therefore we are looking for candidates that are open to discussions, has experience on integration projects.

What we’re looking for:
Required:
Java 8
Spring Boot
Experience on working on microservices architectures
BDD automation (i.e. Cucumber)
Rest/JSON API endpoints
Git Framework (we use GitLab)
Agile Methodology

Nice to have:
Netflix Libraries (i.e. Zuul)
Kafka
Spring Webflux
Gatlink (Performance testing framework)
Scala
Dynamodb/NoSQL databases

In addition we expect the candidate to:
Have an eye for great customer service and delivery
Enjoy working on end-to-end stories in a multi-disciplinary team
Have worked on Integration projects before
Have very good communication skills
Drive meetings
Act as a lead Developer

In return you’ll get:
Bonus – Upto 20%
Holiday allowance – 22 with the option to buy up to 5 days per year
Company pension
Colleague discount across the multi-brands - Argos, Sainsbury’s and Habitat
Share Purchase Plan
Cycle to work scheme
Season Ticket Loan

Senior Software Engineer - Full Stack
- 20000WVW)

The big question: why on earth should a Tech professional like you work for a 150-year-old retail chain? Because we’re on a journey. Changing the way we operate. Learning to think nimble. Giving our teams the time and freedom they need to push boundaries. To create amazing systems and technologies. To give our colleagues and our customers even more incredible experiences.

#There are thousands of experts to talk to and learn from. We’ve got data from billions of transactions for our teams to play with. Things get built here. They get made here. They hit customers and colleagues quickly. Welcome to the home of Sainsbury's Tech.

Team & Challenges:
We create the software that powers hundreds of thousands of sessions every day on thousands of in-store devices. Title: Lead Business Consultant
Description:
Big data, cloud, cyber, communications and sensors.
The Law Enforcement sector is at an exciting cross-roads, where changing user expectations and enabling technology advancements are driving transformation at an unprecedented scale. As a leader in business and technical transformation, we are at the forefront of shaping and delivering these changes to help our clients embrace the ever changing world.
Can you influence the future or inspire change? If so, read on...
The Law Enforcement sector is at exciting cross-roads, where changing user expectations and enabling technology advancements are driving transformation at an unprecedented scale. As a leader in business and technical transformation, Roke is at the forefront of shaping and delivering these changes to help our clients embrace the ever changing world.
Why Roke?
Roke believes in improving the world through innovation. We do it by bringing the physical and digital together in ways that revolutionise industries. That's why we've fostered an environment where some of the world's finest minds have the freedom, support and trust to succeed. Roke is a team of curious and deeply technical consultants and engineers dedicated to safely unlocking the economic and societal potential of connected real-world assets.
Our 60-year heritage and deep knowledge in sensors, communications, cyber and Artificial Intelligence means our people are uniquely placed to combine and apply these technologies in ways that keep people safe whilst unlocking value. For our customers, we're a trusted partner that welcomes any problem, confident that our consulting, research, innovation and product development will help them revolutionise and improve their world. If you're interested in bringing the physical and digital worlds together, we'd love to talk.
Why Roke Consulting? “Business Unusual”
We help to achieve a safe and secure world by supporting the Home Office and our Law Enforcement clients through innovation and by shaping and delivering their most complex business transformations.
We provide outstanding work with unrivalled Intelligent Insight and work in partnership with our clients to deliver the most valued products and services
We combine highly creative and strategic thinking with excellent commercial and technical skills to form powerful teams. Roke Consultancy delivers Strategic Advice, Analysis and Architecture in the areas of:
Customer insight, future trends and business case development
R&D and innovation process analysis and organisational improvement
Technology visioning, strategy development and solution implementation
Concept generation and innovation management
What will your role look like?
We are looking for an experienced Business Consultant with a proven track record in leading business and technical design and delivery by leveraging cutting edge technologies and proven agile ways of working. You will be involved in all aspects of the Consultancy lifecycle, i.e. Win, Deliver and Develop. This role is required to support our National Security, Commercial and Defence clients.
As a Roke Business Consultant you will be responsible for growing our client relationships, winning work, delivery and continuing to expand our world-class consultancy skills and capabilities. You will be involved in some of the most cutting edge and complex technology programmes within one or more of our client-side teams.
This role will expand your abilities by working alongside our wealth of world leading specialists in data analytics, cyber and secure communications, from rapidly prototyped research right through to high grade enterprise systems. Many of our projects are highly creative, so we are looking for individuals who want to work with the best, have the ability to think around, propose and implement solutions to some of the most difficult problems.
Specific responsibilities
You will take responsibility for all aspects of business development and be a senior contributor to projects where appropriate, working alongside other business development, project management, technical staff and business analysts. Specific responsibilities are:
Working with and guiding our dedicated business development team to maximise opportunities for the consulting team
Understanding client business and technical needs and communicating these clearly to the team
Personally close key significant sales and delivery of key consultancy deliverables
Developing strong commercial relationships with senior client executives during project delivery to ensure expectation of quality and value of projects is met and shaping further sales opportunities
Utilising market, technology and/or business consulting methodology knowledge to guide the technical team, informing strategy and internal investments
Interacting with teams across the diverse market and technical base of the division
You will also use your strong business skills to help communicate what Roke Consultants can deliver to potential clients
Your consulting skills will also help you to make a significant contribution to the overall direction of business strategy projects, often working on more than one concurrently.
Your skills, energy and insight will make a significant contribution to Roke.
Minimum requirements
To meet the demanding requirements of this role you will have:
Proven track-record in winning and delivering business and technical consultancy projects within the UK Government and Law Enforcement arena.
Hold a degree in a business field or in a field of technical relevance for Roke or equivalent
Have significant expertise and experience in either a management or technology consulting environment. Our team applies consulting skills to strategic technology questions, working across a range of technologies and in the National Security, Defence and Commercial sectors
Have already been successful in business strategy development / implementation, and innovation management
You are experienced in recognising technology-led opportunities, helping to shape breakthrough products and bring them to market.
In addition, to be successful in the role you will be expected to:
Be committed to providing top quality advice to address the needs of our clients
Have a track record in developing client relationships, recognising potential and selling significant projects
Be a highly effective communicator with the ability to write, present and facilitate workshops
Have excellent team working skills and be able to build and maintain new relationships
Able to steer projects, but also on occasion lead them as a project manager
Have flexibility, energy and a constructive approach to challenges
Have a positive attitude and maintain a policy of openness
Uphold the values of Roke of delivering impact and caring for colleagues
As an effective communicator you will have experience consulting or teaching and enjoy mentoring staff.
What we can offer you?
This position offers a competitive salary and benefits package, including bonus scheme, private medical insurance employee assistance program and pension, along with a whole host of flexible benefits including amongst others childcare vouchers, flexi-leave (up to 8 days per year), travel insurance and dental care.
Security
Due to the nature of this position, we require you to either hold or be eligible to achieve SC and or DV clearance. As a result, you should be a British Citizen and have resided in the UK for the last 5 years for SC and 10 years for DV. We will provide assistance transferring your clearance, as well as, pay a high level clearance bonus.

We are committed to a policy of Equal Opportunity, Diversity and Inclusion. Our working environment is friendly, innovative and inclusive. We can consider flexible working arrangements, and support a diverse work-force and those with additional needs.

Description:
Lead Big Data Developer – Competitive Salary Plus Benefits – London - J9884

This data rich service provider believes passionately in the value of this data to provide solutions to help solve often complex business challenges. You will lead a team to undertake solution development utilising appropriate models, processes, standards and principles. This is a critical role, joining a well-known brand, whose fundamental principle is that data is a corporate asset which creates value.

Role and Responsibilities
Make great quality, well understood data available that can then drive analytics and insights into the business
Turn successful variants into production solutions
Enhance the organisation model for the development team
Update and manage artefacts created by the team
Choose appropriate solutions to meet needs.
Implement an operating model to deliver end to end solutions in matrix.
Deliver, cost effective, appropriate capabilities for the business
Manage a day to day resources to deliver solutions
Develop a team of approximately 6 colleagues
Decide how best to deliver against the agreed requirements.
Independently manage the completion of tasks

Qualifications, Experience & Skills Required
Have flexibility to undertake standard solution development
Help recruit and/or develop a high class data development team
Manage a team that delivers change into various data assets.
Experience of Big Data Technologies, technology stack includes: Cloudera, Spark, Hive, Kafka, Python, Scala, SQL
Experience with AWS is advantageous
Deliver a complex and complete development solutions for the business.
Exemplary technical and strong leadership skills
Demonstrate commitment to succeed in a fast-moving, highly pressured environment
Share your knowledge with others
Proven ability to deliver quality solutions
Great communication skills with the ability to deliver complex findings to non-technical parties.


If you fit the above job description please contact Roisin McCarthy on
Show phone number
or email her on rmccarthy@datatech.org.uk. Please be advised that we can only accept candidates who have the right to work in the UK.

Alternatively, you can refer a friend or colleague by taking part in our fantastic referral schemes! If you have a friend or colleague who would be interested in this role, please refer them to us. For each relevant candidate that you introduce to us (there is no limit) and we place, you will be entitled to our general gift/voucher scheme.

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
About Us
We want to help small businesses win. That’s why we’re here.
We connect small business owners to investors – to create jobs, help families and power economies – because we believe that people are made to do more. And we want to help them.
So, we created the leading online marketplace for small business loans. Our investors have lent £8.1 billion in 110,000 loans to 77,000 small business owners. In a single year , we unlocked 115,000 jobs and contributed £6.5 billion to the global economy. There’s never been a better time to join!
Be part of the team that changes everything. Let’s build the place where small businesses can get the funding they need to win and leave a legacy behind, forever.
This role sits within the “Tech” team. The drivers behind our platform – brilliant people working together to create, code, and build the next game changers.
About the role
The data team makes sure that data at Funding Circle is reliable and easily accessible across the company. We leverage the latest technologies and a team of diverse backgrounds to build a data platform to address these challenges. We build tools to help us automate traditional data processing pipelines so that we can build data systems at scale. We also build tools to empower our analysts and data scientists in their day to day work.
Day to Day, this role will include:
Build internal tools and libraries for our engineers and internal customers
Maintain and monitor our AWS data infrastructure
We love pairing! Whenever you wish for knowledge sharing or learning between the teammates. Driving design and problem solving sessions.
Research and learn new tools and technologies in the data space
Synchronising with the teams in London, San Francisco, and Bangalore
Documenting the architecture and decisions made
Work with our stakeholders to iterate on our data products
Collaborate with the team to solve architectural challenges
About You
A great communicator! A real people person that connects easily with people and brings a strong positive energy to the table.
Fired–up to achieve. Passionate about the power of data to drive better business outcomes for our customers.
Super organised. Someone who knows how to manage their workload, cope with multiple priorities and can organise their days and week effectively
Quick to learn. You get things quickly, can take on feedback and understand how to explain complex concepts and products to our customers simply
Good working knowledge of any of the following: SQL, Python, Clojure, Scala
Looking forward to working in an international team
We’re interested in meeting people from diverse education backgrounds and this role would suit someone who likes to help others
You will have worked on one or two of the following: AWS:Glue, Athena, Redshift, Apache Airflow, Kafka, Spark, Terraform.
Why join us?
We’re gearing up for our biggest chapter yet – and it’s being driven by everyone.
We think of ourselves as the career launchpad. A place to develop yourself, fast. Real work. Real experience. Real opportunities to collect skills. Think big remits and huge ownership to make great things happen.
Yes, it’s target-driven and high-octave – but we like to play hard too. That’s what makes us, us. Our vibrant culture is built around potential and creating a place where you can really be you. We keep it agile and open. All voices heard. Because we believe great ideas come from everywhere.
If you show skill and are willing, we’ll back you all the way. This is the place for you to build something incredible.
It’s in our differences that we find our strengths.
We celebrate and support the differences that make you, you. So we’re building a culture where difference is valued. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We truly believe diversity makes us better.
Want to Build The Incredible? We’d love to hear from you.

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
Senior Data Engineer ( Scala / Spark / Cassandra / Kafka )
6 months
£600-£650
Central London
A Senior Data Engineer ( Scala / Spark / Cassandra / Kafka ) is required to join a prestigious entertainment company based in Central London. The project is six months in length and will look to commence in November. My client is inviting a passionate technologist with lengthy big data experience, to apply hands-on skills and ideas to their core technology as a senior member of the team. The ideal candidate will be recognised as a subject matter expert and must be willing to mentor and develop more junior Data Engineers, providing help and support when required.
The Senior Data Engineer ( Scala / Spark / Cassandra / Kafka ) will cover specific areas of big data like data engineering, distributed computing and machine learning. Experience in most of these and proven interest in others is required.
Essential and Desirable Skills for the Senior Data Engineer ( Scala / Spark / Cassandra / Kafka ) include:
At minimum of six years of hands-on professional experience as a data engineer developing production level analytics, big data applications.
Expert programming skills in Java, Scala or/and Python.
Expert in Apache Spark.
Good knowledge of AWS analytic stack – Redshift, Spectrum, Kinesis, Elastic Beanstalk.
Excellent experience of RDBMS, NoSQL.
Proficient in handling operational tasks on AWS and/or managing databases, etc.
Proficient understanding of distributed computing principles, components and architecture.
Experience with streaming solutions and real time applications
Experience in processing real-time events using Kafka, Flume or NiFi
Knowledge in machine learning / recommendations.
Qualifications & Prerequisites for the Senior Data Engineer ( Scala / Spark / Cassandra / Kafka ) role:
Degree or higher in Computer Science / Big Data / Machine Learning.
Must be proficient in reading, writing and speaking English.
Ability to interact at all level across our client base.
The technology Stack
Scala / Java, Apache Spark, AWS big data stack, Kinesis / Kafka, Cassandra, Elasticsearch / Solr, Apache Nifi
If you would like to be considered for the Senior Data Engineer ( Scala / Spark / Cassandra / Kafka ) role, please click Apply.
The ideal candidate must be able to start in November, with a view to interview immediately.
Venturi is a staffing business dedicated to you, differentiating ourselves in the marketplace by quality of service and candidate delivery. Our highly skilled and experienced staff operate within dedicated markets to give you the best service possible. Venturi markets include Business Intelligence, Development IT & Legal IT. Venturi operates as an employment agency and employment business. No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age for this role.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Description:
Advanced analytics. Intelligent insights.
IXICO is a fast growing and profitable medical data analytics company, providing data management and advanced analytics to the pharmaceutical clinical trials market. Established in 2004 and listed as a public company in October 2013, IXICO has firmly established itself as a trusted partner to the global pharmaceutical industry developing new therapies for neurological conditions such as Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s and Huntington’s disease.
Our purpose is to advance medicine and human health by turning data into clinically meaningful information, providing valuable new insights in neuroscience. We will focus on developing and deploying breakthrough data analytics, at scale, through our remote access technology platform, to improve the return on investment in drug development and reduce risk and uncertainty in clinical trials for our pharmaceutical clients.
Our integrated technology offering encompasses every stage of clinical drug development through to post marketing surveillance and we continue to invest in infrastructure and innovation to support our ambitious growth strategy. Our competitive advantage is our dedication to address complex unmet clinical research needs by partnering and collaborating with clients and academic partners early in the drug development cycle to identify and validate promising new imaging and digital biomarkers.
We are guided by our “4A” values: Aspiration; Ability.; Agility; and Accountability. These are at the heart of our culture and empower our people to directly contribute to achieving our goal to be a leading proponent of artificial intelligence in clinical drug development. We recognise that we will succeed in realising our purpose and achieving our goal only by bringing together the diverse set of skills needed to innovate and develop cutting-edge technologies, and by building an inclusive culture to continuously enhance our service offering to support our customers’ scientific endeavours.
As our team continues to grow we are now looking to hire a Senior Business Analyst for our internal Software Development team:
Key Responsibilities:
To capture and document requirements for the next generation software platform from internal stakeholders and users.
Work closely with the Product Owner/Senior Business Analyst to translate requirements into features that bring value to the users of the platform.
Create diagrams and documents to support and promote the product vision for the features and facilitating workshops to present them to users and stakeholders.
Write User Stories with clearly defined acceptance criteria and working closely with developers and testers to ensure that the stories are completed to an agreed definition of done.
Help to plan and maintain the product backlog and scheduling the backlog into sprints.
To be a key member of one or more, self-organizing Agile teams and a participant in Agile ceremonies.
To be an advocate for transparency and the sharing of knowledge across the organization.
Skill Requirements:
Experience of eliciting, capturing and documenting requirements
Experience of writing User Stories and Acceptance Criteria
Experience of creating UML structural and behavioural diagrams
Experience of creating BMPN process diagrams
Experience of running sprint planning and grooming sessions
Strong knowledge of software development lifecycle and processes
Knowledge of tools such as JIRA/Confluence, or Azure Dev Ops Boards
Degree level education (High attainment, or, otherwise, exceptional candidate)
Medical, biotechnology or pharma experience preferred
Person Specification:
Strong interpersonal skills
Analytical, results focused with excellent problem-solving ability
Collaborative and experienced facilitator
Pro-active and adaptable team player with a can-do attitude
Ability to prioritise workloads and requirements
Strong growth mindset and work ethic
Excellent written and spoken communication skills
Employee Benefits
Competitive remuneration package
Generous employer pension contribution of 6%
25 days annual leave, increasing up to 28 days with every year at IXICO
Various discounts in retail, food & drink and entertainment through our benefit portal
Annual salary review and company bonus scheme
Life Assurance scheme
A very sociable, supportive and highly motivated team
A company in an industry where your work has an impact every single day
How to Apply
IXICO is working hard to create a representative, inclusive and super-friendly team, because we believe different experiences, perspectives and backgrounds make a better workplace, and ultimately better services.
IXICO doesn’t discriminate on the basis of race, colour, religion or belief, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or any other protected class.
This is a great opportunity to thrive in an engaging and fast-paced environment, to make a difference on an every day basis. You will be given support to enable you to grow with your challenges, and we pride ourselves to be a sociable and diverse bunch of people, who are all working together on one big mission: Improving brain health. Will you join us?
If you think IXICO should meet you, please send us your CV and covering letter by email to careers@ixico.com. We are looking forward to your application!
Please note that IXICO will process the data provided by you only in order to perform the outlined recruitment exercise. For more details on what data we process and on what legal basis this happens please view our Recruitment Privacy Policy or contact careers@ixico.com.

Title: Senior Java Developer (Data Team)
Description:
The company
Vonage is the emerging leader in the $100B+ cloud communications platform (CPaaS) market. Customers like Airbnb, Viber, Whatsapp, Snapchat, and many others depend on our APIs and SDKs to connect with their customers all over the world.
As businesses continue to shift to a real-time, customer-centric communications model, we are experiencing a time of impressive growth.

The team
The Engineering team at Vonage is a fast growing group of talented engineers. They face multiple challenges associated with high performance, distributed systems, and processing large volumes of data in real time.
We are looking for a Data Engineer to join a new team dedicated to transforming the data pipeline to a real-time event-driven one.

The role
Building systems to enable data insight and data science from tens of millions of daily events
Real-time data processing using stream technologies (Kafka streaming or similar)
Write efficient and scalable code
Develop on a public cloud infrastructure

The Stack
AWS (S3, EMR, Redshift, ...)
Google Cloud (GDS)
Kafka
Java / Python
Anything needed to achieve our goals

Must have:
Data engineer experience with software engineering skills or software engineer interested in making a move to data.
Java / Python / any other programming language used to process data.
Experience dealing with event-driven pipeline (Kafka or other).
Willingness to learn and use different technology/programming language.
Experience working with public cloud
SQL / NoSQL

Nice to have:
Experience with streaming framework
Experience with open source OLAP system (Druid, Pinot…)
Telecommunication knowledge
Docker and Kubernetes exposure

Why Vonage
We value disruptive innovation, getting things done, and working with passion and integrity are the values that matter at Nexmo. We are on a mission to enable simplified communications between enterprises and their customers by empowering our employees. We strive for passion and integrity, both personally and professionally.

We have achieved significant growth by hiring exceptional people. We have big goals, and we want the people who join us to be self-confident, focused on customers and delivery, and who are structured and committed in their approach. We value those who will help us continue this spirit. If this appeals to you then we encourage you to apply.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Closing date: 30th November 2018
Competitive Market Rate Salary

Title: Senior Software Engineer/SRE - Bloomberg Indices
Description:
Who are we?
The Bloomberg Index Services Limited (BISL) SRE team is an integral part of a rapidly growing index business within Bloomberg. We are responsible for the smooth operation of a diverse range of systems serving world leading benchmark and tradable index products. These indices underpin many trillion of dollars of trades and assets under management, and hundreds of clients rely on them daily to inform critical business decisions. The reliability, stability, and scalability of this platform is key to our success - and that’s where our SREs come in! Our SRE team is globally distributed across the US, London, and Asia, and we work together to ensure a consistent and seamless platform for all clients.
This is a great opportunity to come join a team of reliability engineers on the SRE journey. You will have the opportunity to make a positive mark early and continuously as you work closely with other engineers.
Who are you?
An SRE with an aptitude for analytical and creative problem solving. You can dive into the detail of complex issues quickly, and you’re excited to harness the power of automation to manage the stability, availability, and scale of our incredibly complex technology infrastructure. You’re passionate about SRE, and don’t shy away from a challenge. You’re excited by the opportunity to help drive the SRE culture across our product and company.
We’ll trust you to:
Use all your technical skills and experience to ensure the reliability of a diverse set of systems with a diverse technology stack
Help expand the observability of these systems to improve their reliability
Quickly grow in your technical knowledge of the technology stack – across all the systems – which lie at the centre of our production environment
Contribute to the work of the whole team, whether pair programming or peer reviewing or collaborating with the engineering and product operations teams to find the very best solution to their problem
Be an enthusiastic agile practitioner, helping us to improve and refine our approach to ensure we deliver quality indices in a predictable manner
You’ll need to have:
Experience programming in one or more scripting languages (Python, Shell, or Bash)
Experience working with any OO language - most of our stack is written in C++ and C#, but we’re open to other backgrounds as well
Working knowledge of Windows Server & Linux operating system
Excellent communication and collaboration skills for daily interaction with engineering and operations stakeholders
Exposure to all phases of the software development lifecycle
The ability to identify opportunities for automation, and develop and test a solution
We'd love to see:
Experience with Chef or other configuration tools such as Puppet or Ansible
A solid understanding of object-oriented design, data structures and algorithms
Experience working on diverse and complex software systems
Experience building monitoring systems and bringing transparency to running systems
A desire to learn new technologies and apply them where appropriate to improve the quality of our software and processes
Other Resources:
Learn how Bloomberg bets big on our SREs: https://www.techatbloomberg.com/blog/bloomberg-bets-big-on-sres/
How we outsmart outages: bit.ly/SRE_BBG
Check out Bloomberg Engineering: www.bloomberg.com/engineering
Read about the unique problems we’re solving: TechAtBloomberg.com
Interview process:
We believe interviewing is a two way street. It's a way for us to get to know you and your skills, and also a way for you to learn more about the team, our technical challenges, and what you'd be working on. The content of each interview round will be tailored to the role and your background, but the general framework can be found here: https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/technology/engineering/software-engineering-experienced-hire/

Title: Sr Software Development Engineer
Description:
Basic qualifications:
A Master degree or above in computer science, engineering or related field is required.
7+ years of programming experience in Java/Ruby/Python/C++, or other object-oriented languages.
Strong computer science and software development fundamentals, including object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design and complexity analysis.
Experience of driving the architecture, engineering and software design of large-scale, multi-tiered, distributed software applications or services.
Experience in big data software systems (Hadoop/Spark/R/Streaming Analytics, etc.).
Experience building and operating highly scalable and available services.

Come and be a part of Amazon's amazing growth story!

Are you looking for an opportunity to solve deep technical problems and build innovative solutions in a fast-paced environment working with smart, passionate software developers? Do you want to be in the forefront of engineering big data solutions that takes Transportation models to the next generation? This might be the role for you!

We are looking for Senior Software Development Engineer (m/w/d) in Luxembourg to be part of our Transportation Business Intelligence team. Our software systems include services that handle peta-byte data volumes, integrate with a network of transportation services worldwide, and drive business decisions impacting millions of Amazon customers and billions of dollars a year. We have an opportunity to build software that scales the business, leads the industry through innovation and delights millions of customers worldwide. We leverage cutting edge technologies in big data, optimization techniques, machine learning, real time analytics and high volume, low latency, high availability services.

Preferred qualificaitons:
Experience in real-time analytical systems and machine learning.
Experience leading or contributing to multiple simultaneous product development efforts and initiatives.
Balance technical leadership with strong business judgment to make the right decisions about technology choices.
Constantly striving for simplicity, and at the same time demonstrate significant creativity, innovation and judgment.
Visionary leader, builder and operator.

Applications with English CV only please

Are you interested? We are looking forward to receiving your application. Please submit your online application including your CV, covering letter (both written in English) and certificates (school, university), stating your earliest start date and salary expectations separately in the applicant form.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. By submitting your resume and application information, you authorize Amazon to transmit and store your information in the Amazon group of companies' world-wide recruitment database, and to circulate that information as necessary for the purpose of evaluating your qualifications for this or other job vacancies.

Title: Operational Resilience Regulations Lead
Description:
Operational Resilience Regulations Lead
London | Royal Tunbridge Wells
Job ref: 200006A8
Closing date: 24/07/2020
for this job
Specialism: IT (including Digital) & Operations
Career area: Digital and data
Salary: Salary dependent on experience
Description
We have an exciting opportunity in our Operational Resilience and Physical Security team for a Strategic Operational Resilience Lead. You will be supporting the delivery of the Operational Resilience programme for all AXA UK companies (AXAI, AXA PPP, Corporate Centre, AXA Ireland and AGH) and subsidiaries (HoL, Health Services, AXA Taking Care, PHC, Proactive Health, and Active+) ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and AXA Group Standards practice and policies.
Your Key Accountabilities will be :
Operational Resilience Regulatory Changes
Manage and develop the AXA UK Operational Resilience framework, governance and model, implementing changes necessary to meet regulatory requirements, and specifically those detailed in consultation papers CP29/19 and CP19/32.
Structure and mobilise the change programmes necessary to meet regulatory requirements.
Be the first point of contact for the OR Regulations Programme with suppliers and project manager
Support the supplier selection process to build both the initial business case and programme of work
Identify gaps in current resilience working practices against new regulations
Identify strategies to address gaps
Ensure changes in working practices are rolled out effectively to OR Team
Consider opportunities to converge team activities as part of the roll out
Support the Head of OR in delivery of Board and Exec level briefings
Management and support of Technology-related resilience
Be the first point of contact for IT Service Continuity, ensure that the OR Team provide all the required information in a timely manner
Be the proactive 2nd line review of ITSCM ensuring that they either meet the required RTO of critical applications or that appropriate review, challenge and sign off has taken place
Lead the implementation of Operational Resilience applications in AXA UK, ensuring they are delivered in line with Group timescales and all potential benefits are realised
Operational Resilience
Support the Head of Operational Resilience AXA UK with the delivery of the Operational Resilience Programme for AXA UK, delivering it in line with AXA Group Standards and commensurate with the risk exposure of each operating company or subsidiary.
Assist the Head of Operational Resilience in the development and implementation of continuity strategy for AXA UK businesses, ensuring the strategy supports both large operating companies and small subsidiaries
Embed a proactive resilience based culture in the organisation that encourages the business and IT to have appropriate mitigation for potential risks in place
Support the ongoing oversight of critical 3rd parties e.g. ABS, AXA tech
Crisis Management
Deliver appropriate crisis management procedures, plans, training and exercising across AXA UK’s businesses.
Manage the deployment of the AXA Group Crisis Management standard across the AXA UK businesses ensuring it supports both UK Operational Resilience strategy and AXA UK crisis and incident management teams
Be the expert, serve as the alternate AXA UK point of contact for Crisis Management, taking the lead when required
Manage the development of both UK and Operating company Crisis Management plans and associated support documentation, ensuring compliance to policy or where required, signed off dispensation
Along with the Head of Operational Resilience develop relationship with AXA Group Head of Crisis Management and their Team and provide support and guidance to regional and global crisis management teams as required
Ensure each entity Comms Team has the appropriate CM comms procedures in place through effective workshops and discussions.
Manage delivery of Crisis Management scenario exercises to applicable crisis and incident teams across AXA UK. These exercises must focus on key risks identified by Operational Risk
Governance and Reporting
Support the delivery of long term resilience strategy supporting the business as it changes change and controlling costs in line with the AXA’s long term financial goals
Manage the delivery of appropriate Operational Resilience governance materials for all UK businesses, reporting to UK, Opco and subsidiary risk committees in a timely and effective manner
Ensure that all exceptions to AXA Group Standards are reviewed and where required, signed off by the appropriate accountable executive or committee
Support the management of the team in delivering Group Standards, PFPM and AXA Group Assessments activities and reporting, producing acceptable action plans which are followed through to completion.
Manage the continuous compliance monitoring of UK entities and provide executive governance reporting. Including the quality assurance of Business Continuity and Crisis Management plans procedures and associated materials, training events and skill sets
Maintain relationships with key executives via regular meetings/ 1-1’s ensuring Operational Resilience is part of the leaderships agenda
Organisation and People Management
Deputise for the Head of Operational Resilience in leading the team when required.
Support the development of the Operational Resilience Relationship Team
Support the recruitment of new Relationship Team members as required
Establish and lead an integrated AXA UK Operational Resilience function, covering all businesses and subsidiaries, ensuring adherence with the AXA Group policies and standards
Ensure effective robust development plans are in place for employees to support continuous improvement in performance and capability of technical and soft skills
Support the management of the function within budget and achieve costs savings where appropriate
Qualifications
The ideal candidate will:
Detailed knowledge of relevant FCA/ PRA legislation and BCM best practice
Minimum of 5 years’ experience in a Business Continuity and Crisis Management role
Role holder must hold or be working towards the Certificate in Business Continuity (CBCI) and be a member of the BCI at ABCI level or above
An up to date knowledge and understanding of Operational Resilience, BC and CM practices, standards and developments within the industry.
A good understanding of at least one major AXA operating company
A proven track working of collaborative working with other AXA entities to deliver Operational Resilience
Good understanding of technical IT and facilities infrastructures, especially Operational Resilience specific applications.
Good presentation, influencing and communication skills.
Ability to successfully communicate with and influence staff at Senior Management level
A record of self-development and enthusiasm to develop a lead role in Operational Resilience
Ability to effectively interact, liaise and influence employees and other third parties.
A demonstrable track record of effective cost management
Experience of working with ITSCM and Physical Security Officer functions
Good planning and organisational skills.
Understanding of project management.
Demonstrate by example commitment to AXA values and AXA behaviours.
An enquiring attitude to ensure up to date knowledge of any impacting influences on the operating environment both within the Company and externally.
About AXA
With a presence in over 60 countries, and 165,000 employees serving the needs of 107 million customers, AXA is big.
But never too big to care for every single person who works here. So when you join us, we promise to put our collective might behind you and your career.
You’ll work in an open and supportive environment where you’ll be developed, challenged and encouraged to move around to achieve even bigger and better things – nationally and internationally. You’ll learn directly from senior leaders, from the best in our business. And you’ll enjoy real responsibility, really early on.
Every large company today talks about supporting diversity and inclusion. But at AXA UK, these values form an integral part of everything we do. For us, it’s about bringing together the best talent, helping people to realise their full potential by being 100% themselves at work and delivering outstanding service to everyone – regardless of difference.

We’re proud to be part of the AXA Group, a global insurance brand and a worldwide leader in financial services, providing corporate support services to a whole range of AXA UK businesses. From how we use the latest technology to exploring new channels to market, our impact is far-reaching, wide-ranging and ever-evolving. We actively encourage our people to think differently. Because only by challenging the status quo will we push AXA onto even greater things.

We’re empowering people to live better lives, which means that we do everything we can to support our customers. You’ll develop and be challenged as you grow your career in the direction you choose, exploring bigger and better things. And you’ll do it all while bringing 100% of yourself to work and making a real impact.
What We Offer
When you join us, you’ll find an open and supportive environment, where everyone is encouraged to be true to themselves. We listen to one another and keep our minds open, so that we can challenge our perspective and grow our understanding. We’re always ready to improve our work environment, and we stand up for what we believe in, because we want to make a difference to the lives of our customers everywhere.
Here is also a small selection of our current benefits:
Bonus Scheme linked to yours and the company’s performance
Pension scheme with employer contributions as well as your own
28 days holiday increasing with service plus bank holidays
Interest free season ticket loan scheme
Share Plan Scheme Flexible benefits scheme
Discount on all AXA Insurance products, including insurance, breakdown cover &
What's life like as an AXA data apprentice?
Rewards and Benefits
As well as a supportive and rewarding working culture, you'll enjoy a good holiday allowance and generous company pension scheme. Depending on your role you’ll have the opportunity to buy share options, a car allowance and private medical insurance. Note that benefits can vary according to the different part of AXA and the role itself.
Pay and Bonus
We carefully consider our pay levels and carry out a review each year so you are paid fairly for what you do. When AXA does well, we share in its success and all employees are eligible for a discretionary bonus payment each year, dependant on individual and company performance.
Pension and Life Assurance
We want to help you actively plan for a financially healthy retirement, so we offer a Defined Contribution Pension Scheme. This means that we contribute to your pension fund depending on the amount you choose to pay in.
Holiday
Work life balance is important. Our holiday entitlements start at a minimum of 22 days (plus bank holidays) dependent on the business area or the role, increasing up to 28 days (plus bank holidays) with length of service. Depending on which part of AXA you work in, there’s also flexibility to buy up to five additional days or sell up to three days, helping you to achieve the right balance for you.
Recognition
We recognise and reward you when you demonstrate the behaviours that make AXA great.
Our Stories
Would you like to know more about life at AXA? Our AXA Stories offer a good insight into what it's like to work here.
Careers advice
“The possibilities and opportunities here are limitless.”
Read more
Digital and data
“You’ll always be encouraged to learn as you go"

Location
Wherever you are in the UK, there's likely to be an AXA office near to you.
Royal Tunbridge Wells
Find out more
London

Inside AXA
Take a peek at what we get up to around AXA.
Our Values
Our values shape what we do and how we do it. They inspire us, guide us and empower us to work together, push the boundaries, challenge things for the better and believe in ourselves. No matter how big or small our achievements, our values sit at the heart of everything we do.
