Title: Senior Manager Transaction Monitoring - Data & Analytics
Description:
Senior Manager Transaction Monitoring - Data & Analytics
London
Up to £95,000
An exciting opportunity to join an industry leading team working with data and advanced analytics to develop solutions for some of the hardest forensic and regulatory challenges.
THE COMPANY
A global leading professional services firm with one of the largest forensic practices. Having recently been ranked top for using sophisticated analytical and technology driven methods, this company is leading the way on addressing fraud and financial crime challenges for a range of industry clients.
THE ROLE
Design, implement and optimise client screening solutions
Lead multiple workstreams across Transaction Monitoring and Anti-Money Laundering
Develop business and encourage the adoption of big data technology and machine learning within clients
Support junior team members with ETL processes, data mining and data analytics using SQL
Deliver reporting and analytics to senior client stakeholders
YOUR SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Strong domain experience within Financial Crime and Forensics, specifically Anti-Money Laundering
Advanced technical skills including hands-on experience with SQL and a programming language such as Python
Previous consulting experience from a professional services firm or internal consulting experience with proven external business development
Proven commercial aptitude and ideas on secure incremental business within the role
Significant experience with Transaction Monitoring systems such as Actimize, NetReveal or similar
BENEFITS
Up to £95,000
Competitive bonus
Health insurance
Life assurance
Technical, professional & management training
HOW TO APPLY
Please submit your CV to Rosalind Madge at Harnham via the Apply Now button.
Please note that our client is currently running a fully remote interview process during the Covid-19 situation.

Title: Senior BI Analyst
Description:
SENIOR BI ANALYST
ASSET MANAGEMENT FIRM
CENTRAL LONDON
£65,000
One of the largest and most recognised brands within Asset and Fund Management are looking for a skilled Senior BI Analyst who can pull key insights from the data to advise their client facing and sales area of the business in order to increase their efficacy.
THE COMPANY
This company is one of the major organisations in this market globally managing a portfolio in excess of £4 billion. This role would join a team of 20 made up of a small team of data scientists, some developers and some BI Analysts.
THE ROLE
If you were to be successful in your application for this Senior BI Analyst position your responsibilities would include:
Using SQL /Python to explore the data and work closely with data science in order to achieve the most valuable insights for the team
Take a lead on the analysis and solution design tasks and all elements of planning and estimates for analysis assignments during sprints including development and testing of working software and solution design.
Work closely with and support product owners to ensure that features and stores are as defined and structured as possible
Work with key members of the sales and client management team to ensure the requirements are effectively reflected in the solutions built or insights found and then communicated simply and effectively
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
In order for your application for the Senior BI Analyst to be successful you will need;
Strong experience using SQL or Python for Data Analysis and the ability to not only find key insights in large data sets but understand and effectively communicate their relevance to non technical stakeholders
Experience using a modern BI tool such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Qlikview to present reports and dashboards
Excellent experience understanding and eliciting requirements from stakeholders and then using these to design technical solutions in a fast paced environment
Knowledge of Salesforce and Salesforce Einstein would be a big plus, as would attribution marketing but not necessary
HOW TO APPLY
If you are interested in this Senior BI Analyst role please apply via this site.

Title: Senior Electro-Mechanical Engineer
Description:
Senior Electro-Mechanical Engineer

At SharkNinja, our purpose is to positively impact people’s lives every day in every home around the world. We work very hard to provide our consumers with high quality, exciting 5-star products that make life easier. We thrive on passion and innovation, and are looking for great people, with great ideas, who want to create the next big thing. We take a team approach to our projects, where everyone has a voice. We want individuals to push limits, look outside the box and think the unthinkable. With the explosive growth we have been experiencing, we’re looking for motivated individuals to join us on our exciting journey. People need to think big, move fast and want to make a significant impact. Are you ready?

Experience
Essential:
Currently (or within the last year) working as a senior Mechanical Engineer or very closely related role
Significant relevant industry experience as a Mechanical Engineer
SolidWorks 3D CAD expertise (or Creo)
Competent with SolidWorks part design and drafting, geometric tolerancing, BoM generation, FEA and hand calcs.
Experience of high-speed rotating assemblies (motors, compressors, turbo-machineries, etc.)
Sound knowledge of conducting thorough thermal and structural analysis.
Direct experience in setting up R&D focus assembly and rigs for experimental investigation.
Direct experience in handling and integrating sensory equipment’s and data acquisitions.
Able to deliver a design from concept to completion.
Desirable:
Electric motor design
Thorough understanding of limits and fits
Automotive industry experience
Understanding of electrical work (for design of PCB outlines/cable routings)
Good drawing skills
Daily Tasks and Responsibilities
Responsible for design and drafting of components and assemblies for manufacture of prototypes
Identification and sourcing of necessary components
Working with both metals and plastics, machined and 3D-printed parts
Liaising with key collaborating partners
Assembly of prototypes
Concept generation, presentation and documentation
Test and validation procedure writing and implementation
Skills/Attributes
Capable of working both alone and as part of a small multi-disciplined team
Thorough, systematic approach with close attention to detail
Enthusiastic with the ability to learn quickly
Flexible and able to priorities tasks
Effective time-management skills
Please note - we are not looking for managerial, project management or team leader/supervisory experience. Please do not apply unless you meet all of the essential criteria as a minimum.
Please communicate your interest in this position with a strong covering letter, CV and any other supporting documentation. Please include details of your current salary/bonus.
SharkNinja Is committed to safeguarding the privacy of individuals. Our Data Privacy Statement outlines how we will process your personal data when you apply for a role at SharkNinja or are engaged in services with one of our entities; https://www.sharkninja.com/employment-privacy-notice/
SharkNinja operates Preferred Supplier (PS) arrangements for all permanent, contract and temporary recruitment across all UK functions. As such, we would ask that agencies refrain from making contact with any of our SharkNinja colleagues and that no CVs are submitted to staff across the Business. Any unsolicited CVs and/or communications will reflect unfavourably on any potential opportunities for your agency. Any CVs will be sent at your own risk and will be interpreted as ‘gifts’ and we will reserve the right to engage with candidates directly having not, in any way, entered into your company’s Terms and Conditions of Contract. If you would like to be considered for Preferred Supplier status, please send a brief introduction to your business to llee@Sharkninja.com, clearly stating in the header of your email your company name and the discipline(s) that you specialise in. Your email will then be kept on file for consideration should we review our incumbent Preferred Suppliers. Thank you for your interest and co-operation.

At SharkNinja, our purpose is to positively impact people’s lives every day in every home around the world. We work very hard to provide our consumers with high quality, exciting 5-star products that make life easier. We thrive on passion and innovation, and are looking for great people, with great ideas, who want to create the next big thing. We take a team approach to our projects, where everyone has a voice. We want individuals to push limits, look outside the box and think the unthinkable. With the explosive growth we have been experiencing, we’re looking for motivated individuals to join us on our exciting journey. People need to think big, move fast and want to make a significant impact. Are you ready?

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
This is an exciting time to join Dentsu Aegis Network (DAN) as we focus on becoming a 100% digital economy business through content, media and commerce. We are well placed to build capability, scale and sustainable growth as a high performance business. Our strategy is driven by our unique culture with one vision (to innovate the way brands are built), one set of values and a unique operating model which drives collaboration, client focus and attention.
Within the Innovation, Engineering and Architecture function at DAN there are a number of ongoing key initiatives that will drive technology strategy, rationalisation and impact;
The Media Ecosystem forms the strategic solution for Dentsu Aegis Network's Client Media Campaign lifecycle and data needs; Globally DAN has thousands of clients, all of whom have a dependency on the availability and subsequent analysis of their marketing and advertising operational data through which DAN delivers demonstrable value. Through Business Intelligence reporting, Analytics, Data Science the clients are informed of the performance of their campaigns and the resulting revenue implications, enabling the client teams to continuously improve the operational effectiveness and efficiency delivered to clients. The Media Ecosystem will be delivered to a highly scalable, robust, cloud agnostic and modular specification, enabling the platform to grow in a manageable and cost effective way with Data Governance and Security forming vital ingredients.
The DAN Software Engineering Blueprint will create a set of standard technology, tools, patterns and practices to drive cloud first, applications / platforms with a fast time to market. It will help to define and kick start associated Software Engineering Centres of Excellence around Technology domains across the Global DAN footprint. Additionally, it will deliver a set of standards, technology and processes to support Data Governance, Security and Policy by design
The Enterprise Data Hub (EDH) is to deliver a number of capabilities; specifically Enterprise Integration, Master Data Management (MDM), Big Data/Data Warehouse, Analytics, Data Science and an Event Driven orchestration mechanism capable of implementing configurable business logic across heterogeneous systems/platforms by region/market/LoB; increasingly we are seeing the negative impact of a fragmented systems architecture and we’ve identified the EDH key enablers to cupport creation of a more streamlined capability supporting more straight through processing. These will also be a critical factor for success for other key programmes, such as our Financial Transformation Programme or our Sales Effectiveness Programme (Salesforce).
Job Title:
Senior Data Engineer
Job Description:
As the Senior Data Engineer you will support the Principal Data Engineer to manage and mentor a software team who will be the core delivery team for big data capabilities in DAN; including both DAN engineers and outsourced partners. You will be a strong advocate for the team and share practices, ideas and successes with other product delivery teams. You will have a deep understanding of and be able to coach and mentor the team in the practicing good software design and development.
We're looking for Engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, and data science/artificial intelligence. We need our Engineers to be versatile, to display leadership qualities and to be enthusiastic in taking on new problems. As the lead of a versatile team, you design, test, deploy and maintain software solutions.
Responsibilities
Support the Principal Data Engineer in looking after a team of Data Engineers (onshore and offshore), who will look to you as a mentor to develop their skills and as a coach to guide them through the software development life cycle
Help with the detailed design of the three major components of Data Engineering; Connector Management, Transformation and Extraction, Data Storage and Query
Identify and implement software engineering best practices in conjunction with your peers, both within Data Engineering and Technology as a whole
Responsibility for ensuring code reviews are conducted to a high standard
Ensure the use of continuous delivery pipelines and tools to fully automate deployment, testing, delivery, and management of development, QA and production systems on a variety of cloud platforms
Troubleshoot our development, test and production environments. Including performance optimization and continuous tuning
Continuous learning and evaluation of the latest development methods, tools, and technologies
Hands on development work, 60/40 hands on/off split
Candidate Profile
Proven experience mentoring Data Engineers
Industry experience working with Bigdata and conventional data platforms
In depth understanding of Bigdata and conventional data technologies and their applications
Proven Data modelling experience using normalised, de-normalised (i.e. Kimball) and hybrid techniques
In depth understanding of the Hadoop ecosystem including security
Proven hands on development experience writing ETL pipelines using Spark and Hive
Test-driven full stack Data Engineer proficient in Python, SQL and UNIX shell scripting
Experience with Java and/or Scala beneficial
Proficient with UNIX/LINUX
Highly experienced in Agile test-driven software development
Passionate about writing well-crafted code and comfortable working in an agile environment
Ability to write high-quality code across modern programming languages and frameworks
Knowledge of microservice architecture
Working experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes is an advantage
Ability to quickly learn and apply emerging programming languages, frameworks, and platforms
Knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery
Knowledge of cloud platforms such as Azure and AWS
Proven experience designing technical Data Architecture
Proven experience in writing technical documentation and creating architectural diagrams
Good communication and collaboration skills
What you’ll get from us
Dentsu Aegis Network is a fantastic place to work with many great benefits on offer including 25 days’ annual holiday, Pension, Cycle to Work Scheme, and get your Birthday day off!
Not only is it an incredibly fun place to work but as part of a multinational organisation there are many opportunities to advance your career within the wider business once you have proven yourself.
About Dentsu Aegis Network (DAN)
DAN is headquartered in London and operates in 145 countries worldwide with more than 45,000 dedicated specialists. Dentsu Aegis Network is Innovating the Way Brands Are Built for its clients through its best-in-class expertise and capabilities in media, digital and creative communications services.
Our values and behaviours:
Agile – Anticipate business needs, continuous process improvement, be flexible whilst maintain high standards
Pioneering – Being constantly curious, be bold in challenging the status quo, support a culture of openness
Ambitious – Strive for excellence, drive hard to achieve, learn from experiences
Responsible – Uphold the highest levels of integrity, lead by example, be courageous in raining concerns
Collaborative – Operate as one finance team locally and globally by sharing best practice and following standard practices and processes
Inclusion & Diversity
We value the strength diversity brings to our business and are working hard to build a more inclusive workplace through partnerships with Stonewall, Business Disability Forum and Business in the Community’s race and gender equality campaigns. We are happy to discuss all flexible and agile approaches to working for all our roles – we can’t promise we will be able to offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly.
If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with the recruiter who contacts you.
Location:
London
Brand:
Global Technology
Time Type:
Full time
Contract Type:
Permanent

Title: Lead Operations Manager
Description:
ABOUT THE TEAM
Revolut does Operations differently. The team sits at the core of Revolut, working with departments across the business to help solve issues and create effective, scalable solutions.
Operations has been responsible for major milestones like launching Premium and building our banking infrastructure, as well as saving millions of pounds for the business.
Working in Operations at Revolut will give you exposure to a range of different verticals, where you will deep dive into the fundamentals of each business area you work on. This gives you breadth and depth of experience unrivalled in almost any other job and offers you the chance to have a huge impact on Revolut’s success.

ABOUT THE ROLE
Lead Operations Managers are hands-on general problem solvers with an ability to take ownership of multiple functions across the organisation and ultimately build teams to achieve great results.
You'll be responsible for:
Building and optimising scalable processes to prepare the company for hyper growth
Leading and executing multiple highly complex core infrastructure projects (end to end)
Strategy: exploring and defining which projects the team should prioritise, and setting a timeline to reach goals quickly
Product improvement: proactively searching for new features to provide a seamless customer experience
Hands on people management: leading a team, setting targets and driving performance
Making critical-business decisions: breaking down complex business cases and backing up reasoning using advanced analysis

WHAT YOU'LL NEED
Graduated with a STEM/Economics/Finance degree and have 7+ years of work experience in a fast-paced environment
A solid track record of achievement, you will have proven experience managing multiple high complexity projects, removing existing and potential roadblocks, and course correcting through automation & process optimisation
You use a highly analytical approach to break down complex problems and thrive on utilising data to facilitate your work using such tools as SQL, Python and Excel
You are curious by nature and passionate in delivering high impact results
The ability to drive business change and effectively influence stakeholders and peers alike

A little about us…When Revolut was founded in 2015, we had a vision to build a sustainable, digital alternative to traditional big banks. Our mission now is to help our customers improve their financial health, empower them to have more control, and promote financial cohesion across the communities in which we operate. Launching into 2020 with 10 million Personal customers and over a quarter of a million Business customers only reinforced our belief in the vast need across the world for better financial services. As our customer base has boomed in the last year, we’ve expanded our team to match that growth. We started 2019 with several hundred employees; we closed it out with 2000.

What we’re looking for…Revolut is being scaled up by people all around the world who share our vision. We’re looking for people who align with our four core values: we Never Settle, we Get It Done because we Think Deeper and we’re Stronger Together. You’re the kind of person who wants to join a community of forward-thinking people, all personally and professionally invested in Revolut’s mission. You thrive in a collaborative space where everyone’s learning from each other, and learning fast. We believe in empowering our Revoluters in their work, giving them autonomy and ownership of what they do. We want everyone at Revolut to own their story and their successes - working with us means you’re not just another cog in the machine.

THE BENEFITS
Competitive salary
Biannual equity bonuses
All the latest tech you need
Skip the commute and work from home once a week
Roll with a free Revolut Metal subscription
Pension plan
Private health insurance
Start the day properly with fresh fruit and cereals
Stay refreshed: get juice, tea, coffee and soft drinks on tap
Rest up with 29 days’ holiday per year

Title: Senior Solution Architect
Description:
Your Role::
As Senior Solution Architect, you will have a cutting edge role on the Architecture team, maintaining an understanding of business needs and developing sustainable and innovative architectures and solutions. You will immerse yourself in our service & business processes, data flows and data models.

Working with key individuals on other teams you will develop an architecture which will support the current and future needs of our rapidly growing business. You will work collaboratively with departments such as Product Management, Engineering, Business Development, and Provisioning to identify opportunities to increase revenues, reduce overhead, and rapidly and continually deliver value to our customers. You will also work to gain executive support for your architecture and regularly interact with stakeholders.

Your Job:

Collaborate and establish a mutually beneficial relationship with multiple business units to gather information about process flows, data flows and data models, to better understand current state as well as challenges and opportunities for improvement
Develop and maintain a systems architecture that will address existing and emergent business needs
Socialize and validate the systems architecture with other business units
Perform requirements analysis to address specific business needs, and develop solution architectures that will best meet these requirements
Provide critical thinking and technical leadership from idea creation through to execution
Lead presentations, to socialize and validate proposed architectures with other business units
Collaborate with technical architects in Engineering to define cohesive solutions
Review technical architectures and detailed designs
Maintain alignment between solution architectures and overall enterprise architecture

About You:
Minimum 5 years of experience in a senior architecture role of similar level of responsibilities
Proven ability to see the big picture and to develop holistic solutions from diverse stakeholder requirements
Proven ability and track record in clearly aligning technical solutions with explicit business objectives
Experience in logically and rationally documenting processes and models using diagrams and presenting findings to various levels of senior management
Strong work ethic and integrity with superior communication skills that allow you to effectively work with a variety of different departments
Strong experience in interacting and collaborating with various levels within an organization
Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to multi-task, prioritize and time-manage
Strong attention to detail
Ability to exercise tact and discretion and to be entrusted with confidential information
Strong problem solving skills and the ability to apply cognitive thinking is a must
Ability and energy to thrive in fast moving, fast growth entrepreneurial environment, have a ‘solution based’ mind set, and be proactive in driving improvements to processes and systems
Experience in one or more of the following areas: distributed systems at scale, consistency models, big data, data lakes / data warehousing / BI, distributed graph databases, time series databases, information retrieval, API management/strategy/infrastructure, asynchronous messaging, security methodologies and technologies, and/or data integrity and reconciliation
About Us::
Global Relay is the leading provider of cloud-based archiving, supervision, eDiscovery, and analytics to the global financial sector. We deliver services to over 23,000 customers in 90 countries, including 22 of the top 25 global banks. Our market-leading archiving service supports over 50 data types, including email, instant messaging, Bloomberg®, Thomson Reuters, social media, and mobile messaging.

We’ve won major awards for our growth, management, and culture – including the Deloitte Fast 50 Leadership Award, Canada’s 10 Most Admired Corporate Cultures, and the Deloitte-sponsored Canada’s Best Managed Companies awards. Our Global Operations & Development Center is located in Vancouver, BC, Canada. In addition, we have offices in seven other cities across the world, including London and other major financial centers like New York and Chicago.
We’ve recently expanded our London operations to better serve our UK and EU customers. Our brand-new, four-story EMEA headquarters at 45 Cannon Street (near St. Paul’s Cathedral) features state-of-the-art amenities, a spectacular view of the city, and a conference centre for customer events. More importantly, it’s the base of Global Relay’s next major technical initiative, and where we will be building our next-generation products. We currently have over 450 employees worldwide, with plans to grow the London office significantly and have a 150-strong team in London by 2020. The Development team in London will work alongside our Business teams, solving complex and exciting business and technical problems.
We provide fantastic opportunities to individuals passionate about business and technology. These opportunities include working alongside members of our senior leadership team, receiving mentoring from seasoned technology and business professionals, and doing business with the world’s largest, most influential banks and enterprise organizations.
To learn more about our business, culture, and community involvement, visit www.globalrelay.com.

Think you’re a great fit for this job? Apply today with your CV and covering letter.

Title: Senior Capital & Reserving Analyst
Description:
Senior Capital & Reserving Analyst
London
Job ref: 200004BS
Closing date: 30/07/2020
for this job
Specialism: Actuarial
Career area: Insurance and financial services
Salary: Salary dependent on experience
Description
We have an exciting opportunity at AXA as a Senior Capital & Reserving Analyst.
Under the responsibility of the Head of Capital and Reserving, you will assist in the development, maintenance, calibration and embedding of risk-adjusted financial models for AXA Insurance. In addition to this you will be providing a second line of defence on all P&C risk activities.
Qualifications
The ideal candidate will:
Typically be a part qualified actuary. Alternatively an actuarial/general insurance professional qualification or demonstrating equivalent insurance knowledge to fulfill key accountabilities for the role
2-3 years insurance risk experience
About AXA
With a presence in over 60 countries, and 165,000 employees serving the needs of 107 million customers, AXA is big.
But never too big to care for every single person who works here. So when you join us, we promise to put our collective might behind you and your career.
You’ll work in an open and supportive environment where you’ll be developed, challenged and encouraged to move around to achieve even bigger and better things – nationally and internationally. You’ll learn directly from senior leaders, from the best in our business. And you’ll enjoy real responsibility, really early on.
Every large company today talks about supporting diversity and inclusion. But at AXA UK, these values form an integral part of everything we do. For us, it’s about bringing together the best talent, helping people to realise their full potential by being 100% themselves at work and delivering outstanding service to everyone – regardless of difference.

We’re proud to be part of the AXA Group, a global insurance brand and a worldwide leader in financial services, providing corporate support services to a whole range of AXA UK businesses. From how we use the latest technology to exploring new channels to market, our impact is far-reaching, wide-ranging and ever-evolving. We actively encourage our people to think differently. Because only by challenging the status quo will we push AXA onto even greater things.

What We Offer
When you join us, you’ll find an open and supportive environment, where everyone is encouraged to be true to themselves. We listen to one another and keep our minds open, so that we can challenge our perspective and grow our understanding. We’re always ready improve our work environment , and we stand up for what we believe in, because we want to make a difference to the lives of our customers everywhere.
Here is also a small selection of our current benefits:
Bonus Scheme linked to yours and the company’s performance
Pension scheme with employer contributions as well as your own
25 days holiday increasing with service plus bank holidays
Interest free season ticket loan scheme
Share Plan Scheme Flexible benefits scheme
Discount on all AXA Insurance products, including insurance, breakdown cover & healthcare

Rewards and Benefits
As well as a supportive and rewarding working culture, you'll enjoy a good holiday allowance and generous company pension scheme. Depending on your role you’ll have the opportunity to buy share options, a car allowance and private medical insurance. Note that benefits can vary according to the different part of AXA and the role itself.
Pay and Bonus
We carefully consider our pay levels and carry out a review each year so you are paid fairly for what you do. When AXA does well, we share in its success and all employees are eligible for a discretionary bonus payment each year, dependant on individual and company performance.
Pension and Life Assurance
We want to help you actively plan for a financially healthy retirement, so we offer a Defined Contribution Pension Scheme. This means that we contribute to your pension fund depending on the amount you choose to pay in.
Holiday
Work life balance is important. Our holiday entitlements start at a minimum of 22 days (plus bank holidays) dependent on the business area or the role, increasing up to 28 days (plus bank holidays) with length of service. Depending on which part of AXA you work in, there’s also flexibility to buy up to five additional days or sell up to three days, helping you to achieve the right balance for you.
Recognition
We recognise and reward you when you demonstrate the behaviours that make AXA great.
Our Stories

Title: Sr. IoT Architect
Description:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
12+ years of experience of IT platform implementation in a highly technical and analytical role.
8+ years of experience in application architecture, database architecture, and networking.
Experience working with external or internal customers to implement large-scale solutions.
Understanding of emerging IoT and Mobile technologies and communications protocols.
Ability to travel to client locations to deliver professional services when needed.

Are you passionate about the intersection of cloud computing, mobile applications, and the Internet-of-Things (IoT)? Do you have the ability to put together unique cutting-edge solutions that bring together IoT/Mobile devices and data? Do you have a unique combination of deep technical knowledge, business acumen and strong interpersonal skills? Amazon Web Services (AWS) is seeking an IoT architect to work with our customers to craft cloud-based IoT solutions.

At AWS, customer obsession is in our DNA. The successful candidate will become a trusted adviser to our customers and will work with AWS sales, business development, solution architects, and our IoT service team to drive mobile-related adoption and revenue. This will include showcasing service such as AWS IoT, Cognito, API Gateway, and Lambda.

Would you like to be part of a team focused on increasing adoption of the AWS platform by engaging with companies and app developers building IoT and Mobile solutions? Do you have the business savvy and the technical background necessary to help further establish AWS as the preferred platform for IoT and Mobile solutions?

Here are some other qualities we are looking for:
Be great fun to work with. At AWS, we have a credo of “Work hard. Have fun. Make history”. In this role, you will love what you do, and instinctively know how to make work fun. You will be dynamic and creative, and willing to take on any challenge and make a big impact.
Enjoy working with customers of all shapes and sizes. You will have a passion for educating, training, designing, and building cloud solutions for a diverse and challenging set of customers ranging from small businesses to large public sector organizations.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Architect end-to-end solutions for our customers using AWS IoT and Mobile Services.
Help develop an overall IoT and Mobile ecosystem engagement strategy.
In partnership with the business development, solution architects and sales team, formulate and execute a strategy to drive adoption of AWS.
Conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions to transfer knowledge to customers considering or already using AWS.
Capture and share best-practice knowledge amongst the AWS community.
Author and contribute to AWS customer-facing publications such as blogs, whitepapers.
Experience developing IoT and Mobile solutions and passion for getting hands dirty with code.
Build deep relationships with senior technical individuals within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates.
Act as a technical liaison between customers, service engineering teams and support.

Masters or PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Engineering or Math.
Intermediate/advanced knowledge of the cloud services, market segments, customer base and industry verticals.
Prior experience in a technical role within a services organization.
Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences.
High level of comfort communicating effectively across internal and external organizations.
Understanding of application, server, and network security and compliance requirements such as FedRAMP and HIPAA.
Demonstrated experience leading or developing high quality, enterprise scale software products using a structured system development life cycle.
Experience in one or more specific IoT / embedded / M2M industry (i.e. home automation, business automation, health, asset tracking, smart utilities, etc.)
Experience with embedded or real-time operating systems, and/or driver/kernel development.
Experience programming applications backed by cloud services.
Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly.

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer – Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

Title: Digital Lead for Healthwatch England
Description:
Grade C - £30,022 (National Framework - homebased) or £34,918 (London Framework – if you are London office based or homebased and live within the boundary of the M25)
Contracted Hours: Full time 37 hours per week
Contract Type: Permanent
Location: London Office* or Homebased
Closing date: Sunday 26th July 2020 at 11.59pm
In line with the Care Quality Commission estates strategy, we are planning to move our London office from 151 Buckingham Palace Road to 2 Redman Place, Stratford, East London in late 2020.

About Us
We are the independent champion for people who use health and social care services. We aim to help improve the quality of services by letting the government and those running services know what people want from care.

We also support a network of 150 local Healthwatch services to reach out to every section of the community and encourage more people to speak up.

Together, our work is resulting in big and small changes that are helping to make care better.

Let us tell you a little bit about the role....
As our Digital Lead, you’ll work as part of team responsible for helping local Healthwatch services use the digital systems we provide to drive engagement with the public and professionals.

You will focus on helping local services to adopt and use our standard website. As well as training staff to use the site and being the first point of contact for queries, you’ll also support services to plan their content migration and then test and launch their sites.

You’ll also work with the digital and communication teams to plan, execute and support other digital services and developments.

What we're looking for from you...
We want someone with a track record of supporting the development and roll out of digital systems, as well as experience of providing training, support and advice to system users.

Ideally, you’ll also have first class project management skills, be used to working in an agile way and bring with you an understanding of how UX and UI can be used to improve digital systems
Accountabilities:
The main functions the post holder will undertake are:
. Managing the delivery of the Healthwatch digital systems to the Healthwatch network including managing the suppliers who host and maintain our systems on a day to day basis.
. Ensuring patches, fixes, system tests and upgrades are applied to ensure our digital systems are robust, comply with data security and information governance protocols, and provides Healthwatch England with live information about the issues the public are sharing with local Healthwatch.
. Systematic investigative research and fact finding to identify areas for improvement and development to Healthwatch digital systems. Managing development and improvement projects in accordance with need.
. Identifying and implementing solutions to resolve issues, managing divergent or conflicting views between users and suppliers.
. Developing and building reporting processes on how the digital systems are being used and how our support services are operating
. Identifying training needs and delivering training to local Healthwatch using HWE digital systems (both face-to-face and distance-based support) to ensure effective and secure management.
. Overseeing the adoption of the HWE website by new users and developing new resources as required.
. Providing briefings on upgrades and the operational status of our digital systems to the Healthwatch England management team, ensuring good engagement and communication with local Healthwatch through the provision of advice and support to digital users in a timely manner.
. Working in the Digital team and closely with the Communications team to manage budgets for hosting, maintenance and training as well as the support budget for solving system glitches.
. Implementing information management policies, ensuring compliance with information security requirements and standards.
. Procuring and managing suppliers in line with organisational policies, managing relationships with technical specialist developers, and negotiating with third party suppliers.
. Supporting the development and delivery of our wider digital systems.
Essential Skills and Experience:
. Functional and technical understanding of web-based platforms and development. Including:
Experience of successfully supporting the launch of websites, content management and user testing.
Experience of effectively using systems to create, edit and publish digital content.
. Experience of database management, development and support.
. Experience of providing specialist advice and training to people with varied skills help maintain cloud-based digital systems and troubleshooting technical issues.
. Experience of reviewing, developing and documenting technical solutions and processes for digital system maintenance to meet business needs and managing and procuring day to day support from a third party.
. Ability to identify and produce analytical reports to communicate issues, risks and trends about digital systems.
. Ability to make quick decisions, proposing a range of solutions that meet needs of different stakeholders in the short and longer term.
. Ability to work autonomously but with support from senior or specialist colleagues on specific areas.
. Ability to take responsibility and to deliver on time with excellent project management skills.
. Experience of implementing information management policies and ensuring web-based compliance with information security requirements and standards.
. Experience of team management, both leading a team and working as part of a team with excellent people skills.
. Well organised, self-motivated and with good attention to detail, ability to respond constructively to feedback, listen carefully and present his/her self professionally.
. Strong interpersonal skills, experience of managing relationships and negotiating with third party suppliers and persuading stakeholders.
. A personal commitment to the mission and values of Healthwatch England.

Desirable:
. Knowledge and experience of managing a Drupal CMS.
. Knowledge and experience of CiviCRM

For further information about the role and job description, please visit www.healthwatch.co.uk/jobs (Healthwatch England website)

Healthwatch England Vision, Purpose and Approach

Our vision: Health and care that works for you
Our purpose: To find out what matters to you and help make sure your views shape the support you need
Our approach: People’s views come first – especially those who find it hardest to be heard. We champion what matters to you and work with others to find ideas that work. We are independent and committed to making the biggest difference to you.

To enable this to happen, it’s important that everyone understands the approach we will take to our work and what they can expect from us.
People’s views are at the heart of everything we do
We work creatively to ensure people from every community have their say about health and care
We speak clearly so that people can understand and act on our evidence
We achieve positive change by working in partnership with others; and
We are independent and are prepared to challenge services.

Our Values

Excellence – Meeting our challenge to be a high-performing organisation
Caring – Treating everyone with dignity and respect
Integrity – Demonstrating our passion for ‘doing the right thing’
Teamwork – Enabling us to be the best we can

Title: Lead Scientist
Description:
Today Lonza is a global leader in life sciences. We are more than 15,000 employees in more than 100 locations around the world. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.
The purpose of this position is to provide scientific leadership on projects including but not limited to standard monoclonal antibody purification process, purification, process transfers (from Customer or between Lonza sites), recombinant purification process development, Downstream process characterisation and process validation studies to support License Applications. You will be required to proactively identify opportunities for process improvement and lead specific improvement projects. You will represent Purification Development at project team and Customer meetings and take an active role in the generation of Proposals for new and existing Customers.
Key responsibilities:
Application of regulatory guidelines to experimental design
Design and execution of standard and non-standard mAb Evaluations
Design and lead bespoke and complex stages or projects
Responsible for execution of Laboratory work for own project or to support others
Competently plan and direct the work of others
Coach, mentor and train more junior members of department as required
Study Director for Process Characterisation Studies and Validation Studies
SME for regulatory inspections
Established as SME in particular area
Competently lead and be accountable for the delivery of multiple projects (focusing on safety, quality, right first time, on time delivery) and additional responsibilities to agreed timelines including creation and completion of project dashboards
Collate, analyse and evaluate data from work / study programs and offer advice when required
Write, review and critique reports to an agreed standard suitable for final review by Head of Department
Prepare and deliver presentations, protocols and reports with right first time quality
Engage with Customers to demonstrate Lonza’s scientific credibility and grow relationships
Escalate risks and issues in a timely fashion (technical, resource, Customer, cost)
Lead problem solving / trouble shooting / lessons learned activities
Primary technical contact for Customers for ongoing projects and Develop Customer relationships Engage with Customers to demonstrate Lonza’s scientific credibility and grow relationships
Role model for communication, best practise and behaviour within Process Development
Input into Customer proposals (technical content and man days)
Identify opportunities and pproactively input into departmental and process improvements and lead specific improvement projects and investigations
Proactive approach to own continuous professional development
Conduct Customer Laboratory Tours
Represent Lonza externally
Demonstrate flexibility to support other activities within the team/department
On call rota
System maintenance / System owner
Deviation writing
Raise and Lead equipment Change control
Execute allocated duties consistent with cGMP and EHS policies and standards
Maintain required training and skills to execute duties
Contribute to departmental training
Demonstrates a high level of independence
Manage and prioritise multiple tasks
Key requirements:
Phd or BSc in relevant scientific / technical discipline and appropriate experience
In depth knowledge of all relevant service offerings
The ability to assimilate complex information and draw insightful conclusions
Established credibility within the Lonza network or broader scientific network
Keen appreciation of commercial requirements
Ability to set clear direction and goal
An excellent understanding of the theory and practice of protein purification and protein structure is required
In depth theoretical knowledge and practical experience in downstream processing e.g; AKTA Chromatography systems, Ultra-filtration, high throughput resin screening etc
Experience in purification of recombinant proteins (including but not limited to monoclonal antibodies)
Some knowledge of GLP/GMP or similar quality systems
An awareness of technology transfer of processes from laboratory scale to manufacturing plants.
Process Validation experience in line with current regulatory guidelines
Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.
People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
This is an exciting time to join Dentsu Aegis Network (DAN) as we focus on becoming a 100% digital economy business through content, media and commerce. We are well placed to build capability, scale and sustainable growth as a high performance business. Our strategy is driven by our unique culture with one vision (to innovate the way brands are built), one set of values and a unique operating model which drives collaboration, client focus and attention.
Within the Innovation, Engineering and Architecture function at DAN there are a number of ongoing key initiatives that will drive technology strategy, rationalisation and impact;
The Media Ecosystem forms the strategic solution for Dentsu Aegis Network's Client Media Campaign lifecycle and data needs; Globally DAN has thousands of clients, all of whom have a dependency on the availability and subsequent analysis of their marketing and advertising operational data through which DAN delivers demonstrable value. Through Business Intelligence reporting, Analytics, Data Science the clients are informed of the performance of their campaigns and the resulting revenue implications, enabling the client teams to continuously improve the operational effectiveness and efficiency delivered to clients. The Media Ecosystem will be delivered to a highly scalable, robust, cloud agnostic and modular specification, enabling the platform to grow in a manageable and cost effective way with Data Governance and Security forming vital ingredients.
The DAN Software Engineering Blueprint will create a set of standard technology, tools, patterns and practices to drive cloud first, applications / platforms with a fast time to market. It will help to define and kick start associated Software Engineering Centres of Excellence around Technology domains across the Global DAN footprint. Additionally, it will deliver a set of standards, technology and processes to support Data Governance, Security and Policy by design
The Enterprise Data Hub (EDH) is to deliver a number of capabilities; specifically Enterprise Integration, Master Data Management (MDM), Big Data/Data Warehouse, Analytics, Data Science and an Event Driven orchestration mechanism capable of implementing configurable business logic across heterogeneous systems/platforms by region/market/LoB; increasingly we are seeing the negative impact of a fragmented systems architecture and we’ve identified the EDH key enablers to cupport creation of a more streamlined capability supporting more straight through processing. These will also be a critical factor for success for other key programmes, such as our Financial Transformation Programme or our Sales Effectiveness Programme (Salesforce).
Job Title:
Senior Data Engineer
Job Description:
As the Senior Data Engineer you will support the Principal Data Engineer to manage and mentor a software team who will be the core delivery team for big data capabilities in DAN; including both DAN engineers and outsourced partners. You will be a strong advocate for the team and share practices, ideas and successes with other product delivery teams. You will have a deep understanding of and be able to coach and mentor the team in the practicing good software design and development.
We're looking for Engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including information retrieval, distributed computing, large-scale system design, networking and data storage, security, and data science/artificial intelligence. We need our Engineers to be versatile, to display leadership qualities and to be enthusiastic in taking on new problems. As the lead of a versatile team, you design, test, deploy and maintain software solutions.
Responsibilities
Support the Principal Data Engineer in looking after a team of Data Engineers (onshore and offshore), who will look to you as a mentor to develop their skills and as a coach to guide them through the software development life cycle
Help with the detailed design of the three major components of Data Engineering; Connector Management, Transformation and Extraction, Data Storage and Query
Identify and implement software engineering best practices in conjunction with your peers, both within Data Engineering and Technology as a whole
Responsibility for ensuring code reviews are conducted to a high standard
Ensure the use of continuous delivery pipelines and tools to fully automate deployment, testing, delivery, and management of development, QA and production systems on a variety of cloud platforms
Troubleshoot our development, test and production environments. Including performance optimization and continuous tuning
Continuous learning and evaluation of the latest development methods, tools, and technologies
Hands on development work, 60/40 hands on/off split
Candidate Profile
Proven experience mentoring Data Engineers
Industry experience working with Bigdata and conventional data platforms
In depth understanding of Bigdata and conventional data technologies and their applications
Proven Data modelling experience using normalised, de-normalised (i.e. Kimball) and hybrid techniques
In depth understanding of the Hadoop ecosystem including security
Proven hands on development experience writing ETL pipelines using Spark and Hive
Test-driven full stack Data Engineer proficient in Python, SQL and UNIX shell scripting
Experience with Java and/or Scala beneficial
Proficient with UNIX/LINUX
Highly experienced in Agile test-driven software development
Passionate about writing well-crafted code and comfortable working in an agile environment
Ability to write high-quality code across modern programming languages and frameworks
Knowledge of microservice architecture
Working experience with Docker and/or Kubernetes is an advantage
Ability to quickly learn and apply emerging programming languages, frameworks, and platforms
Knowledge of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery
Knowledge of cloud platforms such as Azure and AWS
Proven experience designing technical Data Architecture
Proven experience in writing technical documentation and creating architectural diagrams
Good communication and collaboration skills
What you’ll get from us
Dentsu Aegis Network is a fantastic place to work with many great benefits on offer including 25 days’ annual holiday, Pension, Cycle to Work Scheme, and get your Birthday day off!
Not only is it an incredibly fun place to work but as part of a multinational organisation there are many opportunities to advance your career within the wider business once you have proven yourself.
About Dentsu Aegis Network (DAN)
DAN is headquartered in London and operates in 145 countries worldwide with more than 45,000 dedicated specialists. Dentsu Aegis Network is Innovating the Way Brands Are Built for its clients through its best-in-class expertise and capabilities in media, digital and creative communications services.
Our values and behaviours:
Agile – Anticipate business needs, continuous process improvement, be flexible whilst maintain high standards
Pioneering – Being constantly curious, be bold in challenging the status quo, support a culture of openness
Ambitious – Strive for excellence, drive hard to achieve, learn from experiences
Responsible – Uphold the highest levels of integrity, lead by example, be courageous in raining concerns
Collaborative – Operate as one finance team locally and globally by sharing best practice and following standard practices and processes
Inclusion & Diversity
We value the strength diversity brings to our business and are working hard to build a more inclusive workplace through partnerships with Stonewall, Business Disability Forum and Business in the Community’s race and gender equality campaigns. We are happy to discuss all flexible and agile approaches to working for all our roles – we can’t promise we will be able to offer you everything you want or need but we do promise to discuss it with you openly and honestly.
If you have any reasonable adjustment needs arising from a disability or medical condition to fully participate in the recruitment process, please discuss this with the recruiter who contacts you.
Location:
London
Brand:
Global Technology
Time Type:
Full time
Contract Type:
Permanent

Title: Senior Pricing Analyst (Retail)
Description:
Senior Pricing Analyst (Retail)
London | Ipswich
Job ref: 20000390
Closing date: 30/07/2020
for this job
Specialism: Actuarial
Career area: Insurance and financial services
Salary: Salary depending on experience
Description
Axa Retail is currently recruiting a Senior Pricing Analyst to join the Personal Lines team.
As a Senior Pricing Analyst, we are looking for candidates who have experience working within this type of role from either an insurance, consultancy or banking environment.
You will understand that one of the key determinants of profit and growth for all personal lines accounts is Market Pricing which is underpinned by sound analysis and management of risk. You will demonstrate strong communication and influencing skills as well as implement new and innovative techniques while maintaining the pragmatism to keep delivery on track.
The role will include spending time with Claims and Senior Managers, by simplifying processes and complex ideas, having the ability to talk to our customers so they in turn find such ideas easy to understand.
Key responsibilities:-
Conduct analysis and communications to peers and team managers in a timely manner where you have discovered price, model or data issues and suggest appropriate remedial actions
Ensure rate change proposals, analysis and MI reports are of a sufficient quality and in line with pricing strategy
Work closely with wider Pricing and Underwriting teams to deliver upon pricing projects and new initiatives
Qualifications
Skills and Experience:-
Experience of working with personal lines products from a pricing perspective
Understanding of appropriate statistical techniques to build the pricing models
Excellent programming skills (SAS, VBA, Python, R)
Excellent mathematical skills. At least a 2:1 degree in a mathematics related discipline or evidence of equivalent proficiency
Ability to grasp the significance and meaning of a range of technical and complex issues
Ability to work under pressure and to tight deadlines
Good presentation, influencing and persuasiveness skills.
About AXA
With a presence in over 60 countries, and 165,000 employees serving the needs of 107 million customers, AXA is big.
But never too big to care for every single person who works here. So when you join us, we promise to put our collective might behind you and your career.

Proud to be part of the AXA Group, a global insurance brand and a worldwide leader in financial services, AXA Insurance businesses employ over 5,500 in a network of offices across the UK. Our expert teams care for a huge range of customers, helping them protect their cars, homes and businesses against life’s uncertainties. Whether bought directly, through brokers or through a number of corporate partners, our market-leading products are trusted by millions.

What We Offer
At AXA we strive to enable the personal development of our people in a supportive environment. We will offer you a variety of resources and development programs to develop and enhance your existing skills and the opportunity to take your career to new levels of success.
As you’d expect from a global leader, our reward package is a world beater: here’s a small selection of our current benefits: -
Competitive salary with annual bonus.
25 days annual leave rising with service to 28 days (with option to buy or sell holiday).
Joint contribution (money purchase) pension scheme.
Free life assurance (10 x basic salary).
Flexible working hours with a focus on work/life balance.
Flexible benefit options, including pension and life cover flexing, holiday purchase, childcare vouchers, health, dental and critical illness plans and bikes4work.
AXA Insurance product discounts.
Structured personal development with comprehensive training and talent programmes.
How to highlight your transferable skills during the application process

As well as a supportive and rewarding working culture, you'll enjoy a good holiday allowance and generous company pension scheme. Depending on your role you’ll have the opportunity to buy share options, a car allowance and private medical insurance. Note that benefits can vary according to the different part of AXA and the role itself.
