Title: Senior Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Who we are
We are digital healthcare in the palm of your hand. We are clinical excellence in just a few taps. We are doctors, designers and data analysts. Software developers, managers and marketers. And we’re changing the GP experience – forever.

No more waiting for appointments. No more waiting rooms. With Doctor Care Anywhere, you speak to a doctor when it suits you, by video or phone call from anywhere.
But this is just the beginning.

We have ambitious goals and need ambitious people to reach them. If you’re talented, hard-working and make a habit out of dreaming big, we’d like to hear from you.

The role
We are seeking an experienced Senior Business Intelligence Developer to work within the Data team in order to expand and visualise our data, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for utilisation within the wider business.

Key tasks:
Examine complex data and turn the data into information and insights
Develop Power BI models used for the different departments’ reporting
Design and document the entire Architecture of Power BI
Expertise in writing complex DAX functions in Power BI and Power Pivot
Automate Power Query refresh using Power Shell scripts and windows task scheduler
Use various sources to pull data into Power BI such as SQL Server, Dynamics 365, SQL Azure, etc
Install and configure Enterprise Gateway and Personal Gateway in Power BI Service
Create Workspace and Content Packs for business users to view the developed reports
Schedule Automatic Refresh and Scheduling Refresh in Power BI Service
Write Calculated Columns, Measures Queries in Power BI Desktop to show good data analysis techniques
Create stored procedures and SQL queries to pull data into Power Pivot Model
Extensively use Joins and Sub-Queries to simplify complex queries involving multiple tables
Transform complex business logic into Database design and maintain it by using SQL objects like Stored Procedures, User Defined Functions, Views, T-SQL Scripting and Jobs.
Create and Modify Tables, Stored Procedures, Views, Indexes, User-defined Functions, and Triggers as required.
Develop Excel Power View, Power Query and Power Pivot dashboards for data analysis
Perform Index analysis for tables and come up with more efficient solutions to use Clustered and Non-Clustered Indexes for significant performance boost using index tuning wizard
Filter bad data using Derived column, Lookups, Fuzzy Lookups, Conditional split
Create Reports using Charts, Gauges, Tables, Matrix
Create Parameterized Report, Dashboard Report, Linked report and Sub Report by Year, Quarter, Month, and Week
Create Drill Down Reports, Drill Through Report for multiple dimensions
Build and interrogate ETL and ELT processes to maintain data quality
Build data loading services for the purpose of importing data from numerous, disparate data sources, inclusive of APIs, logs, relational, and non-relational databases
Keep track of industry best practices and trends, and through acquired knowledge, take advantage of process and system improvement opportunities

Who fits the role
Database design, interrogation & programming skills (relational database, advance select queries, indexes and constraints).
Writes advanced SQL including some query tuning.
Expert in creating and developing Power BI Dashboards in to rich look
Good understanding on the data warehouse concepts.
Expertise in OLAP and OLAP Cubes
Experience in ad-hoc reports, data driven subscription reports
Experience in developing Dashboard Report, Parameterized Reports, Linked reports, Sub reports by Region, Year, Quarter, Month and Week
Developed U-SQL scripts for processing massive amounts of data in a very familiar environment which is mainly used for Azure Data Lake Analytics
Worked on creating Azure Data Factory for moving and transforming the data
Worked with Azure Data Lake Store to capture data of any size, type, and ingestion speed in one single place for different operations
Experience designing and building complete Extract & Loading processes using ADF & Extract, Transformation & Loading processes using SSIS
Previously worked with a large data sets
Excellent problem solver able to analyse data, identify issues/opportunities, design and implement pragmatic solutions.
Proven abilities to be pro-active, take initiative and be innovative within a team environment
Analytical mind within a problem-solving attitude with a keen eye for detail
Able to work on several projects at the same time and prioritise effectively
Software experience
Must have
SSIS, AAS, DevOps, Advanced Excel, Microsoft Dynamics, Microsoft Azure SQL Server, Power BI, Tableau or similar BI tools, SSRS, SSAS, Azure Data Warehouse environment, Power apps, Git hub. Jira – Confluence

What we offer you (amongst other role specific benefits):
Competitive salary
25 days holiday per full time FTE
4 'Care in the Community' days per year
Free Private Medical Insurance
Doctor Care Anywhere subscription for employees and family
Cycle to Work Scheme
A supportive and approachable management team
Informal office environment
Pool table, PlayStation and SingStar
Weekly fruit deliveries/Nespresso Machine
Digital health market set for rapid growth over the next 5 years
Business to grow massively within the next 12 months, offering multiple career opportunities
Talented, welcoming and social team

Title: Senior Research Manager
Description:
About the Role
We are looking to recruit a dynamic and experienced Senior Research Manager to lead delivery of a high profile NIHR research portfolio covering areas of experimental medicine and applied health research. These funding schemes drive the delivery of world-leading clinical research, translating research breakthroughs into new life-saving treatments for patients, driving technical innovation, and supporting the UK’s international competitiveness in clinical research. The following links provide information on some of the clinical infrastructure schemes funded through NIHR.
https://www.nihr.ac.uk/explore-nihr/support/experimental-medicine.htm
https://www.nihr.ac.uk/explore-nihr/support/collaborating-in-applied-health-research.htm
https://www.nihr.ac.uk/explore-nihr/support/research-design-service.htm
https://www.nihr.ac.uk/explore-nihr/academy-programmes/senior-investigators.htm

About NIHR
The National Institute for Health Research (NIHR) is a large, multi-faceted and nationally distributed organisation funded through the Department of Health and Social Care. Together, NIHR people, facilities and systems represent the most integrated clinical research system in the world, driving research from bench to bedside for the benefit of patients and the economy.

About the LGC
LGC is an international life sciences company working with customers in the government, academic, pharmaceutical, agricultural biotechnology, food, environment, security and sports sectors to achieve excellence in investigative, diagnostic and measurement science. LGC’s Grant Management Group (GMG) holds the contract to deliver the NIHR Central Commissioning Facility for the Department of Health and Social Care, and are experts in managing research funding to maximise its impact.
Job Purpose:
Reporting to the Programme Lead, and working closely with the Department for Health and Social Care, and key liaison point for the post holder will manage activities including:
leading the end-to-end delivery of funding calls (commissioning; from scope to contract) for infrastructure funding schemes for NIHR e.g. in areas such as Biomedical Research, Patient Safety and Applied Health,
relationship building with Directors, managers and associated networks to develop effective communication and trusted relationships with the community,
working with stakeholders to support development of a forward-looking agenda and workplan relevant to the research and health policy landscape, and
developing and delivering appropriate monitoring and impact activities.
You will have significant experience of leading a portfolio or ‘patch’ within a research funding environment (public, charity or private), the NHS or university research management environment, or working within industry. You will also bring experience of strategic leadership of complex programmes, knowledge of the UK’s research environment and political agenda, and honed skills in stakeholder management.
Key Accountabilities:
Development of new funding calls: Support the strategic specification of new funding calls (commissioning), assessment approaches and monitoring requirements.
Recommend new strategic directions: This will involve performing or supporting mid-scheme evidence reviews or evaluation of current competitions (scope, process, monitoring, impact) to shape the next funding call.
Stakeholder engagement: Developing an outward facing strategy and plan to support schemes in order to raise the visibility of the awards within academic, clinical, public and government fora.
Support monitoring and annual reporting approaches: Support the review of current processes and the development of a ‘fit-for-purpose’ approach to annual reporting and monitoring taking into account the need to provide both adequate assurance and up-to-date evidence of progress and impacts.
Flexible support to the team: flexible team player happy to provide support on additional tasks across the team during busy times.
Line Management:
The team works using a matrix model and initially the post will have no formal line management responsibilities.
Qualifications
Required Knowledge, Experience and Technical Skills:
Required Criteria:
A PhD degree (or equivalent) in biomedical or health sciences research
Current knowledge of the UK’s health and care research and policy landscape
A minimum of 4-5 years’ experience of working in at least one of the following:
Major research funding/management environment
Research management within the NHS or HEIs or clinical trial/study coordination
Working within pharma/biotech
Experience in stakeholder management within and across multiple organisations
Evidence of management of high profile projects and programmes
Strategic thinker able to interpret complex information while having a clear view of the “big picture”
Evidence of writing high level strategy documents and papers for senior committees
Sound data analysis skills (comfortable developing spreadsheets, manipulating and analysing data).
Excellent planning and organisational skills, able to prioritise and manage multiple tasks, working to challenging targets and deadlines
Committed team player with an ability to build effective working relationships
Desirable Criteria:
Some experience of mentoring, supervising or staff development.
Flexibility:
This post is advertised at 1.0 FTE and LGC will look to accommodate suitable requests for flexible approaches to working hours.

Title: Senior Credit Modeller
Description:
ABOUT THE TEAM
The credit department at Revolut designs, develops and launches credit products across multiple countries.
As we do this from scratch we have complete responsibility for each product: developing the backend, the front-end, the data science infrastructure, and then creating a local setup in each country with scalable risk management and portfolio management solutions.
The team is made up of a mix of risk management, product, design and software professionals, providing lots of opportunity to share knowledge and learnings across functions.

WHAT WE NEED
Revolut's Credit Modellers are a specialised data-science & analytics team that sit in the front-office to provide analytical insights to drive business decisions and to build best in class predictive models for in country credit risk.

They have strong backgrounds in applied mathematics and computer science, taking advantage of Revolut's elite technology platform to revolutionise the world of finance.

WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING
We're hiring the world's best data scientists to utilise sophisticated methodologies (including Machine Learning) to optimise data-derived strategies that support our product launches and shape Revolut's retail lending strategy.
You'll collaborate with product owners and engineers to improve Revolut's data infrastructure
Help design scalable production level models for retail products and procedures to ensure continuous performance of products in country
Constantly review and suggest opportunities to enhance our underwriting models through the use of existing and alternative data sets
Provide support in customising models for country specific requirements and product launches
Deliver enhanced insight and analytics to ensure best in class predictive models for scoring, pricing and targeting

WHAT YOU’LL NEED
Master’s/PhD in a STEM subject (Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Economics)
Proficiency in developing production level models for retail risk management
Familiarity with retail credit products and the underwriting process
Hyper-logical thinking: - Using systematic approaches to diagnose problems and engineer new solutions.
Databases: SQL {Exasol, PostgreSQL, BigQuery}, NoSQL {DataStore, CouchDB, Redis}
Production: Docker, K8s, Multi-threading
A little about us…When Revolut was founded in 2015, we had a vision to build a sustainable, digital alternative to traditional big banks. Our mission now is to help our customers improve their financial health, empower them to have more control, and promote financial cohesion across the communities in which we operate. Launching into 2020 with 10 million Personal customers and over a quarter of a million Business customers only reinforced our belief in the vast need across the world for better financial services. As our customer base has boomed in the last year, we’ve expanded our team to match that growth. We started 2019 with several hundred employees; we closed it out with 2000.

What we’re looking for…Revolut is being scaled up by people all around the world who share our vision. We’re looking for people who align with our four core values: we Never Settle, we Get It Done because we Think Deeper and we’re Stronger Together. You’re the kind of person who wants to join a community of forward-thinking people, all personally and professionally invested in Revolut’s mission. You thrive in a collaborative space where everyone’s learning from each other, and learning fast. We believe in empowering our Revoluters in their work, giving them autonomy and ownership of what they do. We want everyone at Revolut to own their story and their successes - working with us means you’re not just another cog in the machine.

THE BENEFITS
Competitive salary
Biannual equity bonuses
All the latest tech you need
Skip the commute and work from home once a week
Roll with a free Revolut Metal subscription
Pension plan
Private health insurance
Start the day properly with fresh fruit and cereals
Stay refreshed: get juice, tea, coffee and soft drinks on tap
Rest up with 29 days’ holiday per year

Title: Senior Business Solutions Strategist, NEMEA Staines, Surrey
Description:
Business Solution Strategist, NEMEA (UK)
Are you passionate about building customer relationships and looking for a role where you can make an exciting business impact? The VMware Advisory Team is an EMEA organisation investing in our strategic account base to develop and demonstrate client transformation strategies aligned to their business goals that is actionable, fundable, and measurable.
The Business Solutions Strategist (BSS) is a senior level individual who will work closely with our sales teams and other Advisory Services program roles to drive enterprise customer advisory services. We have ownership for growing revenue and strategic solutions within our most strategic VMware customers by supporting account and services sales teams in the VMware sales process.
We collaborate with the VMware account teams to devise a business technology strategy for selected customers, inclusive of business alignment (the WHY), future state definition and measurements (the WHAT) and transformation execution (the HOW).
As a BSS you need to demonstrate proficiency in all VMware solutions and be able to influence customer opportunities leading to revenue increase and customer growth. Using a structured engagement framework, you will identify the future state of a customer’s business, determine a desired future state, and develop/agree a customer roadmap. You will define the business requirements, solutions strategy and future digital transformation plan (including value modelling and business cases). The EMEA Advisory team is passionate about creating and growing >$10m engagements across the spectrum of VMware solutions. Therefore, you will be practised in operating at C-Level to become a trusted advisor to the client.
In addition to sales and scope management expertise, you will need knowledge surrounding Application Transformation and Modernisation, Multi-cloud, Cyber Security, End-User Compute and Modernised Data Centre Practices, with demonstration of business technology justification and industry trends. Using this experience and knowledge of VMware’s solutions, you will advise clients on issues related to the digital transformation strategy and complexity trade-offs of technical and business transformation impact. Strong knowledge and experience in Application Transformation would be of particular interest.
Experience of Change Management, and Transformation of the full complement of People, Process and Technology is essential to crafting a series of advisory services work streams and work packages to define the customer’s long-term IT strategy. You will run customer discovery, business imperative, executive playback and value realization workshops using the Advisory Services Engagement Framework, building replicable collateral and best-practices.
ADVISORY Engagement Framework:
Discovery and Business Landscape workshops (Discovering, Developing and Demonstrating value)
Customer strategy and Transformation planning
Business IT Alignment (As-Is / To-Be)
Business Technology workshops
Benefit Dependency Networks
Strategy and Roadmap creation
Value Modelling
Business Case development and demonstration
Exploring Future Technology/Industry Technology trends and analysis
ADVISORY BSS Responsibilities:
You will work with account teams on the most strategic customer accounts for VMware by developing an Advisory Services Engagement Framework to influence and grow the size of large deals
Build, maintain and enhance the Engagement Frameworks within accounts demonstrating growth of customer opportunity
Define, develop and implement elements of the Advisory Services Catalogue and consulting insights to grow potential value of VMware solutions inside the account plans with account teams
Effectively communicate fact-based solutions strategy to the customer, third parties and the project teams
Participate in the sales and pre-sales process to understand and influence customer business technology objectives and requirements
Ensure that propositions are representative of the customer technology strategy, are tangible, that they are deliverable, competitive and representative of market leadership in the application of technology to addressing business issues
Build and maintain C-level relationships with strategic accounts
Reporting on Advisory Services activity which is influencing customer opportunities and is aligned to the VMware selling process within assigned territory
Ensure effective client engagement and stakeholder management during an Advisory Engagement Framework
Drive business development to support pre-sales activities, with a focus on identifying, scoping and proposing services engagements
Participate in regional marketing events to promote VMware
Develop new business opportunities on focused accounts
Adhere to VMware sales process and methodologies on all opportunity pursuits and support the creation of relative contribution for Advisory in EMEA
Maintain proficiency in VMware service offerings, value propositions, and representative case studies
Requirements:
Business development experience in a management consulting or ‘big 4’ consulting environment to an executive level
Business solutions experience in a consulting environment, including time supporting sales and managing technical staff and customer transformation strategies
Demonstrable techniques in developing customer relationships at C-Level including building trusted advisor status
Experience in a consultancy lead role for teams including virtual teams and Subject Matter Experiences
Presentation, executive client management and business development skills
Ideally possess experience in several industry verticals (Telco, Financial Services, Healthcare, etc.
Candidates need to be located in the UK.

Category : Sales
Subcategory: Business Development
Experience: Business Leadership
Full Time/ Part Time: Full Time
Posted Date: 2020-07-16

VMware Company Overview: At VMware, we believe that software has the power to unlock new opportunities for people and our planet. We look beyond the barriers of compromise to engineer new ways to make technologies work together seamlessly. Our cloud, mobility, and security software form a flexible, consistent digital foundation for securely delivering the apps, services and experiences that are transforming business innovation around the globe. At the core of what we do are our people who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Shape what’s possible today at http://careers.vmware.com.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement: VMware is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Prohibits Discrimination and Harassment of Any Kind: VMware is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at VMware are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, family medical history or genetic information, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. VMware will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. VMware encourages applicants of all ages. Vmware will provide reasonable accommodation to employees who have protected disabilities consistent with local law.

Title: Senior Credit Manager, Credit Risk
Description:
About Us
We want to help small businesses win. That’s why we’re here.
We connect small business owners to investors – to create jobs, help families and power economies – because we believe that people are made to do more. And we want to help them.
So, we created the leading online marketplace for small business loans. Our investors have lent £8.1 billion in 110,000 loans to 77,000 small business owners. In a single year , we unlocked 115,000 jobs and contributed £6.5 billion to the global economy. There’s never been a better time to join!
Be part of the team that changes everything. Let’s build the place where small businesses can get the funding they need to win and leave a legacy behind, forever.
About the team
Funding Circle’s Credit Risk team is hugely influential to our overall lending process. They look at measuring our risk, optimising our credit risk funnel and forecasting the performance of our loan portfolios. To do this, they work globally with the credit risk modelling, engineering, data management, capital markets and business operations teams to truly understand our objectives and shape analytical solutions.
As a Senior Credit Manager you will...
Deliver value for Investors and Funding Circle through optimization of the credit lifecycle management:
Shape and lead thinking on lending, collection and recovery strategies
In partnership with the Operational Teams and with attention to efficiency and quality, implement, monitor and measure the success of those strategies
Work the linkage between operational execution and investor’s value. Deliver plans and the underlying operational targets to achieve them.
Think up new credit strategies and support in shaping them analytically with attention to details. Measure impacts and be open to iterate.
Be an excellent communicator and presenter. Turn complex analysis into simply articulated visions / insights.
Conduct rigorous statistical analysis, forecasting and data mining of various datasets to shape and guide decision-making across a number of strategic areas
Identify, develop and maintain key relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Have a clear and relentless focus on delivering business results
Be comfortable challenging the status quo
About You
A great communicator! A real people person that connects easily with people and brings a strong positive energy to the table.
Fired–up to achieve. Passionate about the power of data to drive better business outcomes for our customers.
Super organised. Someone who knows how to manage their workload, cope with multiple priorities and can organise their days and week effectively
Relevant commercial experience in a risk strategy setting, ideally within SME or retail lending environment
Proven track record of driving strategic/operational changes within an organisation
Experience leading a key analytical function (people management experience not required)
Exceptional problem solving skills using logical reasoning and analytical methods
Advanced knowledge of Excel
Working knowledge of SQL
One programming language (R, SAS, Python)
Why join us?
We’re gearing up for our biggest chapter yet – and it’s being driven by everyone.
We think of ourselves as the career launchpad. A place to develop yourself, fast. Real work. Real experience. Real opportunities to collect skills. Think big remits and huge ownership to make great things happen.
Yes, it’s target-driven and high-octave – but we like to play hard too. That’s what makes us, us. Our vibrant culture is built around potential and creating a place where you can really be you. We keep it agile and open. All voices heard. Because we believe great ideas come from everywhere.
If you show skill and are willing, we’ll back you all the way. This is the place for you to build something incredible.
It’s in our differences that we find our strengths.
We celebrate and support the differences that make you, you. So we’re building a culture where difference is valued. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We truly believe diversity makes us better.
Want to Build The Incredible? We’d love to hear from you.
It’s in our differences that we find our strengths.
We celebrate and support the differences that make you, you. So we’re building a culture where difference is valued. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We truly believe diversity makes us better.

Title: Project Delivery Lead
Description:
Project delivery lead
6-month contract role based in London
Daily rate: £650 to £750
Our client operates in the Real Estate arena and we are looking for a Project Delivery Lead. The client is currently embarking on a large-scale digital transformation.

Must have 7 to 10 years' experience working for one off the Big 4 consultancies
Please only apply if you have the management consultancy background

Your duties will include:
Designing roadmaps and managing project plans for multiple projects
Being an effective interphase between the business and technology

Please only apply if you have the following experiences:
Proven experience in Cloud Migration
UML Modelling tools experience
Previous ERP Implementation - Yardi desirable
Led multiple Data driven projects
Jira experience
SDLC experience
Six Sigma

The JM Group is operating and advertising as an Employment Agency for permanent positions and as an Employment Business for interim / contract / temporary positions. The JM Group is an Equal Opportunities employer and we encourage applicants from all backgrounds.

Title: Senior Devops - Applied Data Science for Global Technology I...
Description:
Our Global Technology Infrastructure group is a team of innovators who love technology as much as you do. Together, you'll use a disciplined, innovative and a business focused approach to develop a wide variety of high-quality products and solutions. You'll work in a stable, resilient and secure operating environment where you-and the products you deliver-will thrive.
As a DevOps Engineer, you will help build a meaningful engineering discipline, combining data, software and systems in order to engineer and maintain data science and AI solutions. Much of our support and software development focuses on building AI and machine learning capabilities in the firm, utilizing internal infrastructure and cloud platforms. You'll join a team of curious problem solvers with a diverse set of perspectives who are thinking big and taking risks. In this environment you'll take the lead on relevant projects, supported by an organization that provides the support and mentorship you need to learn and grow.
As a DevOps lead you will focus on the following responsibilities:
Lead the DevOps efforts in the team of data scientists and software engineers.
Help architect and develop machine learning and AI infrastructure and capabilities.
Lead the deployment, maintenance and support of AI and machine learning products and systems in production
Manage the PTO process: progressing Data Science products from development stage to testing to production.
Develop a support model for the Data Science products in production
Troubleshoot priority incidents, facilitate blameless post-mortems and ensure permanent closure of incidents
Engage with development team throughout the life cycle to help develop software for reliability and scale, ensuring minimal refactoring or changes
Identify application patterns and analytics in support of better service level objectives
Design self-healing and resiliency patterns
Design automated software and product upgrades, change management, and release management solutions
Coach or manage teams as applicable
Participate in the 24x7 support coverage as needed
This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in an software engineering discipline
Expertise in at least one technology stack designing, coding, testing, and delivering software
Proficiency in one or more technology domains, may be a cross-domain expert able to solve complex and mission critical problems within a business or across the firm
Working knowledge of infrastructure components. (E.g. routers, load balancers, cloud products , container systems , compute, storage and networks)
Excellent debugging and trouble shooting skills
Experience organizing and executing work around a defined process
The hiring manager for this job opening would welcome a conversation about flexible working. This could range from ad hoc flexibility in a full time position, to a more formal Flexible Work Arrangement.
When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest tech companies. In 20 technology centers worldwide, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $11B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will are transforming the financial services industry.
At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you're looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.
Ready to use your expertise and experience to drive change? Apply today.
© 2020 JPMorgan Chase & Co. JPMorgan Chase is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer Disability/Veteran.J.P. Morgan is a global leader in financial services, providing strategic advice and products to the world's most prominent corporations, governments, wealthy individuals and institutional investors. Our first-class business in a first-class way approach to serving clients drives everything we do. We strive to build trusted, long-term partnerships to help our clients achieve their business objectives.
We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs.

Title: Senior Technical Officer
Description:
Senior Technical Officer - London Wimbledon Stables x2

Location

Wimbledon, GB

Department Name

Southern region

About Network Rail

The Wessex Route’s Works Delivery business unit is a project management and delivery organisation with a diverse portfolio of projects covering track, signalling, electrification, geotechnical, and civil engineering disciplines.
The Works Delivery business unit has experienced large growth over the previous two years and currently has an annual turnover of circa £40m per annum. To date, Works Delivery has grown organically to meet the needs of its customers however the current size of its order book and its plans for future growth over the next seven years necessitates a more structured engineering capability.

Brief Description

Works Delivery – Track

Our track technical teams provide support to the Works Delivery Unit Track Engineering team taking projects from feasibility through detailed design to construction and project closeout.

Working within a team of technical staff, you will assist in the survey, design and construction of works ranging from plain line and switch and crossing refurbishments, to longitudinal timber replacements and full track renewal.
This role involves days, nights and weekend working, and is a safety critical role so subject to drug and alcohol testing and passing of the relevant medical assessment.

About the role (External)

You’ll provide vital, specialist technical support and guidance to the Maintenance Engineering team. It’s an excellent opportunity to hone your skills in your chosen discipline. Reporting to the Principal Technical Officer, you’ll enjoy a varied role, with the scope to make a big impact across diverse areas of work.

Your focus will be on careful analysis and quality control. We’ll look to you to manage the preparation of work and resource specifications, method statements and plans. We’ll also expect you to proactively check the quality of work that’s delivered. You’ll confirm assets are compliant to the highest standards. You’ll carry out technical inspections, investigations and data analysis. You’ll design, install, test and commission equipment. And you’ll sometimes take a hands-on role, both carrying out and supervising technical tasks, surveys and design work. Along the way, you’ll shape both your own ongoing development and that of others.

Essential Criteria
Proven knowledge of technical support activities and techniques
Experience and insight spanning maintenance processes, systems and standards
Understanding of design requirements, processes and techniques
Able to demonstrate, promote and embed safe working behaviours within the team
Excellent communication skills, both in person and in writing

Desirable Criteria
Able to coach, influence and develop others
Hold or be working towards and NVQ level 2 or 3 (or equivalent) in an engineering/leadership subject
Able and willing to drive vehicles as required by business need

This role involves days, nights and weekend working, and is a safety critical role so subject to drug and alcohol testing and passing of the relevant medical assessment.

How to apply (External)

Network Rail welcomes applications regardless of age, disability, marital status (including civil partnerships), pregnancy or maternity, race, religion or belief, sexual orientation, transgender status, sex (or gender), employment status, trade union affiliation, or other irrelevant factor. We will interview all disabled applicants who meet the essential criteria.

Safe behaviour is a requirement of working for Network Rail. Applicants should be able to demonstrate their awareness of our safety vision
Network Rail positively embraces flexible working recognising that employees may wish to balance work and family/home life.

Salary: £29,724 per annum. Please note that there are 2 positions available.

Extended closing date: 30th July 2020 - late applications will not be accepted.

Title: Procurement Process Lead Engineer - Operational Excellence
Description:
You will deliver business process development and operational excellence for the global Supplier Management operations; including supplier on boarding, screening and risk management. You will apply your procurement knowledge to develop processes, operating procedures, systems and automation to accelerate the value proposition for BCG. You possess a very high level of self-motivation/drive, resourcefulness and a willingness to facilitate change in an agile environment. You will lead-in best practices, and report to the Director of the Global Procurement Service Center. This is a great opportunity to develop process engineering best practice and operations excellence as part of the Global Procurement Transformation at BCG: one of the world’s leading and fastest growing consulting firms. You will:
Deliver operational excellence to end to end business processes that scale to support the global Procurement roll out and operations of Supplier Management, applying lean and digital transformation working in partnership with the Service Line Lead
Map current state processes, benchmark processes and identify opportunities to improve customer service levels, quality and cost performance of the services
Define and implement solutions to standardise, simplify and scale our processes; including quantifying benefits and tracking against benefits realization
Develop and maintain process maps and Standard Operating Procedures for the end to end process to ensure consistency, compliance and reference for audit purposes
Automate operations to the greatest extent possible, applying robotic process automation (RPA); working in collaboration with IT and Operations
Secure processes to maintain master data to a high level of data integrity through robust data gathering, analysis and dashboard / reporting working in partnership with the Service Line Analyst
Communicate clearly on change initiatives and selected internal projects to management and business stakeholders – including presenting initiatives and reporting on them at a regular cadence
Communicate technical decisions to non-technical audiences and build consensus around them
Identify, develop and implement best practices, applying Agile ways of working to accelerate customer value
Provide outstanding global customer service across all local office and times zones; delivering consistent service standards and meeting deliverable commitments
Build positive stakeholder relationships and manage all relevant communications and interactions with IT, Finance and other internal control groups
Act as a thought partner and provide problem solving and expertise insights, guide teams to avoid pitfalls and hurdles
YOU'RE GOOD AT
You should be good at process re-engineering, building relationships, having an eye for detail and a structured approach to delivering results.
Process Engineering – map business processes and apply process re-engineering best practices to and continuously improving business processes performance
Drive and Motivation - Successfully handles multiple tasks, takes initiative to improve his/her own performance, works intensely towards extremely challenging goals, and drive and deliver change in a global organization with minimum supervision
Creativity/Innovation - Drives process improvements and develops executable creative solutions
Client and Business Focus - Effectively handles difficult requests, builds trusting and long-term relationships with clients, helps clients to identify/define needs, and manages client/business expectations
Teamwork - Acts as a strong team player, collaborates with others within and across global teams, encourages other team members to participate and contribute, and acknowledges others' contributions
Communication Skills - Communicates what is relevant and important in a clear and concise manner and shares information/new ideas with others. Clearly articulate observations and linked recommendations verbally and in writing
Analytics - Analytical thinker, able to quickly assess situations, multi-task, prioritize and make observations and linked recommendations
Judgement and Problem Solving - Thinks ahead, anticipates questions, plans for contingencies, finds alternative solutions and identifies clear objectives. Sees the big picture and effectively analyses complex issues
Professional - Convey a strong positive personal and professional image with excellent standards of professional behaviour and ethics
Global Environment - Comfortable, flexible, and able to work under pressure
Comfort with ambiguity, virtual working and iterative process development
Organization - Highly organized with attention to detail (especially data quality) and excellent follow-through required
YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)
Strong experience in developing global and best in class business processes, doing procurement process reengineering preferably in a professional services, consulting, blue chip organization
In-depth working knowledge of supplier life-cycle management (supplier on boarding and maintenance), supplier screening or procurement processes
MBA or Bachelor’s degree in a related field (Engineering, Business, Technology etc.).
Experience or certification in Six Sigma/Lean or related operational excellence methodology
5+ years of work experience preferably in an operations environment
3+ years’ experience delivering process improvement and re-engineering within operations
2+ year tenure in last organisation and have demonstrated consistent role delivery
Expertise in process engineering (including automation) systems and tools – Visio, Robotics Process automation
Proficiency in Lean and Digital transformation tools and techniques (Kaizen, Agile, Kan-Ban etc.)
A sound understanding of Purchase-to-pay tools (e.g. Coupa, Ariba, Emptoris, Oracle)
Strong proficiency in Microsoft suite (Visio, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint),
Design visually compelling process maps, slides and reports
Experience with collaboration tools & ticketing systems (e.g. JIRA, Service Now) is preferred
Experience with big data environments
YOU'LL WORK WITH
BCG spends ~$1.3B on goods and services across the firm globally. At its core, Procurement is accountable for ensuring that BCG is supplied with goods and services that meet business requirements, drive value and at best whole life cost to BCG.

The functional procurement team at BCG is a healthy, yet nascent operating function that has generated material savings to BCG over the past 5 years. Over the past 18 months, we’ve embarked upon a procurement transformation to define and implement strategies, organization, systems and policies to create a sustainable operating model. This model should maximize value from our suppliers, mitigate risk and meet savings targets. BCG is a highly matrixed firm where purchasing decisions are often taken at the local level, therefore this transformation will need to be carried out with high levels of stakeholder engagement, alignment and collaboration.

The BCG Global Procurement function is currently made up of more than 40 procurement professionals located in London, Stockholm, New Delhi, Boston and Munich. This Procurement Operations position will be supporting the team on a strategic and operational level.

Scope of work will be global, regional as well as local, requiring relationship building, sell-in capabilities and sensitivity to local requirements. The individual taking on this challenge must possess a very high level of self-motivation/drive, persistency, resourcefulness and a willingness to facilitate change.
CITY
London
COUNTRY
United Kingdom
YOU'LL BE TRAVELLING
No
YOUR EMPLOYEE TYPE IS
Contractor
YOUR JOB TYPE IS
Full time
WHO WE ARE
BCG pioneered strategy consulting more than 50 years ago, and we continue to innovate and redefine the industry. We offer multiple career paths for the world’s best talent to have a real impact on business and society. As part of our team, you will benefit from the breadth and diversity of what we are doing today and where we are headed next. We count on your authenticity, exceptional work, and strong integrity. In return we are committed to supporting you in discovering the most fulfilling career journey possible—and unlocking your potential to advance the world.

Our team called Global Services (GS) provides corporate support to business areas such as Finance, Legal, HR, Marketing and IT. This diverse team of experts, operators and specialists represent all levels from Partner to entry level staff, operating across the globe in multiple countries. Global Services is in short, the backbone of BCG.
EQUAL OPPORTUNITY
Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under federal, state or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

Title: Big Data Linux Engineer (Senior)
Description:
Fantastic organisation specialising in the research and development of investments and financial markets are currently looking to grow their Platform Engineering Team as they currently undergo a strategic move to a predominantly Linux Infrastructure and the augmentation of Big Data Technologies in order to continue to grow their world class platform. It really is an impressive time for a very well known company, who have experienced an enormous amount of achievements and success over the last 5 years

We are looking for incredible passionate Open Source Linux and DevOps Engineers that have a great understanding of Linux Infrastructure/fundamental as well as great passion and experience within the Big Data space already.

In this senior role, you'll have the chance to work on projects that involve scaling and shaping the Linux Infrastructure and further implement Big Data Technologies to a well established and well known FinTech Organisations.

We are looking for experienced engineers who want to be involved with some of the following;
Linux Engineering
Automation experience (Puppet/Ansible)
Bash and Python Scripting experience
Passionate to work within Big Data and experience with Hadoop/Splunk would be great.
Knowledge around NoSQL Databases (MongoDB, Cassandra)
Knowledge of security principles
The right engineers will be joining a successful company at such an exciting time where you will become part of a platforms team held with such high regard and whilst undertaking such an important and well-received role in the company.

This Senior position will suit a Senior Linux Engineer who is passionate about Big Data and wants to combine their love for both Linux Entering and Big Data technologies. There are not going to be many positions like this arising and these type of opportunities don't come around too often, so get in contact!

To apply for this fantastic opportunity, please use the application form below or contact us.

Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age, and we confirm that we will gladly accept applications from Platform Engineers, DevOps Engineer of any age for this role. LinuxRecruit are a leading open source specialist and provides services as an agency and an employment business.
Please note that no terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age, and we confirm that we will gladly accept applications from individuals of any age for this role.
