Title: Senior Analyst - Analytics Services (12 month FTC)
Description:
This maternity cover role is within the Analytics Services team. The team is responsible for centralising investment analytics servicing. It requires experience and understanding of investment strategies and related service model and analytics requirements. The candidate is also expected to be mindful of existing and possible new tools and technology, data and analytics sources. How these are used by the team and other business functions.
The role’s key focus is on designing and delivering enhancements to the way the team currently responds to client requests. With the use of smarter tools and processes enabling the team to provide timely and accurate client reporting and analysis.
The person in this role must have the ability to interpret and solutionise client requirements, with exceptional attention to detail, accuracy and timing, with real understanding of client reporting needs and desire to shape and influence our service proposition for new and existing clients/products.
The person in this role will be expected to be a driving force in defining, building and constantly improving our client’s servicing solutions, processes and infrastructure, making use of exiting tools and developing, implementing new solutions.
Skills Required
Proven Python, SQL (database), VBA coding and development expertise.
Experience with Vermilion, Axioma (similar risk engine) and Bloomberg data are strongly preferred, and hands on experience in dealing with and handling asset management data.
Strong investment knowledge including an understanding of different investment vehicles. Specialist knowledge of investment strategies, systems, accounting and reporting requirements
Ability to see and deliver smart, scalable solution
Benefits
Whatever your role, we reward ability, performance and attitude with a package that looks after all the things that are important to you. Our employees have a wide range of benefits including a generous pension scheme, life assurance, 27 days' holiday, private medical insurance, performance related bonuses, a variety of share schemes, discounts at both a huge range of high street stores and our own great products, your hard work will be rewarded when you join us.

Title: Product Analyst Lead, Developer Console
Description:
Minimum qualifications:
Master's degree in Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience leading a team of Analysts and Data Scientists.
Experience with statistical software (e.g., R, Python) and database languages (e.g., SQL)

Preferred qualifications:
Experience leading several transformation organization-wide initiatives effectively.
Experience working with Engineers and Product Managers specially around providing product centric insights.
Experience in developing new models, methods, analysis and approaches. Experience in one or more of these methods – time series forecasting, econometrics, statistical and causal inference, classification methods.
Experience transforming organizations to be more data driven.
About the job
Help serve Google's worldwide user base of more than a billion people. Product Analysts provide quantitative support, market understanding and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. As a data-loving member of the team, you serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. You will weave stories with meaningful insight from data. You'll make critical recommendations for your fellow Googlers in Engineering and Product Management. You relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next.
We are looking for a leader, who can inspire, lead, and be hands-on both technically and managerially. You will have a grounding in the fundamentals of statistics as well as technical familiarity of commonly used statistical methods in analytics and data science.
The Product Analyst Lead for Developer Console, will manage a team of Google Play product analysts based in London and in Mountain View, California.
This role not only requires you to provide analytics strength to drive success for all Google Play developers, help develop Google Play Console front-end and business models/features for developers but also support cross-functional teams.
As a data-loving member of the team, you serve as an analytics expert for your partners (fellow Googlers in Engineering, Product Management, and Business).You will be responsible for translating data into meaningful interpretations and recommendations, and where relevant, implement process improvements. The metrics and analyses you develop will serve as a key input in product development and operations decision-making.
Google is and always will be an engineering company. We hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. At Google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage solutions, large-scale applications and entirely new platforms for developers around the world. From Google Ads to Chrome, Android to YouTube, Social to Local, Google engineers are changing the world one technological achievement after another.
Responsibilities
Hire, manage, and develop talent in the team, as well as serving as a point of reference for the team on topics related to measurement, metrics, statistical modeling, and inference.
Be a trusted partner for Engineering and Product Management teams in Developer Console understanding their business needs, formulating the questions analytically, answering it, and challenging notions/hypotheses if needed with critical, analytically driven thinking.
Deliver on key projects with the help of your team - complete end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables, and presentations.
Manage the priorities and projects for your team.
Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to multiple levels of leadership, creating visual displays of quantitative information. Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Title: Team Lead, Data & Analytics Platform Strategy & Implementati...
Description:
Team Lead, Data & Analytics Platform Strategy & Implementation Team
- (003809)
Primary Location UK-ENG-London
Job Research
Organisation DATA ANALYTICS TRANSFORMATION DIR
Job Posting 05-Jul-2020, 6:01:00 PM

The Bank of England is the UK's central bank. Our mission is to deliver monetary and financial stability for the British people.

The Bank of England is a diverse organisation. Each of its 4,000 plus people are committed to public service and dedicated to promoting the good of the people of the United Kingdom by maintaining monetary and financial stability.

Directorate Overview
The Bank’s mission depends on data and analytics, through their role in the Bank's decisions, its operations, and the information it provides to the public.

Data and analytics have received a new level of senior attention and backing in the Bank, following Huw van Steenis' Future of Finance review, the Bank's response, and the Governor's Mansion House speech. The Bank is now publicly committed to delivering a "world class regtech and data strategy". A new Directorate, Data Analytics and Transformation (DAT), headed by Gareth Ramsay, has been created to lead on this. DAT is the Bank’s centre of expertise for data strategy implementation and the compilation, dissemination and publication of regulatory and statistical data. We support analysis, policy and decision making by the Bank’s Committees, UK government departments and international organisations. Key stakeholders for our work include MPC, FPC and PRA Boards and our data are used in the Inflation Report, Financial Stability Report, Credit Conditions Review, Stress Test Results, FPC Core Indicators and Quarterly Bulletin. Decisions made in these Boards and from these reports have national economic significance.”

Data Strategy Implementation Division
Within DAT, a new division called Data Strategy Implementation Division (DSID) leads the definition and implementation of the Bank's data and analytics strategy. This strategy touches on practically all functions of the Bank, due to the central importance of data and analysis in our daily work. It also affects the firms from whom we collect data under statutory powers, the domestic and international official sector bodies with whom we share our data and analytics, and the public who receive data and analytics outputs published by the Bank.

Through the 2020s we intend to transform the way the Bank defines and collects data, the way it manages data and its capacity to analyse it, to make our use of data and analytics as insightful, reliable and efficient as possible. In addition, DSID leads the operation of the shared data and analytics services that mean colleagues can harness the power of data and analytics in their ‘business as usual (BAU)’ work today.

The Analytics Enablement Hub (AEH) was established last year to provide a Bank-wide analytics strategy and the support needed to help colleagues realise the potential of our data, and the analytical tools and platforms available to them. The AEH is a virtual team composed of colleagues from different areas across the Bank. They collaborate together to provide a cohesive, easy to access, supported self-service model utilising the skills and expertise we have. The core teams within AEH comprises teams from DSID (Data Analytics and Transformation) and Data and Analytics Modelling (Technology).

The Data and Analytics Platform Strategy and Implementation Team
The Data and Analytics Platform Strategy and Implementation Team is a new team, within DSID, and will augment the current core team, sitting within the Analytics Enablement Hub, that has the remit of implementing the strategy around our Data & Analytics Platform. This D&A Platform, with Bank-wide scope, will be live at the end of the year and will be the reference platform for self-service analytics across the Bank. For this reason we have designed an ambitious, and industry leading, operating model that is a step-change regarding how analytical platforms across the Bank are managed.
The strategy we have designed ensures:

Colleagues across the Bank can quickly add new, and maintain existing, datasets
Colleagues across the Bank can quickly find, trust and use datasets in the platform
Colleagues across the Bank can quickly make use of their datasets by setting-up reproducible, and performant, analytical pipelines
Data Stewards (those accountability for datasets in the Bank) are assured that their data are used in a governed, secured environment
The platform is kept up-to-date and delivering continuous business value

We fully expect this operating model to transform the way a considerable portion of the Bank’s data & analytics landscape will be supported in the future.


Job description
This is a really exciting opportunity to be part of a high-profile transformation, by leading and developing the team that will be at the heart of shaping one of the most fundamental future capabilities around Data & Analytics in the Bank.

As the Team Lead in the D&A Platform Strategy Team, we expect the job holder to help shape the role, but anticipate they will:

Support the Manager in the establishment of the Data & Analytics platform strategy governance and management activities. Once established, manage the day-to-day governance and prioritisation change activities portfolio.
Manage and prioritise the Data & Analytics Platform activities portfolio.
Oversee and coordinate the necessary delivery activities between the virtual teams sitting across Technology, DAT and Business areas, ensuring processes, policies and standards are defined, agreed, maintained and consistently applied,
Support the team’s role of first point of contact with business areas and projects with respect to the D&A Platform, supporting them in the shaping, scoping and value definition of their analytical requirements
Oversee the delivery of effective and appropriate communications to consumers of the service, including promoting the data being made available Bank-wide
Coordinate the day-to-day activities and decisions of the governance bodies, ensuring prioritisation of activities are driven by business value and alignment with the Bank’s Data and Analytics Strategy

This is a people management role. You will be responsible for day to day management of the team (1 to 2 direct reports) and for defining roles and responsibilities. You will develop your team through sharing information effectively, coaching and communicating a clear vision to ensure that your staff are productive, engaged and motivated to deliver the area’s aims. This will include setting clear goals and smart stretching objectives that are aligned to those of the team, division and directorate. You will also be responsible for managing all staff-related matters that may arise including performance, absence and sickness.
Role Requirements

Minimum (Essential) Criteria
The most important requirement for the role is that the work excites the candidate and that they believe they can help the Bank substantially improve its data and analytics capabilities and make the most of the large investment it is making in new tools and technologies. In addition, the job holder will have experience of:
Working in a change environment, and how to manage change and business as usual together
Leading and coordinating a service, working closely and collaboratively with multi-disciplinary teams, including Technology
Managing data governance and/or change management forums
Forming strong stakeholder relationships, with the ability to command credibility at senior management level and influence both business decisions and behaviors. This means having a reasonable understanding of, and appetite to quickly learn about: the Data& Analytics platforms across the Bank; the nature of data and analytical work in different business areas; the Bank’s approach to data management; and the Bank’s change management processes.
Leading, coaching or mentoring of data analysts or system support staff

Desirable Criteria
You will also ideally also have:

Implemented change within the Financial Services sector,
Exposure to analytical and visualization data tools/products
Change management experience.
Knowledge of the Bank’s business areas.

We anonymise applications so hiring managers will not be able to see your personal information, your original CV or any covering letters when reviewing your submission. Please complete work history and the application form questions as requested because incomplete submissions will not be reviewed.

We continue to build an inclusive culture where everyone can be their whole selves and produce their best work. Our focus on inclusion is intended to build greater diversity in order to reflect the society we serve and be an employer of choice.
This specific role offers a base salary of £45,900 - £50,000 (subject to experience and skillset).
In addition, the total reward package also includes:
A non-contributory, career average pension giving you a guaranteed retirement benefit of 1/95th of your annual salary for every year worked. There is the option to increase your pension (to 1/50th) or decrease (to 1/120th) in exchange for salary through our flexible benefits programme each year.
A discretionary performance award based on a current award pool.
A 7% benefits allowance with the option to take as salary or purchase a wide range of flexible benefits.
25 days annual leave with option to buy up to 13 additional days through flexible benefits.
Private medical insurance and income protection.


The closing date for applications is 27 July 2020.

Please apply online, ensuring that you answer the application questions, complete the work history and submit your CV.

Title: Senior Software Engineer – Tradebook
Description:
Our team:
Bloomberg Tradebook is an industry leading technology provider of a cross-asset electronic and algorithmic trading platform that enables clients to trade around the world. As part of the Tradebook Futures team, you will get to work on a distributed platform that provides seamless workflows and contingent/algorithmic order types which are specialized to match a client's trading strategy and automate their orders using Bloomberg's world class data and analytics. Our automation tools prioritize improved user experience and cost saving for our clients.
We have a lot of exciting projects, but here are a few of upcoming!
User Defined Strategies – This is a very interesting project aimed to support trading of complex user-created spreads. It entails learning of how various exchanges support trading of this complex instrument and familiarizes you with how our clients use various strategies to execute their portfolio. These projects also provide great opportunities to collaborate across various teams within Bloomberg. {https://www.cmegroup.com/confluence/display/EPICSANDBOX/User+Defined+Spread+-+UDS}
High Performance Distributed architecture – We are currently in the process of re-architecting and migrating our platform that supports trading of contingent/algorithmic order types to a distributed system for improving capacity and reliability to support an enterprise trading platform. This opens up many opportunities for redesign and introducing modern C++ concepts into codebase.
What's in it for you?
Work with Kafka and similar internal message queuing solutions.
Own the full development process – from gathering requirements to testing, rollouts, and maintenance.
We put emphasis on doing things right: so you'll get to use industry best practices for testing, automation, and CI/CD (Google Tests, Jenkins, Git etc.).
Opportunities to work on software that have a direct impact on our clients
Excellent opportunities to understand building and enhancing of high performance software
We will trust you to:
Take ownership of the complete SDLC, from meeting with the business, gathering and contributing to requirements and implementing innovative solutions
Explore new technologies and approaches, using the best tools for the problem at hand than what you may already know
Heavy focus on code and data structure efficiency and improve UX workflow for our clients
Think creatively to solve business problems
Have a team player attitude and collaborative approach to development
You will need to have:
Proven industry experience working with C++
Good knowledge of data structures, design patterns and problem solving
Experience with a scripting language, preferably Python
Excellent communication skills to work with other teams and explain technical problems
Proficiency in developing multi-threading applications
We would love to see:
Experience with Javascript and an open mind to using new technologies
Experience with test driven development and CI/CD tools
Experience working in an agile environment
Experience with distributed systems
Interview process
We believe interviewing is a two way street. It's a way for us to get to know you and your skills, and also a way for you to learn more about the team, our technical challenges, and what you'd be working on. The content of each interview round will be tailored to the role and your background, but the general framework can be found here:https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/technology/engineering/software-engineering-experienced-hire
We want to ensure you can put your best foot forward throughout the process, so if you have any questions or need any accommodations to be successful, please let us know!

Title: Master Data Lead
Description:
Job Description :
Master Data Lead
London
Permanent
Closing date: 29/07/2020
From Arthur Guinness to Johnnie Walker, our business was founded on people of great character, and in 250 years, nothing’s changed. We’re the world’s leading premium alcohol company. Our brands are industry icons. And our success is thanks to the strength of our people, in every role. It’s why we trust them with our legacy. And it’s why we reward them with the career-defining opportunities that they deserve. Our ambition is to create the best performing, most trusted and respected Consumer Products Company in the world. To achieve these, we need the world’s very best people.
Feel inspired? Then this may be the opportunity for you.
About the role
The Master Data Lead coordinates at local level all actions needed to guarantee quality of data under scope and deadlines to be met to achieve business objectives and requirements. Point of contact for DBS & BSS teams to ensure global data quality agenda is implemented and maintained in country.
You will be responsible for support data infrastructure by maintaining master data, updating or building existing tools, processes, and systems.
You’ll Manage master data information while maintaining highest level of accuracy and quality control ensuring data integrity across systems.
Working closely with other departments you will ensure data consistency and integrity throughout all areas of the Master Data Management domain
You will analyse and troubleshoot Master Data Domain and system issues with Stakeholders, effectively communicating results to Data Governance team and Stakeholders.
Supporting end-to-end business reporting, analytics to provide insights that will drive business growth, performance, and efficiencies.
You’ll maintain and leverage tools developed for item data management (i.e. supplier tools) and suggest improvements for efficiency.
Assisting in establishing reporting best practices for data analysis by developing an understanding of how the tools are currently being used within the organization and transitioning to new tools.
Maximize the capabilities of current toolsets to create reporting solutions in support of business initiatives, and you will make recommendations on new toolsets for the business.
EDI liaison with multiple stakeholders including EDI partner and supplier base to develop, maintain existing documents, and implement new documents to gain efficiencies for end- to- end process.
About you
To be successful in this role you will have knowledge of business units and functions and how effective data management can support them.
You will have experience in data management, process improvement or a data related role, and it is important you have a logical approach to problem solving.
It would be great if you have experience on SAP, data quality tools deployment and MIS knowledge is an advantage but not essential.
You will have strong attention to detail with a real focus on getting it right first time.
Celebrating our inclusive and diverse culture is core to Diageo’s purpose of “celebrating life every day everywhere”. This purpose is, in itself, inclusive in nature, as it values everybody irrespective of background, disability, religion, gender identity, sexuality or ethnicity.
We know that for our business to thrive and for Diageo to realize its ambition, we depend on having diverse talent with a range of backgrounds, skills and capabilities in each of the 180 countries in which we operate and to reflect our broad consumer base. We view diversity as one of the key enablers that helps our business to grow and our values, purpose and standards set the conditions for us to respect the unique contribution each person brings.
Flexibility is key to success in our business and many of our staff work flexibly in many different ways, including part-time, compressed hours, flexible location. Please talk to us about what flexibility means to you and don’t let anything stop you from applying.
Character Is Everything

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Developer and Analyst
Description:
You will work closely with Data Engineers, Data Scientists and business stakeholder to deliver Business Intelligence to guide our tactical and strategic decisions with actionable insight on all organisational levels. In short, democratise data and insight delivering trusted information where it is needed when it is needed in a form that is easy to consume and explore. We recently started building a cloud-based Data Platform with cutting-edge technology and Data Science built-in from the start. Your role is to imagine and deliver the Business Intelligence part of this platform. This includes the choice of technology, incremental delivery of value and enabling the business with self-service BI capabilities where possible.
The Person
Professional experience in a comparable role
Business Intelligence background and relevant degree
Essential skills and experience
Data modelling, exploration and preparation
Reporting and Descriptive Analytics

Tableau, Qlikview, PowerBI, Microstrategy, etc.
Numerical and general analytics mindset
Beneficial experiences

Software Development practices
Cloud

Retail sector
The Company
Holland & Barrett is one of the nation's most loved and trusted brands, known for offering quality health food, vitamins and supplements all sold by highly trained and qualified advisors.

Title: Data Governance Strategic Lead
Description:
What’s the challenge?
We have an exciting new opportunity to join us at Compare the Market as a Data Governance Strategic Lead. This role will be vital to us, working with Data Governance team to ensuring accountability for delivery against agreed milestones so we delivery against our strategy.

Collaboration will be key, working with the Data Governance team you’ll ensure that all assigned projects have clearly defined requirements for Data Privacy, Data Security, Data Quality & Data Governance. You’ll proactively provide timely and accurate reporting on progress, risks and issues ensuring that progress against projects is communicated and understood and any delays are explored and mitigated or escalated in a prompt manner. You’ll represent our Data Governance team when providing updates to the programme board on the progress of our workstreams, highlighting status of tasks and any blockers that affect delivery dates.

You’ll be contributing to discussions on existing standard process that projects have and should adopt and where necessary suggest how best to comply with both regulatory and business policy. Working with risk team you’ll identify and expand Data Governance Controls and Key Risk Indicators to allow post launch reporting and monitoring of the changes introduced by the strategic projects. You’ll have the opportunity to support the delivery of Data Governance workstreams e.g. Identification of PII data in proposed table structures for new Platform and contribute to the continuous development of CtM Data Maturity Framework and ensure its adoption across the projects.

What will it take?
Knowledge and experience of data privacy and security approaches, practices and toolkits
Experience managing highly complex projects/ programmes in an agile environment
Excellent planning and organisational skills with the ability to prioritise effectively and spot the game changers
Driven, determined and thrives in a fast-paced environment with the ability to remain calm under pressure
Attention to detail with the ability to take a strategic viewpoint
Excellent communication & influencing skills with a high degree of commercial acumen
Self-motivated team player with a collaborative, positive approach

Why choose us?
You might already know us - we're the ones with the Meerkats! Compare the Market has helped revolutionise the insurance market and we have been growing rapidly since starting in 2006.

We are on a mission to transform the comparison industry, moving beyond endless forms and generic search results, to a highly personalised, service-led experience. In order to do so, we recognise that we need to consistently deliver seamless, personalised customer experiences through a connected data and technology ecosystem.

About BGL
Founded in 1992, the BGL Group has grown significantly in size and capability. From 30 to 3,000 people globally we are a leading digital distributor of insurance and household financial services.

We’re growing and we are home to such brands as; Les Furets, Beagle Street, Junction, Budget Insurance and Dial Direct. We are trusted by more than 10million customers in the UK alone, with this foundational success we continually grow and invest in our people and their ideas.

We enjoy what we do and we have fun doing it!

Diversity and Inclusion
We're a diverse community of dedicated, innovative and talented professionals. With an inclusive and open workplace, we encourage our people to create and share ideas – supporting their growth and celebrating their uniqueness.

Flexible working
We understand the importance of achieving a healthy lifestyle balance, whether it’s working remotely or flexibly we have an environment where people are empowered to embrace flexible working in a way that works for them and for the business.

Title: Digital Analytics Lead
Description:

Fully Remote Working - Occasional London Travel

THE COMPANY
An online gaming company rapidly expanding its digital presence is seeking an Analytics Lead to own digital analytics within the organisation and drive data-led best practice with a view to generating greater personalisation.

You will be comfortable being hands-on across Google Tag Manager (GTM) implementation and ideally have experience with connecting digital data to wider data within the organisation, leading efforts around experimentation & marketing automation. In the role you will advise on best practice around how to utilise data effectively within the business, with a long-term view to generating more bespoke and personalised customer journeys.
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Subject matter expertise across the Google Analytics (360) stack
Hands-on implementation experience via Google Tag Manager / GTM (experience with other tag management systems can be considered)
