THE BENEFITS
£60,000-£70,000
HOW TO APPLY
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Adam Osborne at Harnham via the Apply link on this page
Please note that our client is currently running a fully remote interview process, and able to on-board and hire remotely as well. This role is intended to be home working for the foreseeable future

Title: Senior Actuarial Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Senior Actuarial Analyst
Salary Range: up to £50,000
Location: London or Eastleigh

Senior Actuarial Analyst: Our Ageas Actuarial Commercial team are looking to bring on board an experienced Senior Actuarial Analyst to join our successful London or Eastleigh office. The role has become available due to department growth and offers element of remote working and/or flexible hours.
The Senior Actuarial Analyst will play a leading role in reserving, pricing support, capital modelling support, performance monitoring and forecasting and other ad hoc projects. Current high profile projects the team are involved with include technical pricing reviews, the re-design and automation of key processes and Covid-19 claims and exposure reporting. As the department forms a key link between other departments, the Senior Actuarial Analyst will work directly with individuals across all areas of the business, including Underwriting, Pricing, Finance and Claims, therefore strong communication and rapport building skills is a must.
Owing to the varied nature of this role the Senior Actuarial Analyst will have a high degree of autonomy to work independently on a number of specific projects and analysis, with the flexibility to explore own ideas and work off of their own initiative.
The ideal Senior Actuarial Analyst needs to have experience in reserving and/or pricing of general insurance lines, ideally in Commercial Motor business, and must have experience in data analysis and programming packages, such as SAS, R or Python. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who is looking to advance their actuarial career, who enjoys autonomy and variety in their role and is data-driven.
The main responsibilities of the Senior Actuarial Analyst:
Oversee and communicate elements of the quarterly reserve reviews, as well as additional claims related analysis.
Communicate analysis and make recommendations to Underwriters, Claims Managers and Senior Management.
Support the production of analysis of Claims performance, identifying trends and features, which include the interpretation and communication of suitable recommendations to Senior Management.
Work on ad hoc pricing projects with the overall aim of having a direct impact on profitability.
Enhance the team's capabilities by supporting automation projects and the adoption of new software, tools and techniques in analytics.
A pro-active use of available data to support the Underwriting and Claims functions in making effective and informed business decisions.
Assist in the development, maintenance and interpretation of relevant MI in relation to the company's underwriting performance and pricing strength.
Support the development of other team members on a day-to-day basis. Line management opportunities would be available for the right candidate.
The successful Senior Actuarial Analyst will have the following:
A 2.1 degree level mathematics/statistics or equivalent
A minimum of 3 years or relevant experience in reserving and/or pricing of general insurance lines. Experience of Commercial Motor business is particularly desirable.
A high level of understanding of modern actuarial and statistical modelling techniques is essential.
Skills in data analysis and programming packages, for example SAS, R, Python, etc.
Experience with claims reserving software, for example ResQ or Psicle.
Excellent skills in explaining, both internally and externally to key business partners, pricing decisions based on detailed analysis.
Here are some of the benefits you can enjoy within the Senior Actuarial Analyst:
A competitive pension for which Ageas will pay twice the amount.
Generous amount of holidays with the option to buy up to 10 additional days.
Annual Salary review.
Discretionary annual bonus based on personal and company performance.
Life assurance of 4 x salary with the option to flex up.
Return to work programme scheme.
Flexible benefits package (private medical insurance, health and dental plans, free life assurance policy, discounted gym membership, cycle to work scheme as well as discounts with a wide range of retailers through our partner Perkz.com).
Support groups- well-being activities, yoga, mindfulness sessions, Sports and Social Club events and more.
About #Ageas:
With a history of almost 200 years we pride ourselves on being a leading provider of award-winning insurance solutions in the UK. We've scooped a Gold Standard Insurance Award for the last nine years running and received a five star defaqto rating for offering the highest quality products in the market.
We take pride in creating a supportive, inclusive and safe environment, encouraging people to bring 100% of themselves to work every day and where our people are our most valuable asset. With over 2,800 employees based across our offices in Bournemouth, Eastleigh, Gloucester, London and Manchester, our people help Ageas create a thriving, creative and innovative place to work, which is echoed in the service we provide to over five million customers.
We are the Proud Partners of Bourne Free - Bournemouth Pride, a Stonewall Diversity Champion, a signatory of the Women in Finance Charter and the Insurance Inclusion Pledge and support the Rays of Sunshine and will continue to broaden our Inclusion agenda.
Our purpose is clear: To make insurance easy and personal for our customers. We live and breathe our values - we care and respect those around us; we dare to push our boundaries, we deliver what we promise, above all, we learn together, inspire others and share success.

Want to be part of a Winning Team? Come and join Ageas.

Click on the 'Apply button' to be considered for our Senior Actuarial Analyst opportunity at Ageas in London or Eastleigh office.
#INDHP2

Title: Consultant/Senior Consultant – Data Analytics
Description:
JOB TITLE: Data Analytics Consultant
ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY:
Our Client is an international consulting firm specialising in Forensic Accounting, Data Analytics and eDiscovery with six offices and datacentres across the globe. Our client is currently looking to hire an experienced Data Analytics Consultant to join their team.
PRIMARY DUTIES:
Managing and being accountable for complex work streams within a project, and effectively delegating responsibilities to junior team members.
Designing and implementing complex database models of financial, operational, or transactional data to generate meaningful insights.
Identifying, acquiring, synthesizing, mining and analysing relevant data.
Maintaining detailed logs of information sources, assumptions and methodologies used in performing analytical tasks.
Preparing visualisations and written analyses, reports, or presentations.
BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:
Minimum of a Bachelor's Degree.
3+ years of relevant experience with an emphasis in complex problem solving, data analytics, or related competencies.
Experience working in a team-oriented environment.
REQUIRED SKILLS:
Proficient (meaningful experience applying well-developed skills to actual business challenges) in analysing data within database systems such as MS SQL Server, Oracle or NoSQL.
Proficient (meaningful experience applying well-developed skills to actual business challenges) in one or more of Python, Perl, PHP, JavaScript, VBA, or other programming languages for data processing/analysis purposes.
PREFERRED SKILLS:
Familiarity with visualisation tools such as Tableau, QlikView, or open source libraries such as D3.js.
Familiarity with common accounting and ERP packages such as PeopleSoft, SAP, JD Edwards, Hyperion and Oracle Financials.

Title: Lead Data Architect, Borrowing
Description:
We're looking for a Data Architect to step change how we use data safely within our borrowing collective. This will be Monzo's first hire for a Data Architect, with great scope to set the standards hopefully prove the need for more! For the right person there's opportunity to build beyond traditional data modelling and architecture and help support across process automation and analytical tooling.
You'll help us with the following questions and challenges:
How can we use the internal data we have safely to power better borrowing decisions?
How can we make sure all the data we have is easily available, so we can make enable fast self service commercial decisions?
How can we build automatable tools for our key business as usual data process in borrowing (reporting, provisioning and decisioning?)
The role
You'll be responsible for;
Ensuring that data modelling is to a high standard across the organisation
Developing and implementing a data governance framework
Setting documentation and data quality standards
Working with engineers to build data contracts between our services and data warehouses
Coaching and training members of the data team in good practice
You'll work closely with our exceptional data engineering, borrowing analytics, decisioning and engineering teams to build great data products.
You should apply if you have:
Experience and a passion in data warehousing, big data, ETL as a designer or architect
Strong SQL knowledge and understanding of data and databases
A track record of working on data governance
A desire to scale access to data modelling
Experience of analytics, data science and BI approaches and technologies
Logistics
We can help you relocate to London & we can sponsor visas.
Once we reopen our office, this role will be London based.
We offer flexible working hours and trust you to work enough hours to do your job well, at times that suit you and your team.
Diversity and inclusion is a priority for us – if we want to solve problems for people around the world, our team has to represent our customers. So we need to attract the best talent and create an environment that supports and includes them. You can read more about diversity and inclusion on our blog.
If you prefer to work part-time, we'll make this happen whenever we can - whether this is to help you meet other commitments or strike a great work-life balance.
The application process consists of a 30 mins phone call with a recruiter, an initial call with someone from the team, followed by a technical take home task and 2-3 on-site interviews at our office in London or remotely via hangouts. We promise not to ask you any brain teasers or trick questions.
Equal Opportunity Statement
At Monzo, embracing diversity in all of its forms and fostering an inclusive environment for all people to do the best work of their lives with us. This is integral to our mission of making money work for everyone.
We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.
What is Monzo about?
We're a bank on a mission to make money work for everyone. By focusing on solving real problems rather than selling financial products, treating people fairly and being totally transparent, we believe we can make banking better.
Monzo started in 2015 with big plans and a little office in Shoreditch, London. Now we're a fully-licensed bank with millions of customers in the UK, and well over a thousand employees around the world.

Title: Senior Technical Analyst (Advanced Analytics) FTC
Description:
Location: Mornington Crescent, Greater London House, NW1
Department: Technology
Level: Mid to Senior, Non-Manager
Reports to: Senior Agile Delivery Manager
Contract Type - Mat Cover 12 month Fixed Term
THE ROLE
ASOS is the no.1 fashion destination in the world and to achieve that we need data. Data is the life blood of the ecommerce system that powers the ASOS experience. Without data we wouldn’t be able to tell you the products we have on offer, ship to your address, record your returns, and identify when you should be getting rewards or recommend products that you might like.

Data engineering at ASOS is about ensuring that our data platform, is robust, secure, timely and flexible. We achieve this by being integrated with engineering practice and follow principles such as, agile development, continuous delivery, and continuous improvement. We are pushing the boundaries of data engineering to ensure we can be true to these principles…
THE TEAM
Cue Advanced Analytics… We work with big data, leveraging advanced data engineering, analytics and reporting tools/techniques to deliver an accessible store of enterprise data that can be used for business-critical insights and recommendations and enable ASOS to be a Data Driven business.
If you are passionate about technology and data engineering, love hands-on development, you should work with us!
About the role:
As a Technical Data Analyst, based in our Advanced Analytics technology team, you will play a key role in delivering and supporting insights & BI solutions. You will be working as part of a functional delivery team alongside BAs, Architects and Data Engineers to ensure our Insights business are supported to create great data insights for ASOS.
What you’ll be doing:
Working as part of cross-functional agile team who design and develop a large-scale, high-volume and high-performance data platform.
Working with data analysts in Insights to identify and implement report automation.
Deliver and regularly review new datasets for our end users across multiple areas of the business (such as Finance, Retail, Marketing, Digital) .
Work with analysts to identify and implement dashboards for business insight, using SQL and Power BI.
Investigate and fix reported data or reporting issues, working with engineers to ensure robust & timely solutions for insights dashboards, data and technology pipelines
Manage and Prioritise new data requests and issues raised, providing time estimates on how long it will take to complete
Take lead on communication between Advanced Analytics and Insight teams, ensuring that regular updates are given in a clear and concise manner.
Develop a good working knowledge of the data available, documenting and sharing this knowledge with the wider team.
Prepare and present training sessions on topics such as SQL, Power BI and how to query data effectively.
You’ll be at the forefront of the technology team , helping us manage the relationship with the ASOS Insights business team and working directly with the data analysts to create a great working data environment containing a great breadth of data such as orders, customer demographics, web interactions and customer communications.
Who we’d like to meet:
You are a self-starter, who loves technology and bringing solutions to people.
You have a passion for bringing data and people together to drive business value.
Good working knowledge of SQL, automating processes, some shell scripting (ideally PowerShell) and data warehouse concepts.
You are keen to and able to learn new tools and technologies.
You are organised with a desire to be in a data driven service role.
You enjoy problem solving, using analytical skills and you have excellent communication skills.
Knowledge of data visualisation principles and skills –including good user experience/UI Design within BI solutions.
An ability to build strong relationships with end users, eliciting requirements and enabling them to get the most out of the BI Platform.
It will be a plus to have:
Experience in a service or data role previously.
Experience in providing insight to consumers.
Experience prioritising request backlogs.
Understanding of CI / CD and deployment options for Power BI reporting.
You have worked in an Agile environment.
What's in it for you?
Competitive salary, bonus and pension matching
Life insurance, free private medical care, cycle to work scheme + more
A bespoke flexible benefits scheme catered to you
Best in class Learning & Development schemes and career development programmes
25 days holiday + never work on your birthday again!
Free modern onsite gym, plus personal training and wellness rooms
A dynamic social environment, from company-wide sports days, charity days, ‘Give A Week Away’ opportunities to visit our charity partners in India & company-wide celebrations to name just a few
Huge staff discounts and sample sales
Tech Develops days– one day per month dedicated to developing yourself and developing others within Tech
Tech Presents days- breakfast mornings to collaborate and share your work with other teams

Title: Senior Manager - Data, Methods & Analytics
Description:
Site Name: UK - London - Brentford, USA - Pennsylvania - Upper Providence
Posted Date: Jul 2 2020
Are you looking for a high-profile health outcomes role that shapes solid evidence generation for our medicines? If so, this role could be an exciting opportunity to explore.
Data, Methods and Analytics (DMA) are an in-house data and analytics team set up to provide insight into the patterns, burden, and occurrence of disease, cost and healthcare utilisation, and the safety and effectiveness and other outcomes of treatment. As Senior Manager in the DMA team, you will serve as an internal methods expert to execute studies that support a number of different functions within the GSK Value, Evidence and Outcomes (VEO) teams. These studies aim to produce scientifically credible, high quality evidence aligned with the needs of regulators, the scientific community, and decision makers responsible for granting access and reimbursement, through analysis of real-world data and post-hoc analyses of RCT data. In addition to the VEO teams, there is an opportunity to support other functions exploring the potential of leveraging secondary real-world in GSK.
Roles and Responsibilities:
Provide scientific, methodological and analytic expertise to execute a portfolio of inhouse studies and analytic projects to meet disease and asset level evidence needs across the GSK portfolio.
Support project execution including hands on delivery of evidence generation activities including network meta-analyses, match-adjusted indirect treatment comparisons to support content included in value evidence dossiers and reimbursement applications.
Intake projects that can be delivered inhouse, including supporting all necessary steps for study execution i.e., study design, protocol development and review, programming and analysis, scientific input and results interpretation, and report development.
Develop strong partnerships with a variety of internal stakeholders to identify robust, innovative and efficient methods to conduct value evidence generation studies.
Represent DMA as a subject matter expert on real world data, and explore additional areas outside of value evidence generation where DMA expertise and data could be used synergistically.
Why you?
Basic Qualifications:
We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
Minimum of a Master’s degree in Health Economics or Health Services Research, Medical or Biostatistics, Epidemiology, or Quantitative Decision Sciences.
Specialized experience and application of methods for health economics/ economic evaluation, epidemiology, or methods used for health technology assessment.
Hands-on experience and practical knowledge of statistical/analytic software (e.g., R, WinBugs, SAS, STATA).
Preferred Qualifications:
If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:
Be passionate about working hands-on on with large, complex datasets to problem-solve and find innovative solutions to challenging problems.
Be self-reliant with the ability to deliver robust, timely, high-quality analytics
Be an enthusiastic collaborator and enjoy working on a wide range of projects and requests across multiple therapy areas
Be an effective communicator and able to articulate complex concepts to diverse audiences
Please use the cover letter to highlight how you meet the competencies for the role. Your cover letter along with your CV will be used to assess your application. Thanks for your interest in this opportunity.
Why GSK?
Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture.
These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. As GSK focuses on our values and expectations and a culture of innovation, performance, and trust, the successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities:
Agile and distributed decision-making – using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk
Managing individual and team performance.
Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution.
Implementing change initiatives and leading change.
Sustaining energy and well-being, building resilience in teams.
Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning both internally and externally.
Developing people and building a talent pipeline.
Translating strategy into action - a compelling narrative, motivating others, setting objectives and delegation.
Building strong relationships and collaboration, managing trusted stakeholder relationships internally and externally.
Budgeting and forecasting, commercial and financial acumen.
LI-GSK
If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or
Show phone number
(outside US).
GSK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and, in the US, we adhere to Affirmative Action principles. This ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.
Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies
GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.
Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. For more information, please visit GSK’s Transparency Reporting For the Record site.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Us
We want to help small businesses win. That’s why we’re here.
We connect small business owners to investors – to create jobs, help families and power economies – because we believe that people are made to do more. And we want to help them.
So, we created the leading online marketplace for small business loans. Our investors have lent £8.1 billion in 110,000 loans to 77,000 small business owners. In a single year , we unlocked 115,000 jobs and contributed £6.5 billion to the global economy. There’s never been a better time to join!
Be part of the team that changes everything. Let’s build the place where small businesses can get the funding they need to win and leave a legacy behind, forever.
This role sits within the “Risk and Analytics” team. The drivers behind our platform – brilliant people working together to create, code, and build the next game changers.
About the role
Would you describe yourself as a data fanatic? Do you have a passion for analysing and visualising data to help your company make better decisions faster? If you answer yes to these questions then we're looking for you to apply! We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to help drive the use of data across the company. You’ll help by:
Building strong relationships with stakeholders across the business and helping them with their data needs
Understanding how our business works and how this is reflected in our data
Creating engaging visualisations to bring the data story to life
Working with data to prototype solutions for analytics teams and feeding into the design and build of our data platforms
Assessing and tracking the quality of data and working with the team to solve issues.
About You
Ability to extract insight from data and explain, in straightforward terms, what it means
Experience developing dashboards in visualisation tools like Tableau or Qlikview
Strong SQL query/development skills (Athena/Presto, PostgreSQL, MySQL, MS SQL)
Good understanding of ETL processes and data pipelines
Fired–up to achieve. Passionate about the power of data to drive better business outcomes for our customers.
Super organised. Someone who knows how to manage their workload, cope with multiple priorities and can organise their days and week effectively
Quick to learn. You get things quickly, can take on feedback and understand how to explain complex concepts and products to our customers simply
Why join us?
We’re gearing up for our biggest chapter yet – and it’s being driven by everyone.
We think of ourselves as the career launchpad. A place to develop yourself, fast. Real work. Real experience. Real opportunities to collect skills. Think big remits and huge ownership to make great things happen.
Yes, it’s target-driven and high-octave – but we like to play hard too. That’s what makes us, us. Our vibrant culture is built around potential and creating a place where you can really be you. We keep it agile and open. All voices heard. Because we believe great ideas come from everywhere.
If you show skill and are willing, we’ll back you all the way. This is the place for you to build something incredible.
It’s in our differences that we find our strengths.
We celebrate and support the differences that make you, you. So we’re building a culture where difference is valued. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer. We truly believe diversity makes us better.
Want to Build The Incredible? We’d love to hear from you.

Title: Senior Consultant - Workforce Design & Analytics - People Ad...
Description:
The world continues to change as a result of developments in globalisation, demographics, technology and regulation. This disruption requires organisations to change rapidly – and they need their people to be agile and adaptable to that change.

At the same time, it’s getting harder to source, manage, motivate and retain talent while controlling costs. In People Advisory Services, we help our clients harness their people agenda – the right people, with the right capabilities, in the right place, for the right cost, doing the right things.

Looking at people as part of an integrated business strategy, organisations are able to gain a people advantage. We work globally and collaborate to address complex issues relating to organisation transformation, end-to-end employee lifecycles, effective talent deployment and mobility, gaining value from evolving and virtual workforces, and the changing role of HR.

The diversity of our talent, global connectivity and collaborative philosophy means we’re inspired to ask better questions to help organisations design better outcomes, deliver long-lasting results and achieve an advantage.

Continued growth in client demand for our support, combined with our view to triple the size of our Workforce Advisory business means that we are offering career-accelerating opportunities for talent analytics professionals to join our team.

The opportunity

We continue to experience tremendous appetite from organisations keen to leverage their HR data assets. However, many of these organisations are not yet equipped to be able to deliver insights needed to tackle their most prominent workforce issues. In short, the requirement for enhanced workforce reporting and capabilities has never been as pressing.

Our team works directly with clients or alongside client data teams to deliver solutions in the areas of strategic workforce planning; talent acquisition & workforce migration; workforce performance; diversity & inclusion; learning & development; and retention.

This is an opportunity for you to work with a broad set of clients including major private corporate organisations through to government departments and other public sector bodies. Your work will have a high degree of complexity and at times, uncertainty, since you will be working with multiple stakeholders, some of whom will have limited analytics exposure and understanding.

Due to the nature of our projects you will have the opportunity to showcase your strong client management and communication skills, in addition to your rigorous analytical techniques and excellent data handling abilities.

Working alongside and collaborating with experienced workforce planning and talent analytics consultants you will bring your experience of working with large client datasets to help build analytical models; leverage data transformation and visualisation packages; as well as testing your experience of programming and statistical tools (such as R and Python) to derive insight through data modelling and simulations.

All of the above will allow you to construct a narrative that provides real impact using data to drive action.


Your key responsibilities


Supporting people analytics enabled business transformation projects – from generating insight to the identification of changes to people programmes and workforce structures
Involvement with programmes to evaluate people capability; build business cases for change; establish HR Analytics functions or centres of excellence; implement new people programmes and workforce structures; workforce demand and skills assessments; data selection and cleansing
Design and build complex database models and insightful visualisation dashboards to perform analysis on large diverse datasets
Contributing to the development of people strategy, people value propositions and business case for improvements/change for the clients.
Understanding and experience of how key systems or tools are used in this space for data extraction and visualisation (for example applications including; SuccessFactors, Workday, Tableau, SAS, SPSS/ Cognos)
Involvement with designing machine learning solutions, undertaking proof-of-concepts, and implementing these solutions to help clients to be effective in this dynamic environment


Skills and attributes for success
Highly numerate with a strong technical knowledge and experience of applying analytical and modelling techniques to provide insights to business issues
Ability to work with clients and model users, identify their particular use case requirements, design appropriate solutions to load data, perform complex calculations, derive corollaries and deliver interface tools to provide repeatable visual output
Strong oral and written communication skills


To qualify for the role, you must have
Previous experience working in a data analytics, data modelling or data scientist capacity either in a professional services environment or corporate inhouse analytics function
Experience working with large datasets (creating databases, architecting efficient structures and writing optimised stored procedures & queries)
Experience in applying analytical techniques to calculate problems such as predictive forecasting, prescriptive action, capacity planning
Ideally, you’ll also have
Experience of working in a professional services environment, including exposure to high profile strategic workforce planning and talent analytics projects
A relevant primary degree and any post graduate degrees and professional qualifications are desirable but not critical e.g. Computer Science, Organisational Psychology, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or Actuarial Science
Experience in building models in R, and Python programming languages and libraries.
Visually creative, with a good understanding of UX aesthetics
Experience of working with visualisation tools including Tableau, Tibco Spotfire, Power BI and QlikViewExperience in SQL Server, MS Excel and VBA


What we look for

We are looking for people who can demonstrate real impact within talent insights for our clients. We require people who can build our service offerings, understand client needs, grow our internal capability and connect effectively across our global PAS network to maximise our global knowledge and experience in supporting clients to build and develop their talent pool.

What working at EY offers

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes assistance for flexible working and career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions. Plus, we offer:
Coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you
About EY

EY is a global professional services organisation providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction services. We are dedicated to doing our part in building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. And we are united by our shared values and a dedication to delivering exceptional client service

We make sure our people succeed. The networks you build and the experiences you have with us will help define and accelerate the rest of your career. Last year in the UK, nearly 2,000 of our people were promoted or progressed within their grade, and we are significantly increasing the number of partners in the UK. So, when you build something better at EY, we make sure you’re rewarded.

Our People Advisory Services practice has over 10,000 practitioners operating within a globally integrated team, bringing their skills, insights and experience to support our clients.
Driven by our focused insight and innovation, PAS is best positioned to advise and influence our client’s activities at senior leadership level to respond to the scale and complexity of how and where our clients work globally, making us the trusted advisor of choice to our clients and creating more opportunities for our people. As a result, we’re continually seeking new markets, new perspectives and better ways to deliver value.

EY is dedicated to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities. While our client-facing professionals can be required to travel regularly, and at times be based at client sites, our flexible working arrangements can help you to achieve a lifestyle balance.

If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Make your mark.

Apply now.

Title: Team Lead - Portfolio Analytics
Description:
Credit Risk Team Lead – Portfolio Analytics * £Negotiable * Central London * J11175

Our client are committed to putting Data and Technology at the heart of banking, for the benefit of consumers. If you want to work for a company that puts Analytics at the core of what we do, this is the place for you. As they continue to build out their Advanced Analytics and Decision Science capabilities; there is an exciting opportunity for a ‘Senior Doer’ to carve a place for themselves and make a real impact on the development of this new Digital Bank.

Responsibilities will include:

Independent leadership of data analysis and insight delivery
Contributing to the specification, design, build, testing and delivery of data and MI solutions and data lifecycles
Working closely with business stakeholders to understand requirements and elaborate these from business level to data level
Data modelling, including forecasting, PDs, IFRS9
Ensuring data integrity, documentation, validation, stability and controls are in place for all data elements used within the modelling and live production of the model outputs
Supporting in the development, modelling, and execution of the stress testing framework
Providing support and development to junior analysts

Experience and Qualifications:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to question, shape, analyse, understand and explain to a range of technical and non-technical audiences complex requirements
Minimum 5 years’ experience relevant work experience
Good knowledge and understanding of data science principles
Experience with report development and reporting tools (i.e. Tableau)
Good working knowledge of credit risk analytics and behavioural data
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work independently and, at the same time, support the wider project team as needed
Experience using Python – Beginner to Advanced levels considered
Degree level education in mathematics, statistics or data science qualification

To find out more or to apply for this opportunity please contact Teresa Cheeseman on
Show phone number
or email her at teresa.cheeseman@datatech.org.uk

Please be advised that we can only accept candidates who have the right to work in the UK.

Alternatively, you can refer a friend or colleague by taking part in our fantastic referral schemes! If you have a friend or colleague who would be interested in this role, please refer them to us. For each relevant candidate that you introduce to us (there is no limit) and we place, you will be entitled to our general gift/voucher scheme.

Title: Senior Data Analytics Consultant
Description:
Who are we?
Afiniti is the world’s leading applied artificial intelligence and advanced analytics provider. Afiniti Enterprise Behavioral Pairing™ uses artificial intelligence to identify subtle and valuable patterns of human interaction in order to pair individuals on the basis of behaviour, leading to more successful interactions and measurable increases in enterprise profitability. Afiniti operates throughout the world and has measurably driven billions of dollars in incremental value for our clients.

Purpose
Working as the face of the Client Data Services team, you will be a key member who enjoys rolling up their sleeves to solve complex business questions through data. You will be able to partner with and build strong relationships with client partner teams including business owners, marketing, IT and other teams.
You will be able to build a deep understanding of the client partners processes, priorities and goals and be able to articulate them internally. You will also work closely with internal Afiniti data analytics, artificial intelligence and IT teams to develop and deliver the analytic work product.
You’ll be able to pro-actively identify, prioritize and conduct analysis that drives meaningful insight on target objectives.

Key Responsibilities
Liaise with client stakeholders, including senior and executive level client staff, to communicate data requirements and help secure data assets from clients as well as offline data sources
Utilize statistical and analytical methods to provide insights to advise the revenue team, as well as the client on their business, strategy and contact centre operations
Ensure quality, reliability and integrity of data obtained from client sources and offline data sources (ensure that data contains required information for analytics and modelling)
Work with the client to validate data and procedures being used. Reconcile performance data both internally and with the client
Work with the commercial team as well as the AI team to confirm the viability of the optimization metric chosen by the client
Respond to requests for performance results, drill down on results (problem solving analysis) and conduct custom analysis
Perform other duties as assigned - prepare succinct, clear, and easy to follow documents that summarize findings and insights
Responsible for performance reporting aspects on concurrent new installations (or expansions) and for existing billing accounts
You will have
5+ years of working experience
Experience of working in a client facing role; consulting experience preferred
Experience of a call centre environment; ideal candidate will have first-hand experience, understanding call centre hierarchies, technologies, targets, priorities and how they apply to data and performance reporting
Possess the ability to manage clients and internal stakeholders in ensuring that data is received and managed in timely and efficient manner
The ability to convey mathematical concepts in meaningful way to business clients and internal team members
The ability to work independently and in a team environment
The ability to work effectively across functions, levels and disciplines
Knowledge of MS Office Suite – particularly Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Knowledge of SQL; R and Python would be beneficial
Strong knowledge and understanding of statistical concepts
Possess strong problems solving and critical thinking skills
Education & Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Economics, Statistics, Psychology, Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics or Finance

Salary & Package
As well as a competitive base salary dependent on the number of years of experience, we also offer generous stock options, an annual discretionary bonus plus Corporate benefits.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
About the role
The Analytics Capabilities team is a team of Product Management, Data Analysts, BI experts and Analytics Engineers. It is responsible for defining, prioritising and delivering the self-serve analytics strategy, event streaming and optimisation capability, methods and components for enabling real-time, data-driven decision making and customer data insight across all of Tesco’s businesses. It accelerates the self-serve delivery of ad-hoc insight from customer data and enhances the value of our analysis to the business and customers. It connects the customer analytics and insight innovation needs of Tesco’s businesses to our core data platform, tools and services.

You will be responsible for

As a Senior BI Analyst, you are accountable for implementing our self-service analytics strategy, ensuring effective reporting through analytics platforms and contributing to data driven decision making across the broader Tesco business. Collaborate with a cross functional team to develop common approach to automating repetitive reporting tasks. Initiate ideas for the self-service analytics ecosystem development by collaborating with the analytics product team. Drive the acceptance and adoption of ideas and improvement of the self-service analytics and data-driven approach within business users.

Specifically, you will:
Establish, develop and maintain self-service analytics toolkit including end-to-end BI implementation.
Build the self-service analytics ecosystem at Tesco: BI tools deployment, user support, training and communication.
Automating regular reporting to improve visibility of the performance and aid data-driven decision making.
Ensuring data quality and integrity by working with the analytics product development team.
Analysing the existing broader Tesco business processes related to data-driven decision making; to map business reporting requirements to self-service analytics solutions.
Empowering teams across Tesco to use self-service analytics environment to get the most of performance reviews and business insights.
Leverage information from requirements gathering phase and utilize past experience to design flexible and scalable BI solutions.
Training analytics and business teams on the systems, tools and best practices used.

You will need

Expertise of using MI/BI systems and databases such as Hadoop, Teradata and other SQL or NoSQL technologies.
Knowledge and experience of using business intelligence and visualisation tools such as Tableau and MicroStrategy.
Comfortable developing ETL frameworks and processes for automation using software such as Alteryx.
Ability to manipulate, analyse and synthesise data using different sources to create customer led, data driven reports and high impact presentations.
Technical hands on experience running BI tools services – maintaining Linux/Windows servers, installing/upgrading BI server applications, working with Support and Engineering teams to troubleshoot user issues.
Strong understanding of the full data lifecycle and understanding of typical enterprise concerns around data platforms (Governance, Quality, Metadata).
Good knowledge in the use of Tools & Techniques for Backlog prioritisation, managing dependencies and for gaining insights using available data points.
Highly numerate with a university degree of 2:1 or higher in a quantitative discipline or relevant experience.
Broad knowledge and understanding of the technologies relevant to data platforms.
Experience creating outputs for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Experience setting up Analytical Centre of Excellence across functions.
Good Linux skills with experience in shell scripting (to cover various automated tasks such as installation, backup, recovery etc.)
Desired experience with Python, Spark or Scala for data wrangling and building ETL pipelines.

Skills relevant for the job:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
A methodical/ analytical approach and great problem-solving skills
Attitude and the aptitude to learn new product area/domain quickly
Great presentation and persuasion skills
Team player who could work collaboratively with other members of the team

Title: Analytics Delivery Lead
Description:
Are you passionate about using data to drive business decisions?
Can you bring data to life in stories that stick in the minds of your audience?
Have you run more analytics projects than you care to remember?

If so, we have a great opportunity for you!

Team: Global Markets - Strategy and Analysis
Job Rank: Associate Director / Senior Manager

The opportunity
You will be working in a small, agile analytics team within the Global Markets – Strategy & Analysis team; we work with EY’s global leadership to ensure that the best data and analytics-driven insights are used in strategic and operational decision-making across the firm.

Within the analytics team, you will lead our strategic analytics projects to provide innovative, model-driven perspectives on key business questions to a broad audience across EY’s Service Lines and Regions globally, helping to frame the narratives that will ultimately guide how investments are made across our business.

Your key responsibilities

You will develop strategic relationships with our key internal business stakeholders across EY’s Global Markets leadership team.

Your three key areas of focus in this role will be:
Cultivating and managing an evolving portfolio of strategic analytics projects, taking responsibility for their continued success
Overseeing a small global team of data and analytics professionals
Maintaining and evolving our data platform and technical stack
The types of analytics projects you will own include:
Growth opportunity analysis
Designing executive reporting
Business performance analysis
Building recommendation systems
Return on investment analysis on key initiatives
Account portfolio reviews
Account segmentation
Across your project responsibilities you will be required to:
Develop and deliver on product roadmaps
Gather evolving requirements from key business stakeholders
Develop innovative solutions to stakeholder requirements, challenging the status quo when required, in order to impact how the business operates
Create and lead project teams across our onshore and offshore teams and other stakeholders to deliver commercial and business-oriented solutions
Create compelling deliverables (e.g. presentations, interactive dashboards) to communicate key insights and recommendations to senior audiences
You will also proactively identify opportunities for our stakeholders to make better use of data & analytics, anticipating their needs based on your deep understanding of their business.

As a senior leader, you will drive innovation across the team, creating an environment to support the development of new ideas and continuous improvements to ways of working, both within the analytics team and in the teams we work with.

You will also coach junior colleagues to enable them to carry out analysis for senior leaders. This will include managing of workload, quality assessment and evaluation, skill transfer and supervision, and managing deliverable expectations and timeframes across multiple projects.

Skills and attributes for success

We are a diverse team with a variety of skillsets across the data and analytics domains. You are a motivated, curious individual that will use their unique blend of skills and experiences to bring a fresh perspective to our team.

While this is a senior role within the team with people and project management components, it is also a hands-on role; you will personally contribute to the development of both our existing and new analyses.

To qualify for the role, you must have:
Experience in relevant roles, including significant experience in data insight / analytics roles
A strong academic record, ideally with a degree in a technical subject
Experience developing statistical models in a production environment using R or python
A deep understanding of the benefits and limitations of a range of statistical and analytical methods (regression and classification methods, recommendation engines, etc.)
Extensive experience across the software development life cycle, preferably including familiarity at least one formal test framework
An excellent track record in developing and maintaining trusted relationships with senior stakeholders
Experience in data storytelling, especially for non-technical audiences
The ability to determine, explain, and produce the appropriate visualization to illustrate a key insight
Experience in at least one data visualization application e.g. Tableau, Spotfire, Power BI
Experience in developing decision-making models to inform better business decisions
Experience using relational databases to manage and manipulate data for analysis
Ability to quickly grasp complex business problems
Exceptional attention to detail, demonstrated in analysis performed, outputs delivered, and verbal/written communications
The ability to prioritize and balance your time across multiple commitments and help others on the team do the same
Experience leading project teams to deliver efficiently and on time
Ideally, you’ll also have some of the following:
Experience automating the production of data-driven reporting
Experience building interactive dashboards in multiple platforms
Experience working in an agile environment
Experience working in or with a strategy function

What working at EY offers

EY is committed to being an inclusive employer and we are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. We strive to achieve the right balance for our people, enabling us to deliver excellent client service whilst allowing you to build your career without sacrificing your personal priorities.

We offer a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Our comprehensive Total Rewards package includes support for flexible working career development, and with FlexEY you can select benefits that suit your needs, covering holidays, health and well-being, insurance, savings and a wide range of discounts, offers and promotions.

Plus, we offer:

Support, coaching and feedback from some of the most engaging colleagues around
Opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
The freedom and flexibility to handle your role in a way that’s right for you

About EY

As a global leader in assurance, tax, transaction and advisory services, we’re using the finance products, expertise and systems we’ve developed to build a better working world. That starts with a culture that believes in giving you the training, opportunities and creative freedom to make things better. Whenever you join, however long you stay, the exceptional EY experience lasts a lifetime.

Join us in building a better working world.

Apply now.

Title: Senior Exposure and Data Analyst
Description:
Main Purpose of Role
To support and deliver the objectives of the Group Exposure Management through the application of specialist analytical, reporting and project skills. Working with large datasets reflecting both cat and non-cat exposure and collaborating with underwriting, risk, MI and actuarial teams to maintain alignment of our strategic goals with the business. Key parts of the role will include:
The collection, consolidation and curation of accurate exposure data from across the Group to enable effective planning and optimisation.
Production of management information reports to inform strategic business decisions
The application of data modelling, analytics, and MI tools to construct effective management intelligence and decision support for Underwriting, portfolio management, and business planning including optimisation.
The provision of expert advice to business colleagues and external stakeholders to support effective exposure management at Group, business entity, and class levels
The streamlining and automation of processes through digital solutions in order to improve accuracy and efficiency whilst minimising error
Key Accountabilities
Communication of portfolio movements to senior management, Lloyd’s and regulators as required. Ownership of exposure management MI reporting and presentations.
Participation on exposure management regulatory returns
To work with colleagues across the business to continually improve representation of material exposures within ARPS and other systems / tools as necessary.
Development and maintenance of innovative exposure management information tools / reporting / dashboards as business demand dictates.
Assist colleagues within the Exposure Management function, and wider Risk Analytics team as required.
Role Requirements
Skills/Competencies
Experience of working with large datasets to produce clear and actionable MI
Team worker – high level of enthusiasm; ability to get the best from their colleagues and others
Subject knowledge – applies expert knowledge of analytical applications and data to support Group Exposure Management objectives
Organisational skills – consistently delivers tasks and meets deadlines
Attention to detail – works efficiently with minimal errors; checks the work of others diligently
Business minded & results orientated – delivers results that push the business forward
Quality-focussed – continually assessing and finding ways to improve the quality of data and analytical intelligence
Collaborative – establishes excellent relationships; brings people closer together
Qualifications
Excellent academic qualifications including a minimum 2:1 degree in an appropriate subject
Experience working in an exposure / risk management role preferred
Strong mathematical, modelling / technical background
Technical Skills & Experience
Experience of working with analytics in Risk Management, Actuarial or Underwriting MI
Experience of regulatory submissions including Lloyd’s (e.g. LCM & RDS), BMA (e.g. BSCR) and rating agency (S&P; AM Best) preferred
Proficiency in Excel and SQL required
Proficiency in programming languages such as VBA and R preferred
Proficiency in MI tools such as Power BI / R Shiny preferred
Experience with non-property exposure and aggregation systems (e.g. RMS Cyber, Arium, Cyence, Praedicat) desirable
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, ancestry, color, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information, marital status, national origin or citizenship (including language use restrictions), denial of family and medical care leave, disability (mental and physical) , including HIV and AIDS, medical condition (including cancer and genetic characteristics), race, religious creed (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, child birth, breastfeeding, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, child birth or breastfeeding), sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or other status protected by federal, state and/or local laws.
Applicants: If manually entering, only include your most recent or relevant job information needed for this role. For either method, please attach your most current resume. Additional job history may be obtained if selected for the interview process.

Title: Data Engineering Lead (f/m/x) (relocated to Germany)
Description:
Data Engineering Lead (f/m/x)
Location: Tettnang

The challenge
As an engineering lead for the data engineering team in the Data Analytics & Insights unit you are responsible for Avira's data lake infrastructure that is substantial to Avira's credo of being a data-driven company. You are part of the Data Analytics & Insights leadership team and significantly shape the units' future. You lead a team of highly qualified data professionals, currently consisting of a data architect, a DevOps, and three data engineers. In collaboration with various stakeholders throughout the whole company, you design, develop, and maintain the infrastructure for a wide range of business problems: From real-time data integration to GDPR requests to an in-product experimentation framework.

The team
The Data Analytics & Insights team is in charge of Avira's business analytics operations. The unit consists of the data engineering team, the data analysts and scientists team and collaborates on functional projects with stakeholders in product, marketing, and controlling units.

What you will do
Starting from day one, you are familiarizing yourself with our data infrastructure and architecture: AWS as the cloud platform, Kafka as the streaming platform, Spark as the analytical engine, Scala as the main programming language, S3 as the data lake, Athena as the query engine.
Within the first three months, you gained knowledge of the architecture and the business requirements. You work together with the unit lead on a roadmap for future projects and design together with your team the required data architecture.
A year into the job own the data landscape and lead the team with great success. You are connected throughout the whole company with relevant stakeholders and transform the company-wide data pipelines to follow modern architecture.

You have
University degree in computer science or equivalent work experience
5+ years of work experience in data engineering
2+ years of experience in leading data engineering teams
Industrial experience with leading data-intensive projects in the Hadoop-ecosystem and cloud services
Hands-on mentality
Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills

Benefits and perks:
New Work
Stylish building with roof terraces
Canteen and ChocaVira
Modern office concept

Learning & Development
Unlimited access to Udemy
Trainings & Conferences
Specialist Career

Health & Wellbeing
Gym and fitness courses
“JobRad” bike leasing
Medical checkups

Family & Living
Relocation Package
Vacation child care
Avira Prime licences

Events
Onboarding events
Monthly Employee Meetings
Summer & Christmas parties

AN OPPORTUNITY TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE

Update: Although there’s a lot of disruption nowadays due to Covid-19, we at Avira are continuing to run our daily business activities so that we stay true to the promise to our customers - now even more than ever: Protecting people in the connected world.

And we are doing this from the safeness of our own homes. Among other things, this means we are still hiring, but we have moved all our interviews online and all our colleagues are being onboarded remotely

So join us and you will be able to work from home until the danger is over.

We’re an international software company at the forefront of imagining the future of digital security. Avira’s award-winning products and technology protect over 500 million users in the connected world.

What makes us special? First and foremost – it’s the authentic people at Avira. We have a great community feeling that fosters your uniqueness and offers the space to reflect, the feedback to grow, and the freedom to innovate. If you are looking for a culture that also encourages aspiration and professional excellence, get in touch with us and discover the Avira experience firsthand.

Avira
Mircea Enache
mircea.enache(at)avira.com

Title: Strategy and Operations Lead, Global Product Partnerships
Description:
Minimum qualifications:
Master’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience within management consulting or corporate strategy.

Preferred qualifications:
MBA.
Experience leading complex data analyses and translating insights into compelling strategies.
Experience in business development or strategic negotiations.
Experience in publishing, digital media or communications.
Knowledge of regulatory and policy issues related to technology products.
Ability to lead complex operational and strategic initiatives, with increasing levels of responsibility and independence.
About the job
The Business Strategy & Operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. We stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.
Global Product Partnerships (GPP) negotiates and manages Content Partnerships (e.g. data licensing agreements) and Actions Integrations (e.g. collaborations to let users “do things” like reserve a table). These partnerships help build and differentiate Google’s products.
GPP StratOps plays a critical role in driving strategy and execution for GPP. We work directly with GPP leaders on priority topics across all product areas and help the global organization identify, plan for, and execute against their highest priorities.
As Strategy and Operations Lead, you will make sure that we keep our eye on the long-term health of our Products Partnerships, and ensure that things work in our ever-evolving business. You'll work closely with the Managing Director of Product Partnerships in EMEA to identify, prioritize, and execute initiatives that help enable GPP’s strategic partnerships and business development efforts and with the Managing Director of News Product Partnerships Globally to help coordinate and address challenges in the region. You'll act as a thought partner to leadership and an advocate for the team.
Google’s Global Partnerships team powers extraordinary user experiences through partnerships that solve users’ needs, advance our partners’ goals, and further Google’s mission. Our team provides meaningful solutions — from helping publishers and developers grow their businesses through monetization solutions, to helping our long-term partners anticipate and navigate change in a way that delivers economic and reputational value. We build and distribute products through partnerships across a multitude of product areas, including Ads, Search & Assistant, Geo, Platforms & Ecosystems, Devices & Services, Health, Retail, Payments, Next Billion Users, and more. We collaborate across Google, ensuring a coordinated approach when engaging with our most complex and strategic partners.
Responsibilities
Provide day-to-day strategy support to the senior GPP team by developing recommendations that address complex problems.
Support the EMEA Managing Director in driving operational rigor in EMEA by leading planning, hiring and other priority processes.
Collaborate with the broader GPP StratOps team and other GPP Leads on product or feature launches.
Support the execution of a high priority project by coordinating outreach to partners, overseeing budget in different partnerships, and defining and measuring the impact of partnerships.
Build consensus and define priorities across the entire GPP EMEA team as well as cross-functional stakeholders in EMEA.
Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
3-5 years of experience in similar Business Analytics roles
BA or BS in Engineering, Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Computer Science or another technical field
Experience in delivering and influencing business processes using data analysis, including predictive modeling
Experience with statistical analysis, various types of regression modeling and forecasting, time series analysis and data mining using software such as R, SQL, Python, SAS or SPSS
Proficiency with Tableau, Microsoft Excel and VBA for developing interactive reports and advanced data visualizations.
Excellent communication skills and ability to adapt complex topics for audiences across the organization and hierarchy levels
Ability to communicate across all levels of management and excellent verbal and written skills in English

The Amazon Freight product allows Shippers to use Amazon’s transportation network to transport products in bulk across Europe. This is an innovative technology driven solution for the shipping needs of small and large businesses and is scaling rapidly as an offering. Amazon Freight is a part of the Amazon Transportation Services organisation in Europe which is a cutting-edge supply chain technology organisation and responsible for many of Amazon’s best-in-class logistics offerings.

We are looking for a London based Senior Business Intelligence Analyst for the Amazon Freight team. This person will partner with the Amazon Freight's Business Development Managers and Operations Team, responsible for growing and scaling the Business, to help them deliver their objectives across all KPIs.
The Business Intelligence Analyst shall work in a cross-functional environment with the Planning Team, Transportation Operations Teams, and several others to determine future demand and transportation prices which could translates into saving opportunities, using their skills in advanced analytics and statistical modelling.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Understanding existing analytical simulations and assessments and suggesting the business impact of the trends to enable decisions that make sense based on available data
Creating pricing and forecasting models and develop the desired pricing strategy and simulations to drive savings and efficiency in the transportation operations
Extracting and reporting data from numerous databases (using Excel, Access, SQL, Redshift and / or other data management systems) and performing ad hoc reporting and analysis as required
Communicating with external customers (Carriers, Vendors / Suppliers) and internal customers (Finance, Software Support, Fulfillment Centers)

Experience with analytical concepts within transportation e.g. pricing strategy / analytics, forecasting, planning, optimization
Experience developing and growing a business / start-up / association

Title: Data Engineering Lead
Description:

WELL KNOWN MEDIA BRAND
