Title: Senior Customer Analyst
Description:
Senior Customer Analyst - Pricing
London
Up to £70,000 plus extensive bonus and benefits
Harnham are partnered with a high growth FinTech start-up who are seeking a Senior Analyst to work on their pricing and customer insight projects. This high growth tech company have rapidly grown in the last few months and are hiring new analysts due to expansion. The business is looking to advance their analytics function and reduce churn rates, improve targeted customer communications and increase revenue.
Your analysis will have a major effect on this rapidly growing brand. You will work on huge datasets with millions of customers within one of the best FinTech brands in London.
You will champion this business area internationally and work closely with the CEO and other stakeholders in the C-Suite. You will identify trends in the data and also help with pricing analytics, revenue, customer insight, financial forecasting and forecasting key business metrics.
Senior Analyst- Pricing
Working in a highly advanced analytics function and perform deep dive analytics
Work on pricing analytics projects and revenue management
Use SQL/R/Python daily to analyse millions of rows of data to help drive revenue
Analyse customer lifetime value and present this to the board
Work cross functionally with marketing, data science and finance teams to help drive analytics and insight based decisions
Work on customer acquisition and customer retention projects
You will be a part of advanced analytics work too e.g. modelling and personalisation
You don't have to tick all of the boxes but some of the following would be relevant:
You will have commercial experience in SQL and R/Python
You will ideally have had exposure to pricing analytics and revenue management
You will have experience within customer insight and marketing functions
Ideally you will have experience analysing customer, transactional and/or online data
Salary and Benefits
The successful candidate can expect to earn up to £70,000!
Please note that our client is currently running a fully remote interview process, and able to on-board and hire remotely as well.

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
Opportunity Overview
WarnerMedia Inc. is a leading media and entertainment company that creates and distributes premium and popular content from a diverse array of talented storytellers and journalists to global audiences through its consumer brands including: HBO, Warner Bros., TNT, TBS, truTV, CNN, DC Entertainment, New Line, Cartoon Network, Adult Swim, Turner Classic Movies and others. These brands fall into four distinct business units, WarnerMedia Entertainment, WarnerMedia News & Sports, Warner Bros.; and WarnerMedia Affiliates and Advertising Group.

Overview:

The Senior Data Engineer will be responsible for partnering with WarnerMedia International Stakeholders to develop and delivery data engineering, data integration and data pipeline capabilities in support of our DTC products. To be successful in the role you’ll need to be intellectually curious, detail-oriented, open to new ideas and create new ideas, solution approach and possess good data skills and strong aptitude for quantitative methods. The role requires experience with SQL, Advanced SQL with NoSQL/RDBMS preferable with Snowflake DB Cloud Database. And role also requires data warehouses, data lake, knowledge of scripting languages python3, operating on linuxOS, Cloud Infrastructure preferably AWS. Experience and understanding of BI tools and data modeling like snowflake, star schema, ODS and MPP/SMP systems.

What you’ll be doing:
Thorough understanding of WarnerMedia International’s business, ad tech, and data.
Design, Develop and Deploy data engineering and pipeline capabilities that includes a focus on consistency, scale and operational excellence, providing better data quality aspects with optimal and performance solutions.
Create, identify and maintain data patterns, metadata and provide better solution which adhere to data governance, compliance and security policy.
Create solutions to transform data from various sources and load it into the WarnerMedia International Data Platform
Develop and maintain standards for administration and operation including the scheduling, running, monitoring, logging, management of errors, recovery from failures, and validation of outputs.
Contribute to the project planning process by estimating tasks and deliverables.
Work closely with Architect, Track leads, Business Intelligence Managers, Business users, Data Architects, Business Analysts, Scrum Masters and peer developers to understand requirements, design and develop data solutions.
Be at the cutting edge of utilizing data about consumers in the media industry to improve audience experience.
Help out with complex analytical tasks.
What we’re looking for:

Required Skills:
Solid experience as a database developer in building data pipeline using scripting and SQL environment on cloud infrastructure.
Experience with data management/business intelligence concepts, methodologies, and technologies.
Familiarity with FOSS and Cloud tools.
Proven experience working in Data Warehouse, Data Lake, Data Mart environment.
Expert knowledge in SQL and Data Pipeline.
Expertise in database platforms such as RDBMS or NOSQL platforms.
Experience with “big data” platform such as Spark, Hadoop, NoSQL DBs or cloud-based databases such as Snowflake.
Familiar with Agile and SCRUM methodologies.
Self-starter, team oriented and very analytical mindset.
Excellent planning, organization and time management skills including the ability to support and prioritize multiple projects.
Track record of consistently delivering projects and taking accountability for work and results.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Ability to partner with various teams (non-technical to technical).
Demonstrates forward thinking and plans ahead for potential roadblocks; comprehends bigger picture of the business strategy.
Strong oral, written and presentation skills.
Desirable Skills:
Coding skills in one of the modern languages Python, Scala, Java,Unix Shell, SQL and Advanced SQL
Specific application experience with media, Web analytics and consumer data systems will be a plus.
Preference for prior technology or media company experience.
Experience working with Cloud Environment, NoSQL Database such as Snowflake, Linux Platform and Containers.

What’s on offer:

This role comes with a competitive salary and a wide range of benefits and perks, including private medical, generous pension contribution, company bonus and flexible working hours. You’ll have 23 days holiday and we’ll also give you 40 hours per year for you to use for volunteering or charitable work.

Title: Senior Web Analyst
Description:
The Team: English Live
The English Live central team is responsible for all project initiatives relating to EF English Live web presences & analytics globally.
Collaborating with all EL offices globally the team is an integral part of EL Marketing and web brand initiatives.

We are a fun young team on a mission to become the leader online platform that helps people changing their life. We believe data will help us getting there. If you want to be part of something more than your 9-5 this is the team to join.

The Role
We are looking for an experienced web analyst to support the wider digital department and drive key insights around our key KPIs and act as the central point for all data. The senior web analyst will be supporting the wider teams around our customer data, conversion funnel, customer journey and performance marketing. The senior analyst will take full ownership of our Google Marketing Platform 360, working closely with all relevant stakeholders in further development and adding additional solutions.
Take full responsibility of journeys tagging to enable accurate tracking, optimising and updating tags/pixels using GTM360
Own Daily/Weekly/Monthly KPI reporting with dashboards for the wider teams using Data Studio
Monitor and report on website performance using GA360 as the key analytics tool
Support the wider team to translate business goals and requirements into KPIs and measurable events
Analyse and present actionable insights to improve conversion, ad spend and ROI
Create tailored audience lists and segmentation for the performance team, focusing on ad spend and ROI improvements
Help the teams better understand our customers and conversion pain points, shopping behavior, checkout behaviour and conversion funnels
Support the performance team in Attribution modelling, cross-device tracking and omnichannel analysis
Connecting GA360 with the various products along with CRM data
Deep level analysis using Google BigQuery
Support the integration of GA data with Data Lake & Data Warehouse
What we are looking for:
The profile
Extensive experience in web analytics
Understanding of user experience best practices
Solid analytics and problem-solving skills working within different web environments
Ability to interpret data and transform information into meaningful conclusions and recommendations.
A proactive, constructive, and committed attitude; demonstrates great follow-through.
Solid time management skills demonstrated by the ability to execute on multiple projects while working on a tight deadline.
Knowledge of another language is a plus
Sales-minded, with sound understanding of lead generation
Eager to learn & innovative
Goal-oriented, self-motivated, creative, flexible and adaptable to new situations
The Skill
Educated to degree level preferably in Maths, Computer Science, Statistics or similar
Extensive knowledge of Google 360 Platforms, including reporting and customisation
Background in consumer analytics preferable
An understanding of performance marketing channels and customer segmentation
Understanding of cloud data storage (data lake, data warehouse) such as AWS & Snowflakes or similar platforms preferred
Exposure to crawl software such as Optimise360 or other similar MVT solutions
Knowledge in SQL, HTML and Javascript preferable

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Bulb is the UK's fastest growing energy supplier, providing affordable, renewable energy to homes and businesses across the UK. Founded in 2015, Bulb's mission is to help its members reduce their bills and their carbon impact.
We were the UK’s fastest growing private company in 2018 and 2019, and are included in LinkedIn’s 2018 list of the top 25 UK tech startups to work for. Bulb is a Living Wage Employer and a certified B Corp, working to demonstrate how business can be a force for good.

What you’ll do at Bulb
Working across Bulb’s product teams and reporting to the Head of Data Science and Analytics you’ll take ownership for Bulb’s analytics function, making sure that Bulb’s Data Win’s value is in evidence across the company.

Growing a team of analysts across pods, scaling our Analytics function
Continuing building Bulb’s self-service data platform
Analysing data and presenting insights to answer important business questions
Working closely with other teams senior leadership, to define, develop and improve KPIs
Building dashboards to communicate data across Bulb and to third parties
Running statistical experiments to optimise Bulb’s Business
Running training to help Data win
Collaborating with the Data Science team to scope and prioritise projects
Requirements

Have strong SQL skills - able to manipulate, analyse and model large volumes of data with a high level of accuracy
Experience with one or more of Python, R, Looker, Tableau, Mode
Be a smart, strategic thinker who is great at solving problems (not just ones that involve numbers!)
Have great communication skills and confident working with stakeholders across the business including senior management
Be able to prioritise a long list of requests into a work plan and manage expectations accordingly
Have at least 3-5 years experience working with data in a fast-paced company
Be a team player: you see your work as part of the team’s overall plan, and within that you’re happy either driving your own project or supporting team members with theirs
Have an ownership mentality: don't just execute what's asked of you, but question whether we've asked you the right question or if it could be done a better way
Have a can-do attitude: Bulb is a fast-paced environment, you need to be resilient and calm under pressure
Benefits
Be part of a growing technology startup and help shape the future of energy
Collaborative, flexible, and friendly environment
Competitive salary and share options. We all own a bit of Bulb.
33 days holiday a year (including bank holidays) and the option to buy up to 5 more
12 weeks of full pay for maternity, paternity or adoption leave
Healthcare and life insurance
Cycle to work scheme; activities to improve your mental & physical well being, including office yoga and meditation; monthly team socials
One month sabbatical leave after your first year
Tea, coffee, fruit and snacks throughout the day
Free breakfast on Mondays

Title: Senior Insight Analyst
Description:
Senior Insight Analyst
London
Retail Analytics
Up to £65,000 + Benefits
A leading retail company is looking for a talented senior insight analyst to join their customer analytics team. The role will focus on advanced analytics such as customer segmentation, profiling and predictive modelling and in turn, providing easily understood actionable insight for a variety of stakeholders using SQL, R and Python.
Duties and Responsibilities - Senior Insight Analyst
Investigating, interpreting and understanding complex unstructured data and translating that into value driven insight
Communicate complex data and methodologies clearly and effectively to internal and external stakeholders
Manipulating and interpreting large database tables with millions of rows of data
Utilise tools such as SQL and Excel to create propensity/regression/CHAID/clustering models to help understand customer behaviours
Work closely with various teams within the business to gain a holistic view of customers, trends and competitors
Skills and Qualifications - Senior Insight Analyst
Experience and knowledge in SQL
Advanced Excel experience
Prior data analytics and optimisation experience, specifically focusing on segmentation, regression or clustering
University degree, preferably in a numerate discipline
Excellent communication skills
Ability to carry out a senior role within the team, mentoring junior analysts, as well as working independently to meet tight deadlines
Salary and Benefits - Senior Insight Analyst
Up to £65,000 + Benefits
How To Apply - Senior Insight Analyst
Please register your interest by submitting your CV via the apply link on this page.

Title: Senior - Data Engineers (G)
Description:
Senior Data Engineer - £Competitive Salary – Plus Benefits – Kent or Yorkshire – J10982
This great role offers the opportunity to learn and grow whilst helping deliver a companywide technology transformation project. This very well known service provider is at the beginning of a very exciting digital transformation journey and are fully committed to the development of team members to build a spectacular working environment.

Role & Responsibilities
You will be working as part of a Scrum team aimed at delivering fast results in an Agile environment.
Help revolutionise the digital experience.
Assist in delivering the new AWS platform, using your strategic understanding of platforms.
Create a scalable environment that can grow as the company does.
Lead on the creation of processes for data deployment and integration.
Give the data analysts and data scientists the information they need when they need it to deliver the best service for customers.
Continuously improve & innovate to deliver business values for the Group.

Experience & Skills Required
Educated to degree level in a relevant discipline
Create production ready code.
Strive to find the easiest and most direct solutions to connect and query data.
Have a good understanding of data architecture to and deliver logical data structures.
Demonstrable experience developing and analysing both SQL and NoSQL databases.
Foster and cultivate an Agile culture.
Ensure the smooth and rapid transitioning of prototype data products into robust product assets.
Use commercial awareness, influence and communicate across multiple business areas.
Promote new opportunities for data to be used effectively.

If you fit the above job description, please contact Teresa Cheeseman or email her on teresa.cheeseman@datatech.org.uk. Please be advised that we can only accept candidates who have the right to work in the UK.

Alternatively, you can refer a friend or colleague by taking part in our fantastic referral schemes! If you have a friend or colleague who would be interested in this role, please refer them to us. For each relevant candidate that you introduce to us (there is no limit) and we place, you will be entitled to our general gift/voucher scheme.

Datatech is one of the UK’s leading recruitment agencies in the field of analytics and host of the critically acclaimed event, Women in Data UK. For more information visit our website: www.datatech.org.uk

Title: Leading US Life sciences / biotech Venture Capital
Description:
This individual will have a strong scientific and/or medical background in addition to an interest in, and some experience of, working in a capital investment or biotechnology start-up environment. He/she must also have strong professional skills and presence, good written and oral communication skills, and be capable of engaging with senior leaders and stakeholders across many sectors.
Your Duties:
Supporting venture partners and other investment professionals in the detailed review of new investment opportunities or scientific ideas
Performing industry landscape evaluations and strategic review of emerging technologies, disease areas, or scientific proposals
Conducting analysis on company materials
Conducting market sizing and competitor research
Building financial models to stress test unit economics and valuations
Leading or participating in meetings with founders
Supporting the development of a network of founders and investment professionals
Supporting the development of the deal pipeline and deal execution
Your profile:
You have scientific or medical training to Ph.D. or M.D. from a top university with a proven track record of academic/professional scientific achievements
You have an entrepreneurial mind-set with a keen interest in biotechnology/pharmaceutical technologies and start-ups evidenced through a good knowledge of the sector.
You have some previous work experience in a biotechnology start-up, top-tier healthcare consulting firm, or Venture Capital
You can effectively work in an independent, structured and goal-oriented manner
You have a high degree of comfort with analytics, numbers and the capability to draw decisions based on both intuition and data
You are team oriented and ambitious
Your opportunity:
A fast-paced working environment with challenges that let you grow day by day and great opportunity to progress within the firm
Flat hierarchies with space for your own ideas in a dynamic, dedicated and motivating environment

Title: Senior Software Engineer - Feeds SDLC
Description:
Real-time market data is at the core of Bloomberg's business and we are responsible for the software that provides it. Our feed handlers consume data from hundreds of exchanges and financial institutions around the world and translate it into normalized streams. The data we provide is flowing into applications across Bloomberg and ultimately is used by clients driving financial markets. Performance and reliability are key features of our software, and our mission is to provide the best quality financial data in the world.
Our team:
Our mission as the Feeds SDLC Team is “Enabling developers to deliver high-quality software fast”. Feeds SDLC is the center of excellence in Feeds for SDLC/DevX topics such as CI/CD pipelines, local development, software quality, software analytics, gamification, automated testing, automated code fixing, and automated code review. We work closely with Developer Experience, CTO and Corporate Security teams and develop engineering-wide solutions or contribute to existing ones to accomplish our mission. We are an enthusiastic team who are all passionate about their jobs and learning more. Feeds SDLC team is also involved in research projects and collaborates with universities in state-of-the-art Software Engineering research.
What’s in it for you:
You will work with a wide-range of technologies and tools (Docker, Python, Groovy, Java, Ruby, C++, Javascript, Jenkins, SonarQube, Node.js, Github Apps, Nexus, Chef, Jupyter Notebook, Apache Spark, Scikit-Learn, SciPy, Hadoop, etc.)
You will have a chance to be involved in research projects and collaborate with universities in state-of-the-art Software Engineering research
You will be working in a diverse, flexible, enthusiastic, close-knit team
You will have opportunities to work together with Feeds developers in different locations around the world (New York, Tokyo, Hong Kong, London)
You’ll need to have:
A passion for learning about new areas and state-of-the-art technologies in SDLC/Developer Experience
Experience with Python, Docker/Docker-compose
Experience with CI/CD pipelines
The ability to learn new technologies and quickly adapt them
Strong communication and collaboration skills, and an interest in working with various development teams who depend on us

We’d love to see:
Experience with Machine Learning
Passion to collect and analyse software engineering data to understand, predict and improve software development process

We'll trust you to:
Design, develop, and deploy applications that accomplish our mission of “Enabling developers to deliver high-quality software fast”
Support and maintain our existing solutions throughout their lifecycle
Collaborate and communicate with various Feeds development teams to provide a high-quality developer experience

At Bloomberg we are extremely proud of our diverse, open, and inclusive culture. We value diversity of thought and perspective in every form. We're looking for engineers with a real passion for writing reusable, efficient solutions to complex problems, who can adapt to an ever-changing market landscape, and who can collaborate and work effectively on small teams to develop software that impacts thousands of financial institutions and decision-makers around the world.
Bloomberg is an equal opportunities employer, and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Senior Research Assistant
Description:
Senior Research Assistant
- (003831)
Primary Location UK-ENG-London
Job Research
Organisation DATA ANALYTICS TRANSFORMATION DIR
Job Posting 15-Jul-2020, 7:40:10 AM

The Bank of England is the UK's central bank. Our mission is to deliver monetary and financial stability for the British people.

The Bank of England is a diverse organisation. Each of its 4,000 plus people are committed to public service and dedicated to promoting the good of the people of the United Kingdom by maintaining monetary and financial stability.
The Data and Statistics Division (DSD), part of the Data and Analytics Transformation Directorate (DAT), is the central data division with responsibilities that span production and management of some of the Bank’s core datasets to aspects of data management and data culture that reach into the working lives of almost all Bank staff. This is a time of significant change as the way we collect and manage data, and compile statistics, evolves in the light of the use of new technology with DSD at the forefront. The change draws on a wide range of skill sets, including: data management; data science; operational work; subject matter expertise in aspects of economics, statistics and banking and insurance supervision; and people and process management. The Household and Rates team focuses on the compilation and communication of key features of the household lending and deposit data that the Bank publishes, and quality assurance and management of the granular Product Sales Database (PSD) and Buy to Let (BtL) collections.

Job description
We are recruiting for a Scale H Junior Analyst / Senior RA to work on producing the Bank’s interest rate statistics in the Household and Rates team. The job holder will combine skills in analytical tools, such as R, with an interest in data on household lending and interest rates. The job offers the opportunity of developing both analytical and technical skills, and has the flexibility to be moulded towards the job holder’s current skills.

The job holder would spend approximately half their time producing and explaining the monthly statistics on household lending and interest rates. They would use the knowledge gained from this, and their technical (eg R) skills, to improve the efficiency of data processes across the H&R Team’s varied data sets, and DSD more widely. This work is varied, and could include developing processes for handling loan-level data, visualising data in Tableau dashboards, or working on DSD wide projects to use R to design and implement more automated processes for quality assuring and aggregating data.

The specific responsibilities undertaken by the job holder will depend on their skill set. The role will involve being part of the monthly data round, helping compile and explain movements in the Lending-to-Individuals (LtoI) and/or Effective and Quoted Interest Rates data. This part of the role will take around half the month. As part of this the job holder will:
Conduct due diligence on banks’ returns and MoneyFacts data to understand unusually large movements or spurious stability in the data;
Capture market intelligence from individual banks as part of the due diligence process, identifying common themes and stories that emerge;
Have the opportunity to present the latest developments in the data to other areas of the Bank, for example via presenting at the “Latest Trends in DSD Data” meeting, and writing the Rates Indicator.
Explain technicalities and movements in the data in response to queries from internal and external users.
Depending on the skills and development wishes of the applicant, the job holder will also have the opportunity to be involved in some of the following:
Maintenance and development of Tableau Dashboards to allow a ‘self-service’ culture for data.
Maintaining and developing scripts (R and Python) for obtaining data from MoneyFacts.
Designing and implementing process in R for cleaning loan-level mortgage data.
Use R to design and implement more automated processes for checking and aggregating data, including building on Machine Learning techniques developed in DSD.
Be involved with DSD wide projects, including to use technology to design the future of plausibility checking data, or build a tool that allows effective sharing of information about data returns across teams in DSD.
Contribute to users understanding of our data, for example via writing the Money and Credit Indicator, or statistical release.

The job holder will also be encouraged to actively challenge the way we work, and suggest ways in which we can use technology to work more effectively and inclusively as a team


Role Requirements


Essential criteria
Strong technology skills, including the desire to develop these skills further. A good understanding of tools such as R, Tableau or Python would be helpful, but a desire to learn R would be vital;
A keen interest in understanding banks’ interactions with households, and how developments relate to policy issues of our users;
Good numeracy skills;
Strong interpersonal skills to be able to work across a large team;
Be well organised, and able to make progress on projects whilst dealing with the commitments of a monthly round;
Ability to work autonomously.

As a unique institution, we have a reward package which sets us apart from other organisations. It includes a competitive salary, but also a much wider offering, including a defined benefit pension and comprehensive flexible benefits. We also offer a working environment which fully supports individuals through flexible working, wellbeing initiatives including an on-site medical and dental unit.
This specific role offers a base salary of approx £28,050 (subject to experience and skillset)
The total package also includes:
A non-contributory, career average pension giving you a guaranteed retirement benefit of 1/95th of your annual salary for every year worked.
A discretionary performance award based on a current award pool and target award of 10%, with a maximum potential award of 25%
A 7% benefits allowance with the option to take as salary or purchase a wide range of flexible benefits
25 days annual leave with option to buy up to 13 additional days through flexible benefits
Private medical insurance and income protection insurance

We anonymise applications so hiring managers will not be able to see your personal information when reviewing your submission, including your CV. Please fully complete the application form questions as requested as any incomplete submissions may not be reviewed.
The closing date for applications is 5th August.
We continue to build an inclusive culture where everyone can be their whole selves and produce their best work. Our focus on inclusion is intended to build greater diversity in order to reflect the society we serve and be an employer of choice.


Please apply online, ensuring that you answer the application questions, complete the work history and submit your CV.

Title: Senior Customer Insight Analyst
Description:
The Company
With their innovative business model, this company has been experienced massive year on year growth. Breaking the mould of traditional retail companies, this ecommerce business depends on innovative technology driven solutions, with a huge focus on data and analytics. With excellent avenues for progression across the business? analytics functions.
The Role
This role sits within the Grocery Insight Team, who work with stakeholders within buying, merchandising and marketing, to utilise the vast amounts of data at their disposal in order to create valuable insights to support decision making.
With a focus on customer analytics, you will be dedicated to projects concerning predicting lifetime value of customers, segmenting the customer base to better understand how they shop and then using this to recommend changes to: marketing campaigns, range, pricing and promotions and building an acquisition attribution model to calculate return on marketing investments.
This is an opportunity to gain line management experience as well because you will have one graduate analyst reporting into you.
With daily use of SQL, Python and Tableau this is a brilliant opening for an analyst with an inquisitive mindset to join a company that offers excellent development and progression opportunities.
The Requirements
Excellent academics from a top university
Experience in an analytical role within a commercial environment, preferably customer or marketing focused
Strong communication skills to effectively manage stakeholders
Proficient user of SQL and Excel, other tools will be taught
Job Owner: d.prosser

Title: Diversity and Inclusion Lead
Description:
Global Payroll Lead | London
We're looking for a Diversity and Inclusion Lead to help us take positive action and make meaningful progress on our journey towards becoming a truly inclusive and diverse company. You'll bring your awareness and knowledge of inclusion, diversity, equity and equality to a fast-growing company on a mission. You'll help define the vision and work with our teams to make it happen.
Your mission
There's been lots of work on Diversity and Inclusion initiatives in various pockets of TransferWise. You'll help us bring this work together and build a framework and roadmap to make real impact and change.
This isn't a role for someone who typically directs a strategy but doesn't get involved in the doing. Instead, this role would suit someone hands-on who can own and deliver work and also drive accountability in others.
You'll bring together people from across TransferWise as part of the Inclusion and Diversity Guild to focus on specific projects (see 2020 focus areas below), champion different teams by running focused projects and empower inclusive communities and safe spaces for our employees
You'll build tools, resources and best practice to run projects that are scalable and practical so that our people and teams can take action themselves
You'll challenge us to work harder and go beyond performative gestures, guiding teams and leaders to champion inclusion and diversity
You'll build a strategy and focus areas for your work and develop a plan to make it happen. A natural doer, you'll create something, test it, see what works, iterate and empower people to do more themselves
Things that come naturally to you:
Collaboration - You're a team player and can project manage and coordinate global cross-team projects and campaigns (internal and external)
Relationship building - You're someone who builds trust by having open and ongoing (and sometimes hard) conversations to take people across all levels of seniority on a journey towards more awareness, education and inclusion
Problem-solving - You're great at getting to the root of problems, mapping out multiple solutions and then creating practical actions plans that get things moving and have measurable impact and results
Measuring progress - You're comfortable using data to track, measure and report on progress for both internal and external audiences and understand when you've made an impact. You can tell a story and take people on a journey using data
Growing thought leader - You regularly attend industry events, and perhaps you're a contributor to the conversation (Twitter, blogs, etc.). You understand inclusion and diversity is a journey, and you like to keep yourself informed and educated on the topic
This role will give you the opportunity to:
Choose your own path to impact - we believe people are most empowered when they can act autonomously. So rather than telling you what to do, you'll work with your team to create a vision of your own. Of course, you can always gather feedback from smart, curious people across TransferWise but you'll have the freedom to make your own calls
Inspire teams with your ideas and knowledge and self-starting attitude - we're open-minded, we want to learn, and we want you to challenge us. This is an opportunity for you to use your skills to make real change
Grow as a leader and help shape and build Inclusion and Diversity at TransferWise - working within the Employer Brand, Inclusion and Diversity team you'll be a pioneer and champion for the strategy we shape and deliver. We're one of the fastest-growing companies in the world, so your role and remit has the opportunity to grow with us
Example work and projects
Inclusion and diversity is a broad remit. You can't solve everything at once, so you'll work with your Team Lead to narrow your focus on what areas you feel will have the most impact. To give you an idea, below are some of the types of projects you could be working on:
You might work with specific teams, for example, Engineering or Product to solve a diversity or inclusion challenge for example how to achieve gender-balanced applications by widening our candidate pool and funnel
You could think about how we can use an internal voluntary self-identification survey to understand the diversity of our employees and think about how best we can use the data to make interventions and positive impact
We've built the foundations for what inclusion and diversity means for us at TransferWise, but you'll help us take this further and build a narrative that inspires candidates to join us and every employee to feel that they belong and can be themselves at work
Assess and benchmark TransferWise against other companies and within industry to figure out what's best practice
Put in place support systems and safe spaces for our employees from underrepresented communities. Build a framework to grow these communities (for example our Black Lives Matter steering group and allies) and a way to measure impact longer-term
Launch and pilot inclusion training to build cultural awareness and measure the impact
Diversity and Inclusion at TransferWise
TransferWise was built for people without borders - expats, students, immigrants, freelancers, traders, businesses and everyday people from all walks of life. We're proud to have a truly international team from 70+ nationalities, and we celebrate our differences.
Having diverse teams that reflect our diverse customer base helps us build a better product. We can be more creative and empathetic to our customer's needs and life experiences. We want to make sure we leave no-one behind on our journey to making moving money around the world free for everyone.
Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every person feels respected, empowered to share their contributions towards our mission and able to progress in their careers.
Our D&I focus areas in 2020 are:

Attraction and hiring

Our goal is to increase the number of people who identify as women to apply for Product and Engineering roles and build awareness of our career proposition in target communities
We're working hard to build a fair and inclusive hiring process to mitigate bias, evaluate candidates fairly and consistently and measure progress

Learning and development

Increase our knowledge of our employee and candidate diversity to see where we have areas that we can focus on to make the most impactful interventions to increase diversity and build inclusion
Help our leads and their teams create an open and inclusive, trusting environment where people feel safe to be themselves.

Support for all

Build a framework that empowers Inclusive Communities and safe spaces for our people to celebrate our different communities
Help our employees build empathy and an understanding of each other and increase our knowledge of inclusion and difference
Your team
Your role will sit within the Employer Brand, Inclusion and Diversity team, reporting into the Global Lead for Employer Brand, Inclusion and Diversity. We're a small team and you'll be our first hire focused purely on D&I.
Based in the People team, we're collaborators in the truest sense focusing on internal and external programmes across the full candidate/employee journey. Teams we work closest with are: Recruitment, PR, Internal Comms and Brand, Performance Marketing (Paid and Organic Social), People Operations, People Reward, People Development, People Analytics, Design, Creative & Buzz to name a few!
We then bring people together as part of the Diversity and Inclusion Guild. Guilds are an alliance of people with the same skillset or working on similar projects that come together regularly to align on what they're working on, plan and share knowledge. Examples include the Analytics, iOS, D&I and Android Guilds. You can read more about how we work in this guide.
We're people without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We want to work with the best people, no matter their background. So if you're passionate about learning new things and keen to join our mission, you'll fit right in.

Also, qualifications aren't that important to us. If you've got great experience, and you're great at articulating your thinking, we'd like to hear from you.

And because we believe that diverse teams build better products, we'd especially love to hear from you if you're from an under-represented demographic.

Key details
Office: London
Salary range: £50,000 to £70,000
We encourage people who fall outside of this range to apply if you feel you are the right fit for this role.
Key benefits:
Flexible working - whether it's working from home, school plays or life admin we get that flexibility is essential and you're trusted to do the right thing and be responsible
Stock options in a profitable company
Generous parental leave
Private healthcare plan
Pension scheme
Relocation support
Lots of development opportunities
A fun work environment with social activities and events
The opportunity to work with super smart, curious people
View all our benefits in London

Title: Senior BI Engineer
Description:
Senior BI Engineer
Depop is the fashion marketplace where the next generation buy, sell and get inspired. We are headquartered in London, UK with locations in Manchester, New York, Los Angeles and Australia. We have almost 20 million registered users in 147 countries. In the UK, 1 in 3 Gen Z/Millennials are registered and in the US we have grown 300% over two years. We are also the only European player to have recently entered the top 25 shopping apps by daily active users.
Our mission is to empower the next generation to transform fashion, and our team of over 200 people are dedicated to serving the needs of our global community.
We operate on three pillars:
Community: Our buyers, sellers and employees are inclusive, diverse and accessible. We are committed to empowering diversity within the fashion community.
Entrepreneurship: We support our community and help them build their business with Depop. We thrive on supporting innovation by shaping an environment where creators, makers or hustlers can thrive.
Sustainability: Depop helps extend the life of garments and reduce waste, we care about the world and want to make a positive change within the fashion industry.
Read a little more about us here.

The Depop Insights Team:
Depop's Insights team sits at the heart of our business. As a fashion marketplace with millions of monthly active users, we have a lot of data at our fingertips. Right now, we are looking for a talented Senior Business Intelligence Engineer to become an integral member of our Insights team. In this role, you will help manage our growing information needs and support analysis of increasingly complex business problems by taking ownership of our BI and reporting tools, including Looker, and ensure that the data infrastructure supporting these tools runs smoothly.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for the overall delivery of the entire BI/ETL pipeline, including ETL development and delivery, resource scheduling and QA.
Design, build and maintain data sets and table structures, and the ETL processes required to populate them, in order to enable key business processes and the design and development of analytics visualizations.
Proactively identify and implement ways to improve data processes and warehousing for the Insights team.
Design and own technical implementation of various BI tools needed by the business, including becoming the primary custodian of Looker and LookML within Depop.
Support technical aspects of dashboard building and other data visualizations as needed by end-users.
Support and coordinate other large-scale BI projects within Depop.
Requirements:
Must-haves:
Proficiency in SQL including a solid understanding of how to optimise query performance.
Experience creating resilient ETL pipelines with workflow management tools such as Airflow or Luigi.
Advanced knowledge in a high-level programming language commonly used in ETL pipelines, such as Python or Scala.
In-depth knowledge of AWS data solutions such as Redshift, S3, and Athena.
Familiarity with best-in-class BI and reporting tools like Looker, Chartio, Tableau,
Mixpanel, Google Analytics, etc..
Ability to display complex quantitative data in a simple, intuitive format and to present findings in a clear and concise manner.
Collaborative and humble team player with an ability to work with cross-functional teams, including technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Comfortable working in a fast-past environment and able to respond to change or uncertainty with a positive attitude and a willingness to learn.
BA/BS in a technical field such as Computer Science, Engineering, or Statistics, preferred.


Bonus points for:
Previous experience in Looker implementation and familiarity with LookML.
Benefits
Depop offers the opportunity to work in one of the UK's fastest-growing scale-ups, with a vibrant and diverse group of people, building a product we all deeply care about, in addition to:
Learn and Grow: We sponsor and run a myriad of programmes, conferences and meet-ups to up-skill our employees and enhance their journey with us, just ask!
Wellbeing: We care about wellbeing. We offer a cycle to work scheme, healthy fruit and snacks in the office, breakfast every Tuesday, eye-care vouchers and a discounted gym membership.
Mental Health: Mental health is a top priority for Depop. We offer subsidised counselling appointments through SelfSpace, have mental health first aiders and also run yoga, meditation and more.
Work/life balance: We have 25 days of holiday with the opportunity to buy or sell 5 more, a day off for activism, and sabbaticals for our long-serving employees.
Family life: We offer flexible working (based on your team), generous parental leave policies, and, all of our offices are dog-friendly! Do your best work with your best friend.
Financial: We match up to 6% on your pension and offer discounts through BenefitHub.
Fun: We love to celebrate our successes at Depop. On Friday we finish an hour early to socialise with free food, and have amazing Winter and Summer Parties. We also host internal employee socials such as quiz night, games night, movie night and more.

Depop is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Sr. Business Intelligence Engineer - Logistics
Description:
MBA/MS in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Business Analytics, Information Systems or related field.
7+ years of relevant work experience in a role requiring application of analytic skills to integrate data into operational planning or advanced degree.
Advanced knowledge of SQL and ETL jobs.
Advanced understanding and experience working with data warehousing, data quality.
Recent experience applying visualization tools such as interactive GIS visualization and processing systems, Tableau, Qlik View to data elements.
Recent experience implementing basic software solutions to automate data source, visualization and/or data modeling application.
Customer focus and professional demeanor.
Organizational skill and an operations mindset.
An ability and interest in working in a fast-paced and rapidly-changing environment.
Ability to understand operations at a detailed, practical level and to think big / strategically
A work ethic based on a strong desire to exceed expectations.
Interpersonal skills, including written and oral communication skills.

Sr Business Intelligence - Amazon Logistics:

Have you ever ordered a product on Amazon and when that box with the smile arrived you wondered how it got to you so fast? Have you wondered where it came from and how much it cost Amazon to deliver it to you? If so, the WW Amazon Logistics, Last Mile team is for you. We manage the delivery of tens of millions of products every week to Amazon’s customers, achieving on-time delivery in a cost-effective manner to deliver a smile for our customers.

Amazon Logistics is looking for a customer focused, analytically and technically skilled Business Intelligence Engineer to drive effective performance measurement and management, innovation and execution in last mile delivery. This position will be responsible for leading a BIE team building out analysis and visualization tools and processes’ to support our growing Amazon Logistics business in Europe and World-Wide.

The successful candidate will be able to effectively retrieve, integrate, visualize and present critical data to improve the efficiency of the package delivery network, and enable efficient management of a large global logistics system. This individual will work with technical and business teams to optimize planning, execution, process improvement and track progress against goals. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities as well as outstanding business acumen and comfort with technical teams and systems. The successful candidate will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, and enjoy working with large scale of data.

Core Job Responsibilities include:
Partner with internal stakeholders across multiple teams, gathering requirements and delivering complete solutions
Partner with Data Engineering and Software Development Engineers to prioritize and define AMZL data and BI development needs
Work with in-house scientists, global supply chain, transportation and logistics teams to identify new BI capabilities and projects
Conduct deep dive investigations into operations execution and business problems, identify opportunities, and lead or support implementation (role varies by opportunity).
Analyse and visualize large scale geo-spatial logistics and transaction data to determine user behavior or delivery process problems, and output solid analysis report with recommendation.
Serve as liaison between the WW Planning and Analytics team and the operations business teams to achieve the goal of providing actionable insights into current delivery performance, and ad hoc investigations into future improvements or innovations. This will require data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and recommendations.
Develop queries and visualizations for ad-hoc requests and projects, as well as ongoing reporting.

MBA or quantitative graduate degree in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Business Analytics, Information Systems or related field.
Project Management experience and/or Tech product management experience
Proven track record of delivering projects within scope, time, budget and quality
10+ years of relevant work experience building end to end solutions to performance measurement and process improvement in a transportation, logistics or supply chain setting.
Demonstrated excellence in working with operations teams.

Amazon.com is an Equal Opportunity Employer – Minority / Women / Disability / Veteran / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation / Age

Title: Senior Software Developer
Description:
Description
Senior Back-End Developer- Commercial IoT
London
Do you want to be part of the Commercial IoT team?

Our purpose at Vodafone is to connect for a better future. At Vodafone Group, we partner with our local markets to drive consistency and earn customer loyalty across 20 countries for over 600 million customers. We are restless and passionate about creating a better future for all. We are always open to new things, and curious to create solutions that our customers will love. We are constantly learning to innovate the way we operate, set our global standards and to deliver on our strategy. Our ambition is to improve 1 billion lives and half our environmental impact by 2025. It’s up to each of us to make this happen. Ready?

The commercial team drives all consumer-facing products, services & innovation. If you are part of the team, the future is in your hands. Our products help build a Digital Society that’s hyper-connected. In that society, inclusion is key - we want everyone to have access to technology, not just the fortunate few. This ranges from Consumer IoT solutions for the home, price plans for girls in India, and data offerings that suit all streaming needs. You build the Vodafone our customers see and experience every day. The team is broad; you could be working within brand, commercial management, consumer services, terminals, M-Pesa or customer experience operations. What links us all together is that we think big, take risks, keep the best and learn from the rest. Do you?
We created V by Vodafone 2 years ago with a mission to pioneer a new way of connecting customers to the world of Internet of Things. Now, we are revolutionising the playing field in Consumer Internet of Things.

You will
Develop software for a continuously growing platform in a explorative space of IoT for consumers
Create and design infrastructure based on state of the art cloud infrastructure
Design architecture that is simple, scalelable, secure and serves the needs of our customers
Set quality standards
Shape how you work and what you work on in collaboration with a great team

It would be nice if you have…
Broad experience and skills in the area of IT and/or Telecommunications and/or IoT
Experience in working with cloud infrastructure and native cloud services (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience in designing and developing microservice-based solutions

You must have…
A strong communicator: You are humble but opinionated and can serve as an intellectual sparring partner. You are also friendly (or at least an extroverted introvert)
Deep knowledge of software development projects and delivery in agile environments.
Deep experience in software development with Java and/or Python
Education: You have work which speaks for itself, whether you are self-taught or have school credentials
A quality focus: You understand what it means to write SOLID, well tested code
Passion: You love working with code

#groupresourcing
Job Responsibilities
Designs and develops code, writes and executes unit and integration tests, and supports testing of deliverables against user and technical story acceptance tests;
Designs and develops micro-services in Digital Agility Layer supporting specific commercial requirements and customer journeys;
Builds performance driven websites/user interfaces with an understanding of network traffic, HTTP requests and other performance focused enhancements;
Tests and deploys developed micro-services to relevant environments using available CI/CD tools;
Understands / uses RESTful APIs and JSON;
Coordinates with relevant stakeholders inside and outside the squad to clarify commercial requirements and ensure the correct high-quality outcome;
Estimates user and technical stories to help inform and prioritize backlog;
Develops and executes unit and integration tests and supports testing against user and technical story acceptance tests;
Suggests improvements to user stories and design;
Manages technical debt as part of daily activities;
Maintains coding standards;
Troubleshoots, maintains and optimizes released micro-services based on defined allocation of ownership;
Skills
MicroServices and APIs
Data Analytics and Insights
Agile
Coding
Continuous Integration and Delivery (CI/CD)
Security
Architecture and Design
Software Engineering

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
Lead Data Analyst - Negotiable Salary – Plus benefits – London

This role would include managing customer data to the highest standard whilst driving income generation and customer relationships to gain a better understanding of the audience. The new Audience Research & Data team uses audience intelligence and data to inform strategy and planning across this unique organisation.

Role & Responsibilities.

Segment, analyse and interpret data.

Display a track record of success in using customer data and analytics
Demonstrable experience of interpreting data and extracting the relevant insights.

Title: Test Lead - Racing (Gaming Background Needed)
Description:
At NaturalMotion, we make games that wow people. We innovate to create experiences that previously were impossible and that would not exist without us. We take pride in making titles that reach a large audience and in creating communities that last. In 2018, NaturalMotion Studios were named one of the Best Places to Work in the UK games industry by gamesindustry.biz.
As Test Lead - Racing, you’ll already have confidence in your core skills whilst being aware of what you don’t know yet. A strong sense of personal belief is important, supported by work samples, references, and lessons learned on the way.
Job Purpose
You will have a key role in ensuring quality throughout the project with respect to the testers under your leadership, and you will also work with on and external partners to achieve the highest possible quality standards. You will be deeply integrated with the development team and QA teams on that basis and be a key voice for ensuring the highest quality standards that our players deserve.
Key Roles & Responsibilities:
Line management responsibility of multiple QA Engineers working with feature teams at your location; providing support, mentoring and along with Project QA Lead, suggesting potential growth or learning opportunities to ensure continuous improvement, and championing a collaborative, inclusive team environment
Resolve performance issues with direct reports where necessary, working with Project QA Lead / QA Manager if required
Plan and estimate QA effort required to test required changes or areas being developed, making sure that effort is aligned with the Project QA Lead where necessary
Ensuring established QA quality practices are adhered to, informing Project QA Lead of any risks or blocking issues which need to be addressed or mitigated
Reporting QA progress on specific areas to production and the Project QA Lead, informing them of risks.
Liaising with vendor test lead for Live QA, assigning tasks, monitoring progress and resolving issues or queries (where required)
Reviewing all reported bugs are of consistent quality and contain all required information to ensure timely resolution
Ensure that all team members follow a best practice, proactive philosophy to ensure timely, high quality delivery
Responsible for updating and adding to departmental Confluence pages, in order to ensure that the team has easy access to all information required to complete required testing
Improve overall knowledge of the project(s) over time, understanding the relationship being the client and server elements, along with third party plugins, systems etc, and passing knowledge to the wider QA team, being hands on where necessary
Researching and identifying potential opportunities in tools, automation to enhance and improve test process
Supporting the QA Project Lead where required due to illness or absence.

Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree educated with a relevant degree and/or equivalent experience (1-4 years or more) as a Senior QA Engineer or Test Lead
Prior experience of testing on a live service title, on mobile or other platforms (at least 1 project pre and post launch)
Prior experience as a line manager or supervisor of one or more QA Engineers
Clear, concise written and verbal communicator both with internal and external staff
Have a prior background or experience in testing of some or all the following technical areas: game design, art, graphics, data/analytics, performance, networking, security, platform compliance, agile testing
Has prior experience with non-functional testing (such as performance, scalability, load testing, compatibility etc) in order to enhance functional test coverage
Strong working knowledge of test tools and reporting, such as JIRA, TestRail, GameBench etc and have an understanding on how to use such tools to ensure comprehensive test coverage
Extensive experience collaborating with offsite and/or outsource QA teams, ideally at a development studio
Exposure to industry standard editor tools (such as Unity, Unreal)
Exposure to source control systems (such as Git, SVN, Perforce)
Excellent communication skills in both written and spoken English
Passion for racing, free to play mobile or console games!

What do we offer?
Competitive salary, discretionary annual bonus scheme and Zynga stock allowance
Contributory pension scheme
25 days holiday, plus public holidays and Christmas shutdown
Private medical care and healthcare cash plan
Life insurance and critical illness insurance
Discounted gym membership and free weekly yoga class
Flexible working hours
Free fruit, snacks & soft drinks provided daily, as well as free lunch on Fridays
Annual season ticket loan and cycle to work scheme
Summer and Christmas parties and Happy Hour every Friday
NaturalMotion is an equal opportunity employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, religion, pregnancy, marital status or veteran status.

Title: Senior Software Engineer/SRE - Market Data
Description:
Apply Now
Site Reliability Engineers in Market Data at Bloomberg fill the mission-critical role of ensuring our complex, real-time enterprise product is healthy, automated, observable, and designed for reliability. We work at enormous scale - billions of financial ticks are being processed every day - and we ingest, enrich, and deliver it to clients within milliseconds. Our clients have extremely high expectations around latency, correctness, and availability in order to react quickly and place market-moving trades.
We'll trust you to:
Apply your expertise to analyze and improve the reliability and performance of our market data pipeline
Design, develop, and deploy applications that maintain a healthy production environment. We are accountable for monitoring, observability, intelligent alerting, incident response, change management, capacity planning, provisioning, configuration, and orchestration
Support services throughout their lifecycle, working with component teams for system design consulting, shared component development, and release reviews
Participate in a support escalation rotation during working hours only - we have a follow-the-sun model for global 24x7 coverage
You'll need to have:
Excellent Python skills
Experience working on large-scale projects in an OO language (i.e. C++/Java)
Familiarity with design and implementation of large scale distributed systems
Strong interpersonal communication skills and ability to work well in a collaborative environment
A persevering attitude to challenge the status quo
We'd love to see:
Applied SRE experience
Working knowledge of data streaming and analytics platforms
Market Data industry exposure or knowledge


Interview process:
We believe interviewing is a two way street. It's a way for us to get to know you and your skills, and also a way for you to learn more about the team, our technical challenges, and what you'd be working on. The content of each interview round will be tailored to the role and your background, but the general framework can be found here: https://www.bloomberg.com/careers/technology/engineering/software-engineering-experienced-hire/ We want to ensure you can put your best foot forward throughout the process, so if you have any questions or need any accommodations to be successful, please let us know!
You can check out more about how we work and what it means to be an SRE at Bloomberg in our blog post: https://www.techatbloomberg.com/blog/bloomberg-bets-big-on-sres/
Apply Now

Title: Senior Commercial and Marketing Analyst, Cardiac and Vascula...
Description:
Careers that Change Lives

The lifesaving work of medical professionals inspires us. Through partnerships with medical communities around the globe, we create advances in medical devices, supplies products to improve lives. From reducing surgery time to accelerating healing, our breakthrough solutions are a vital part of daily healthcare delivery. Through progressive thinking and cutting-edge technologies, Medtronic is well positioned to lead the way in today's rapidly changing healthcare industry. As a global, $28+ billion healthcare products leader, we deliver outstanding results and innovative solutions for challenging problems.

A Day in the Life
Partner with the Cardiac and Vascular Solutions (CVG) Commercial Manager and CVG SAMs on generating sales and health economic data to support key account strategies.
Analyse and identify trends using market share reports such as Eucomed and IHMT. To communicate these trends to relevant business partners to help them explain performance and develop strategies.
Partner the Commercial Manager in creating CVG cross business deals
Provide support to Commercial Manager to create and further develop pricing strategies within the operating model.
Work with Commercial Manager to expand and continually develop value-added schemes such as MedPoints.
Act as a point of contact for HST to support requests and queries.
Maintains analytical systems and catalogues, verifies the accuracy of the data, and acts as a liaison to the business and procurement customers
Co-travel as necessary with the sales team with data analytical tools and information to demonstrate tangible value to commercial customers.
Sales & Collaboration
Support decision making in terms of analysing the marketing model, market analytics, margins (ASP Trends) and product mix to support forecasting for the management team.
Support cross business commercial offers including creating the template and deal analysis.
Work with the new analytics team to monitoring the performance of rebate / Medpoints based proposals and communicating progress and outcomes to relevant partners.
Consult the Commercial Manager, Marketing Managers and Business Managers and work with finance and pricing to ensure robust commercial decisions are made.
Marketing and Business Development
Take ownership of analysing the external and internal market share date, identifying trends and communicating these to relevant partners for further explanation and analysis.
To support the Commercial and Marketing team with specific data mining requests for new business development opportunities.
Must Haves
Degree or equivalent work experience
Ability to work independently under limited supervision to determine and develop approach to solutions.
Very high standard of Microsoft particularly excel
Proven strong communications skills
Practical knowledge of project management.
Excellent organizational skills and ability to work under pressure
Desire to provide excellent customer service
Good understanding of NHS procurement model
Nice to haves
Understanding of CVG product portfolio
Experience of working in a finance function
Experience of working with Private companies and NHS
Experience in a large multinational company
Your Answer
Is this the position you were waiting for? Then please apply directly via the apply button!

About Medtronic

Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life.
We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be. We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team.

Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.

Founded in 1949 as a medical repair company, we're now among the world's largest medical technology, services and solutions companies, employing more than 86,000 people worldwide, serving physicians, hospitals and patients in over 155 countries.
Whatever your specialty or ambitions, you can make a difference at Medtronic - both in the lives of others and your own career. Join us in our commitment to take healthcare Further, Together.

Title: Marketing Effectiveness- Senior Analyst
Description:
Function:
Market Research/Intelligence
Closing Date:
31/07/2020
Location: Reading or Hammersmith or Manchester
As we enter one of the most exciting times in our history we are looking for a Marketing Effectiveness Senior Analyst that oozes our Virgin values and embraces the on-going ways of working within Liberty Global.
Why Virgin Media? We are the future. We understand our people, their lifestyles and we support them no matter what. We LOVE being different, thinking outside the box and being the best we can be, all the time.
What will you be doing?
As the Effectiveness Senior Analyst you will be responsible for supporting the Effectiveness function of the team, working on multiple statistical projects to address key business questions. You will work alongside other Effectiveness Managers, Research Managers, and stakeholders across multiple business functions as well as external analytics consultancies and media agencies
Key Accountabilities:
Assist the wider team with collecting, processing and interrogating data for insights & econometrics and automating processes where possible to improve project efficiency
Liaise with stakeholders across marketing, sales and commercial functions to: gather key questions for insights & econometrics projects, obtain context for results, and ensure that the recommendations of the modelling are implemented successfully into future plans
Use tools provided by partner agency to run marketing scenarios and optimisations for stakeholders to assist with quarterly and annual planning; recommend efficiency gains within plans and inform of sales and revenue impacts of different scenarios
Work with partner agencies to ensure that models are built to the highest standards using consistent techniques that can be applied to other projects
Responsible for creating and maintaining data reports and dashboards for the Marketing Strategy & Effectiveness team as well as the wider marketing function using a range of data sources such as Adobe, SQL and statistical outputs
Lead on ad hoc projects to answer key questions that cannot be addressed within the econometrics framework. This will include data analysis, trend analysis and A/B testing using a variety of programmes such as Python, SQL, Excel and R
Are you right for the role?
So it’s the moment of truth, right? What are we looking for in the successful candidate?
Highly numerate experience in an analytical field
Self-motivated and results orientated individual with excellent numeracy and analytical skills
Understanding of the basics of econometric model construction and interpretation is key, as well as showing an aptitude to learn new skills and techniques quickly in a fast-paced environment
Pro-active and able to work across multiple functions and departments
Experience of Planning and forecasting
Presentation and communication of insight
Strong T-SQL, R, Python, Aginity or experience in equivalent relational data technologies
Experience of Anaplan would be beneficial
Advanced Excel with experience of business modelling an advantage
Virgin Media is part of Liberty Global, the world’s biggest cable company. We are delivering the biggest investment in the UK’s digital infrastructure for over a decade. Through four multi-award-winning services - Virgin Fibre, Virgin TV, Virgin Mobile and Virgin Phone - we help people access technology to build connections that really matter.
We are dedicated to nurturing an engaged workforce that represents the diversity of our customers and communities.
Our benefits are your reward for being brilliant. They’re pretty darn spectacular. Just like our people. We’ve put together a package to help you love what you do, at work and at play. You will get 25 days holiday and your birthday off each year, we provide a company funded Medical Plan as well as a Pension Plan where we will match every pound you put in, up to 10%. What's more you'll also benefit from discounts across Virgin Media products and Virgin brands and many other perks on top.
Come and be a part of something special. Join us!

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Product
Description:
Data Scientist – Product - £Competitive Salary – Plus Benefits – London - J10892

This data science team is looking for a very talented Data Scientist to utilise machine learning, advanced analytical and statistical techniques. You could be enjoying great imaginative benefits whilst working across an extensive portfolio of businesses and brands to orchestrate the delivery of customer experiences on a both local and global scale.

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Global Shipping
Description:
High level of proficiency in Excel (PowerPivot, PowerQuery)
Experience in Supply Chain
Excellent discretion, judgment, and executive presence
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s leadership principles requirements for this role
Meets/exceeds Amazon’s functional/technical depth and complexity for this role
A Bachelor of Science degree in Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Supply Chain, or a related field
6+ years of relevant experience in business, data, or statistical analysis
Experience with SQL, data warehousing, statistical analysis tools, Microsoft Excel, and data visualization tools such as Tableau.

Global Shipping team merges professional expertise, experience in international transportation and customs brokerage, innovation in supply-chain design and management, and world-class operations in order to digitize cross-border transactions. Our globally based teams of Product, Program, and Supply Chain Managers, Strategists, Analysts, and Sales and Operations Managers are building a global network that improves speed, reduces costs, and brings selection closer to Customers..
Our team is seeking experienced professionals to join our Global Shipping team providing business insights and deep dives that will determine our product designs, segment focus and shape our value proposition to our customers. Qualified candidates will bring their technical expertise and have the ability to directly impact the building of new tools, services, and distribution structures across Amazon’s growing footprint. The insights and analysis enabled by this role will deliver unprecedented selection while innovating beyond established supply chain norms. The right candidate will thrive in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment with interactions across a wide variety of e-commerce topics, and will demonstrate competence in multiple fields and skill sets.
As a Senior Business Analyst, this role will be part of a broader business analyst team, responsible for providing insights and business support for our European product and business teams.
As a Senior Business Analyst, you will serve as the subject matter expert on presenting data in an informative and actionable way and in a way that facilitates productive, cross-functional dialogue, especially between operators and key leadership. You will help to build and define the strategy for the Business Insights team and its projects. You will help build analytical models, develop new techniques to process large data sets, apply statistical testing methods, address quantitative problems, build dashboards that enable leaders to better understand their business data, assess functional business performance, and develop targeted, scalable action plans. As an experienced data expert, you will also be responsible for coaching and mentoring junior members within the team. You will be responsible for designing and implementing tangible insights, business metrics, measurement systems that guide operations, projects, and programs roadmaps. You will have an opportunity to publish findings, updates, and data driven recommendations to Senior Leadership. You will hold a highly visible role that requires interaction with leaders across operations.

Major responsibilities:

Design and execute analytic projects in collaboration with business, product, data engineering, finance, and other specialists
Build data visualization reports and tools for self-service consumption of data
Analyze and extract relevant information from large amounts of both structured and unstructured data to help automate and optimize key processes
Define the business problem and solution approach autonomously with limited guidance
Analyze and validate data to ensure high data quality and reliable insights
Partner with data engineering teams to improve data assets, quality, metrics and insights
Proactively identify opportunity areas for deep dive investigations and future program development
Write concise documents communicating results to stakeholders and visualize data to drive decision making

An advanced technical or business degree (MS or MBA)
8+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst, data analyst, or statistical analysis role
Understanding of data modeling
Strong background in statistics methodology, applications to business problems, and big data
Experience in scripting languages (Python) for parsing and data analysis
Experience with one or more of the statistical modeling languages/ toolboxes (R, SAS)
Ability to apply statistical techniques (i.e. hypothesis testing, control groups)
