Title: Lead Commercial Analyst
Description:
Lead Commercial Analyst
London
Up to £60,000
An amazing hospitality brand with a focus on wellness and uniqueness are looking for a passionate, curious and technically savvy Lead Analyst. You will work in an innovative environment that is fast-paced. You will conduct sophisticated analysis on big data, look at where customers land online and help deliver commercial impact and influence senior stakeholders. This is a fantastic role for a senior analyst seeking to progress their analytics career in a multi-million £ tech company.
Lead Analyst
You will use your commercial knowledge to help drive business insights
Work on commercial analytics and revenue projects as well as forecasting
You will take ownership of projects and work with board-level stakeholders
You will work on ad-hoc projects and use their wide range of data sources to provide deep-dive insights
Mentor and manage junior analysts
Act as a team lead and second in command to the Head of Analytics
You don't have to tick all of the boxes but some of the following would be relevant:
Commercial experience of SQL coding
Ideally experience with R or Python
Commercial outlook with a focus on driving business change
Ability to influence senior stakeholders
Ideally you will have hands-on experience with big data
Experience within customer insight and presenting senior stakeholders
Salary and Benefits
The successful candidate can expect to earn up to £60,000 plus benefits.

Title: Senior Product Analyst
Description:
SENIOR PRODUCT ANALYST
LONDON
£50,000- £70,000 +BENEFITS
THE COMPANY
An exciting role working for a technology-driven online business who are in a growth stage. You will report directly into the Data Director and be part of creating the data direction. The aim of this position is to build the data pipeline and start implementing advanced analytics.
THE ROLE
As a Senior Product Analyst, you will in a growing analytics function. Some of your main responsibilities will be:
Analyse customer data to provide insights on customer personalisation.
Build statistical models, focusing on customer segmentation projects.
Build and manage key stakeholder relationships and expectations.
Share analytical results in a commercial manner, with the ability to visualise insights with impact.
Work to build the data pipeline.
YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
A successful Senior Product Analyst will have:
Degree level or higher in a STEM subject.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, able to proactively network across functions and influence at all levels.
Expert in a range of statistical and programming software; SQL and visualisation
Experience having built advanced models in Python or R is essential.
Experience building out a data pipeline would be ideal.
THE BENEFITS
A salary of up to £70,000.
Comprehensive benefits package.
Lots of ownership of projects.
HOW TO APPLY
Please register your interest by sending your CV to Lydia via the apply link on this page.

Title: Senior Associate, Credit Risk, Analytics & Modelling, Audit...
Description:
Your opportunity
Deloitte's UK Financial Services Audit and Assurance practice provides a full range of high value external audit services to many of the world's leading financial institutions, including banks, brokers, insurers, investment managers, investment and pension funds, private equity businesses and more.
Our Banking and Capital Markets Group is a dedicated team of 400+ professionals with deep technical accounting and financial reporting and audit skills, and a multi-disciplinary team of specialists advising on a range of topics to the banking and capital markets industry. Our portfolio of clients include some of the largest and most complex businesses that Deloitte work with. They are influential, exciting and at the heart of the UK economy. Given some recent high profile audit wins, we are looking to expand our team by adding high performing and ambitious new individuals. We are currently seeking a Senior Associate to support our fast growing business at an interesting time for the financial services industry and the audit profession.
If you join our Credit Risk team, you will partner with world-renowned clients, helping them to leverage the power of their data to solve their most complex business challenges. You will be part of a market-leading team, bringing together people and insights from a variety of sources and backgrounds. You will work on cutting edge projects where no two days are the same, accelerating your learning and allowing you to progress more quickly.
We encourage consideration of flexible ways of working, both formal and informal arrangements that allow for the best outcomes for our people and our clients. If this opportunity is of interest to you with some flexibility, please do discuss with us.

Your role
To help our clients improve and develop their credit measurement capabilities focussing on IFRS9, IRB and stress testing approaches across the full range of credit asset classes.

Responsibilities:
Providing credit measurement modelling and analytics services to clients. This could involve supporting a client’s 1st Line teams with the build of new models or improvement/review of existing models, support to 2nd Line oversight/model review functions or to 3rd Line Internal Audit teamsHelping clients with designing and improving their wider credit measurement ecosystems; for example practices around insight into movements, data, controls, model risk management, model monitoring and maintenance, reporting and external disclosureSupporting Deloitte’s external audit of IFRS9 and assurance of RWA through challenge of our clients’ methodological approaches and quality of implementation to identify material weaknesses or areas of concernSupporting other credit measurement-related projects such as acquisition due diligence, stress testing and Asset Quality ReviewsContributing to thought leadership around credit measurement best practice and its evolutionContributing to the Analytics & Modelling team’s strategy and identifying new opportunities for Deloitte to help its clientsBuilding long-term relationships with clients to be regarded as a trusted advisorWorking in a diverse team and promoting an inclusive culture where colleagues are recognised for their contribution
Your work, your choice
At Deloitte we believe the best impact is the value we add, not the hours we sit at our desk. We carefully consider agile ways of working, both formal and informal, that allow for the best impact for our people and our clients. Please speak to your recruiter about the working pattern that works best for you.

Location:
London

Work pattern:
This is a permanent opportunity and should be worked on a full time basis.

Your professional experience
Essential
Good programming skills with modelling software such as SAS, SQL, MS Excel (including VBA), Python, R Knowledge of the financial services industry and the credit fundamentals of different asset classesAbility to communicate complex concepts to non-expert audiencesAbility to partner with clients or other stakeholders and build great relationshipsAbility to think creatively, generate innovative ideas, challenge the status quo and deliver effectively Desirable
Good credit modelling skills and experience in the development, delivery and/or validation of credit risk models under one or more of the IFRS9, IRB and forecasting/stress testing regimesKnowledge of current economic and market trendsUnderstanding of regulator and/or auditor point of viewCommercial understanding of the use and business consequences of rating system outputsUnderstanding of wider rating systems concepts including data, systems, controls, use test etc. Understanding of the changing regulatory environment as it relates to credit measurementExperience with data visualizationUnderstanding of the management of credit financials, associated governance and stakeholder perspectives
Salary: Market Rate. Opening Date: 22.06.2020. Closing Date: 20.07.2020. Full Time
Your service line: Audit & Assurance
In an industry best known for looking back, Deloitte looks beyond.
Our Audit & Assurance team understand the most important decisions are the ones we are yet to make. Crafting the future in an informed and clear-sighted way means understanding current conditions, as well as the trends that are shaping tomorrow. That is why we use our expertise in audit to show where things stand now, and to help inform the next step. With the assurance we provide, we help our clients to look ahead with strength and confidence across all of their accounting, regulatory and transaction needs.

Innovation is the key, underpinned by audit quality. You will be joining a diverse team of experts capable of delivering meaningful and durable change for both our clients and our profession.

Personal independence
Regulation and controls are standard practice in our industry and Deloitte is no exception. These controls provide important legal protection for both you and the firm. We are subject to a number of audit regulations, one of which requires that certain colleagues abide by specific personal independence constraints. This can mean that you and your "Immediate Family Members" are not permitted to hold certain financial interests (shares, funds, bonds etc.) with audit clients of the firm. The recruitment team will provide further detail as you progress through the recruitment process.
About Deloitte

Our Purpose & Strategy
To make an impact that matters for our clients, our people and society - defines who we are and what we stand for. Our purpose provides the foundation for our strategy and our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services: this is not about size, it's about being the first choice. The first choice for the largest and most influential clients, and the first choice for the best talent.
What do we do?
Deloitte offers global integrated professional services that include Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Legal, Risk Advisory and Tax Consulting. Our approach combines intellectual leadership, industrial expertise, insight, consulting & problem solving capabilities whatever the role, technology revolutions and innovation from multiple disciplines to help our clients excel anywhere in the world.
Beyond the UK: Deloitte North and South Europe
The UK is part of Deloitte North and South Europe (NSE), the second largest member firm in the Deloitte network. Deloitte NSE combines operations in Belgium, Central Mediterranean (Italy, Greece, Malta), Ireland, the Middle East (Bahrain, Cyprus, Egypt, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Oman, Palestinian Ruled Territories, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen), the Netherlands, the Nordics (Denmark, Finland, Iceland, Norway and Sweden), Switzerland and the UK. Deloitte NSE brings together 2,700 partners and over 50,000 people, combining our unmatched breadth and depth of capabilities in audit and assurance, consulting, financial advisory, risk advisory, and tax and legal across the region. Being part of Deloitte NSE supports our aspiration to be the undisputed leader in professional services and will create more opportunity and growth for our people.
What do we value?
What brings us all together at Deloitte? It’s how we approach the thousands of decisions we make every day. How we behave, our beliefs and our attitudes. In other words: our values. Whatever we do, wherever we are in the world, we lead the way, serve with integrity, take care of each other, foster inclusion, and collaborate for maximum impact. These five shared values lead every decision we make and action we take, guiding us to deliver impact how and where it matters most.
Being a Leader at Deloitte
Cultural fit and purpose-led leadership is crucial for Deloitte. Our leaders always set the example and inspire their colleagues. They make quality time for people and take an interest in them. They know what matters to people - both inside and outside work – and value them as individuals; always finding opportunities to develop them while showing respect and appreciation.
We expect colleagues at all levels to embrace and live our purpose and our leadership culture by challenging themselves to identify issues that are most important for our clients, our people, and for society and make an impact that matters. We know leadership comes in all shapes and sizes, but our Leadership Charter helps all of our people understand what we’re looking for:
We live our purpose: we act as a role model, embracing and living our purpose and values, and recognising others for the impact they makeWe develop talent: we develop high-performing people and teams through challenging and meaningful opportunitiesWe drive performance: we deliver exceptional client service; maximise results and drive high performance from people while fostering collaboration across businesses and bordersWe believe positive influence can make an impact that matters: we influence clients, teams, and individuals positively, leading by example and establishing confident relationships with increasingly senior peopleWe move, together, towards a strategic direction: we understand key objectives for clients and Deloitte, aligning people to objectives and setting priorities and direction.

Deloitte LLP is a limited liability partnership registered in England and Wales with registered number OC303675 and its registered office at 1 New Street Square, London EC4A 3HQ, United Kingdom.Deloitte LLP is the United Kingdom affiliate of Deloitte NSE LLP, a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"). DTTL and each of its member firms are legally separate and independent entities. DTTL and Deloitte NSE LLP do not provide services to clients. Please see www.deloitte.com/about to learn more about our global network of member firms.

Requisition code: 178248

Title: Senior Gas Analyst
Description:
Location: London, Canary Wharf
Grade: 11 ( for internal purposes only )
The Role: Platts Analytics is looking for a senior analyst to drive forward its European gas fundamental and price forecasting and analysis services delivered under their market-leading product line. This exciting role will be pivotal in producing price forecasts, writing market commentary and developing analytical tools, research and models that underpin our gas and power services. The role will make use of your detailed knowledge of European and Global gas/LNG markets and will leverage your strong quantitative and modelling skills. In time, the role could provide line management opportunities.

The Impact: Platts Analytics is a global team responsible for analyzing, interpreting and forecasting all global energy commodities markets and prices. Our customers represent a wide range of activities across the energy industry and, as a result, our analysis is reviewed and challenged from many different perspectives. You will play a key role in supporting Platts Analytics’ services and could also play a role in developing these services into major new growth areas.

The Career Opportunity: This is a role with significant potential for development within a short timeframe. You will be a key input into Platts Analytics’ European gas analysis service under and also its development in the coming months and years as a part of an integrated, cross commodity global analysis offering. In addition there will be ample opportunity to contribute to an emerging global brand and to take part in customer-facing activities, including webinars and conference presentations.
The Team / The Business: You will be part of the European Gas and Power Analytics team which comprises international specialists with outstanding knowledge of European and global gas, power, carbon and coal markets.

Accountabilities:
Be an expert
Study all factors that contribute context to the current and future value of natural gas in European markets, and their interaction with global gas markets
Spot trends, identify emerging trends early and, where possible, anticipate market movements
Have and build on own understanding of natural gas trading, modeling and forecasting
Constantly update own knowledge of evolving markets, including price movements, trade-flows, trading behavior and regulatory developments that impact on the gas markets
Harness existing data sets, identify new, valuable data sets for collection and analysis and conduct rigorous reviews of the quality of that information
Research, collect, organize, standardize, process, and analyze gas market data
Develop and rigorously adhere to independent, transparent methodology for all analytical processes
Demonstrate a dynamic approach to learning and a passion for the natural gas industry and Platts Analytics’ leading place in it
Coaching and mentoring: Work towards becoming an expert and the go-to person in gas analysis
Communicate expertise
Engage with customers, market experts and potential customers, demonstrating expertise and acting as ambassador for Platts’ pursuit of analytical excellence. Travel is likely to be required
Communicate expertise through the creation of compelling, “must-have” content that leverages all the knowledge listed above and helps Platts’ core readership make better-informed trading, risk management and investment decisions
Deliver succinct, high-quality and accurate written content that demonstrates the expertise outlined above
Create charts, graphs and other visually valuable content that illustrates the trends Platts’ customers need to follow
Articulate expertise and thought-leadership through a variety of media including but not limited to podcasts, webinars, video, TV, conference and forum speaking engagements
Carry out internal and external training and education, explaining the dominant trends in the natural gas markets, the analytical processes employed to arrive at a particular decision and the systems in use to carry them out
Innovate
Build internal relationships at Platts that will help generate ideas for the integration of pricing content with fundamental data to offer greater value to customers. Take action when opportunities arise for collaboration that will provide a better experience to users of Platts’ information services
Use competitive intelligence to stay ahead and innovate
Be commercially astute through listening to customers’ needs and being able to identify viable opportunities for revenue generation
Work with Platts technology teams to develop robust databases, products and tools that could become embedded in our customers’ work-flows and processes
Lead
Utilise industry knowledge and soft skills to coach and mentor other analysts with potential line management opportunities
Challenge processes and status quo, be prepared to place own footprint on organisation and lead product development
Independently identify commercial opportunities to enhance product offering and drive execution
Exhibit best practice behaviors in all business activities to uphold ethical and business standards to build on and maintain high levels of staff engagement
Knowledge & Skills:
Proven experience in natural gas markets. Upstream understanding also valuable. Additional experience in other markets, e.g. power, coal and oil as well as knowledge of developing markets (i.e. Central and Eastern Europe or Turkey) is advantageous
Knowledge of key Financial metrics/concepts (NPV, IRR) or Technical Analysis experience encouraged
Ability to tackle problems and take independent action. Ability to seek out new assignments and act on opportunities. Track record for delivering against demanding targets and deliverables. Comfortable with high levels of responsibility and accountability
Exhibits a natural curiosity for the energy industry and has a problem-solving/solutions-oriented attitude
Excellent communication skills, including listening; concise written style; and good verbal skills. The ability to communicate across a wide range of groups and personalities internally and externally
Willingness and ability to anticipate and respond to customer needs and market changes to leverage the business capabilities to continually position Platts Analytics as the go-to provider. Ability to provide insightful analysis to the market in compelling and straightforward content
Leads by example to create a positive and collaborative work environment. Strong relationship building skills and ability to influence others within the organization to gain buy-in and drive initiatives to completion
Proficient in identifying, gathering, and analyzing information to solve problems effectively. Ability to recognize trends and provide recommendations and develop logical conclusions. Knowledge of mathematical, statistical and modelling concepts and research methods would be beneficial
Shows a desire to do the right thing for the team, segment and business. Demonstrates personal integrity and an openness to continually learn and develop
Familiarity with latest content delivery methods, such as web-based platforms, would be helpful. Ability to shape/influence/test the development of new system applications and knowledge of relational databases is also an asset
Ability to build and maintain best-practice procedures and documentation of models and processes
Promoting a positive and team oriented work environment. Take pride in a job well done, learn from mistakes and celebrate successes
Comfortable with and aptitude for public speaking
Strong Excel skills are required. Experience with SQL, Python, Matlab, VBA, SAS, or cube data structure would be useful but not essential
Verbal and written fluency in English is essential. Knowledge of other languages seen favourably but not required.
Upon Applying: Please provide a resume/CV and tailored Cover Letter with your application!
About S&P Global Platts
At S&P Global Platts, we provide the insights; you make better informed trading and business decisions with conviction. We’re the leading independent provider of information and benchmark prices for the commodities and energy markets. Customers in over 150 countries look to our expertise in news, pricing and analytics to deliver greater transparency and efficiency to markets. S&P Global Platts coverage includes oil and gas, power, petrochemicals, metals, agriculture and shipping.
S&P Global Platts is a division of S&P Global (NYSE: SPGI), which provides essential intelligence for individuals, companies and governments to make decisions with confidence.For more information, visit www.platts.com
To all recruitment agencies : S&P Global does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. Please do not forward such resumes to any S&P Global employee, office location or website. S&P Global will not be responsible for any fees related such resumes.

Title: IT Lead Business Analyst
Description:
Gather, develop, and distribute key financial and status reports to business and project managers that assist them with resource utilization and enable them to prioritize within their approved budgets. Collaborate with business and technology management, development, and support staff to understand the priorities, scope of effort required to deliver accurate groupings of initiatives, programs and projects. Provide resource management through the analysis of the cost impact of direct staff and contractors. Forecast the headcount over time, reporting on and explaining trends to management. Achieve monthly, quarterly, and annual targets by utilizing financial management, including cash and performance and loss impact, and capitalization and amortization. Create reports for development and support programs related to project financials and accruals, headcount, Cross Border approvals, Internal Audits, software development lifecycle project documentation, application compliance, and resource and vendor contract status. Engage in Project Management Office (“PMO”) responsibilities including regular contact and communication with platform end users to assist in their experience with the platform. Cooperation with Technology and development teams to understand process changes and functionality enhancements made to the platform.
Monitors and reports trends to Management on a variety of capabilities performed by platform users. Providing status reporting to the Business and Project Mangers
Partners with Technology and Business Stakeholders to identify impactful releases into the platform ecosystem for CPB North America Technology team. The duties also include assisting in a program focused on defining and implanting a communications strategy for our IT systems.

Education/Experience Requirement
Requires a Bachelor’s degree in International Business, International Relations, or closely related field and 4 years of experience as an IT Business Analyst or closely related position. Alternatively, the employer will accept a Master’s degree in the stated fields and 2 years of experience in the stated fields.
Full term of work experience must include:
Applying data analysis (Producing quantitive outputs regarding platform analytics to assist in the increase of adoption and reporting of specific Technical capabilites using Business Objects Software, Oracle Database Management and Microsoft Office products) Program Management and Process Changes (Establishing process to ensure that capabilities are effectively rolled out into production while ensuring software development lifecycle project documentation requirements are met using Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Project tracking tools)

Title: Senior Mathematician/Data Analysis/Algorithm
Description: Recruiting for a highly motivated individual to lead, and bring a commercial perspective to the Data Analytics team Current work includes data processing, appliance inference, and behaviour change research. The role requires a combination of high level mathematical analysis skills, algorithm and software development experience to lead the team and contribute to the company roadmap, along with a commercial understanding that can target the business applications and prioritise R&D to market need. Title: Associate - London - Boutique - Leading M&A Advisory Corpora...
Description:
Specialising in advising on the sell- and buy-side of distressed and non-core banking asset transactions globally.
Clients include international banking groups, global investment banks, speciality finance providers and private equity and debt funds.
On the sell-side, provides advice to clients on:
Asset options analysis
Data and analytics
Transaction preparation and structuring
Lead M&A and transaction execution
Portfolio valuation / pricing
Asset on-/off-boarding
On the buy-side, provides advice to clients on:
Data and analytics
Single credit and portfolio re-underwriting
Portfolio valuation / pricing
Acquisition structuring & negotiations
Deal sourcing
Fundraising
Your day-to-day duties will include:
Sell-side transactions
Assisting in the preparation of client pitch presentations and other business development opportunities;
Assisting the project lead in the management of the process, attending stakeholder calls/meetings and managing follow-up actions;
Leading the preparation of transaction marketing materials, including investment teasers, process letters and information memoranda;
Supporting the P&A team on the preparation of transaction data tapes, assessing quality of data and portfolio pricing;
Overseeing selected transaction workstreams;
Leading the structuring, build and management of the data room, including investor Q&A; and
Participating in investor communications throughout each transaction.
Buy-side transactions
Assisting in the preparation of client pitch presentations and other business development opportunities;
Assisting the project lead in the management of the process, attending stakeholder calls/meetings and managing follow-up actions;
Supporting the P&A team on the review of transaction data tapes, assessing quality of data and portfolio pricing;
Leading the management of the data room, including Q&A;
Leading the preparation of client investment committee reports; and
Participating in client and stakeholder meetings.
Role requirements:
3 to 5 years of experience in a transaction role (buy-side, sell-side, advisory)
Strong interest in banking and financial services
Strong academic background
Understanding of financial statements, capital structures and credit
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word
Experience analysing large data sets and some cashflow modelling is preferable
Well organised, self-motivated and eager to learn
Entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to contribute your own ideas and work autonomously
Ability to take ownership of a task whilst working under pressure
Strong communication and presentation skills (verbal and written)
Strong attention to detail
English proficiency (verbal and written) is a requirement. Knowledge of other languages is not crucial
Interested and motivated to travel throughout Europe on projects

Title: Senior Designer
Description:
Senior Brand and Marketing Designer
MySense has a mission to improve people's wellbeing and lives through AI and cutting- edge technology. In doing so, we are creating a brand and a community of people with like-minded values.

We are now looking for a senior designer to join us on this journey and develop our brand and marketing presence across multiple channels. This is an opportunity for an ambitious designer who is as much a visionary as a technically brilliant designer to help shape our direction.

The successful candidate will have experience of and be confident with interrogating briefs, enhancing briefs and presenting ideas to senior stakeholders. They must also have demonstrable expertise in delivering effective design across multiple channels for commercially driven organisations.

Responsibilities

Work within and evolve the MySense brand guidelines, acting as the brand guardian
Design effective digital campaign assets for B2B/2C markets including; banners, adverts, landing pages, social media artwork/campaigns, ensuring they are up to date with industry trends and guidelines
Create engaging graphics that translate across print and digital mediums for business collateral such as presentations and brochures
Overseee and develop design of the MySense website
Introduce new proposals on how to differentiate or improve the effectiveness of brand and marketing design
Support pitches through impactful and uncluttered design
Manage print production on business materials
Commission and manage creative projects with freelancers or third party service providers
Design and create engaging and effective HTML emails
Manage the timely production and delivery of all digital assets, across website, photography, display ads and email and social media
Work with the content creator to implement campaigns and business collateral
Brainstorm and ideate with team members. Taking sketches and concepts through to design delivery.

Essential skills and experience

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent in Arts / Design
Several years design experience in commercial/agency environments
Photoshop, HTML, Adobe Creative Suite, Illustrator, InDesign
Portfolio of published work across digital and print mediums

Who you are

You're a self-starter with strong organisational skills, attention to detail, and thrive in an environment of rapid development
You're creatively curious and understand that 'ok' is not good enough.
You're positive and enthusiastic with the natural ability to inspire and motivate others
You are collaborative and a team player but able to take the initiative and make decisions on your own
You are comfortable asking the right questions to develop and clarify briefs
You are someone with drive who shares our passion and vision
You communicate confidently and clearly with senior management
You reflect our values of being: caring, committed, positive, trustworthy and together

Benefits:
30 days holiday + your birthday + Public Holidays
Fruits, Coffee, Tea and breakfast all are in office
80% Remote working
Private Health Insurance
Life Insurance
Pension scheme
Office dog (hypoallergenic)
Relaxed start-up environment - your input matters
Company laptop

About MySense
MySense is a wellbeing analytics platform built on compassion, by people who understand what it's like to care for a loved one. But we're also a team of dedicated (selfproclaimed) nerds, tech is what we know and love. So, we have combined these two drives and created a product we can be proud of.
The idea is that peace of mind about a loved one's wellbeing should be at people's fingertips no matter who or where they are. To do this, we created a wearable device and 11 sensors that can be placed around someone's home. Each sensor picks up information about a key activity. This means looking at drinking and eating habits, toilet usage, sleep patterns and heart rate (approximately 5,000 data points). These sensors collect data that our AI then analyses for any patterns of decline in wellbeing. When we start to notice that something isn't looking ideal, we send caregivers notifications so they can address problems before they escalate.

Check us out: https://www.mysense.ai https://www.linkedin.com/company/mysense

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation or age.

Title: Senior Manager - Advanced Analytics
Description:
Advanced Analytics Manager - £Competitive Salary – Plus Benefits – Kent and/or London – J11084

This Financial House is one of the fastest growing credit management providers in Europe with a strong ethical code and reputation. They are again recruiting to maintain their strong market position and deliver a first class, unrivalled, customer service to their clients. This is a new role to the business and will work closely with the Chief Analytics Officer to use advanced analytics in a more commercially focussed and strategically impactful way.

Create value from analytics projects
Understand customer behaviour from the analysis and manipulation of customer data.
Undertake end-to-end analytical projects related to operational optimisation.
Improve the customer experience of the company consumer portfolios.
Manage analysis work, resources, tasks, budgets, deadlines and delivery
Understand where data comes from, how its captured or created,
Cover customer personal data, credit bureau data, transactional data, digital and telephony data.

Hold a good understanding of regulations around use of data.
Demonstrate experience in product development.
Possess a strong working knowledge of classical and machine learning predictive analytics techniques.
Have experience using Cloud based virtual machines for analytical projects.
Experience in portfolio valuation advantageous.
A strong interest in retail financial products and innovation a plus.
Confident in presenting ideas, business cases and results to senior management
Practical experience in one or more of SAS, Python or SQL.
Experience in developing and deploying API services.
Background:
Financial Services experience on the product or investment side a distinct advantage.

Title: Strategy and Communications Advisory, Senior Consultant
Description:
Strategy & Communications Advisory, Senior Consultant, Strategy
London, England, United Kingdom
Senior Consultant, Strategy: Strategic Communications UK
The Strategy team at Teneo helps companies make the right choices, and set priorities, to determine strategies that build and protect trust and reputation, unlocking value. Our work not only shapes communications and campaigning, but informs business decisions, corporate culture and the embedding of values.
Our approach is audience-led and evidence-based, drawing on qualitative, quantitative, social and digital listening and desk research as appropriate at every stage of our projects.
We help companies:
identify what reputation, with whom, is required to achieve business objectives
determine where key audiences stand today, and what drives their perceptions
define what they stand for as a business, their winning territory in contentious debates, and the arguments that genuinely change minds.
shape the organisational, functional and individual skills required to deliver strategies with winning outcomes.
A Senior Consultant (SC) in the Strategy team plays a pivotal role in providing the highest quality of service, overseeing team delivery day-to-day for client projects. The successful candidate will have the following skills and experience:
Research management and insight creation
Essential:
Experience delivering and managing large-scale research projects focussing on the general public
Experience delivering qualitative research, including using techniques such as structured, depth interviews and focus groups
Experience in making communications and/or marketing recommendations based on consumer and/or stakeholder research
Experience presenting complex research to senior internal or external clients
Show great aptitude, enthusiasm and flexibility in learning new research methodologies
Ability to develop a research brief and research plan in response to questions asked by team leaders and other senior colleagues
Experience in other research techniques such as market research, opinion polling, desk research or digital analytics.
Desirable:
Ability to analyse primary quantitative data using Excel and draw out the most interesting aspects for a client.
Experience of conducting statistical analysis of quantitative data, and proficiency in a standard statistics packages, for example, R, SPSS, or Stata.
Academic training in the measurement of public attitudes and behaviours, in disciplines such as psychology, political science, marketing, statistics or economics.
Using research for strategy
Essential:
Able to understand what research conclusions are important and relevant to the key strategic questions we work on
Develop draft strategic recommendations and campaign ideas based on research findings
Collaborate with colleagues planning communications and campaigns activity to deliver end-to-end solutions for clients: from research, through to
Essential:
Act as a coordinator for major projects, reporting back to the client on progress and key deliverables
Undertake day to day liaison with clients, understanding how their priorities may change, setting clear expectations and ensuring that team leaders are aware of any potential issues
Show understanding of the strategic challenges our clients face and make relevant suggestions for how they should respond based on insight
Create compelling, concise and professional presentations for clients that you either deliver yourself or are delivered by your colleagues
Team
Essential:
Manage and prioritise your workload when working on multiple different projects.
Ensure team leaders are kept abreast of progress and are made aware of any issues or opportunities.
Manage and support junior colleagues, ensuring they are thoroughly briefed and understand what is expected.
Help shape the direction of a client account: pre-empting client needs and identifying opportunities to add more value and expand the relationship.
Qualifications/additional skills:
Educated to degree or equivalent level
A minimum of 5-7 years' experience in a similar role
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Excellent presentation skills
Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Office
About Teneo London
Teneo London advises business leaders, enabling them to achieve goals faster by earning trust, navigating disruption and removing barriers.
We're focused on strategy & communications advisory, working in close partnership with clients to help them address their biggest reputational and business issues. We have four Centres of Excellence – Campaigning, Strategy, Political and Financial – but just one P&L, so we enjoy all the benefits of integrated working without the politics.

Title: Senior Researcher – Qual/Quant – Behavioural Science
Description:
This agency leads the way in using advanced behavioural science to effect change for its clients who span a number of continents and sectors.
Working out how to improve employee engagement for a large restaurant chain and developing a strategy for a new skincare launch illustrates the variety you can expect as part of this team. This agency have developed a range of bespoke tools in order to apply research using behavioural science as the premise.
They are looking for an experienced researcher at SRE level, to join the team to support the senior directors on a range of projects. The ideal candidate would be a self-starter, ideally have a background in quant research but have experience of or an interest in developing qualitative skills. The nature of the work means you will always be challenging your thinking and trying to come up with ideas as to how best resolve clients commercial problems.
In this role you would manage qual and quant projects, contribute to proposals, be involved in marketing and networking to promote the business and using your research skills contribute to the insights needed by their clients.
This is a great environment to learn and develop in a growing agency, you will be supported and have regular contact with the team as they engage and talk to each other on a daily basis during these times. If you are interested then please get in touch.

Title: Senior Bioinformatician – Rare Diseases
Description:
Senior Rare Disease Analyst/ Statistical Geneticist London

Genomics England have a very interesting and challenging role available for a Senior Rare Disease Analyst, skilled in statistical and human genetics to join their world-leading team. To build on the success of the 100,000 Genomes Project, Genomics England are launching a new NHS Genomic Medicine Service comprising a National Genomic Test Directory where 300,000 tests have been re-profiled and whole genome sequencing will be available for direct healthcare. Through 7 Genomic Laboratory Hubs this offers equitable access to the 55 million people in England to the latest genomic medicine and research. This will lead to faster diagnosis and personalised medicine. Genomics England applies state of the art approaches to whole genome sequences for processing, analysis, quality assurance and annotation. This includes integrating phenotypic and other clinical data with whole genome sequencing to create a world-leading, high fidelity data repository for the NHS and third party users. The Bioinformatics team develops and applies state of the art approaches to whole genome sequences (WGS) in the areas of: *Analysis of WGS in cancer and rare diseases *Sequence alignment and variant calling of up to 100 genomes per day *Quality assurance and sample provenance monitoring This analyst role is part of a highly motivated Bioinformatics team, working as part of a small team responsible for rare disease analysis.

Key Accountabilities Include: *Carrying out alignment and variant calling, family based analyses and burden and association testing *Benchmarking genome analysis pipelines *Performing computational analyses for a range of projects *Developing and implementing new features *Establishing general bioinformatics resources for day-to-day use by colleagues

Skills Required: *Postdoc with experience of working within Rare Diseases and Bioinformatics/Computational Biology and Systems Biology or equivalent work experience *Good knowledge of rare disease genomics *Have solid training in statistics and or machine learning, and ideally some quantitative background such as a degree in physics, computer science, and maths. These skills could have been developed during a PhD for example through a PhD in computational biology, statistical genomics, and statistical genetics. *Practical knowledge of NGS algorithms and available resources *Solid skillset in Bioinformatics and experience of working as a computational biologist *Solid knowledge of family based analysis and knowledge of association testing *Strong programming skills (Python, R); ability to develop codes as a part of team *Practical knowledge and understanding of statistics *Excellent technical writing skills *A demonstrable ability to cope under pressure and deliver to deadlines *Ability to communicate effectively within a multidisciplinary team *Flexible and co-operative approach to colleagues *Ability to work independently and to show initiative within a team *Ability to prioritise and balance competing demands There are some great benefits on offer with this role including a competitive salary, pension, generous holidays and more. Please do not hesitate to contact Harvey Uppal at huppal@pararecruit.com or call
Show phone number
to discuss this opportunity further.

Title: Senior Marketing Science Analyst
Description:
Senior Marketing Science Analyst – Salary up to £47k - Plus Benefits - London
J10521

This media giant, is a respected world-wide organisation now searching for a Senior Analyst,
aiming towards being more data driven and this team includes people who specialise in different forms of analysis and variations include digital analysis, social media analysis, time series modelling and real-time analysis. This is a great opportunity to join an excellent operation assisting them in achieving their objectives with a majority focus on their digital properties and the wider online world.

Role & Responsibilities
Help to plan the data collected both from online and offline partners.
Think about issues and business questions with a creative approach.
Help to develop the company’s data collection framework and strategy as well as work with product and other stakeholders to help resolve any data quality issues.
Come up with robust solutions even when the data available is thin.
Provide insights and create data products for stakeholders to use.
Undertake and deliver analytics, data and measurement projects across a range of divisions.
Maintain high standards of presentation
Collaborate with analysts and technical teams across the business.

Experience & Skills Required
Educated to degree level or above in a STEM subject or Economics
Have a strong knowledge of media, data, measurement methodologies and industry standards including online and offline channels.
Possess several years’ commercial experience in building Marketing Mix Models essential.
Demonstrate proficiency in R and have used the package for econometrics modelling in previous roles.
Able to simplify complex problems into component parts and deal with them systematically
Experience in Marketing Mix Modelling, preferably having worked on brands with a high level of spend and a complex media/marketing plan.
Confidently present complex results in a simple and comprehensive way that stakeholders will immediately understand.

If you fit the above job description, please contact Rachel Keane on
Show phone number
or email her on rkeane@datatech.org.uk. Please be advised that we can only accept candidates who have the right to work in the UK.

Alternatively, you can refer a friend or colleague by taking part in our fantastic referral schemes! If you have a friend or colleague who would be interested in this role, please refer them to us. For each relevant candidate that you introduce to us (there is no limit) and we place, you will be entitled to our general gift/voucher scheme.

Title: Senior Bioinformatician
Description:
Senior Data Scientist – Bioinformatics London

A fast-moving, newly formed biotech are looking for an experienced and highly creative data scientist to join their team. Working with single cell RNA sequencing data, bulk sequencing data and other complex datatypes, you will work to establish a data repository and analytics pipeline to support the identification of therapeutic targets to address a range of disease indications. You will develop and apply methodologies for multi-dimensional data analysis and support computational pipeline design and development activities. You will also design and implement a database schema to support multi-dimensional data access and further visualise & analyse complex data sets, working in close collaboration with scientists and clinicians for the purpose of drug target discovery. You must be technically flexible and comfortable with multi-tasking analytical, data management and programming assignments. Key Requirements Include: *PhD in Data Science/ Bioinformatics (or equivalent) or MSc in data science/bioinformatics (or equivalent) plus 3+ years relevant academic or industry experience *Experience of analysing complex RNAseq data sets (including scRNAseq) *Demonstrated R programming fluency *Programming experience in a structured query or procedural language (e.g. SQL) *Solid understanding of key data integration concepts (e.g. ETL) and practices (e.g. data modelling, database schema design and implementation) Additional Requirements Include: *Prior experience of integrating complex datasets for the purpose of drug target discovery *Working knowledge of UNIX based operating systems *Experience with cloud-based technologies (e.g. AWS) *Experience in reproducible research practices (e.g. dynamic documents, version control & containerisation) A successful candidate will have exceptional communication skills, ability to effectively manage concurrent projects and within a virtual team environment. There are some great benefits available including the opportunity to join an exciting venture and build a pipeline of therapeutic products. The company offer a competitive salary package and benefits. Please do not hesitate to contact Harvey Uppal at huppal@pararecruit.com or call
Show phone number
to discuss this opportunity further.

Title: Lead Data Manager
Description:
Job Overview:

Lead Data Manager (Clinical Data Manager)

Home-Based

Get ahead in your career and make a difference in peoples lives

Are you a self-starter who knows how to take initiative in your daily work? Would you enjoy making a real difference in the lives of others.

If you are looking for a high-energy position in a collaborative environment, learn more about the Lead Data Manager opportunity with Covance.

In this role, you will:
Serve as the technical leader on all data management aspects for project(s) including start-up, maintenance, and completion activities.
Develop [Global] Data Management Plans and Quality Management (QM) Plans that will deliver accurate, timely, consistent, and quality clinical data.
Identify and implement solutions to project data management issues and concerns, including proactive prevention strategies based on metrics and forecasts.
Serve as the project and client liaison including management and provision of project specific data management status, cycle time, and productivity metrics.
Coordinate and participate in the development of the clinical data model and/or database design and annotate the CRF (eCFR) according to these specifications.
Review data acquisition conventions and data review guidelines / diagnostic specifications consistent with the clinical data model, [statistical] analysis plans, and CRF (eCRF) completion / monitoring conventions.
Coordinate the development and testing of data management systems edit / data validation checks) diagnostics) and special listings / procedures used as tools for the data review and discrepancy management activities.
Interact and collaborate with other project and specialty team members (clinical, programming, statistics, CDM technical support, drug safety, etc.) to support the set-up, maintenance, and closure of the data management aspects of the project to ensure consistent, cohesive data handling and quality.
Advanced planning and risk management for projects (issue escalation, resource management).
Oversee the technical performance of the data review project staff on achieving client satisfaction through delivery of quality data, on-time and on-budget.
Assist with goal creation and performance review assessment for data review project staff.
Maintain technical data management competencies via participation in internal and external training seminars.
Ensure project staff are trained and adhere to project-specific, global, standardized data management processes.
Identify areas for process and efficiency improvement and implement solutions on assigned projects.
Support achievement of project revenue and operating margin for data management activities to agreed targets.
Develop and maintain strategic client relationships and receive client satisfaction surveys and implement appropriate action plans as necessary.
Support business development for data management time and cost estimates and prepare and present to potential clients on global data management capabilities.
Review literature and research technologies/procedures for improving global data management practices.
Perform other duties as assigned by management.
Education/Qualifications:

University/college degree (life science, pharmacy or related subject preferred) or certification in a related allied health profession from an appropriately accredited institution.

Broad knowledge of drug development processes

Understanding of budgets and productvitity targets

Thorough knowledge of ICH Guidelines and GCP including international regulatory requirements for the conduct of clinical development programs especially as related to data handling and processing
Experience:

Previous relevant work experience in data management with approximately one year technical supervisory experience to include data management, clinical operations, and knowledge of several therapeutic areas

Demonstrated skill for technical management of staff exceeding 5 employees

Financial management

Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills

In depth knowledge of clincal trial process and data management , clinlical operations, biometrics, quality management and system applications to support operations.

Working knowledge of the relationship and regulatory obligation of the CRO industry with pharmaceutical/biotechnological companies

Title: Senior Workforce Information Analyst
Company: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust
Description:
This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced workforce analyst to join our team. Workforce information is a key resource to enable managers to deliver services in a cost-effective way and you will have a key role in supporting this. The key elements of your role will be to:
Coordinate statistical returns relating to workforce ensuring they are produced in a timely, consistent and timely manner.
As team leader lead supervise the team on a day to day basis ensuring coordination of regular and ad-hoc reporting requirements, identifying training needs and supporting team development.
Critically analyse workforce and pay-related data from multiple sources to provide a range of reports for clients such as Trust Board, Project Management Boards, and Trust Managers.
A key aspect is to transform raw data into valuable information by analysis, and the development of management reports to meet user needs. The Senior Workforce Analyst will lead the HR contribution to the trust’s workforce and operational plan.
You will have experience of working within healthcare and have advanced knowledge of ESR and the production and analysis of reports.

Title: Senior Data Consultant
Description:
Senior Data Consultant
- (003864)
Primary Location UK-ENG-London
Job Operations
Organisation DATA ANALYTICS TRANSFORMATION DIR
Job Posting 16-Jul-2020, 1:18:55 AM

The Bank of England is the UK's central bank. Our mission is to deliver monetary and financial stability for the British people. The Bank of England is a diverse organisation. Each of its 4,000 plus people are committed to public service and dedicated to promoting the good of the people of the United Kingdom by maintaining monetary and financial stability.

Department Overview
The Bank’s mission depends on data and analytics, through their role in the Bank's decisions, its operations, and the information it provides to the public.

Data and analytics have received a new level of senior attention and backing in the Bank, following Huw van Steenis' Future of Finance review, the Bank's response, and the Governor's Mansion House speech. The Bank is now publicly committed to delivering a "world class regtech and data strategy". A new Directorate, Data and Analytics Transformation (DAT), has been created to lead on this. DAT is the Bank’s centre of expertise for data strategy implementation and the compilation, dissemination and publication of regulatory and statistical data. We support analysis, policy and decision making by the Bank’s Committees, UK government departments and international organisations. Key stakeholders for our work include MPC, FPC and PRA Boards and our data are used in the Inflation Report, Financial Stability Report, Credit Conditions Review, Stress Test Results, FPC Core Indicators and Quarterly Bulletin. Decisions made in these Boards and from these reports have national economic significance.

Within DAT, a new division called Data Strategy Implementation Division (DSID) leads the definition and implementation of the Bank's data and analytics strategy. This strategy touches on practically all functions of the Bank, due to the central importance of data and analysis in our daily work. It also affects the firms from whom we collect data under statutory powers, the domestic and international official sector bodies with whom we share our data and analytics, and the public who receive data and analytics outputs published by the Bank.

Through the 2020s we intend to transform the way the Bank defines and collects data, the way it manages data and its capacity to analyse data, to make our use of data and analytics as insightful, reliable and efficient as possible. In addition, DSID leads the operation of the shared data and analytics services that mean colleagues can harness the power of data and analytics in their BAU work today.


Role Description
Reliable and well managed data is critical to the Bank in order to achieve its overall strategy. This new position provides the opportunity to be part of the team that will define, shape and implement the Bank’s Data Management policies and processes. The purpose of this role is data enablement through empowering projects and business areas with the support and tools they need to leverage their data in order to achieve their objectives. Underpinning this is a foundation of best practice Data Management including Data Governance.

The successful candidate will work closely with colleagues across all areas of the Bank. They will seek to gain an understanding of each business area and their data-related objectives. This will help them position realistic ideas to address data-related problems and articulate the value of Data Management principles relative to their operations, priorities and constraints. The ideal engagement output would include a fully sponsored plan of action, with clearly defined objectives, roles and timelines. They will achieve buy-in of their ideas through demonstrating subject matter expertise which establishes credibility, and through the alignment of goals and deliverables.

With the aptitude to be actively involved in project work, as well as change initiatives in BAU areas, the successful candidate will be comfortable influencing data considerations at the planning stages as well as helping to implement at execution stage. They will provide consultative guidance on all things data and be seen as a thought-leader whilst providing realistic ideas and continuously looking for operational improvements.

The successful candidate will be proactive and self-sufficient, and will be entrusted with the freedom shape their own working agenda. In return there will be an expectation to demonstrate positive stakeholder engagement that results in value-adding progress and the adoption best practice Data Management, or the utilisation of existing services such as Master Data Management, Data Registration (data cataloguing), Data Governance Advisory, Metadata Management and Data Quality. Whilst given some freedom to evolve their own role, they will also define and create new data enablement capabilities.

The candidate will need to develop deep working relationships with key stakeholders such as Technology (all teams within), Projects and Programmes, Corporate Portfolio office, HR, the PRA, Bankwide Risk and Compliance. Effective working relationships built on trust, mutual good intent and win-win outcomes will need to be developed, oftentimes resulting in intensive collaboration.

In parallel with the regular ongoing data enablement work, there will be an expectation for the candidate to contribute to the Bank’s new data strategy by working with their line manager to shape and implement activities that enable data users to find, access, share and trust data more effectively.

Although initially there are currently no formal line management expectations, the mentoring of junior DAT team members is expected. There will be line management responsibilities to follow in line with the success of the role, and scale of the workload. This arrangement is subject to change at any time depending on business needs.

To summarise, the role will primarily involve:
Data enablement through consultancy grade advice, guidance and support on projects and change initiatives.
Proactively raise the awareness of Data Management and Data Governance principles and practices across the data, product and operational lifecycles.
Continuous expansion of the understanding and adoption of Data Management best practices across areas of the Bank.
Ensure data-related practices, processes and controls align to the Bank’s data policy and are clearly documented, visible and accessible.
Be a primary contact on data-related matters, stemming from existing subject matter expertise and a continuous improved understanding of the data landscape across the Bank.
Raising awareness and opportunities for new and alternative approaches and tools.
Provide training and support to others outside of DAT, such as data stewards, in areas relating to Data Management, including MDM, Data Governance and Data Registration (cataloguing).
Join and on occasion lead or chair some of the Bank’s data boards and project working groups where Data Management expertise is required.
Liaise with internal and external stakeholders to understand data systems and specific datasets better; as well as their data-related problem areas. Formulate opportunities to improve them.
Provide a positive contribution to the wider team, their meetings and ad-hoc team endeavours.


Role Requirements
Essential Criteria
Data and data systems subject matter expertise.
Detailed experience in at least two of the following Data Management knowledge areas:
Data Governance
Master Data, Reference Data & Metadata Management
Data Quality
Data Architecture & Modelling
Data Integration & Interpretability
Data Storage & Operations
Security, Compliance and Data Protection
Experience of imparting knowledge, advice and guidance to other business areas and being a go-to person for you subject matter expertise.
Experience of improving or fulling resolving data or data systems problem areas.
Previous hands-on experience working with data (e.g. as a data analyst, data scientist, data engineer etc) to understand the nuance of data and data systems incidents and issues.
Experience of working with and managing stakeholders across reporting boundaries; developing strong and effective working relationships.
Experience of drafting documentation such as policies, standards and other related artefacts.
An understanding of the risks associated with poor Data Management, and how it impacts business outputs and objectives downstream.
An ability to align multiple stakeholders through informal influence as well as governance.
Strong communication skills, both verbally and written, to influence decisions.
Able to chair meetings to senior managers and deliver presentations with impact and clarity.
Experience formulating plans and creating roadmaps to meet long-term business objectives.
Experience of mentoring, coaching, and developing other staff, including imparting knowledge.
Business analyst skills such as problem solving and critical thinking.
Self-sufficient and proactive attitude managing one’s own workload.
Adaptable to changing business needs with minimal fuss or objection.
A willingness to receive personal feedback, in order to adapt, improve or learn.
A genuine passion and positive appreciation of the need for Data Management.


Desirable Criteria
An understanding of the pain-points and resolutions to users finding, accessing, sharing and trusting data.
Knowledge of established Data Management frameworks and best practice approaches.
Experience shaping or implementing a data strategy or data change programme.
Experience of completing Data Management Framework assessments or data capability maturity assessments.
An understanding of data migration strategies and foresight of implementation issues.
Understand the concept and benefits of data lakes and data warehousing.
Experience of working in a Chief Data Office or a data related programme or project.
Experience of working with data in the financial services industry.
Ability to analyse and visualise data through languages and tools (e.g. SQL, R, Python & Tableau).
Experience of influencing without authority and using persuasion to get things done.

We anonymise applications so hiring managers will not be able to see your personal information, your original CV or any covering letters when reviewing your submission. Please complete work history and the application form questions as requested because incomplete submissions will not be reviewed.

We continue to build an inclusive culture where everyone can be their whole selves and produce their best work. Our focus on inclusion is intended to build greater diversity in order to reflect the society we serve and be an employer of choice.
This specific role offers a salary of £60,000 - £70,000 (subject to experience and skillset).
The total package also includes:
A non-contributory, career average pension giving you a guaranteed retirement benefit of 1/95th of your annual salary for every year worked.
A discretionary performance award based on a current award pool and target award of 10%, with a maximum potential award of 25%
A 7% benefits allowance with the option to take as salary or purchase a wide range of flexible benefits
25 days annual leave with option to buy up to 13 additional days through flexible benefits
Private medical insurance and income protection insurance

The closing date for applications is 6 August 2020.


Please apply online, ensuring that you answer the application questions, complete the work history and submit your CV.

Title: Senior Insight Analyst
Description:
The Role
The Insights team is an integral and fast expanding department within Virgin Bet. As a Senior Insight Analyst, you will support data driven decision making across the business to advise senior leaders on emerging strategic issues. This role will focus predominantly on trading, as well as customer insights. With an abundance of data at our disposal, our analysts strive to provide the business with actionable recommendations through a vast number of analytical tools.
We pride ourselves on giving our analysts the freedom to explore new software and analytical techniques to produce the best analysis possible. Our friendly and knowledgeable team is always at hand to provide guidance, brainstorm ideas and help teach new concepts.
The ideal candidate will have an interest in the gambling market, and a keen understanding of market & trends analysis, as well as core business KPIs. Experience with analytics tools such as SQL, Excel, R, and Google Big Query are beneficial but not essential.
Key Responsibilities
Be the go-between from traders to data team.
Transfer business concerns and concepts into tangible data points and metrics.
The ability to analyse data from multiple sources to provide actionable insight.
Monitoring the performance of the business and investigating changes in core KPIs.
The ability to communicate complex outputs in a clear and coherent manner.
Understanding the business, especially Trading, to ensure analytical needs are met.
To keep open and continue communications with your manager and your team with regards to workload and projects.
Communicating findings confidently and coherently to drive change.
Regularly keeping an eye on Virgin Bet core KPIs.
Key Skills/Experience
University degree (ideally Ph.D.) in Mathematics and/or some field in applied mathematics such as statistics, control theory or theoretical physics.
At least 2-years working as an analyst within a risk-based setting.
Knowledge of Mathematica, SQL and some statistical software (for example R, SAS, SPSS) is an advantage.
Ideally, you've already worked with quantitative finance modelling or similar (experience with sports betting is a big plus).
Ability to turn complex concepts into actionable recommendations.
Ability to learn in a fast-changing work environment.
Adaptable and flexible with an ability to multitask.
Ability to communicate confidently and coherently.
A good understanding of sports or betting would be a bonus.
Firm believer in teamwork & collaboration.
The Person
As an experienced Analyst, preferably within a gambling or risk-based environment, we expect you to be a logical yet creative thinker with good communication skills to help you excel in this role. An interest in sports and gambling would be a benefit, but not essential for this role. You will be self-motivated with the desire to find and solve real business problems and confident in delivering your findings to multiple stakeholders across business departments.
What can we offer?
Performance bonus
Private Healthcare scheme
Subsidised gym membership
Ride to Work Scheme
Virgin Tribe – access to exclusive Virgin offers and experiences
Life Assurance (x3 salary)
Contributory Pension Plan
Friday drinks in the office
Daily fruit, quality coffee and soft drinks
Festival summer and cracking Christmas parties
About Us:
LiveScore Group is home to the world's largest scores and stats provider, boasting more than 54 million dedicated monthly users, and a sportsbook that truly packs a punch. Delivering live scores, results, tables, news and facts via native apps and an unbeatable website, LiveScore throws the spotlight on football, cricket, tennis, basketball and hockey.
Launched in May 2019, Virgin Bet offers daily price boosts and a huge range of markets across all major sports. Delivering unsurpassable user experience, quality customer service and betting choices galore, we have the perfect line-up to disrupt the sportsbook market. From now on, sport is at the forefront of our agenda.
Whether it be first-in-class designers, leading industry marketeers or technology, we'll continue to make an impact by growing our talent pool across the globe. Taking our products to the fingertips of users internationally, we intend to combine our skills to create the best odds for a bright and lucrative future — and win.

Title: Senior Actuarial Analyst
Description:
General information
City: London
Country: United Kingdom
Creation Date: 20-Jul-2020
Closing Date: 17-Aug-2020
Employment Type: Fixed term contract
Department: Actuarial
Ref #: 3854
Description & Requirements
Who we are?
Liberty Specialty Markets is part of Liberty Mutual Insurance Group, a leading global insurer. We offer a breadth of world-class insurance and reinsurance services to brokers and insureds in all major markets. Established in 2013, bringing together Liberty’s company, syndicate and reinsurance operations into one combined operation of over 1,900 people, over 50 specialty and commercial insurance and reinsurance products and four underwriting platforms.
About the Team:
To maintain and develop the multi-entity LSM Calculation Kernel and the associated processes.
To assist with development of aspects of the Internal Model that directly feed the Calculation Kernel
To determine Internal and Regulatory Capital requirements

Risk Template, Use Test Dashboards (UTDs) and SharePoint Maintenance

Title: Senior Research Assistant
Description:
Senior Research Assistant
- (003822)
Primary Location UK-ENG-London
Job Financial Markets Infrastructure
Organisation FINANCIAL MARKET INFRASTRUCTURE DIR
Job Posting 03-Jul-2020, 9:30:58 AM

The Bank of England is the UK's central bank. Our mission is to deliver monetary and financial stability for the British people.

The Bank of England is a diverse organisation. Each of its 4,000 plus people are committed to public service and dedicated to promoting the good of the people of the United Kingdom by maintaining monetary and financial stability.

FMID oversees all aspects of the regulation of Financial Market Infrastructure in one directorate, bringing together supervisors, policy experts, risk specialists and researchers in one place. The team supervises some of the most systemically significant firms in the world, including the UK's central counterparties (CCPs), payment systems and central securities depositories (CSDs). The work involves external engagement facing, requiring collaboration across the Bank, with colleagues at HM Treasury and the FCA, and with our international counterparts.

Department Overview
In FMID, you will work in a directorate at the heart of the Bank, responsible for supervision, policy and technical risk analysis on the infrastructure that sits at the core of the financial system. This infrastructure includes the UK’s – and in some cases, the world’s – most systemically important payment systems, central counterparties and central securities depositories.
FMID is a small directorate; this means there are plenty of opportunities for cross-cutting work and the opportunity to get an insight into how different areas operate. FMID welcomes cross-Directorate moves as part of a career within FMID and there are a number of people who have followed this route. Learning about financial market infrastructure can also set you up for your career within the wider Bank, as shown by the fact that a large number of senior people across the Bank have spent time in FMID, and it is a good way to understand the interlinkages right at the heart of the financial system. FMID is committed to ensuring diversity within the Directorate: diversity of skills, perspectives and background.


Job description
As the Senior Research Assistant in the FMI Data team, you will play a critical role in supporting FMID’s ability to use data to support policymaking and ongoing supervision. In addition, you will provide support to other directorates across the Bank wishing to make use of the datasets managed by FMID. We would expect the work to be interesting and challenging; and to offer some opportunities to demonstrate the capacity to work at higher scales, i.e. a scale G level.

Key responsibilities will include:
Becoming an expert on how FMI-related datasets, in particular the Trade Repository (TR) derivatives dataset and the CCP regulatory return dataset, are used to support FMID’s policy and supervisory objectives, and its external reporting obligations
Querying big datasets to regularly produce Key Risk Indicator packs which are circulated to senior management at the Bank
Using the Bank’s data platforms and tools to draw statistics and conclusions from the datasets, thus answering queries from a wide range of internal and external stakeholders
Contributing to the team’s work in delivering briefings and visualisations which drive financial stability policy making
Contributing to the FMI Data team’s work on improving data quality and existing data-related processes

Role Requirements
You do not need to have prior knowledge of FMIs. However, you will be able to explain how your experience is relevant to FMID and have a demonstrated ability to pick up and apply new areas of knowledge quickly.
Good Microsoft Excel skills and some experience in using R for statistical analysis and visualisation, or ability and willingness to learn R
Good problem-solving skills and proven ability to deliver statistics and charts from datasets
An interest in the global financial markets and the role played by FMIs
Ability to manage workload and prioritise incoming requests for data from various different stakeholders
Good teamwork and communication skills (written and verbal)
Some experience in using Tableau and/or SparkR is very helpful but not essential

We anonymise applications so hiring managers will not be able to see your personal information, your original CV or any covering letters when reviewing your submission. Please complete work history and the application form questions as requested because incomplete submissions will not be reviewed.

We continue to build an inclusive culture where everyone can be their whole selves and produce their best work. Our focus on inclusion is intended to build greater diversity in order to reflect the society we serve and be an employer of choice.

This role offers a base salary of £28,050 - £31,500 (subject to experience and skillset). The total package also includes:
A non-contributory, career average pension giving you a guaranteed retirement benefit of 1/95th of your annual salary for every year worked. There is the option to increase your pension (to 1/50th) or decrease (to 1/120th) in exchange for salary through our flexible benefits programme each year.
A 7% benefits allowance with the option to take as salary or purchase a wide range of flexible benefits.
25 days annual leave with option to buy up to 13 additional days through flexible benefits.
Private medical insurance and income protection insurance.


The closing date for applications is 23rd July 2020.

Please apply online, ensuring that you answer the application questions, complete the work history and submit your CV.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Description:
A Senior Data Scientist is needed for a leading Cyber Security company in London who are looking to build a new data science team. They have used consultants to understand where the value in their data is and have mapped out a series of interesting and challenging projects.
The role will be to build sophisticated machine learning models around audience modelling, behaviour analysis and optimisation models to name a few. You will also undertake critical research into understanding causes to changing metrics and helping to build a clear understanding of their customers, user interactions, trends etc.
The company are highly data driven and data science will be a large part of the companies planned growth this year. You will work alongside the product and data engineering team to turn your ideas into reality and help support your research and delivery.
They see you coming from a analytical and statistical background that will prove key to help drive quantitative analyses on large and sometimes complex datasets but ideally with some knowledge of: • Python • MySQL • TensorFlow • SciKit-Learn • AWS They have a great benefits package, relaxed and “start up” feel to the office.
